Rome, Italy Marketing and Communications Creative Marketing Production Manager, Marketing Production - Italy & Greece It's an amazing time to join Netflix as we continue shaping the future of global entertainment. We are bringing new stories to millions of people worldwide by promoting our original, exclusive content. We are looking for a Production Manager to join our Marketing team on a full-time basis. The role will oversee campaign production & project management across our marketing campaigns for films, series, and overarching initiatives. The role will require strong project management skills and production expertise, with an ability to juggle multiple projects and to navigate multiple tools & complex workflows whilst maintaining creative excellence and operational best practices for the business. This person will join our Marketing team and will work closely with cross-functional partners across Netflix's Marketing and communications groups to connect our stories with millions of people worldwide. The Opportunity Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with 270 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. The Role We are looking for someone to join our Italian Marketing team to manage the production and delivery of all marketing campaign deliverables for local and international titles across our Series, Films and Unscripted slates in Italy, ensuring that all the elements that go into making a great campaign are delivered on time and on budget. We are looking for a nimble, solutions-oriented, project management expert, who thrives in a fast-paced environment. You will work closely with in-house producers in our AV, Art & Print, Digital as well as external creative and production agencies, to manage Netflix’s production and operational campaign needs. You will partner closely with marketing managers working across the Italian team, to ensure creative and operational excellence and solutions led project management approach to all the campaigns you are assigned to.  You will serve as the connection point to cross-functional stakeholders, facilitating alignment between global and local teams dedicated to creative, localisation, strategy, media, marketing, publicity and social. The ideal candidate will be a creative production manager with a strong background in Media Production and a solid production local expertise with a drive for innovation and creative and executional excellence. Key Responsibilities
  • Effectively managing the production of multiple campaign launches to ensure timely and accurate development, production and delivery of creative assets and consumer activations in the market both for Local and International titles and initiatives. 
  • Being a thought partner with marketing managers on the creative development of local campaigns. Partner with them to provide production guidance, best practice advice, and innovative solutions for the creation and execution of campaign assets, stunts, and activations linked to the promotion of our titles. 
  • End-to-end production management for marketing shoots (esp. AV), activations and asset creation for bespoke title campaigns. 
  • Managing agency and vendor relationships by leading day-to-day production communications, project scope of work, production budgets and timelines. 
  • Define, negotiate, communicate, implement and monitor technical quality standards and brand & creative integrity on all project deliverables according to Netflix guidelines.
  • Driving and enabling production excellence and innovation across channels like Social, Digital, OOH and Experiential. 
  • Project managing the delivery of integrated marketing campaigns, including online and offline video, out of home, print, digital display, TV, cinema, radio and paid social.
  • Support our Italian marketing team by planning overall campaign production timelines, budget management, project deliverables and campaign resources. Ensuring a regular flow of information between all cross-functional partners in Italy, EMEA and Globally. Regularly share updates on project timelines and budgets and escalate any anticipated production issues.
  • Operational Strategist & Project Management. Proactively identify business-critical issues and opportunities to improve how we track, produce, share, utilize, and traffic promotional assets at Netflix, balancing the short and long-term needs of multiple cross-functional Marketing and Communications teams. Elevate our project management functions to enable flexible processes and structure, while also driving accountability for process and workflows improvement. 
  • Nurture and maintain a network of best-in market vendors (production companies, freelancers)
    • Experience & Skills
  • 8+ years of marketing creative production & project management crafting world class campaigns and executions. Experience within the entertainment industry and International experience are a plus. 
  • Knowledgeable of the evolving Italian and Global advertising and media landscape, including exposure to/experience with digital marketing and media.
  • Passion for storytelling and high competency and proven track record of project management for high profile local and global campaigns.
  • Expert knowledge of marketing campaign and localisation workflows, including understanding the creative and production process for AV, Print & Digital deliverables.
  • Fluent in AV, Print & Digital types and formats, whilst understanding the fundamentals of asset management, servicing and ad trafficking.
  • Great agility to oversee a wide range of production types (shoots, on set and digital activations, media assets) and a high volume of creative and campaign types in parallel.
  • Exceptionally strong communication and analytical skills along with the ability to think strategically and creatively.
  • Proactive, fast, and flexible problem-solver with superb time, resource, and stakeholder management. 
  • A strong appetite for innovation, an open and solution-oriented mindset
  • An entertainment fan who understands the power of entertainment to transform behaviors and influence pop culture.
  • Ability to thrive in a fast-paced and demanding environment, possessing a high level of intellectual curiosity, and demonstrate strong and effective judgment in the face of ambiguity.
  • Fluency in Italian and English is required.

description: Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service, with over 247 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films, and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause, and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. About the Role: The Netflix Product Operations team is seeking a Product Operations Lead to join our team.  You will be partnering with a cross-functional leadership team to oversee a portfolio of projects and drive cross-functional teams to meet the objectives for the Partner Product domain.  You will directly lead portfolio management efforts related to annual planning, roadmap management, OKR & project tracking, and cross-functional collaboration. This role is based in our Los Gatos office (preferred) in a hybrid model, but we are open to remote candidates on the West Coast. If remote-based, some travel to Los Gatos will be required. Responsibilities: Partner closely with Product Management and cross-functional leaders to successfully deliver on objectives of the product domain. Lead all operational activities in close coordination with the Product Management Lead. Conduct portfolio management activities across a variety of cross-functional projects. Lead project and OKR tracking discussions and create related artifacts. Help facilitate cross-functional collaboration and communication across the product domain by designing and facilitating an operating rhythm of meetings and reporting. Develop and implement the operating framework for the product domain including establishing the proper meeting cadence, responsibilities framework, and stakeholder alignment activities. Lead process improvement initiatives to maximize efficiency. Must Have: 7+ years of applicable program or portfolio management experience in a Product organization Ability to work across multiple squads and teams while maintaining a view of the bigger picture Experience overseeing portfolios of projects consisting of 50+ team members Experience with a variety of product development processes and methodologies Experience standing up new product development and cross-functional processes Demonstrated ability to build project plans for complex, cross-functional projects Experience with projects involving a balanced mix of Data Science, Engineering, Design, and Customer Insights. Strong conflict resolution and negotiation skills and the ability to manage in an environment of ambiguity with a diverse range of partners Communication skills to clearly articulate your concepts and evangelize on their behalf Experience with a variety of project management and product development tools Partnerships experience is a plus Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $120,000-$515,000 Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more details about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with 240M+ paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Machine Learning drives innovation across all product functions and decision support needs. Building highly scalable and differentiated ML infrastructure is key to accelerating this innovation. We are seeking a senior software engineer to join the Metaflow project, developing a product that makes it easy to build, manage and scale real life ML applications.   Metaflow is used in over 100+ distinct ML applications within Netflix, spanning personalization and recommendations, growth and Ads. You will lead requirements, design, and implementation of Metaflow product improvements, and have the opportunity to work alongside our applied researchers and data scientists on the cutting edge of machine learning.  You will have a strong customer focus and consistently engage with our ML community to source feedback, identify pain points, and opportunities to evolve Metaflow and the Machine Learning Platform in general.  You will also partner with the OSS Metaflow development community to ensure a mutually beneficial roadmap and relationship. To be successful in this role, you must have a strong software engineering background, a keen sense of software design, a track record of prioritizing user experience, have proven experience with distributed applications, be a good communicator, and work well in large cross-functional teams. What we are looking for: 5+ years of software engineering experience with a successful track record of delivering quality results Strong software design and development skills, with prior Python experience Experience working with tools, systems, and processes that accelerate ML researchers and Data Scientist velocity Experience in building and operating scalable and reliable ML systems Experience in large-scale build, release, continuous integration/continuous deployment (CI/CD), and observability methods Experience working with public clouds, especially AWS Preferred, but not required additional areas of experience: Knowledge of machine learning algorithms Prior experience as a Data Scientist or MLE Experience with deep learning frameworks, such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, etc. Significant contributions to open source projects Experience in building UI More information To learn more about the work we do to check if it align with your interests, check the following articles: Supporting Diverse ML Systems at Netflix Metaflow Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $100,000 - $720,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . description: It’s an amazing time to be joining Netflix as we continue to transform entertainment. We deliver billions of hours of movies and TV shows per month to more than 260 million members in over 190 countries. At Netflix, we want to entertain the world. To achieve this, we must be able to rapidly build and ship innovative experiences for our members and creators all around the globe. | Who we are Delivery Core is a full-stack platform engineering team (we have frontend and backend engineers in one team) that enables continuous delivery of software and infrastructure changes across all Netflix services. We work cross-functionally with partners across engineering to make working inside the Netflix engineering ecosystem more efficient and enjoyable for all. We focus on increasing productivity, minimizing toil, and increasing the frequency and safety of software delivery. | What you could work on Our team is primarily responsible for the developer platforms that roll out software and infrastructure changes to the entire Netflix fleet. We do this through our Continuous Delivery (CD) system Spinnaker , and our higher level declarative delivery-based platform, Managed Delivery . We are more closely unifying these products into one cohesive unified Delivery experience. Some example goals for projects include: - Reduce friction and time to deploy software across our internal fleet - Improve the safety of infrastructure changes - Improve ease of use for configuring application deployment specifications | What We’ll Expect From You We are seeking a backend, distributed systems focused engineer who is comfortable writing, improving, maintaining, and sunsetting critical services at tremendous scale. Below are the specific behaviors and competencies important for this role. Behaviors Cross-Functional – You enjoy collaborating with multiple teams on creating solutions and supporting solutions with a myriad of sometimes conflicting requirements. Seeking Excellence – You enjoy the pursuit of engineering excellence by evangelizing, establishing and iterating on best practices. Curiosity – You are curious and enjoy working on ambiguous problems where the solutions are not (yet) well defined. Communication –  You are proficient in verbal and written mediums at explaining topics that the audience was not familiar with previously. Core competencies You possess strong software skills in Java or other JVM languages. You are experienced with operating complex distributed systems components (like databases, APIs (REST, gRPC, GraphQL), and controllers). You know how to debug them and how they can fail. You are proficient in backend services and integration layers. You are able to break down complexity, iterate, and communicate progress to a wide variety of partners and stakeholders Helpful competencies You possess strong software skills in Java or Kotlin. You have worked on a developer platform team where other engineers were your customers. You have worked on schema changes in a federated GraphQL gateway. You are familiar with the Spring Boot framework. You are proficient with high volume data stores. | What to Expect From Us High Impact - your work will touch every engineer at the company and be crucial for the ongoing success of Netflix. Stunning Colleagues - you will be working with other excellent people with diverse perspectives, who value collaboration, working to excel as the “dream team”. Energizing Challenges - there is a wealth of opportunity when working on complex technical projects and our culture both enables and encourages you to rise to the challenges. Feedback – you will constantly have opportunities for growth because meaningful positive and constructive feedback is part of everyday life at Netflix. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $100,000 - $720,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: It’s an amazing time to be joining Netflix as we continue to transform entertainment globally. Netflix is the world's leading internet entertainment service with over 270 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, and feature films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any internet-connected screen. Members can play, pause and resume watching, as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. We are pursuing consumer products because we believe it will drive meaningful show awareness/buzz with more tangible, curated ways to interact with our most popular content and in effect, drive long-term revenue. Seoul, South Korea Marketing and Communications Consumer Products Consumer Products Marketing Coordinator, APAC - 12 Months Contract It’s an amazing time to be joining Netflix as we continue to transform entertainment globally. Netflix is the world's leading internet entertainment service with over 270 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, and feature films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any internet-connected screen. Members can play, pause and resume watching, as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time.  We are pursuing consumer products because we believe it will drive meaningful show awareness/buzz with more tangible, curated ways to interact with our most popular content and in effect, drive long-term revenue. We want licensed merchandise to help promote our titles and build them into franchises so they become part of the Zeitgeist for longer periods of time. This role requires someone to take on the responsibility of creating and executing Netflix consumer products licensing and marketing programs for the APAC region based on the Netflix originals content slate. Responsibilities:
  • Work with our partners to maximize the marketing that they do and align with the marketing that we do at Netflix
  • Partner with external stakeholders (e.g. retailers, licensees) and internal stakeholders (e.g. Netflix local cross-functional teams, global teams) on the development, execution and amplification of marketing programs across all the priority markets in APAC
  • Define the right marketing & media mix to amplify partner marketing campaigns (i.e. in-store communication, to e-commerce, social channels etc)
  • Be an internal and external champion of the opportunity and vision with regards to our marketing strategy and push for innovation and out-of-the box ideas
  • Partner with agencies and creative teams from writing creative briefs, concept development, production to the asset delivery as well as managing budgets 
  • Serve as main marketing contact for partners on all marketing approvals
  • Manage multiple partner marketing programs at once within a very fast paced environment, and give creative direction when needed for partners
  • Guarding the attribution, usage and representation of the Netflix brand and owned/licensed titles in partner marketing assets
  • Demonstrates strong leadership through self managing projects and keeping the team informed
  • Communicates with and solicits feedback from internal stakeholders regularly
  • Prioritizes workflow effectively
    • Skills Required:
  • Proficiency in English and Korean (Japanese is a plus) 
  • Demonstrated, 5+ years of experience in building brands working on 360 marketing campaigns with various production outputs including TVCM/digital films, digital/social, influencers, pop-up/events
  • Account management or traffic/operations experience in a marketing/advertising agency or production house would also be a suitable fit
  • Strong collaboration and relationship-building skills
  • A self-motivated and self-managing individual who thrives under a high degree of freedom
  • Experience in launching brand collaborations is preferred
  • Global mindset
  • Entertainment experience is a plus

We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. description: As Netflix grows globally, we continue to look for the best and brightest talent to scale with our growth. We are looking for an Accounts Payable (AP) professional to support our International Supplier Invoice and Payments operations. This newly created position is due to the continued growth of the business, and will be based in our Philippines office and report to the Accounts Payable Manager based in Manila. This position will interact with the AP team across our global offices and will require working in a fast paced environment for the role. The ideal candidate will have experience in managing end-to-end Accounts Payable operations in Invoice processing, Payments processing, AP Month-end Close, and Reconciliations. He or she will have a solid understanding of Accounts Payable and Procure-to-Pay (P2P) workflows, an ability to partner with technical teams and build strong cross-regional and cross-functional relationships, a deep curiosity and passion for automation and process improvements, and the ability to see a broader picture yet get their hands in the details to contribute to the team’s goals. Responsibilities: Netflix Culture Ambassador Be a Netflix Culture Ambassador for the team and Managing cultural updates and discussions with the team Team Management and Development: Focus on talent development, team building, and training. Develop team members through coaching and feedback results Be the first point of contact for daily guidance on process queries/clarifications Conduct daily huddles & 1-1 with the team Evaluate team performance and set goals for the team using KPIs/SLAs Manage staff leaves, coverage and overtime along with training, and performance evaluations. All areas noted here should be a regular topic of discussion with the Manila AP Manager and the APAC regional leader. Operational Oversight: Oversee invoice processing (high volumes of invoices daily) by the team members. Monitor invoice processing SLAs and conduct analysis for tickets that exceed SLA thresholds. Prepare metrics and review them with AP Manila Manager and Regional AP leaders. Manage AP procedures and ensure compliance with AP & SOX Controls Performance Monitoring: Review daily metrics and track employee performance, SLA, and daily activities Regular alignment with the APAC Regional lead to ensure the KPIs and SLAs are reasonable. Identify areas of inefficiencies and training opportunities Review and monitor AP aging and resolve aged invoices/credits. Research and resolve invoice discrepancies effectively Reporting and Compliance: Ensure compliance with internal controls and financial deadlines Assist with internal/external audit reviews and ensure compliance with SOX guidelines Support the Invoice Resolution team in year-end 1099s and 1096s reviews Support the team in monthly AP close activities Strategic Initiatives: Identify opportunities for process improvement, standardization, Discuss with leadership on appropriate policies, procedures and internal controls. Assist with special projects, including system upgrades and standardizing SOPs Evaluate invoice quality based on a metrics-driven approach and develop a training plan based on identified gaps in partnership with the appropriate AP Regional Leader Regional Leader’s Support & Liaison Skills Required Experienced people manager at a global company preferably in a shared services environment. Demonstrates ability to manage a multi-faceted dynamic and talented team in a fast-paced environment Understanding of U.S. and International GAAP Accounting Principles Able to maintain a high level of accuracy in reviewing and auditing Invoice and Payment transactions that comply with AP Controls and SOX Compliances Customer-oriented person who focuses on best-in-class communication and attention to detail and conflict resolution Excellent written and verbal communication skills Proficient in Excel and ERP systems (Workday experience a plus) Experience using ticketing tools like FreshDesk or Zendesk a plus A forward-looking thinker who can articulate the need for and implement process improvements Understanding of SOX compliance rules and guidelines Fluent in English, proficient in other languages a plus. Education and Experience Accounting or Finance background 8+ years of relevant experience 3+ years of People Management experience Degree in a relevant field of study We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

description: About Netflix: Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services, with over 238 million paid memberships in over 190 countries, enjoying TV series, films, and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. We are pursuing consumer products and experiences because we believe they will drive meaningful show awareness/buzz with more tangible, curated ways to interact with our most popular content IRL and drive long-term value. We want merchandise and experiences to help promote our titles and build them into title brands or franchises so they become part of the zeitgeist for longer periods of time. As Designer of product development, you will be the creative lead on development and product strategy mainly for Mexico plus other territories in the LATAM region. Responsibilities include: Lead the development and execution of the Netflix brands on how they turn up through products. Build and maintain strong, highly collaborative relationships with external partners/licensees to ensure creative excellence. Lead creative meetings with external partners/licensees. Align with key stakeholders across the CP x-functional teams in order to ensure all products being developed are on brand and effectively align with the brand’s strategy. Maintain strong knowledge of the trends in the space of assigned key categories. Manage vendors/agencies for creative projects. Be the expert on the product approval process on Brand Comply in order to keep track and carry out submissions for all categories from concept to production. Requirements: 8+ years of experience in product development in the consumer products industry - preferably in the entertainment space. English is mandatory for this role, and proficiency in Portuguese will be viewed as a significant advantage. Candidates who are able to read, write, speak, and comprehend Portuguese will be prioritized, as this skill is a key differentiator in our multicultural work environment. Knowledge and understanding of development within the hardlines, soft lines, health & beauty, and food product categories. Experience working with multiple partners internal and external. Strong creative instincts and ability to distill stakeholder comments into actionable creative feedback. Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, and able to provide clear direction. Ability to prioritize and multitask in a dynamic, deadline-driven environment. Strong desire to think outside the box and innovate. Resourceful in troubleshooting issues and finding creative solutions. Experience using Adobe and Google Suite applications. Extreme attention to detail and maintaining accuracy. Self-starter who thrives in a fast-paced environment. Positive attitude and team player, especially when faced with changing responsibilities. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

description: Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services, with 270 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. Visit our culture memo and long-term view to learn more about the unique Netflix culture and the opportunity to be part of our team. The Opportunity The APAC Partner Engagement team builds strategic, holistic, long-term partnerships with consumer electronics manufacturers, mobile, broadband, and TV operators to make it easy for Netflix members to access, enjoy and pay for Netflix across Asia. The Partner Engagement Manager will be responsible for leading the integration of Netflix into our Japan operator partners' consumer devices, set-top boxes and payment systems, creating a compelling bundle of complimentary services. The Partner Engagement Manager must understand the needs of our partners, Netflix, and the industry to build products that will spark joy with current and future Netflix members. Responsibilities Managing the integration of the Netflix application into consumer electronics devices such as Smart TVs and operator set-top boxes. Negotiating Netflix product experience within the consumer electronics and operator entertainment experience. Enabling operator bundle offers that include the Netflix subscription and facilitate members to pay for Netflix through the operators' bill. Defining joint product roadmaps and taking it through to launch. Contributing to the regional partnership strategy and testing, learning, and evolving our future product offerings. Qualifications 12+ years of experience building strategic relationships at leading operators or global platforms. Fluent in Japanese and English. Strong written and verbal communicator. Led complex technical projects involving multiple parties. Navigated complicated, high-stakes negotiations resulting in value creation. Collaborated with cross-functional teams including product, engineering, business development, legal, marketing, customer service, and finance distributed worldwide. Able to effectively influence at all levels (internally and externally). Designed and optimized acquisition user journeys through consumer insights and AB testing. Managed end-to-end device integration (Smart TV and Operator set-top boxes) and implemented TV user experience design. Developed payment, acquisition, mobile, wallet, or direct carrier billing products. Data-driven analysis and decision-making, informed by a passion for metrics. Willingness to travel for partner and internal team meetings. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status or disability status. description: Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services, with 270 million paid memberships in over 190 countries, enjoying TV series, films, and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause, and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. In this role, you will dive into different regions and countries to holistically answer questions like “Who are our members?”, “How satisfied are current members with our service?” and “How do the needs and expectations of non-members differ from those of members?”  The questions you answer will help shape how senior leadership thinks about opportunities and challenges in these different regions, and enable us to evaluate and determine how our country-level strategies are performing. As a Senior Analytics Engineer, you will be responsible for developing and maintaining data pipelines, conducting in-depth analyses, and developing tools and products to create a single source of truth around Netflix's greatest consumer-facing opportunities and challenges—at both a company and country level. The ideal candidate will excel in data analytics, storytelling with data, cross-functional collaboration, clear communication with executive stakeholders, and share a passion for continuously improving the way we use data to make Netflix better. To learn more about analytics engineering at Netflix, read here . In this role, you will: Become an expert in country-level performance by diving deep into our data to understand both our members and non-members. Spearheaded research to understand the consumer-facing opportunities and challenges facing Netflix. Scale these insights—Netflix is a global company, and we need to be able to efficiently zoom in on different regions throughout the world and ladder this up to a global view. Share your learnings with high-level leaders in a way that is digestible, actionable, and clear. To be successful in this role, you have: At least 5 years of experience as an analytics professional. Expertise in SQL, programming skills (e.g. Python, Scala), and some exposure to ETL and data warehousing concepts. A proven track record of data analysis, reporting and visualization (e.g. Tableau, D3). Strong communication with the ability to build meaningful stakeholder relationships. Enthusiasm for creative thinking and innovation in a fast-paced data and analytics space. Excitement to learn about new fields, with the ability to be scrappy as needed. Comfort with ambiguity; able to thrive with minimal oversight and process. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $170,000 - $720,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . search_text:
Los Gatos, California Products & Technology Data Science and Engineering Analytics Engineer (L5) - Regional Understanding Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services, with 270 million paid memberships in over 190 countries, enjoying TV series, films, and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause, and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. In this role, you will dive into different regions and countries to holistically answer questions like “Who are our members?”, “How satisfied are current members with our service?” and “How do the needs and expectations of non-members differ from those of members?”  The questions you answer will help shape how senior leadership thinks about opportunities and challenges in these different regions, and enable us to evaluate and determine how our country-level strategies are performing. As a Senior Analytics Engineer, you will be responsible for developing and maintaining data pipelines, conducting in-depth analyses, and developing tools and products to create a single source of truth around Netflix's greatest consumer-facing opportunities and challenges—at both a company and country level.   The ideal candidate will excel in data analytics, storytelling with data, cross-functional collaboration, clear communication with executive stakeholders, and share a passion for continuously improving the way we use data to make Netflix better. To learn more about analytics engineering at Netflix, read here. In this role, you will:
  • Become an expert in country-level performance by diving deep into our data to understand both our members and non-members.
  • Spearheaded research to understand the consumer-facing opportunities and challenges facing Netflix.
  • Scale these insights—Netflix is a global company, and we need to be able to efficiently zoom in on different regions throughout the world and ladder this up to a global view. 
  • Share your learnings with high-level leaders in a way that is digestible, actionable, and clear.
    • To be successful in this role, you have:
  • At least 5 years of experience as an analytics professional.
  • Expertise in SQL, programming skills (e.g. Python, Scala), and some exposure to ETL and data warehousing concepts.
  • A proven track record of data analysis, reporting and visualization (e.g. Tableau, D3).
  • Strong communication with the ability to build meaningful stakeholder relationships.
  • Enthusiasm for creative thinking and innovation in a fast-paced data and analytics space.
  • Excitement to learn about new fields, with the ability to be scrappy as needed.
  • Comfort with ambiguity; able to thrive with minimal oversight and process.
    • Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $170,000 - $720,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here. Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here. description: The Role At Netflix, the Production Solutions team enables the Content and Production teams to achieve their creative pursuits and operational goals through production solutions, technology, resource assurance, and workflow optimization. We seek to identify and address pan-regional opportunities for operational improvement and provide project management advice and support, to enable the execution of our Studio strategy on a global, regional, and country level. As the Program Manager, you will serve as a liaison between the regional teams and central teams to gather learnings and improve. PMs are globally savvy, self-motivated, flexible in thought, and able to juggle multiple responsibilities with a strong emphasis on organization. We value people who are creative problem solvers, have great judgment, and thrive in a fast-paced environment.  Truly collaborative, you are always excited to take on a new challenge and enjoy making the business better for everyone. You are tenured at Netflix - with the drive and passion for data analysis, and workflows with solid internal tools knowledge, and expertise to identify and address pan-regional opportunities for operational improvement to enable the execution of our Studio strategy on a global, regional, and country level. All SME activity is aligned through the Program Manager. As part of the Production Solutions team, you will: Act as the primary conduit between local teams and Central as well as other regional Production Solutions teams. Work in sync with production teams to highlight and communicate local and regional priorities to global teams, ensuring collaboration to make global initiatives relevant regionally. Forge partnerships with Content Operations and Innovations to craft enhanced workflows, establish best practices, and develop tool solutions. Seek out region-specific chances for ongoing improvement in workflows, technology, efficiency, tool enhancement, and deployment. Collaborate with global, regional, and country teams to ensure that data is complete, accurate, and contextual. Eliminating operational redundancies optimizes process efficiency and resource usage, enabling our content, creative, and production teams to prioritize tasks of greater value. Lead the discovery, development, and integration of tools, facilitating operational rollouts of new products, tools, and enhancements through scalable onboarding and localized support. Utilize data and trend analysis to foster regional improvements and maximize resource efficiency. Requirements: Functional experts tenured at Netflix(+3yrs)—with the drive and passion for data analysis and workflows and solid internal tools knowledge. Driven by intense curiosity, this individual delves into the deeper nuances of topics and challenges, displaying a knack for connecting the dots through pattern recognition. This person is adept at quickly addressing concerns and opposition within their function, offering necessary adjustments or explanations for decisions on proceeding with, adjusting, or abandoning solutions. This includes navigating challenges that emerge during the engineering process. They are skilled in prioritizing and realistically scheduling deliverables, fostering alignment within their function and across others, and practicing active listening. The ideal candidate is capable of juggling numerous tasks, prioritizing effectively, and tackling problems with a solution-oriented approach aimed at creating a significant impact. Experience with data analysis, setting strategic goals based on insights, and presenting these insights is highly valued. A strong passion for upholding our culture and values in the workplace is essential. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status or disability status. 넷플릭스는 다양한 경험과 생각을 가진 구성원이 모였을 때 최고의 성과를 내는 팀을 만들어 갈 수 있다고 믿고 있습니다. 다양성과 포용성은 우리가 지향하는 기업 문화의 핵심 중 하나이며, 이것의 궁극적인 목적은 모든 직원이 역량을 마음껏 발휘하고 성장하며 기여할 수 있도록 환경을 조성하는 것입니다.  인재를 선별하는 과정은 이러한 목적을 달성하는 데 매우 중요합니다.  이에 따라 넷플릭스는  성별, 인종, 피부색, 국적, 종교, 성적 지향, 나이, 결혼 여부 등 모든 개인적인 배경과 상관없이 모두에게 평등한 기회를 보장하며, 공정한 과정을 통해 채용을 진행하고 있습니다.장애인 및 국가보훈 대상자는 관련 법령에 따라 우대합니다.

description: Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with 270 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. Our team builds products to help Netflix plan, spend and account for the money we spend producing world-class, award-winning, high quality, and diverse content. The goal of our team is to provide accurate planning of our content budget, help production houses manage their production budget, accounting of content spend and reduce the risks associated with reporting of the content spend. We work cross functionally with Engineering, Product, Design, and our Business Partners to build solutions for their needs. These systems help our business plan, account for, and operate all-things-finance for our productions. Our team is a diverse mix of talented engineers that work together building applications, core services, and systems on the Netflix Paved Path. We deeply care about our business partners and seek to understand the need and importance of what we’re working on. We need your help to build the technologies that allow us to scale our efforts across the globe, and do so effectively and efficiently! This role is based in Warsaw and our teams work in a hybrid-working model. We are looking for both Level 4 and Level 5 Software Engineers to join our team. Your Day-to-Day Design and build systems and services for Netflix’s Content Finance using Java. Work cross-functionally to build new services, tools and data models to operationalize our workflows at scale. Participate in product reviews and team meetings, providing technical insight. Help scope, estimate, and prioritize between conflicting needs. Evaluate new technologies and approaches to streamline and improve our rapid application development tooling and conventions. Regularly learn new systems and tools as the Netflix platform and ecosystem evolve. Participate in our on-call rotation and contribute to incident reviews. You may enjoy working with us if you: Are self-driven and highly motivated to deliver top-tier solutions with minimal guidance. You also recognize when you're wrong, learning from your mistakes and moving past them. Love brainstorming with fellow Backend and UI engineers, product designers, and product managers, and directly with our users, to understand what they want, figure out what they really need, and finally, what we should build. Strive to embrace best practices and are always searching for opportunities to continually improve. We would love to work with you if: You are adept at building applications with an Object Oriented language. We work with Java primarily, so interest in learning and coding in Java is desirable. You excel in developing microservice-based distributed systems with high availability, throughput, fault tolerance, and performance. You are experienced in utilizing relational and non-relational data stores. You have previous experience in Media and Entertainment industry. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

description: It’s an amazing time to join Netflix as we continue to transform entertainment globally. Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services, with over 270 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films, and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. The Opportunity As Netflix continues to grow in Korea, it is an exciting time to join the team. As the Recruiter for Korea, you will have an outsized influence on Netflix’s success in the region, as a function of the caliber of talent you are able to hire. At Netflix, Talent Acquisition is a massive priority, and we operate in a progressive hiring environment in which hiring the best -- versus “making the hire” -- guides everything we do. Recruiters who thrive here are adept at coaching and partnering with their hiring teams: defining what the best looks like for a given role; and executing the recruitment strategy to bring the hires across to the finish line. About you: 10+ years of experience in recruiting from within a global, high-growth company Able to be hands-on in sourcing, screening and closing candidates, while coaching and influencing the highest levels of the businesses you support. Experience in designing and executing recruiting programs and projects targeted for niche talent (e.g. Content, Production, VFX,  Early Careers Program) would be a big plus. Highly self-directed, a problem solver with a burning desire to contribute to Netflix’s reputation and success. Insatiably curious, you enjoy asking what makes different different businesses tick, and understanding how different parts of the business fit in with and impact one another. Strong understanding of the complexities of search throughout Korea, and excited at the opportunity to meaningfully engage in the market. Being a thoughtful recruiting partner to the business. Use talent market expertise, data, and business acumen to educate and influence hiring managers as to how to identify and acquire the best talent. Excited about technology; consuming TV, movies, and entertainment is fun, not a chore. Excited to be able to impact Netflix’s hiring brand in Korea, and appreciate the importance of that brand to hiring. Fluent Korean speaker, proficiency in English We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

description: About Netflix: Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with over 270 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. We recently launched a new ad-supported tier to offer our members more choice in how they consume their content. Our new tier allows us to attract new members at a lower price point while also creating a compelling path for advertisers to reach deeply immersed audiences. Our Team The Ads Platform team builds the advertising systems and integrations that power the delivery of ads using our world-class content delivery ecosystem. We deliver ads in a manner that’s thoughtful of our member’s viewing experience and drive great outcomes for advertisers. We also ensure that advertiser brand safety is ensured during serving, members only see the most appropriate ads for them and Netflix’s advertising policies and contracts are thoroughly enforced. Our team is new, yet we are ambitious about building highly performant advertising systems and delivering high impact to our business by monetizing our incredible slate of content. As one of the newest entrants in the rapidly growing Connected TV advertising space, we seek to build unique value propositions that help us differentiate from the competition and become a market leader in record time. What you'll be doing: Define the program and plan for product launch partnering closely with regional counterparts, AdOps, RevOps, Marketing, and Revenue leadership to drive product adoption. Partner closely with the Revenue team to deeply understand regional advertiser needs and pain points to form business requirements and prioritize solutions. Communicate directly with clients to support Revenue and Account Management teams providing regional technical sales and integration support Lead regional product requirements through the early stages of planning and development with a clear articulation of customer feedback and market insights, becoming a trusted partner to Revenue and Marketing. Develop a deep understanding of local market dynamics, opportunities, competitive sets, value propositions, adoption accelerants and customers. Contribute and work independently on ad hoc strategic projects to generate process efficiencies and to drive revenue growth for our ads business Contribute through knowledge sharing and training for internal teams in process and platform best practices We’re seeking a candidate who has: At least 7 years of experience in product marketing, product operations, strategy and technology project management 3 years of experience in the entertainment and streaming TV sector is preferred Experience partnering with and influencing global product teams and/or engineering to represent market requirements Experience partnering with and influencing sales teams and developing market-specific go-to-market strategies We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. description: Senior Software Engineer - Linux Specialist The Senior Software Engineer—Linux Specialist is responsible for the management, design, and implementation of game systems. You will provide technical mentorship and guidance for junior engineers, focusing on Linux-based environments. Essential Functions/Responsibilities: Work on key gameplay and engine features independently or in a supervisory capacity over a small, cross-disciplinary team. Collaborate with Principal/Director level engineers to define technical specifications for large systems. Support project Lead. In their absence, fill in as needed for project meetings. Disseminate information and updates as appropriate and necessary. Partner with other engineers to develop tools and processes that improve efficiency and quality. Develop and update feature documentation, maintain a shared library of tech, and process documentation. Independently design and implement key systems and gameplay features. Demonstrate expertise/ownership in at least one major area of the codebase. Mentor, motivate, and inspire other engineers. Help guide or lead cross-disciplinary dialogs to drive features from initial concept to completion. Exemplify reliability, accountability, and professionalism in all work-related interactions. Partner with principal/director-level engineers to drive coding standards and best practices for the department and project team. Design, implement, and manage Linux-based systems and infrastructure. Optimize and troubleshoot Linux systems for performance and reliability. Ensure security best practices are followed for Linux systems. Serve as a liaison between Art and Engineering to efficiently facilitate art integration. Coordinate with game teams to ensure consistent standards and production methodologies across the studio. Work alongside the existing game team and code base to bring Netflix Stories to Linux platforms. Resolve any issues that arise with existing systems when running on Linux. Skills and Abilities: Advanced programming skills within the relevant development environment(s). Ability to objectively evaluate code as part of a formal review process and effectively communicate opportunities for improved performance, resilience, and stability. Ability to coordinate and build effective partnerships within the engineering team and other development verticals. Demonstrated fundamentals of leadership, including clear and proactive communication and coordination, meeting moderation, and oversight of small cross-disciplinary initiatives. Able to manage multiple, competing tasks and be self-directed to meet deadlines in a quickly evolving environment. Advanced knowledge and experience with Linux operating systems and environments. Proficiency in Linux shell scripting and command-line tools. Experience with Linux-based application development, deployment, and maintenance. Familiarity with containerization technologies like Docker and orchestration tools like Kubernetes. Education and Experience: Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, or related degree, or equivalent work experience. 8 years experience in delivering production-level code in a professional environment. Experience shipping multiple successful game products into the marketplace. Experience supporting a live service. iOS and Android mobile development experience. Real-time strategy and Unity 3D game development experience. Thorough understanding of the software development life cycle, and practices. Experience with Jira, Confluence, or other defect-tracking software. Extensive experience with Linux operating systems in a professional environment. Previous experience in Linux system administration or engineering. Position Type/Expected Hours of Work Our core hours are 10:00 am to 6:00 pm CST, which means you should be available for meetings etc. during this time frame. description: THE JOB: We’re looking for an experienced and highly skilled Senior Community Manager to lay the foundation for helping us build deeply engaged player communities for Cloud Games streamed directly to our members' TVs. In this role, you will be responsible for developing strategies and maintaining a healthy community of players within Netflix's unique social ecosystem, which drives member joy and engagement. The right candidate will be intimately familiar with building early development communities from the ground up, developing the foundational advocates we need to drive explosive player growth after launch. You will leverage your deep knowledge of grassroots community building to help us drive early Beta experiences; Developing social channels, acquiring players, executing playtesting, gathering feedback, and building relationships with content creators. You will leverage your experiences in launching new games to collaborate closely with Netflix partners, developing strong relationships that will amplify our voice, and build joyful relationships with players around the world. THE TEAM: ISX’s mission is to empower small teams of exceptional developers to build breakout hits, leveraging innovative gameplay married with beloved IPs and served seamlessly within the Netflix streaming ecosystem. You will join the group of developers who are aligned with our core values, and care deeply about the experiences they create as well as the people they make them with. Those who bias towards action and are energized by the learning that comes with bold experimentation at an agile pace. As a part of Netflix, we strive to hire the best and value integrity, excellence, respect, inclusion, and collaboration. Responsibilities Voice of the Player: Identifies meaningful community feedback and trends, and tactfully represents their voice to our development teams. Build, foster & grow safe communities: Develops online communities across multiple channels (Discord, Reddit, X, TikTok, etc) that are inclusive, respectful, and promote strong engagement with our games. Drives early community playtesting: Partners with development team(s) to plan and execute early community playtesting roadmaps for games in Alpha & Beta. Develops methods to acquire new players, hosts playtest events, and collects early player feedback. Owns content creator strategy: Builds strong player advocacy for our games by developing and maintaining healthy relationships with content creators, influencers, fan sites and more. Develop & execute social campaigns: Create player joy & conversations through a consistent stream of social content including text, images, videos, live streaming, events, and more. Partner with Netflix communications & marketing: Cultivates a strong relationship with partner groups within Netflix in order to identify and deliver on game launches, marketing campaigns, product collaborations, and cross channel opportunities both virtually and in person. The Ideal Candidate 7+ years of experience creating, growing, and maintaining thriving game communities Excellent written and verbal communication skills Strong track record of planning and executing early Beta community play-testing events Deep experience in working with content creators, influencers, and social media advocates Proven ability to create best in class external external-facing content Strong track record of creating and protecting inclusive, safe, and welcoming community spaces. Has shipped at least one game at scale in partnership with publishing, marketing & comms Bonus Skills Pre-existing relationships with key community members, content creators, influencers & more Prior background in Marketing, Publishing, PR or Communications Prior background in creating content as a player (Content creator, influencer, fan sites, etc) Technical experience in game operations (Build deployment, troubleshooting player issues, etc) Experience leading & managing other community professionals Required Application Materials Resume Portfolio of communities you’ve played a key role in, social channels you’ve run that demonstrate how you create and build community Location Orange County or Los Angeles preferred Will consider remote applicants who are willing to travel for work-related events Compensation: Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top-of-market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $100,000-$600,000 Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more details about our Benefits here . Netflix has a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with 270 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. The Content & Media ML Foundations team, within Data Science and Engineering, is responsible for foundational R&D initiatives shaping the future of content production and promotion on a global scale. Using rich multi-modal data (text, video, audio, images), we build ML models and capabilities such as customized generative algorithms and multi-modal embeddings that enable unique content understanding. These initiatives lead to the development of high leverage capabilities and drive significant impact across Netflix. We also partner closely with platform teams to ensure that ML models and other data-driven solutions can be scaled effectively across Netflix. We are looking for our first Amsterdam-based Analytics Engineer to join the team. In this role, you will own and deliver insights that directly inform our ML strategy across model performance, improvements and new applications across Netflix. Specifically, you will collaborate with ML practitioners to develop tooling that provides insights into model performance, enabling a deeper understanding of model behavior and informing both improvement roadmaps and the creation of analytical products with modeling outputs. You will also partner closely with platform teams to offer analytical support on foundational systems such as the Netflix media platform and the Netflix scripts ecosystem to enable better decision-making and drive operational efficiency. What You Will Do Amplify impact of ML models through Analytics: Drive insights across our ML ecosystem that shape long-term execution roadmaps against our strategy. Where appropriate, design and develop tools & dashboards that enable “unblackboxifying” of complex ML models, broadening the surface area of their impact. Stakeholder Analytics: Partner with business teams to identify critical analytical problems, applying an entrepreneurial mindset to find innovative solutions using data. Metric Design: Spearhead the creation of new metrics to inform decision-making and improve operational efficiency. Regional Expertise: Become an expert on all things related to our Data Science & Engineering efforts, helping educate and connect regional offices to existing and new data solutions. You Are… Able to develop and deepen strong relationships with a wide variety of stakeholders and have a proven track record of influencing strategic decisions through data. Able to thrive with minimal oversight and process, connecting the dots across business needs and independently driving projects forward. Proven experience with ML models and an understanding of modern ML algorithms, enabling effective collaboration with ML researchers and engineers. A senior analytics professional with extensive experience in data wrangling, analysis, reporting, and visualization. An expert in data-oriented programming languages, including Python and SQL, and intuitive dashboard/visualization design (e.g Tableau). Proficient in ETL processes and data warehousing best practices. Experienced at working across different cultures on a globally-distributed team, with core working hours in the Central European and GMT time zones. Culture You will have the opportunity to impact the business in a meaningful way, working alongside smart people who love to solve hard problems, and who not only expect but also foster high performance. You will have the freedom to innovate, solve interesting problems, and influence decision-making in a fast-paced, exciting environment. You can learn more about our culture at jobs.netflix.com/culture . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

description: It's an exciting time to join Netflix as we continue to transform entertainment globally. We are bringing new stories to millions of people worldwide by promoting our original, exclusive content. A key to growth is our ability to work well with global partners across a number of different interactions. As we move beyond 270 million paid members and hundreds of partnerships worldwide, we are looking for talented individuals to drive better creative outcomes in the various ways in which we work with other brands. The Partner Marketing team drives acquisition and retention through a series of marketing and promotional activities with Operator brands across APAC such as Docomo, KDDI, SKT, KT, Jio, Airtel, Foxtel, Optus, AIS, Spark, etc. As a member of the Marketing Partnerships team, you will wear several hats to ensure that the APAC team runs smoothly from asset management to various other team operations tasks.  In this role you will work with a variety of cross-functional internal partners, vendors and external distribution partners. The applicant should be organised, detail-oriented and comfortable working autonomously to meet daily and long-term deadlines. The ideal candidate is technically knowledgeable across asset types, systems, and technologies and excels at translating complexity into simplicity whilst working with geographically dispersed teams. You are able to define best practices and frameworks, lead operational change management, and identify and implement cross-functional solutions that will drive measurable creative operations at scale. KEY RESPONSIBILITIES Asset Management Expert. Drive efficiency and best practices in asset management and fulfilment both internally (for our teams, workflows, and tooling) and externally (for how we outsource tasks to partners and agencies). Operational Strategist. Proactively identify issues and opportunities to improve how we can efficiently support partner campaigns across Netflix APAC. Improve workflows and tools to close gaps and make meaningful change. Define clear and attainable goals, and deliver continuous measurable improvements on these. Cross-Functional Coordination. Ability to balance the short and long-term needs of multiple cross-functional teams. Lead and manage communication and workflow on a range of creative projects, ensuring effective exchange of deliverables with cross-functional and external partners. Ability to effectively and clearly communicate overall campaign timelines and project deliverables with internal and external partners. REQUIREMENTS Minimum 6+ years experience, preferably with experience in an entertainment or agency environment. Ability to cultivate relationships and efficiently communicate across multiple cross-functional partners - internal, external and agency partners Ability to work in a fast-paced environment with multiple stakeholders and prioritise tasks and escalate issues as needed. Proven experience fulfilling and managing large sets of assets in complex asset management environments. Existing knowledge and experience in production briefs, and confidence in actioning briefs to deliver a variety of creative outputs. Knowledge of A/V and Artwork file types and specifications, and digital file specs and size formats Room to grow and support major creative partnerships in APAC. PERSONALITY ATTRIBUTES: Works effectively and enjoys the interplay across multiple teams and stakeholders Strong attention to detail, creatives best practices and analytical problem-solving skills Bias to action, proactive & innovative by nature. Excellent verbal and written communication skills and exceptional attention to detail. Fluency in English is required. Japanese or Korean language skills are a plus. A positive and energetic team player, who can flourish in our unique company culture. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

description: This individual will support the Animation Series Casting team and work closely with both internal Netflix cross-functional teams and partner-managed productions. This assistant will provide administrative support to the department head, logistical and data entry support for relevant casting information, and coordinate with various cross-functional partners to ensure a premium experience for Netflix productions, hired voice directors, external casting directors and voice talent throughout the entirety of the series casting process. Responsibilities will also include but are not limited to: Manages calendar for the department head while organizing team specific meetings. Responsible for preparing any material including presentations, memos, and decks for internal syncs. Creating and updating forms, templates and tracking sheets to increase overall workflow efficiency for series productions.
