search_text:
New York, New York Products & Technology Advertising Senior Analyst, Sales Incentive Compensation Netflix is one of the world's leading streaming entertainment services, with 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries. Members enjoy TV series, documentaries, feature films, and mobile games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause, and resume watching as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. The core Advertising team is charged with building a new, best-in-class Ads organization to establish Netflix as the premiere platform for advertiser partners and to drive advertising revenue. As part of the Business Operations & Strategy team, this role will be a critical builder of the Sales Incentive Compensation (SIC) program, supporting the Advertising business. This means driving new solutions across SIC plan design, quota setting and management, payout operations, program analytics, and process/tool design and implementation. Netflix is seeking a Sr. Analyst, Sales Incentive Compensation to build with us at this early stage. The ideal candidate will be an exceptionally strong analytical thinker who can demonstrate teamwork, strategic relationship building, and the ability to influence at multiple levels of the organization. They thrive in fast-paced dynamic environments and are flexible, detail-oriented, and passionate about customers and advertisers. They must also be comfortable working with numerous stakeholders across the global organization in a highly ambiguous environment. For this role, the successful candidate will have deep experience across Sales Incentives and/or Sales Ops programs and in defining and managing processes and metrics to support a high-growth sales organization. They will be able to juggle competing projects, define and execute against roadmaps to support the SIC program, and solve complex problems. This role will be accountable for the definition and implementation of Sales Incentive program metrics and measurement. Drawing insights from industry benchmarks and internal baselines will be core to success for this role. This role will also lead the building of reporting capabilities, data transformations, and forums for reviewing program health. This person will work closely with sales leaders, finance, HR, talent, legal, and other Netflix business partner teams to set and administer our SIC policies and program. Specific Responsibilities:
  • Determine the effectiveness and impact of global sales incentive compensation models, producing data insights and making design recommendations to a steering committee
  • Drive revenue data quality, including sourcing and reconciliation
  • Partner with engineering to design and implement SIC reporting and automation solutions
  • Play a key role in the global SIC program foundational buildout including; SIC strategy, policy and procedure documentation, enablement and related content creation, payroll, SOX, annual plan design process, quota, and stakeholder support
  • Define, document, and govern the health of the program metric review forums for Sr. Director and VP-level stakeholders from Sales, Finance, Talent, and Business Operations organizations
  • Propose and present ideas effectively, influencing decisions and outcomes
  • Design and implement SIC plans via tools, processes, and sales readiness
  • The successful candidate must be able to roll-up their sleeves and dive deep to implement effective processes and solutions. They will be passionate about their work, detail-oriented, resourceful, analytical, and have excellent problem-solving abilities. Communication and partner-relationship skills are critical, with a deep background in SIC or sales operations. Must be a passionate advocate for creating programs that deliver exceptional results from teams.
    • Basic Qualifications:
  • Bachelor’s degree in a related field
  • 7+ years of sales incentive compensation, FP&A, or sales operations experience
  • Expert-level user of Microsoft Excel and/or Google Sheets
    • Preferred Qualifications:
  •  Experience implementing variable sales compensation plans
  • Experience working with Sales CRM and SIC tools (such as Salesforce and CaptivateIQ/Xactly/SPIFF)
  • Demonstrated understanding of finance/FP&A concepts and processes
  • Ability to define, aggregate, and analyze metrics to assess performance drivers
  • Experience setting, interpreting, and governing policies for a large-scale program
  • Experience with sales incentive compensation models for advertising
  • Strong interpersonal and communication (written and verbal) skills
  • Exceptional attention to detail
    • Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top-of-market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $70,000 - $420,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more details about our Benefits here. Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here. We are an equal opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services, with 270 million paid memberships in over 190 countries, enjoying TV series, films, and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause, and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. THE OPPORTUNITY Netflix seeks an experienced Copyright Counsel to evaluate and advise on the chain of title in connection with the acquisition of rights to the intellectual property that underlies Netflix’s content.  This unique and exciting role sits on the Copyright Team which is part of the larger Intellectual Property Team.  On the IP Team, it is our mission to support creative excellence by managing the risks associated with Netflix’s content from acquisition through distribution, and beyond.  This role reports to the Director, Copyright, Intellectual Property, and is based in Los Angeles. As a member of the Copyright Team, you will support vital components of our intellectual property practice, and be an integral resource for Netflix’s business and creative teams. Your determinations directly impact the viability and valuation of potential acquisitions. Your rights experience allows you to make determinations around legal risk as it relates to ownership, attachments, and obligations. Your copyright expertise allows you to confidently advise on material issues including termination, reversion, and public domain. Your expert eye for detail and exceptional organizational talents mean that you excel at quickly piecing together the jigsaw puzzle of a complex rights situation. You are comfortable working with incomplete information and ambiguous contractual terms. You are adept at pragmatically analyzing risk, and you confidently communicate across all levels of the business. You are passionate about the entertainment industry and excited to learn more about the business. You think outside the box, challenge long-standing assumptions, and look for opportunities to innovate. Your bias is toward collaboration, responsiveness to change, feedback, and new ideas. This is an opportunity to help shape the future of entertainment. Responsibilities: Conduct chain of title analysis and provide concise and pragmatic advice regarding complex rights acquisitions and grants, as well as copyright reports, registrations, and recordations Prepare and present a detailed chain of title memos and analysis to business and creative teams Keep apprised of domestic and international copyright developments and adjust Netflix’s practices and approaches accordingly Implement efficient workflows for chain of title review Train internal attorneys and staff about the chain of title and copyright transfer issues Develop and maintain strong relationships with international counsel and outside vendors Requirements: JD degree and 6+ years of transactional copyright experience in the media industry, including chain of title review Deep understanding of U.S. copyright law as it relates to ownership and transfers Experience with the development and production process for scripted filmed entertainment Unparalleled organizational skills and unwavering attention to detail Clear, concise communication skills, excellent interpersonal skills, and creative thinking Interest in and/or experience with the chain of title adjacent legal issues, such as bankruptcy, estate planning, and tax Tech­-savvy, including proficiency with cloud­-based document and database systems Ability to work proactively, independently, and reliably on multiple projects under tight time frames in a fast­-paced environment In addition to be successful at Netflix’s culture, the candidate should possess the following: Strong analytical (strategic and creative) capabilities and judgment Comfort making decisions even when faced with ambiguity Business-centered and focused on pragmatic solutions Highly collaborative and effective in teaming up with business and legal partners Commitment to actively seeking feedback in the spirit of continuous improvement Flexibility, including the ability to work effectively and collaborate cross-functionally with people having diverse viewpoints and interests Curiosity and the willingness to tackle matters outside their area of expertise Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top-of-market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $250,000 - $530,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more details about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: At Netflix, we want to entertain the world and are constantly innovating on how entertainment is imagined, created and delivered to a global audience. We currently stream content in more than 30 languages in 190 countries, topping over 260 million paid subscribers, and are expanding into new forms of entertainment such as gaming. Content Engineering builds the products and services used by our internal and external creative partners to create, launch, and promote our global content. Our products enable the entire workflow of content creation, from pitch to play, and provide innovative new ways to develop and manage entertainment at scale. We are looking for talented distributed systems engineers like you to help build the technologies that allow us to scale our efforts globally, effectively, and efficiently! You’ll have a direct impact on how the Netflix studio creates and promotes shows such as “Squid Game,” “Stranger Things,” and “The Queen’s Gambit” globally. We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive team to bring new perspectives as we solve the next set of challenges. In addition, we are open to remote candidates - we value what you can do, from anywhere in the U.S. You will be successful in this role if you enjoy: Being self-motivated and working independently while collaborating with engineers on the team and cross-functional teams (product managers and TPMs). Empowering other engineers by building and operating robust, scalable, and highly available infrastructures, with a focus on developer experience, observability, and operational excellence. Being passionate about code quality and engineering best practices. Embracing and thriving in ambiguity. Complex and fuzzy requirements are more common than clearly defined customer expectations. Living the Netflix’s culture and thinking you would thrive here. Qualifications: Have 2+ years of experience working on distributed systems features or applications. Have recent proficient experience with Java, C# or other OO programming languages, as well as OO design principles. Have a good understanding of concepts like multithreading and parallelism, as well as software observability. Experience in developing microservices, data modeling, and API designs. Ability to describe complex technical concepts to cross-functional team peers, driving conversations and decisions through written and/or verbal communication. Nice to have: Experience in building infrastructure and platforms. Experience in API design and implementation using gRPC and/or GraphQL. Experience in any of the following areas: cloud storage/file system, data platform, event-driven infrastructure, ontology, and workflow orchestration. Spotlight on Content Engineering Teams: Content MiddleWare Infrastructure (MWI) The Content MiddleWare Infrastructure team(MWI), a part of the Content Infrastructure & Solutions group, provides Studio and Content Engineering specific, highly leveraged, and fully managed data, workflow, and messaging & communication platforms facilitating the goal of the Connected Studio . To learn more about what the MWI team does, check out the following tech blogs:Workflow ( 1 , 2 )Graph Search ( 1 , 2 , 3 )Data Movement ( 1 , 2 ) Media Infrastructure Platform (MIP) The Media Infrastructure Platform team provides large-scale infrastructure for content media, enabling Netflix to store, access, and process media files at scale, reliably, and efficiently to meet the demands of Netflix streaming and studio. Our products are highly leveraged by Encoding, Netflix Studio, and Content Engineering. We closely partner with a variety of cross-functional teams, including Encoding Technology, Netflix Engineering Platform, Data Science Engineering, and Content Engineering, as well as Product Managers. The team currently owns a few key products such as a polyglot application framework, and container-based executor for media-aware serverless functions with observability tools and workflow orchestration frameworks, a storage layer built on top of S3 with a set of features like file and folder solution, lifecycle management,  media sequence detection, Netflix access control, security,  client side encryption, full file checksum, etc.  Besides the cloud services the team currently owns, the team is also looking to grow into a more diverse and hybrid media processing and storage media space to meet the needs of business growth. A few more things about us: As a team, we come from many different countries, and our fields of education range from the humanities to engineering to computer science. Our team includes product managers, program managers, designers, full-stack developers, distributed systems engineers, and data scientists. Folks have the opportunity to wear different hats, should they choose to. We strongly believe this diversity has helped us build an inclusive and empathetic environment, and we look forward to adding your perspective to the mix! Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top-of-market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $170,000 - $720,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more details about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services, with 270 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume as much as they want, anytime, anywhere and can change their plans at any time. Netflix is the leading provider of streaming video, much of the content being original features, shorts, series, documentaries, comedy specials and unscripted content. Across all types of projects, Netflix strives to optimize content quality and longevity without compromising efficiency and creative vision.  As part of the Production Technology and Operations team, Production Technologists aim to drive the adoption of practices that favor technical quality and predictable results on Netflix Productions. From on-set through to final delivery, we offer direct support to production crews as well as internal and external physical production, post, and visual effects teams. By staying up-to-date with the most advanced developments in professional and consumer technology, our Technologists offer expertise in key areas of motion picture production and post-production - cameras, sound, data management, image science, dailies, editorial, color correction, deliverables, archival, VFX imaging and more! The Nonfiction Technologist serves as the subject matter expert consultant on workflows for documentaries, unscripted shows, and ‘live-to-tape’ productions. As part of the Production Technology & Operations team, you will: Support Netflix Original productions through technical consultation, onsite visits, and targeted engagement throughout the production lifecycle to remove technical barriers and empower creative flexibility. Work closely with both Netflix Production and Innovation teams, informing them on the practicality and go-to-market strategy for emerging / new technologies and imaging workflows on Netflix productions. Contribute to designing, testing, and implementing cloud-based production technologies. Consult for complex imaging and workflow pipeline issues that impact production costs, time, and delivery to service. Engage with internal and external teams on both Netflix’s technical specifications and production best practices and why they exist, setting our partners up for success in areas such as image capture, scaling, color management, and interchange. Evaluate challenges and opportunities for partner self-sufficiency in support of Netflix productions, both in-region and in collaboration with global teams. Maintain currency on filmmaking trends and new technologies in production workflows. Introduce key stakeholders (creatives, production executives, partners) to emerging production technologies, increasing their knowledge of “what’s possible.” Represent the Netflix Production Technology and Operations team at industry functions, conferences, committee meetings, etc. Skills & Requirements: Minimum of 5 years experience of practical workflow and imaging experience applied toward actual productions either in technical on-set or post-production roles, with a focus across Nonfiction genres. Strong customer orientation and helpful, collaborative demeanor. An ability to translate technical jargon and filmmaking workflows into practical, applicable, and actionable directions. Extensive understanding of broadcast, image capture, production, and post-production workflows. A strong desire to bring cutting-edge innovative technology and techniques to elevate the Nonfiction space. Understanding of common industry tools and production practices. Willingness and aptitude to educate both internal and external entities with varying degrees of knowledge in your areas of expertise. Ability to develop long-standing relationships with production and post-production operational teams. Ability to communicate and interact on a global level and frame projects with sensitivity to cultural diversity and industrial variation. Knowledge of industry standards and the bodies that ratify them. Experience in and relationships with technology solutions, equipment, and service vendors across production and post. A passion for sound and the moving image. Ability to thrive in the Netflix culture centered around feedback, transparency, and accountability. This position is based in Los Angeles, CA Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $160,000 - $360,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

  • Maintain currency on filmmaking trends and new technologies in production workflows.
  • Introduce key stakeholders (creatives, production executives, partners) to emerging production technologies, increasing their knowledge of “what’s possible.”  
  • Represent the Netflix Production Technology and Operations team at industry functions, conferences, committee meetings, etc. 
    • Skills & Requirements:
  • Minimum of 5 years experience of practical workflow and imaging experience applied toward actual productions either in technical on-set or post-production roles, with a focus across Nonfiction genres.
  • Strong customer orientation and helpful, collaborative demeanor.
  • An ability to translate technical jargon and filmmaking workflows into practical, applicable, and actionable directions.
  • Extensive understanding of broadcast, image capture, production, and post-production workflows.
  • A strong desire to bring cutting-edge innovative technology and techniques to elevate the Nonfiction space. 
  • Understanding of common industry tools and production practices.
  • Willingness and aptitude to educate both internal and external entities with varying degrees of knowledge in your areas of expertise.
  • Ability to develop long-standing relationships with production and post-production operational teams.
  • Ability to communicate and interact on a global level and frame projects with sensitivity to cultural diversity and industrial variation.
  • Knowledge of industry standards and the bodies that ratify them.
  • Experience in and relationships with technology solutions, equipment, and service vendors across production and post.
  • A passion for sound and the moving image.
  • Ability to thrive in the Netflix culture centered around feedback, transparency, and accountability. 
  • This position is based in Los Angeles, CA
    • Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $160,000 - $360,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here. Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here. description: Netflix is one of the world’s leading entertainment services with over 270 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films, and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause, and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. We’re looking for an innovative, self-starter to fill the role of Coordinator, Film & Series Marketing, Japan, and create breakthrough ideas that market our titles and create a lasting brand story for local members.  This is an opportunity to lead the development, launch, and execution of 360-degree campaigns that pierce the cultural zeitgeist and drive global conversations about the Netflix brand and our titles. Our ideal candidate is strategic, solution-oriented, and highly passionate about storytelling. This person will serve as the strategist and creative lead for title campaigns. Visit our culture memo and long-term view to learn more about Netflix's unique culture and the opportunity to join our team. Responsibilities: Develop, lead, and execute unique and conversational title campaigns that place Netflix in the middle of the cultural zeitgeist. Serve as creative lead for these campaigns from print/OOH, trailers/AV/Social, events/activations to non-traditional headline-grabbing creative. Align with the Japan marketing strategy to establish Netflix's brand image within the Japanese market through campaign activities. Work alongside other marketing functions (Social Marketing, Marketing Partnerships, etc.) to build impactful campaigns that demonstrate our values and ingrain us in Japanese culture. Partner with and act as the main point of contact for local creative and media agencies to bring campaigns to life Partner with and act as the main point of contact for marketing communications with local talent agencies and production companies to share our campaign strategies and to execute the campaign. Work with and serve as the liaison between internal cross-functional teams (such as Content, Publicity, Product, etc.), ensuring that all aspects of a title campaign are cohesive across all lines of business. Be part of our Dream Team to help Netflix better understand the needs and shifting cultural landscape of Japan. Continue to innovate and push to think of the best media strategies for Netflix. Qualifications: A seasoned creative exec/marketer with a minimum 5 years of experience in building strategic and creative consumer marketing campaigns, preferably at a streamer, network, or studio with a background in entertainment or for a global lifestyle brand that intersects with Japanese entertainment and culture (TV, film, gaming, sport). A natural leader, team player, and project manager; you are a selfless, collaborative marketing professional who will go beyond your roles to get great work done. Passionate about great stories. You can talk on and on about your favorite shows, genres, and creators you admire in your life. A proven track record of building impactful, world-class creative campaigns that connect with audiences and break through the cultural zeitgeist. We are not only building campaigns, we are transforming our properties into culturally relevant brands. Knowledge and experience in building and executing strategic media strategies. Inherently bold and comfortable with risk-taking. Strong presentation, prioritization, and decision-making skills. An entrepreneurial mindset. This person should be a proactive self-starter, who is not afraid to get their hands dirty and wear multiple hats. Passionate and curious about all aspects of Netflix and the Netflix business at large. Written and Verbal fluency in the Japanese language is required. Fluency in the English language is preferable. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status or disability status. Netflixは男女雇用機会均等法を順守しており、考え方や背景の多様性がより強力なチームを構築すると認識しています。Netflixは多様性・インクルージョンについて、真剣にかつ思慮深く取り組んでおり、人種、宗教、出身地、性別、性自認・性表現、経済状況、性的指向、年齢、婚姻状況、兵役、障がいの有無、その他の属性によって差別することはありません。 Netflix Japan will not accept unsolicited resumes or applications from recruitment agencies, and we will not be responsible for any related fees. Please do not forward resumes to our career page or employees.

description: Netflix is one of the world's leading streaming entertainment services with over 248 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause, and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. Since the days of DVDs in envelopes, our content analysts and ratings strategists have brought context to content, analyzing and tagging titles on service to help match titles to members, and to help them make the right choices for them and their families. Now as Netflix explores a broader world of entertainment – expanding into Games, Live, Ads and more –  we are looking for a leader to take the Content Analysis and Ratings teams in the US, Canada, and Latin America to their next act: more metadata, more local, more impact. As a leader in the Product Metadata and Ratings group, you’ll be responsible for leading the Content Analysis team covering some of our key markets, a team that captures the local nuances of a global catalog; for creating and managing relationships at all levels of the company – including Content and Product – in a complex matrixed environment; for driving innovation in the ways we think about content and member needs; for transforming workflows as we take advantage of ML and AI – and doing it all at the scale and quality our users and cross-functional partners demand. You will also work closely with the Ratings Policy team in-region, ensuring an effective collaborative relationship between Content Analysis and Ratings Policy, providing insights from key cross functional stakeholders in UCAN, and communicating ratings sensitivities to local partners. You will: Lead a team of content analysts working on titles produced in the US and Canada organized by vertical categories: Series, Film and Animation, and Non-Fiction (including Live). You will also be responsible for a smaller slate of content produced in Latin America. Be accountable for how we classify, rate and review content and assets in a way that supports existing and new use-cases across the Netflix business. Be accountable for your teams maintaining performance standards, achieving key results and setting up the appropriate recurring review processes to ensure they are on track in a fast-paced operationally critical environment. Manage day-to-day partnerships across the business in the region, creating and facilitating working relationships across Merchandising, Product, Content, vertical leadership teams, and Ratings. You will work with leadership at all levels across the business and must fluidly communicate between organizations. Represent the wider Product Metadata & Ratings department in the region – working with Series, Film and Animation, and Non-Fiction  leadership on strategy and team management. You will also represent Product Metadata and Ratings with local LATAM partners. Serve as an escalation point of contact in-region for issues related to metadata application and ratings. Ensure obstacles to launching and supporting key projects are addressed for your team. You will elevate opportunities and challenges with solutions to improve efficient and effective output, as needed. Be responsible for the development and growth of Content Analysts. Travel as required. Qualifications: 5+ years of experience in a field encompassing any of product metadata, audience engagement, content classification and curation, content insights, content strategy and management, or similar. Experience managing or leading teams in high-scale product and/or content organizations. Deep understanding of consumer behaviors and discovery habits with entertainment, understands how those intersect with content catalog and services. Should have experience with globally distributed, matrixed, and remote-first teams. Strategic, analytical thinker with a strong customer-focused mindset and empathy. Strong judgment and decisiveness when dealing with timely, deadline-driven, content-related issues and concerns. Excellent written (memos and presentations) and verbal communication skills; timely communication. Highly motivated self-starter with the ability to work independently and drive alignment amid ambiguity. Ability to build strong relationships with stakeholders and effectively influence and contribute with concrete recommendations/next steps, across both regional and global teams. Comfortable applying a combination of qualitative and quantitative methods to define success. Insatiable curiosity to learn new domains, keep up with industry innovation, and constantly ask ‘why’. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $170,000-$400,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

Members can play, pause, and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. About the Commerce Lifecycle & Platform team You’ll lead the Content Designers working on our Commerce Lifecycle & Platform team (within Growth XD). This team is responsible for creating innovative and delightful customer acquisition and retention experiences, while helping drive Netflix’s revenue growth opportunities globally. The mission of the team is to turn every Netflix prospective member into an informed, delighted and satisfied Netflix customer. About Content Design Content Designers partner with Product Designers, Product Managers, Product Marketing, Globalization specialists and others to create Netflix’s product experiences. Designing through the lens of language, they develop testable, strategic content that minimize friction and helps Netflix speak meaningfully to a global audience. About You You have experience building diverse teams and set a high bar for execution, communication, and responsibility. As a leader, you measure success in terms of both human and business impact. You foster excellence through collaboration and encourage an inclusive, open environment that makes space for different views and work styles. You’re an excellent advocate, evangelist, and listener who seeks and offers candid, constructive feedback. You know how to think critically about product flows and drive innovation ideas forward. You work cross-functionally with multiple teams and can speak to and elevate the unique value of Content Design. You strive to simplify complex problems, and support your ideas with data to get everyone on the same page. Los Angeles, California Content Production Management Manager, Production - Adult Animation Comedy Netflix is seeking a Manager for Adult Animation Series Production with a focus on Adult Comedy. This role is an integral part of a dynamic team that serves as the production point person for television animated series. The successful candidate will be expected to collaborate extensively with Netflix cross-functional teams to ensure the delivery of high-quality animation productions. The ideal candidate should have a strong understanding of episodic animation production processes and be able to demonstrate flexible use of their production knowledge. The candidate should be self-motivated, proactive, and capable of advising on multiple productions simultaneously.  Key responsibilities include overseeing the entire production process, from initial concept to final delivery, while maintaining the highest quality standards. The role involves managing project budgeting, scheduling, and staffing, and staying abreast of the latest industry trends and technologies. Reporting to the Senior Manager, Production - Animation Series.   Responsibilities:
  • Serve as the production point person, flexibly balancing creative understanding and production needs
  • Manage scheduling, budgeting, day-to-day and long-term planning of animation projects of varying degrees of complexity
  • Identify, source, support and guide partner animation studios 
  • Track and problem-solve throughout all phases of animation production to ensure delivery on schedule, within budget, and to creative expectations
  • Partner with Content leadership for elevating creative opportunities
  • Display adaptability in prioritizing and re-prioritizing as situations arise during production
  • Foster and maintain good relationships with leadership and crews on animated series, animation studios and Netflix teams
  • Liaise with, and update Netflix Teams throughout all phases of production
  • Ensure that appropriate procedures are followed in all phases of production and for the confidentiality and security of the work
  • Handle confidential information discreetly
    • Qualifications:
  • Possess a strong knowledge of all phases of animation production and the ability to structure their thoughts well
  • In-depth experience working with Talent (writers, directors, producers)
  • Extensive experience and knowledge of pre-production, production and post-production methods in 2D and CG 
  • Have excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Strong interpersonal skills and ability to interface with varied levels of management, talent, and staff
  • Proficiency in Google Suite, MS Word, Excel, Final Draft, Shotgun 
  • Must be able to work on site 4 days per week in Hollywood, CA
    • Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $160,000 - $360,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here. Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. As Netflix continues to produce amazing content worldwide, we are also focused on creating the best services, facilities, and experiences for our filmmakers. The Studio is building in-house Post Production Services for the exclusive use of our shows. The Post Production Services team is charged with the strategy, implementation, and operational management of our purpose-built facilities and vendor partnerships, providing bleeding-edge technology, workflows, and services to our filmmakers. The Role You will be part of a team that supports our Offline Editorial, Dialogue Recording, Color Grading Suites, Dailies Processes and Sound support for our productions and creative artists, ensuring our in-house facilities and speciality rooms are fully optimized and meet the creative demands of our filmmakers. The Specialist, Post Services will drive impact across two primary functions: Screenings and reviews in service of corporate functions, and  specialized imaging-related, online editor services and expertise in Casa Netflix Post Facility. As the ideal candidate, you will perform well under pressure and have exceptional client service skills. You are a quick learner and can pivot quickly when the need arises. You are self-motivated and require little to no supervision. In this role, you will collaborate with key technology teams across the Studio to provide our filmmakers with a high level of support. Specific responsibilities include, but are not limited to: Work closely with Feature Artists and Editors. Help develop tools to automate workflow tasks within the studio. Provide escalation support for local and remote Editorial teams. Implement and support various workflows for the pipeline. Mentor and train less experienced personnel on the team. Maintain Audio and Video calibration standards throughout the facility. Maintain preventive maintenance schedules. Escalate issues to Management, Engineering Services, and Infrastructure teams when necessary. Qualifications: Colour science/colour management workflow expert with Display calibration (CalMan workflow) knowledge. Knowledge and experience of content creation and post-production workflows encompassing NLE, Dailies, Dialogue Recording, Picture, and Audio Mastering. Understanding of IP networking, Network storage, and Workstation architectures. Proven track record of innovation, initiative, creativity, and implementation High proficiency with the following software applications: Black Magic Resolve, Colorfront (Transkoder/OSD/ExD), Baselight, Pix, Media Composer is a plus Knowledge and experience with IP protocols and standards such as SMPTE 2110, AES67, and Dante is a plus Knowledge and experience on Windows, Mac, and Linux operating systems is a plus Experience with Crestron and Q-Sys control systems is a plus. Strong communication skills with proven ability to socialize, explain and promote new and complex technology, tools, and workflows. Ability to respond after hours for important, timely, and urgent matters. Ability to prioritize and juggle multiple projects at once. Team player who thrives in a fast-paced environment. Strong organizational skills and great attention to detail. Spanish Fluent Passionate about our culture and values in the workplace. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

description: Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with 270 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. Content Infrastructure & Solutions (CIS) empowers engineers working on content and studio applications to be innovative and agile in supporting our massive global content production needs. We do that by providing scalable and resilient infrastructure to address integrated large-scale media, assets, data, workflow, and communication use cases. Examples of this organization’s work include massive-scale media processing platforms ( 1 , 2 ), workflows ( conductor ), and data processing at scale. The Content MiddleWare Infrastructure team(MWI), a part of the Content Infrastructure & Solutions group, provides Studio and Content Engineering specific, highly leveraged, and fully managed data, workflow, and messaging & communication platforms facilitating the goal of the Connected Studio. To learn more about what the MWI team does, check out the following tech blogs: workflow ( 1 , 2 ), search ( 1 , 2 , 3 ), data movement ( 1 , 2 ). The Media Infrastructure Platform team (MIP) is part of a media-focused engineering group that provides highly available infrastructure for content production and processing, storage, and access, across all Netflix productions and licensed content. Infrastructure pieces like massive-scale media processing platforms ( 1 , 2 ), and media storage infrastructure ( 1 , 2 )  are key systems we build. All of this is custom-built on top of Amazon Web Services (AWS) infrastructure. We are hiring managers in PL to build and lead either of the following teams: MWI Data Search Team: This team will own Graph Search ( 1 , 2 , 3 ), a Search-as-a-Service platform, within the MWI Data team. Graph Search streamlines search functions across various entities and workflows, notably in the Content Engineering domains but not limited to them. It offers a unified user experience encompassing both backend services and reusable front-end components. Graph Search is currently leveraged by around 70 applications and serves thousands of end users. This team may also contribute to the other infrastructure such as Ontology, SDSP, EARS, and RAW Hollow by collaborating with the rest of the MWI Data term in the US. MIP Media Infra and Operational Tooling Team: This team will 1) develop key portions of our media processing and media storage infrastructure in close collaboration with the broader Media Infrastructure Platform team, and 2) own the development of operational tooling for the broader Content Infrastructure and Solutions organization.  You’ll have the unique opportunity to work both on developer-facing tooling as well as high scale distributed systems in the deep and interesting domain of media processing at Netflix scale and to uplift Netflix’s operational tooling. In particular, we want to evolve our operational tooling to make contemporary concepts like SLO management a first-class concept. While there has been some prior exploration in the operational tooling space, there is significant freedom to evolve this area from its current early state into a mature and thriving What you will do You will lead a team of software engineers to deliver high-impact results, your responsibilities in this role: Partner with the product manager, engineers, and other engineering managers in the broader team to deliver the vision, strategy, and adoption of platform solutions across content and studio engineering, and ensure that we’re building the right features to power other engineering teams to effectively design and build search solutions at scale. Collaborate closely with the rest of the MWI Data or MIP team in the US, drive the alignment of roadmaps for Search and other data infrastructure products (such as Ontology, Search, EARS, and RAW Hollow) or Cosmos, and ensure that we offer a cohesive and streamlined experience to our stakeholders across all the products MWI or MIP owns. Foster a strong accountability culture in the team and help the team deliver the results reliably and in a timely manner to support the needs of critical business stakeholders. Act as a credible technical advisor to the team; help the team make thoughtful, informed decisions in ambiguous situations Form trust cross-functional relationships with partners and stakeholders in PL and US within Netflix, connect the dots and drive adoption to maximize the business impact, ensure our solutions meet their needs, and selflessly prioritize work beyond the scope of your own domain. Effectively communicate complex ideas and influence decisions across a diverse range of stakeholders. Balance business needs with strong engineering principles, ensure investment in foundational technical work, paying off tech debts and incremental improvements to deliver timely results. Lead, coach, hire, and develop a team of outstanding engineers, challenge them to bring their best selves to their daily work, and deliver exceptional results in stability, performance, efficiency as well as developer experience. Build and nurture an inclusive team culture where every member feels empowered, accepted, and respected. What we are looking for Experience in building and managing high-performing teams with a focus on inclusion and diversity. Ability to attract and retain the best talent, and ensure that all voices are heard to inform our decisions while fostering a strong culture of accountability, where individuals take ownership of their responsibilities and contribute to the team’s collective success. Ability to foster a team culture of open and direct communications, where team members feel empowered to offer constructive and positive feedback and acknowledge achievements and areas for improvement. Experience building and operating extremely reliable platform systems supporting large-scale and critical use cases, including running 24x7 on-call, highly available, and fast response services. Long-term strategic thinker with a strong platform mindset, and ability to define and articulate product vision and strategy and how they fit into the broader objectives of the organization. Ability to prioritize strategically and align the team’s work with larger business goals. Have the courage to pivot based on broader impacts. Ability to build and maintain strong partnerships with cross-functional partners and stakeholders with excellent communication and collaboration skills. Capable of influencing the strategic direction of partners and stakeholders. Proven track record helping a team deliver timely results on critical priorities against many demands for their time, and partnering with product and engineering management to influence the right areas for investment Bring rigor to decision-making and drive down ambiguity with the right mix of collecting data, seeking input, farming for dissent, and making pilot investments to build understanding or confirm direction. Experience driving teams to adopt specific KPIs/leading indicators of system health, observing and tuning the systems to prevent predictable outages. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

description: It’s not often there’s an opportunity to join a company that is changing consumer habits all over the world, and challenging an entire industry at the same time. The Philippines is a key market for Netflix in Southeast Asia and this is an exciting time to be part of driving our growth in the market, alongside a number of stunning colleagues on the team. We have hundreds of original films and series from Squid Game to Trese to Avatar: The Last Airbender (and more!) that are produced for all kinds of tastes and moods. We are looking for an experienced and dynamic Marketing Production Manager to join our team and drive the execution of best-in-class multi-channel title campaigns in the Philippines, working with multiple internal and external stakeholders, and bridging both the creative and technical aspects of local marketing initiatives. Responsibilities include: Manage and coordinate with internal and external stakeholders to maintain industry-leading marketing executions that help drive our content and brand Lead internal and external production communications and workflows with multiple stakeholders, ensuring effective exchange of campaign information and asset delivery, whilst always managing expectations. Be a regional creative and production expert, driving workflow practices about best-in-market activations, in-market technical capabilities, and cultural nuances back with global and international teams. Manage localization, production process, and creative approvals of advertising materials (including clearances, delivery, trafficking, etc.). Integrate closely with internal and external trafficking teams to ensure that all asset tracking is implemented correctly, and efficiently, deadlines are met, and executions are flawless. Work closely with regional and global teams, supporting local implementation and customization of import campaigns, and leveraging global materials to deploy local marketing experiences and creative extensions. Qualifications: At least 10 years of marketing production experience, preferably at an advertising or creative agency with an emphasis on integrated campaigns A deep and comprehensive technical understanding of end-to-end campaign execution, including online and offline video, high-impact display takeovers, rich media, D/OOH, on-ground event activations, digital marketing, and paid social campaigns Expert knowledge of marketing campaigns and localization workflows, including understanding the creative and production process for both Video, Digital, and Print materials. Ability to translate creative ideas through to technical and native executions, for various ad-serving platforms and proprietary publisher platforms. Ability to manage a high volume of creative and campaign types in parallel Knowledgeable of and familiar with leading creative and production agencies in the Philippines Personality Attributes: See Who We Are and what our Culture is like. You thrive in a fast-paced and demanding environment, possess a high level of intellectual curiosity, and demonstrate strong judgment and leadership in the face of ambiguity. You are always solving and forever curious. You are an agile, goal-oriented personality, driven to succeed and always up for a challenge! Passion for TV and film content with some knowledge of the entertainment landscape and media trends in the Philippines and globally You are a multi-tasker, with clear time management and prioritization skills. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

description: At Netflix, we want to entertain the world and are constantly innovating on how entertainment is imagined, created, and delivered to a global audience.  We currently stream content in more than 30 languages in 190 countries, topping over 260 million paid subscribers, and are expanding into new forms of entertainment such as gaming and live events.  Engineering teams within Netflix work hard every day to scale and innovate content production and member experiences in an ever-growing complex software landscape. Content Engineering builds the products and services used by our internal and external creative partners to create, launch, and promote our global content and ads. Our products enable the entire workflow of content creation, from pitch to play, and provide innovative new ways to develop and manage entertainment at scale. Team Spotlight: Ads Platform Engineering The Ads Platform Engineering teams build advertising systems and integrations that power the delivery of ads using our world-class content delivery ecosystem. We use a number of Netflix investments and innovations to power our ads - a unique mix of client and server-side ad insertions, state-of-the-art content delivery systems, ad encoding recipes, content understanding, and metadata. We deliver ads in a manner that’s thoughtful of our member’s viewing experience and drive great outcomes for advertisers. We also ensure that advertiser brand safety is ensured during serving, members only see the most appropriate ads for them. We are looking for highly motivated engineers working in the advertising space who are excited to join us on this journey. Qualifications: You have experience crafting resilient, high-scale, low-latency microservices in production environments. Proficient with gRPC, GraphQL, or RESTful API design and implementation. Have recent proficient experience with Java, C#, or other OO programming languages with a solid understanding of OO design principles, concurrency, multi-threading, performance tuning, and observability. You have a proven track record of resilient data modeling through understanding and translating business requirements to technical requirements and identifying entities and their relationships that will serve the business process needs. What Sets You Apart: Curious about a broad range of new or unfamiliar technologies, the consumer base, and product vision. Seek different perspectives, feedback, and relevant information to continuously grow and improve. Maintain strong relationships with cross-functional teams through clear communication. Take a thoughtful, practical approach to problem-solving that considers tradeoffs and avoids over-engineering. Comfortable asking questions and seeking knowledge in unfamiliar or ambiguous situations. You evangelize new ideas and exemplify technical leadership with a bias for action. You appreciate the complexity of engaging with a global challenge. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $100,000- $720,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. search_text:
Los Gatos, California Products & Technology Core Engineering Software Engineer 4 - Ads Platform Engineering At Netflix, we want to entertain the world and are constantly innovating on how entertainment is imagined, created, and delivered to a global audience.  We currently stream content in more than 30 languages in 190 countries, topping over 260 million paid subscribers, and are expanding into new forms of entertainment such as gaming and live events.  Engineering teams within Netflix work hard every day to scale and innovate content production and member experiences in an ever-growing complex software landscape.   Content Engineering builds the products and services used by our internal and external creative partners to create, launch, and promote our global content and ads. Our products enable the entire workflow of content creation, from pitch to play, and provide innovative new ways to develop and manage entertainment at scale.  Team Spotlight: Ads Platform Engineering The Ads Platform Engineering teams build advertising systems and integrations that power the delivery of ads using our world-class content delivery ecosystem. We use a number of Netflix investments and innovations to power our ads - a unique mix of client and server-side ad insertions, state-of-the-art content delivery systems, ad encoding recipes, content understanding, and metadata. We deliver ads in a manner that’s thoughtful of our member’s viewing experience and drive great outcomes for advertisers. We also ensure that advertiser brand safety is ensured during serving, members only see the most appropriate ads for them. We are looking for highly motivated engineers working in the advertising space who are excited to join us on this journey. Qualifications:
  • You have experience crafting resilient, high-scale, low-latency microservices in production environments.
  • Proficient with gRPC, GraphQL, or RESTful API design and implementation.
  • Have recent proficient experience with Java, C#, or other OO programming languages with a solid understanding of OO design principles, concurrency, multi-threading, performance tuning, and observability.
  • You have a proven track record of resilient data modeling through understanding and translating business requirements to technical requirements and identifying entities and their relationships that will serve the business process needs.
    • What Sets You Apart:
  • Curious about a broad range of new or unfamiliar technologies, the consumer base, and product vision.
  • Seek different perspectives, feedback, and relevant information to continuously grow and improve.
  • Maintain strong relationships with cross-functional teams through clear communication.
  • Take a thoughtful, practical approach to problem-solving that considers tradeoffs and avoids over-engineering.
  • Comfortable asking questions and seeking knowledge in unfamiliar or ambiguous situations.
  • You evangelize new ideas and exemplify technical leadership with a bias for action.
  • You appreciate the complexity of engaging with a global challenge.
    • Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $100,000- $720,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here. Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: About Netflix: Netflix is one of the world's leading streaming entertainment services with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. Netflix has been on the leading edge of the cloud since beginning the migration to AWS 15 years ago and runs one of the largest Cloud footprints around. The Cloud Engineering organization exists to manage that massive scale, constantly innovating to increase fleet-wide agility, efficiency, and reliability of the Netflix cloud infrastructure. We build, operate, and maintain Compute, Network and Storage services so that developers at Netflix can rely on foundational building blocks when entertaining hundreds of millions of customers around the world. About the Role: We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated core Linux OS engineer to join our dynamic Compute team. The ideal candidate will have experience in AWS and Linux networking, kernel maintenance, a deep understanding of operating system internals, and expertise in Linux's process bootstrapping and isolation to support Netflix's Base OS powering EC2 images and its container orchestrator. You will focus on optimizing our AWS and Linux networking stacks for container performance and reliability, ensuring optimal performance for Netflix's cloud-based applications. Your stunning colleagues are top of their field and innovators at heart, with some innovations saving compute costs in excess of $100M. If you have a passion for innovation, AWS, Linux, and solving hard problems, we want to talk to you! Key Responsibilities Performance Optimization: Identify and resolve performance bottlenecks in the Linux and AWS networking stacks, optimizing network traffic for containers in a Kubernetes infrastructure to enable efficient scaling and lower networking costs. Optimizing our entire server fleet to get us every last usable CPU  cycle executing on our latency-sensitive and throughput-sensitive workloads System Integration: Integrate kernel changes with user-space applications and container runtime, ensuring seamless operation within the Netflix ecosystem. Linux Plumbing & Kernel Engineering: Maintain Linux kernel and core userspace subsystems including submitting patches upstream against latest stable releases, with a focus on networking. Debugging and Troubleshooting : Diagnose and fix networking-related issues in the Linux kernel and related software. Documentation: Create and maintain comprehensive documentation for developed kernel code and procedures. Collaboration: Work closely with our internal customers, software developers, and other stakeholders to align kernel development with overall project goals, including customer requirements for GPU-based solutions and other specialized needs. Open Source Contribution: Contribute to the FOSS community, including the Linux kernel, through code submissions, bug fixes, and participation in discussions. Presentation: Deliver write-ups, blog posts e.g. submissions to LWN.net , and presentations at conferences such as Linux Plumber’s to engage the community in Netflix Linux engineering. Operational Excellence: Maintain and improve the operation of our highly-scalable compute infrastructure by applying engineering best practices and providing first-class on-call support. Desired Qualifications Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or a related field. Minimum of 5 years of experience in core Linux maintenance and engineering and 7 years total industry experience. Cloud Network Engineering on a major cloud provider platform at scale, preferably AWS. Expertise in the full Linux network stack, including network packet flow, sockets, system calls in the kernel, and low-level networking (TCP/IP, IPv6, IPv4). Strong understanding of kernel-space vs. user-space. Debugging and tools (such as GDB, perf, and ftrace). Knowledge of kernel subsystems such as memory management, process management, file systems, and storage. Experience with tools for network performance analysis. Deeply proficient in C programming. Experience optimizing performance on Linux hosts with dozens to hundreds of CPU cores. Strong problem-solving abilities and analytical skills. Excellent communication and collaboration skills. Ability to work independently as well as part of a team. Attention to detail and a commitment to delivering high-quality code. You will thrive in the role if: You thrive in ambiguity; complex and fuzzy requirements are more common than clearly defined customer expectations. You take incremental steps toward solving big problems; test-and-learn approaches work better than heads-down development. You are independent and self driven; progress is often self-directed by teams & individuals. Your bedtime reading consists of technology blogs such as: “ Debugging a FUSE deadlock in the Linux kernel ”, “ Investigation of a Cross-regional Network Performance Issue ” and “ Talking IPv4 to IPv6 without NAT ” You’ve read about Netflix’s culture and think you would thrive here. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is  $100,000 - $720,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services, with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries, enjoying TV series, films, and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause, and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. As Netflix continues its global expansion, we are looking for the best and brightest talent to play a key role in our growth. That’s where you come in! We are seeking a Tax Analyst to provide tax compliance support for Latin America based out of our Mexico City office. You will report to the Tax Senior Manager, LATAM, in Mexico City, and will assist with all aspects of direct and indirect tax compliance, electronic invoicing, and account reconciliations related to our LATAM activities. You are a curious, self-starter who can collaborate effectively both within Tax and with your cross-functional partners. You possess direct and indirect tax technical and analytical skills, navigate competing deadlines easily, and are laser-focused on detail. You have a hands-on mentality, are eager to make an immediate impact on the team, and are constantly looking for ways to improve routines. You are also unusually responsible and are thrilled by the chance to join a high-performance Dream Team! Responsibilities Your primary responsibilities will be assisting with ongoing compliance requirements related to direct, indirect, and/or digital service taxation in the LATAM region (including Mexico, Colombia, Argentina, Chile, and Perú, among others). Your day-to-day activities will include: Performing month-end and quarter-end close activities, such as preparing journal entries, tax account reconciliations, and related tasks. Gathering information and preparing reports to meet ongoing tax compliance obligations; managing filing deadlines with internal stakeholders and external advisors; driving filing processes to ensure on-time tax payments. Performing tax compliance controls related to electronic invoicing (e.g., CFDI), such as reconciling and validating invoices in our ERP (revenue, expenses, payments, etc.). Monitoring online tax mailboxes for messages from tax authorities; investigating discrepancies to help shape the business’ response to “invitation letters”; managing invoice cancellation / other routine requests. Preparing and filing recurring VAT refund requests in countries across the region. Assisting with automation projects to improve processes and achieve efficiencies. Providing support during tax audits. Requirements You embrace and advocate the Netflix culture and our long-term view . You have a Bachelor’s degree in Accounting. You have 3+ years of relevant experience in Mexican tax compliance; experience in tax compliance in other LATAM countries is a plus, but not required. You demonstrate strong communication skills and are able to cultivate positive relationships and rapport with other teams/departments. You are open to feedback, and highly motivated to improve your current skill set in a fast-paced environment. You are highly proficient in spreadsheets, ERP, CFDIs, and SAT systems; experience with Google applications is preferable; knowledge of Workday, Blackline, and other LATAM tax portal systems is a plus but not required. You have a proven ability to work proactively, independently, and accurately to meet tight deadlines in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. You are never satisfied with the status quo; always mindful of how to improve existing processes. You are fluent in Spanish and English. We are an equal opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.
