description: Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with 270 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. It’s an amazing time to join Netflix as we continue to shape the future of global entertainment. As Netflix expands globally, we look for the best and brightest talent to scale with and contribute to our growth. We are seeking an Internal Auditor to join our growing team in support of Netflix’s studio and corporate operations. Based in Amsterdam, this role will primarily focus on our EMEA and APAC business but will also work regularly with our broader US team. Reporting to the Senior Manager of Internal Audit, the ideal candidate will have hands-on experience identifying and assessing operational, compliance, and financial risks across a variety of business functions, evaluating the design of processes and controls and executing large-scale and complex projects. In addition, the candidate will need to exhibit strong technical and communication skills necessary to navigate a complex environment and cultivate strong partnerships with key stakeholders. Responsibilities: Execute operational and advisory engagements including understanding business processes and underlying systems, conducting interviews and process walkthroughs, and performing audit procedures to assess operational efficiency and effectiveness. Support production audits for Netflix productions worldwide in the following areas: policy & procedure compliance, cost reporting, FCPA compliance, local regulatory and legal compliance, and fraud detection. Work collaboratively across the business to drive value through participation in special projects and ad hoc requests. Work closely with cross-functional partners and leadership to develop proactive solutions, communicate potential impacts, and ensure business objectives are met. Interpret the significance of audit insights, make practical recommendations, and collaborate with stakeholders on remediation action plans. Build effective working relationships and trust with business partners across the organization. Effectively manage relationships with the Internal Audit co-sourcing partners (as applicable) to ensure cohesive and collaborative execution. Qualifications: 4+ years of operational and/or advisory internal audit experience preferably with a minimum of 2 years of public accounting experience. Relevant academic degree with at least one relevant professional qualification (in accounting, audit, business, or technology). Qualified accountant or Certified Internal Auditor preferred. Strong technical skills and working knowledge of internal auditing standards. Strong verbal and written communication skills as well as presentation skills. Proven prioritization and multitasking skills. Ability to execute multiple projects simultaneously within deadlines. Experience in the Technology and/or Media industry. Knowledge of studio/production accounting and related financial functions is a plus. Prior experience with cloud-based systems, data analytics audit tools, and/or third-party vendor solutions. Ability to build strong relationships with stakeholders. Must be able to work independently in a dynamic and fast paced environment. You embrace and advocate the Netflix culture and our long-term view. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.
search_text:
Amsterdam, Netherlands Corporate Functions Finance Internal Auditor - EMEA Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with 270 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. It’s an amazing time to join Netflix as we continue to shape the future of global entertainment. As Netflix expands globally, we look for the best and brightest talent to scale with and contribute to our growth.  We are seeking an Internal Auditor to join our growing team in support of Netflix’s studio and corporate operations. Based in Amsterdam, this role will primarily focus on our EMEA and APAC business but will also work regularly with our broader US team. Reporting to the Senior Manager of Internal Audit, the ideal candidate will have hands-on experience identifying and assessing operational, compliance, and financial risks across a variety of business functions, evaluating the design of processes and controls and executing large-scale and complex projects. In addition, the candidate will need to exhibit strong technical and communication skills necessary to navigate a complex environment and cultivate strong partnerships with key stakeholders.  Responsibilities:
  • Execute operational and advisory engagements including understanding business processes and underlying systems, conducting interviews and process walkthroughs, and performing audit procedures to assess operational efficiency and effectiveness. 
  • Support production audits for Netflix productions worldwide in the following areas: policy & procedure compliance, cost reporting, FCPA compliance, local regulatory and legal compliance, and fraud detection.
  • Work collaboratively across the business to drive value through participation in special projects and ad hoc requests.
  • Work closely with cross-functional partners and leadership to develop proactive solutions, communicate potential impacts, and ensure business objectives are met.
  • Interpret the significance of audit insights, make practical recommendations, and collaborate with stakeholders on remediation action plans.
  • Build effective working relationships and trust with business partners across the organization.
  • Effectively manage relationships with the Internal Audit co-sourcing partners (as applicable) to ensure cohesive and collaborative execution.
    • Qualifications:
  • 4+ years of operational and/or advisory internal audit experience preferably with a minimum of 2 years of public accounting experience.
  • Relevant academic degree with at least one relevant professional qualification (in accounting, audit, business, or technology). Qualified accountant or Certified Internal Auditor preferred.
  • Strong technical skills and working knowledge of internal auditing standards.
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills as well as presentation skills.
  • Proven prioritization and multitasking skills. Ability to execute multiple projects simultaneously within deadlines.
  • Experience in the Technology and/or Media industry. Knowledge of studio/production accounting and related financial functions is a plus.
  • Prior experience with cloud-based systems, data analytics audit tools, and/or third-party vendor solutions.
  • Ability to build strong relationships with stakeholders.
  • Must be able to work independently in a dynamic and fast paced environment.
  • You embrace and advocate the Netflix culture and our long-term view.
    • We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

Day-to-day Accounts Payable activities/responsibilities include
  • Assist with processing high volumes PO and Non-PO invoices in multiple languages and currencies

  • Able to work with high volume of transactions in a fast-paced environment 
  • Able to maintain a high level of accuracy in preparing and entering financial information

  • Proficient in Excel and ERP systems (Workday experience a plus)
  • Highly motivated with the ability to work independently 
  • Forward looking thinker who can articulate the need for and contribute to process improvements ideas 
  • Works with a sense of urgency and sensitivity to last-minute highly critical business requests
  • Uses good judgment and knows when to make a decision and when to escalate
  • Exemplifies the Netflix Culture
  • Understanding of SOX compliance rules and guidelines

  • Accounting or Finance background
  • 5+ years of relevant experience
  • Degree in a relevant field of study
  • Experience at a Global Company a plus
  • Knowledge of cloud related ERP systems a plus
  • Experience with a ticketing tool or system a plus

description: The Dubbing team is bridging global storytellers with local voices, making joy accessible to all audiences. As Netflix continues to scale, the Dubbing Global Resource Strategy team supports the long-range planning of external resources along with supporting global frameworks for ongoing vendor management. You will work within the Dubbing team, along with a variety of cross-functional teams such as Engineering, Sound Technology, Studio Strategy & Analysis, and Product among many others. You will identify audio, tooling, and workflow challenges amongst the external partner ecosystem and partner with engineering and innovation teams to design solutions, serving as an informed captain for external partner impact and needs.  In partnership with local Dubbing & Language Production Managers, you will be responsible for the implementation of dub audio solutions and infrastructure to Netflix Asia Pacific (APAC) Dubbing partners, in support of driving creative and operational excellence. This role is unique as it merges audio engineering expertise with technical operations management.  Our environment is fast-paced, requiring the ability to work autonomously with minimal supervision. You will need to demonstrate excellent strategic, and problem-solving skills and a proven record for improving existing frameworks, tools, and technologies. The right mix of organizational and communication skills is key to success as a large part of the role is collaborating with business partners to understand and communicate needs. About You You are an expert in the fields of dubbing/localization, sound recording, editing, and mixing and possess a mix of both a strategy and operations mindset. You understand dubbing workflows and tools and how technology and creative demands are evolving. You have worked with translators, editors, recordists, mixers, sound supervisors, archivists, and network or studio executives, and you understand their goals and challenges. You've kept abreast of developing standards and new technologies that are shaping the way soundscapes are created and reproduced for consumers, and have ideas about how to ensure their longevity. You’re comfortable interacting with the domestic and international sound community and are able to easily explain technical concepts to non-technical audiences and internal/external senior leaders. Responsibilities: Strive to bring alignment between Netflix Dubbing partners and Netflix’s technical and workflow goals to drive creative excellence; recording, mixing, quality control, delivery, M&E, and software solutions. Partner closely with our Dubbing Strategy & Innovation team to amplify internal tooling/workflow development and initiatives, and then form a bridge with APAC Language Production/Dubbing Managers for external impact and rollouts. Identify, and partner with teams to execute, any needed internal or external educational technical/audio training. This will involve typical scenarios related to the recording and mixing of dubbed content, plus territory nuances and best practices. Gather context and identify key pain points with partner workflow technical challenges, and assess the impact of the problem. Document business priorities, and define goals and outcomes to achieve. Thoroughly understand the dubbing market across the studio ecosystem and research into the context and impact around audio, tooling, and workflow initiatives, in partnership with local/regional colleagues and third parties, where needed. Command an understanding of Netflix tooling and how those tools are used and integrated with external partners. Partner with teammates on execution, for partner technical evaluations and testing, Dubbing tool training, partner support ticketing workflows, and Partner Help Center maintenance. Consume QC and other performance metrics to drive continued excellence of partner performance, identifying pain points and strategizing remediations. Requirements: 10+ years experience in audiovisual exhibition and post-production or dubbing technology, interacting with creatives, and vendors, managing maintenance and upgrades Strong understanding of the Asia Pacific market and familiarity with external partners within the region. Experience in vendor management and senior relationship management Understanding of all forms of professional audio formats, technology, and best practices. Experience with integration and operation of post-production/dubbing tools and infrastructure. Experience in dub audio mixing, editorial, and quality control Agile, goal-oriented personality, driven to succeed, and always up for a challenge. Ability to be forward-thinking, strategic, and innovative, while proactively making decisions that can sometimes be difficult or challenging. Passion for learning and experimenting with new technologies. Experience building and defining software requirements. Top-notch communication and presentation skills with the ability to speak clearly and concisely, and translate technical speak for non-technical partners. Ability to forge strong partnerships, collaborate, and learn with stakeholder groups. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status or disability status. 넷플릭스는 다양한 경험과 생각을 가진 구성원이 모였을 때 최고의 성과를 내는 팀을 만들어 갈 수 있다고 믿고 있습니다. 다양성과 포용성은 우리가 지향하는 기업 문화의 핵심 중 하나이며, 이것의 궁극적인 목적은 모든 직원이 역량을 마음껏 발휘하고 성장하며 기여할 수 있도록 환경을 조성하는 것입니다.  인재를 선별하는 과정은 이러한 목적을 달성하는 데 매우 중요합니다.  이에 따라 넷플릭스는  성별, 인종, 피부색, 국적, 종교, 성적 지향, 나이, 결혼 여부 등 모든 개인적인 배경과 상관없이 모두에게 평등한 기회를 보장하며, 공정한 과정을 통해 채용을 진행하고 있습니다.장애인 및 국가보훈 대상자는 관련 법령에 따라 우대합니다.

Tokyo, Japan Content Production Services and Technology Senior Manager, Dubbing Partner Operations - APAC The Dubbing team is bridging global storytellers with local voices, making joy accessible to all audiences. As Netflix continues to scale, the Dubbing Global Resource Strategy team supports the long-range planning of external resources along with supporting global frameworks for ongoing vendor management. You will work within the Dubbing team, along with a variety of cross-functional teams such as Engineering, Sound Technology, Studio Strategy & Analysis, and Product among many others. You will identify audio, tooling, and workflow challenges amongst the external partner ecosystem and partner with engineering and innovation teams to design solutions, serving as an informed captain for external partner impact and needs.  In partnership with local Dubbing & Language Production Managers, you will be responsible for the implementation of dub audio solutions and infrastructure to Netflix Asia Pacific (APAC) Dubbing partners, in support of driving creative and operational excellence. This role is unique as it merges audio engineering expertise with technical operations management.  Our environment is fast-paced, requiring the ability to work autonomously with minimal supervision. You will need to demonstrate excellent strategic, and problem-solving skills and a proven record for improving existing frameworks, tools, and technologies. The right mix of organizational and communication skills is key to success as a large part of the role is collaborating with business partners to understand and communicate needs.  About You You are an expert in the fields of dubbing/localization, sound recording, editing, and mixing and possess a mix of both a strategy and operations mindset. You understand dubbing workflows and tools and how technology and creative demands are evolving. You have worked with translators, editors, recordists, mixers, sound supervisors, archivists, and network or studio executives, and you understand their goals and challenges. You've kept abreast of developing standards and new technologies that are shaping the way soundscapes are created and reproduced for consumers, and have ideas about how to ensure their longevity. You’re comfortable interacting with the domestic and international sound community and are able to easily explain technical concepts to non-technical audiences and internal/external senior leaders.   Responsibilities:
  • Strive to bring alignment between Netflix Dubbing partners and Netflix’s technical and workflow goals to drive creative excellence; recording, mixing, quality control, delivery, M&E, and software solutions.
  • Partner closely with our Dubbing Strategy & Innovation team to amplify internal tooling/workflow development and initiatives, and then form a bridge with APAC Language Production/Dubbing Managers for external impact and rollouts.
  • Identify, and partner with teams to execute, any needed internal or external educational technical/audio training. This will involve typical scenarios related to the recording and mixing of dubbed content, plus territory nuances and best practices.
  • Gather context and identify key pain points with partner workflow technical challenges, and assess the impact of the problem. Document business priorities, and define goals and outcomes to achieve. 
  • Thoroughly understand the dubbing market across the studio ecosystem and research into the context and impact around audio, tooling, and workflow initiatives, in partnership with local/regional colleagues and third parties, where needed.
  • Command an understanding of Netflix tooling and how those tools are used and integrated with external partners.
  • Partner with teammates on execution, for partner technical evaluations and testing, Dubbing tool training, partner support ticketing workflows, and Partner Help Center maintenance.
  • Consume QC and other performance metrics to drive continued excellence of partner performance, identifying pain points and strategizing remediations.

  • 10+ years experience in audiovisual exhibition and post-production or dubbing 
  • technology, interacting with creatives, and vendors, managing maintenance and upgrades

description: Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. The Quantitative & Screening Operations Pod sits in Consumer Insights and our mission is to build solutions for quantitative research projects and programs. This includes partnerships on custom quantitative research projects, global trackers, and online screenings. We employ best practices alongside innovative methodologies to capture the voice of the consumer. We are looking for a stunning Senior Research Program Manager to join our Quantitative & Screening Operations Pod. This role will partner across Consumer Insights Content Researchers, Product, Data Science & Engineering, and Product Design teams along with external vendors to execute online content screenings and surveys. This role will identify and drive opportunities to innovate, and to build efficiency, which ultimately empowers Consumer Insights to deliver extraordinary insights for the company. Responsibilities Strategic leadership and operational execution of online screenings and surveys Develop and lead online screening and survey management workflows. This includes but is not limited to survey programming, data quality, data cleaning, incentive management, reporting, partnering with vendors Monitor participation rates and performance of live surveys Manage troubleshooting for survey product and programming escalations Manage troubleshooting for leaks and anti-piracy escalations Manage shifting research priorities and timelines for custom or panel-based survey projects Assist in strategizing and planning recruitment for screening and survey participation Identify innovation opportunities with internal processes and data tools related to the Netflix Preview Panel program Partner with Customer service, Legal, Localization, and Post Production teams on Netflix Preview Club title screenings Qualifications You have a minimum of 5 years of global research operations experience, working with Researchers ad cross-functional teams Up to five years of experience managing online sample health, profile data, sampling, and deploying surveys You have excellent oral and written communication skills and a strong ability to work with cross-functional teams Ability to make sound independent decisions while knowing when to call out issues Flexibility to accommodate time zones or other team members and partners globally, as needed Possess a passion for research and the ability to screen early TV shows and Movies to consumers You thrive on the ability to multitask in a dynamic environment - making sound, contextualized, and independent decisions You have a passion for finding the right approach, tool or solution for the challenge at hand You enjoy being part of a team that can creatively flex and drive innovation for our research practice You’re a pragmatic problem solver and have a gift for identifying areas of improvement You haven’t lost your ability (or passion!) to be hands-on or in the weeds when needed You have a Bachelor's degree or relevant experience, including 3+ years of leadership experience, managing, growing and inspiring teams Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $130,000 - $470,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more details about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: Netflix in EMEA Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with 270+ million paid members in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any internet-connected screen. The DACH countries were one of the first markets we launched in Europe (2014). Today, we continue to invest in a strong slate of locally produced DACH titles alongside our global US slate, making Netflix unique, accessible, and highly entertaining for local consumers. The Role The Title Marketing Director, DACH role will be based in Berlin. They will manage a local Title Marketing team responsible for creating and executing title-specific strategies, leveraging our local original shows and movies to create conversation and talkable moments for the Netflix brand, our shows & movies, and the talent featured within. We are looking for an experienced and inspiring leader who can bring sharp, sophisticated, and innovative thinking to the team while focusing on operational excellence both internally (execution, cross-functional collaboration) and externally (bold creative assets, holistic consumer campaigns, & beneficial partnerships). Experience & Skills: A history of strong team leadership, a leader who is highly skilled at cross-functional collaboration, someone who feels challenged and energized by the entertainment industry's deep transformation over the last decade, a leader who understands the value of diverse experiences and backgrounds and has a track record of building inclusive teams. The Ideal candidate will have experience working within intricate global or regional structures, with a proven ability to navigate complex, cross-functional teams and environments. An independent thinker, capable of self-motivating and self-managing, thriving with the level of freedom & responsibility we offer our employees. This leader must be able to operate in an ambiguous environment and to connect autonomously with a vast network of collaborators seeking to understand how Marketing can holistically impact our business. Someone well versed in integrated marketing tactics, trained in combining digital/social and offline media to create powerful and holistic campaigns. A creative and idea-oriented mind who can leverage powerful cultural insights to produce earned media results as the basis of our marketing efforts. Who is strongly committed to taking integrated 360-marketing campaigns for Netflix to a new level, generating impactful experiences, and redefining campaigns and culture while delivering excellent results. An entertainment fan who understands the power of entertainment to transform behaviors and influence the cultural zeitgeist. An innovative thinker who continuously searches for new ways to engage consumers and executes disruptive, world-class campaigns that position Netflix and its offerings as must-haves and best in class. An articulate communicator in speech and writing, with German and English as mandatory languages, and a deep understanding of German, Austrian, and Swiss popular culture. Key Responsibilities: You will set and lead the title marketing strategy to have the most amount of business impact, leveraging market and audience insights, programming needs and brand positioning You will lead and launch unique and innovative campaigns for our local shows and movies and import titles from other markets that resonate with the DACH audience You will work closely with the local Partnerships team responsible for overseeing the strategic direction and execution of local commercial and brand partnerships Cross-functional Excellence. You will serve as a key voice in aligning marketing, comms, publicity, content, business development, payments, and other key stakeholders. Inspiring leadership: You will lead by example in alignment with our principles of Freedom and Responsibility and Context, not Control, giving guidance to your team but also the space and support to thrive at Netflix.

description: Netflix is the world’s leading streaming entertainment service with 270 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Having launched in Germany in 2014, Netflix evolved from being a relatively unknown company in a brand new segment to become a successful mainstream player in entertainment and pop culture in the country. Globally and locally, our growth came in the wake of sustained commitment to satisfying consumers, combining a great product experience with an ever-growing library of exclusive series and movies. The Social Marketing at Netflix is on the pulse of conversation among our consumers - not just listening, but participating in and starting thoughtful, hilarious, exciting discussion with fans across platforms outside of Netflix. Though part of the larger marketing organization, this team’s work is to build love for the brand by keeping Netflix members entertained even when they’re not watching. As Senior Social Media Manager, you’ll need to have excellent judgment to balance between what’s good for business versus what audiences want to talk about. You’ll be thinking through new ways to talk about Netflix content and larger cultural moments that shape conversation within our audience, owning the strategy for Netflix Social channels and managing a world class team. You excel at building creativity out of meaningful insights and are able to inspire teams to do their best work, leading a team of 2. We are searching for a Senior Social Media Manager. This position’s primary mandate is to create and execute long-term strategy and creativity to keep the Netflix community growing and gaining broader relevance in the DACH region. The remit of the role includes: The Role & Expectations: Rooted in our business objectives, create and own the Netflix DACH social audience & community strategy. Be the voice of our members & fans in the room, work with consumer insights to evolve our knowledge about the audiences. Build the Netflix long term channel strategy & prioritization based on the audience strategy. Enable creativity within Netflix and our partners to create broad relevance, brand love and consumer advocacy for Netflix. Own the innovation & trend management, identifying new opportunities, building a strong relationship with established and new & emerging platforms. Be an Social Media advocate & loud voice internally and externally with partners, talent and producers. With a deep knowledge of the DACH social media landscape and audiences, both in platform growth and the creator ecosystem. Deep knowledge of social platforms and the ability to craft engaging stories as well as marketing and social media analytics. Work closely with the internal stakeholders in marketing & PR as well as content and others. As part of the DACH Marketing Leadership team help evolve and shape the overall Marketing strategy and lead a team of 2 individuals. Manage a team of channel experts & own the social marketing budget. Excellent written and verbal communication skills in German and English.

description: Netflix is one of the world’s leading entertainment services with over 270 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. About the Photo & Audio Visual (AV) Studio team The Photo & AV Studio team has the enviable position of straddling two worlds in the entertainment industry: Photo & AV asset creation and global communication strategy. We specialize in capturing and creating photo & video assets that shape, enhance and support our publicity campaigns for our Netflix content including Series, Films, and Documentaries. Simply put, we produce content that compels people to watch our shows through various media. About the Role We’re looking for a senior creative storyteller with an editorial, creative and/or entertainment background to be based close to one of our production hubs. The role requires a high level of creativity, innovation and an ability to identify creative solutions and efficiencies at scale. A successful candidate will be self-motivated, a succinct communicator with the ability to start and drive innovative initiatives at scale, as well as someone who has a deep passion for investing and fostering team development. This role is highly cross functional working with Publicity, Marketing, Product, and global Photo & AV Studio leadership to provide best in class photography and on-set video content from our TV and films to create stories press and consumers alike can’t stop talking about. Responsibilities of the role: Manage an agile team of Photo and Audio Video specialists across APAC Be a regional creative and editorial expert, to guide your team in driving innovative visual storytelling strategy based on title and talent insights as well as the evolving external media landscape Identify opportunities for creative inspiration and learnings to ensure team members across countries and regions have access to new ways of thinking in order to support continued team and skill development Provide regional oversight on operational strategies and creative output by being a connection within the global Photo & AV Studio leadership team to drive APAC needs globally while adopting global best practices locally Collaborate with global partners in creating and championing better ways of asset creation, management, and storage in order to find scale without losing local or creative nuance Develop relationships across functions beyond PR e.g. Product, Production, Marketing identifying opportunities for greater collaboration and/or efficiencies Skills & Requirements: 12-15+ years experience working across visual asset creation, publishing, publicity and/or entertainment Deep background in leading diverse creative and/or editorial teams and growing those teams from a “start-up” phase to more established organizations Strong people manager who can lead through context and not control Must possess solid organizational skills, model effective time management and deliver consistently excellent verbal and written communications across internal and external teams Strong creative eye with a keen understanding of visual storytelling in the service of audience-first communication Must be able to work independently, make sound decisions-exercising judgment, think strategically, and maintain accuracy and attention to detail Experience working with TV/film productions, talent, filmmakers and with publicity teams Understand and interest in copyright laws, usage licenses and embargoes Understand the photography/video industry and preferably with networks in each Strong knowledge in creative digital assets formats and asset management Extensive knowledge of Adobe Suite including Photoshop and Pro is preferred Fluency in English and ideally, one other Asian language We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

  • Identify opportunities for creative inspiration and learnings to ensure team members across countries and regions have access to new ways of thinking in order to support continued team and skill development
  • Provide regional oversight on operational strategies and creative output by being a connection within the global Photo & AV Studio leadership team to drive APAC needs globally while adopting global best practices locally
  • Collaborate with global partners in creating and championing better ways of asset creation, management, and storage in order to find scale without losing local or creative nuance
  • Develop relationships across functions beyond PR e.g. Product, Production, Marketing identifying opportunities for greater collaboration and/or efficiencies 
    • Skills & Requirements:
  • 12-15+ years experience working across visual asset creation, publishing, publicity and/or entertainment 
  • Deep background in leading diverse creative and/or editorial teams and growing those teams from a “start-up” phase to more established organizations
  • Strong people manager who can lead through context and not control
  • Must possess solid organizational skills, model effective time management and deliver consistently excellent verbal and written communications across internal and external teams
  • Strong creative eye with a keen understanding of visual storytelling in the service of audience-first communication 
  • Must be able to work independently, make sound decisions-exercising judgment, think strategically, and maintain accuracy and attention to detail
  • Experience working with TV/film productions, talent, filmmakers and with publicity teams
  • Understand and interest in copyright laws, usage licenses and embargoes
  • Understand the photography/video industry and preferably with networks in each 
  • Strong knowledge in creative digital assets formats and asset management 
  • Extensive knowledge of Adobe Suite including Photoshop and Pro is preferred
  • Fluency in English and ideally, one other Asian language

description: Netflix is revolutionizing entertainment. We connect people with movies and television globally by delivering outstanding content and technological innovation. This is your chance to be at the forefront of Netflix’s new video game offering. We will bring these new experiences to market through the world's leading streaming entertainment app with 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries who are already enjoying TV series, documentaries, and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and now they can play mobile and (early) cloud games anytime, anywhere with a collection of Netflix curated and produced Games. The External Games team Technical Director will work as part of the External Games leadership team to support delivering external developer partners’ games successfully to our members.  The ideal candidate is excited to leverage broad games engineering leadership and strategic experience partnering with producers, business development, and our internal Netflix product and technology teams. An ideal team member has a deep understanding of the technology considerations having collaborated on multi-discipline teams to build and release a wide variety of games with both client and backend/live service considerations as well as their implications to business, production, and design.  This leader will get deeply involved in numerous efforts, including but not limited to developer partner and project due diligence and deal signing, service and platform integrations, influence, and game and portfolio health; previous experience in similar roles in publishing-oriented organizations is also ideal. Responsibilities: Partner with Head of External Games and Head of Tech for Games Studios on the broader technical and engineering strategy to ensure dots are connected across the organization Accountable for Technical Leadership across External Games including External developers, the games they are creating, and cross-functional partnerships Connecting Strategy to Technical Considerations and Opportunities and supporting BD and Producers  to execute with these considerations in mind Partnering with BD and cross-functional teams on External Developer due diligence Drive highly effective collaboration across multiple cross-functional partners and External Games, primarily with Partner Engineers, Platform, Product, Games Technology, and Cloud Streaming Teams. Partner with Engineering on supporting the needs of developers specific to the games they are releasing on Netflix Partner with Engineering and Product on TRCs and Security requirements to ensure they filter correctly to our External Developers Qualifications: Experience as a Technical Director in both publishing and game development is a must 8+ years experience shipping multiple games (social, F2P, mobile, web, console, handheld) Experience with multiple complex engineering problems across a variety of genres Familiarity/expertise in a wide spectrum of game-relevant technologies including Unity, Unreal, “custom” engines, backend services and systems, game platforms, etc. Excellent communication approach with the ability to work with a variety of people Ability to influence direction, without relying on positional authority An uncanny knack for arriving at solutions through unconventional methods and developing a plan to put them into action Passionate about playing and creating games Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top-of-market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $100,000 - $500,000 USD. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more details about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: The Netflix Design team is searching for a Staff Product Designer for our Merchandising & Communications XD team. Merchandising at Netflix drives continuous engagement through highly relevant, scalable experiences that connect the right members, with the right content, at the right time. We strive to make every member feel like “Netflix gets me” by anticipating what they want and fostering deeper connections with content they love.  The person we are looking for should possess deep knowledge, and be known for... A) Being able to effectively balance design systems thinking with the creativity needed to appeal to the tastes of every Netflix member. B) Understanding that it’s not only important for members to easily understand the depth of choices on our service, and why it’s relevant to them, but also that these personal experiences must be appropriately scalable across regions, content types, and devices. In this role, you will lead the creation and evolution of our merchandising design system, working across the company with cross-functional partners and stakeholders to drive the system forward, bring alignment, streamline creation, and empower innovation. You will work closely with many designers across the business, bringing both systems and merchandising design expertise to the table. This role is ideally based in our Los Gatos offices. There is also the option to be based out of LA, or remotely from the West Coast/PST working hours. Expect to travel monthly to meet with your teams, stakeholders, and partners. Key Responsibilities Lead a critical workstream of multi-disciplinary team members - Product Design, Content Design, Operations, Product Management, Merchandising, and Research – to ideate, test, and align around principles and patterns that enable effective merchandising across Netflix Define an engagement model with teams across the business Work closely with the Netflix Design Systems team to design, document, and support a Merchandising Design System Collaborate with teams innovating around merchandising strategy and tactics to leverage and up-level our design system Create the Merchandising Design System roadmap by blending product-oriented, short-term objectives and long-term vision. Determine a design strategy that reflects what Merchandising means at Netflix to our members, and inspires the business to push boundaries Skills, Characteristics & Qualifications Proven ability to lead horizontal initiatives that involve multiple teams across the business, and successful track record of executing to the benefit of all teams. Experience creating or contributing to design systems, and evolving them as business needs change Understands the intersection of user journeys and merch lifecycles Is an advocate for the user, ensuring the balance of design that offers choices (and shows clear value) to the user vs. trying to "sell" something to them Understanding of merchandising challenges, strategies, and tactics for a large and diverse catalog of offerings Experience collaborating closely with cross-functional stakeholders, helping drive alignment between design and your cross-functional partners, and building strong relationships across business areas. Comfortable working with ambiguity - able to bring rigorous design thinking and operational structure to complex and evolving problem spaces. Exceptional communication skills, in writing and verbally, whether in small group discussions, large-scale presentations, or with executives. Demonstrated ability to work on patterns across multiple UI platforms, such as TV, mobile, and web. Known for high quality craft, both in the holistic design approach and detailed execution Does this sound interesting but overwhelming? Please don’t self-select out; let’s figure it out together. We’d love to talk to you! Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $240,000 - $725,000 Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: Who We Are Next Games, a Netflix Game Studio, is a Helsinki-based studio dedicated to crafting fans-first interactive experiences that combine the stories from popular movies and shows with engaging game mechanics. Our values, Caring, Courage, and Curiosity, drive our commitment to our players and each other, with a focus on fun gameplay free from the constraints of free-to-play. The Role We're now looking for a Senior Producer. As part of the game team’s Production team led by the Lead Producer, you will be the driving force behind one of our exciting new game projects. You are a servant leader with natural people skills and adept at proactively resolving team conflicts and managing personal dynamics effectively. You will coach your team and enable them to grow their skills and encourage them to adopt efficient practices. You have a solid understanding of games as a product that enables you to ask the right questions from designers, product managers, and other stakeholders. You understand the importance of velocity and the value it brings to the team. Ultimately you will be responsible for the day-to-day, week-to-week, sprint-to-sprint development cycles, and organizing the development of the feature teams. Responsibilities With the Lead Producer: Finding effective ways of working and organizing the production of the game Planning the project’s timeline and scope, identifying risks, and drafting mitigation plans for them well in advance Articulating and communicating product backlog to all stakeholders Organizing the day to day development work of feature team(s) Defining, updating, and enforcing Definition of Done and Definition of Ready for team deliverables With the game team: Coach the team to be self-organized and cross-functional, clarify roles within the team Create, own, and facilitate agile events (Daily, Review, Retro and Planning) Take out impediments on feature team and game team level Coach team to agile methods and make sure everybody understands why they are being used Mediate conflicts and nurture team dynamics Your Experience and Skills Include Proven track record of producing and shipping multiple games with modern Agile methodologies Experience of mobiles games’ live operations and shipping updates Strong leadership experience Strong experience in managing team dynamics within a game team Extensive experience in iterative development Ability to set up and configure team’s production tools and information radiators Deep knowledge of Atlassian Jira and Confluence Passion for games and understanding of the mobile games industry Ability to adjust to the given production framework and tools Disciplined and self-motivated with a strong work ethic Experience in working with senior levels of management Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English We're eager to hear from you if you're passionate about creating innovative mobile games in a fun, supportive environment! Does this opportunity sound like your next adventure? Then apply today! Why Next Games? As a studio, Next Games offers competitive pay, unlimited holidays, hobby clubs, and so much more. With over 30 nationalities, multiple genders, and people from all kinds of backgrounds within our studio, we pride ourselves in being a welcoming and inclusive place to work and grow. Our working language is English. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

description: We are seeking an experienced Manager, Local Originals - Thailand to help build and execute the original slate strategy for Thailand productions for the world to watch.  This role will carry projects from a creative perspective from pitch/development through to final delivery. Targeted programming will be focused on a broad range of scripted programming from across Thailand range of genres, languages, and budget ranges in scripted TV and Film programming. Responsibilities will include establishing and growing strong partnerships with creative partners in the market to source and commission great content.  This role will also lead the execution of the shows working with internal cross-functional partners such as Content Planning, Physical, and Post Production. VFX, Marketing and Publicity.  This position will report to the Director of Content for Thailand. The Opportunity Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with 222 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any internet-connected screen. Members can play, pause, and resume watching, all without commercials or commitments With the continued international expansion and a move into growing APAC Local Original production underway, it's a great time to join Netflix. The Role A successful candidate will have a strong sense of narrative structure, a regional sensibility, and the ability to guide a project from pitch/idea through to delivery. They will be self-motivated, proactive, quick-thinking, flexible, able to pivot when necessary, thorough, and able to juggle multiple and diverse responsibilities across projects at varying stages from development through to delivery. At all times unwavering attention to creative detail.  S/he will have excellent problem-solving skills, with the ability to think about the best solutions in the best interest of the company as they arise.  This is a demanding and fast-moving position that requires someone who is a proactive and positive thinker and is able to exercise sensitivity, good judgment, and initiative while working with a high-volume production slate and a diverse range of creative/production partners. Specific responsibilities include, but are not limited to: Development/Pre-Production/Setup of Show Work closely with Showrunners, Producers, Writers, and external creative teams to develop projects and assess for long-term viability. Work with Finance, Legal, Business Affairs, Product, Post & external production teams on establishing key schedules and workflows while maximizing the budget to spend as much on-screen as possible. Develop and foster relationships with a multitude of producing partners/third parties. Qualifications: BA/BS Degree Minimum 7 years’ experience with long-form production executive management both in the field and/or on a network/studio level for film or series. Ability to handle a fast-paced environment simultaneously supervising several projects in various phases of production (from evaluation to production through delivery) Ability to respond after hours for important, timely, or urgent matters Team player who operates in a fast-paced team-oriented setting Ability to be discrete and maintain confidential information Understanding how to prioritize and respond accordingly while being an effective communicator Willingness to continue learning to ensure understanding of the current production process and gear Strong written and verbal communication skills and the ability to multitask Willingness to take educated risks and think out of the box We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

description: Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services, with 270 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. The Financial Planning & Analysis group is looking for an Associate to focus on Financial Planning & Analysis for Japan and Taiwan. This role will be a critical and integrated business partner to the global APAC content acquisition and production team and be responsible for financial planning and analytics for the company’s rapidly expanding programming initiatives. This position will reside within the company’s Tokyo office. description: Netflix is revolutionizing entertainment. We connect people with movies and television globally by delivering outstanding content and technological innovation. This is your chance to be at the forefront of Netflix’s new video game offering. We will bring these new experiences to market through the world's leading streaming entertainment app with 231 million paid memberships in over 190 countries who are already enjoying TV series, documentaries, and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and now they can download and play mobile games anytime, anywhere with a collection of Netflix curated and produced Games. Netflix is looking for an experienced Executive Producer to join the External Games team. This role will report to the Production Director, leading the execution of our big bet games across the External Games portfolio. This role interacts with External games leadership, Producers, Business Development, Product Manager and Creative Leads across External Games, as well as cross-functional partners to ensure our games are tracking to the highest possible quality. The candidate will have a proven track record of releasing Must Play games, working across complex partnerships with publishers, developers, and IP owners, as well as deep experience across multiple platforms. Responsibilities: This role will focus on our big bets from a production perspective, ensuring our highest priority, most impactful games are tracking well across quality, development, and member value Define, develop, and refine the overall production strategy for our larger, more complex titles, including platforms, pipelines, and processes to ensure that Producers have everything they need to serve players, developers, and partners. Identify and lead additional strategic initiatives to ensure our team and developers have the goals, frameworks, and priority they need to be successful during  development Assist the Production Director in budget management of games in the development Partner with business development and creative teams to ensure we are making the right decisions for our developers and members Manage a team of producers, supporting them in their role as our external developer’s primary point of contact during development Mentor, manage, and lead multiple producers, creating growth and opportunities for their success while maintaining a balanced production capacity. Help resolve unique, complex product issues through ingenuity, creativity, and any other means necessary to get the job done. Identify risks early and often and remove roadblocks and performance bottlenecks as needed. Develop strong relationships with internal and 1st party studios to establish and maintain a flow of information so we are aligned on frameworks, games, opportunities, and priorities Work cross-functionally to create a healthy team culture based on rich communication, transparency, and shared context. Qualifications: Previous Executive Producer or Production Director experience in game development and publishing 6+ years of management experience, including managing direct reports with varying levels of production experience 12+ years experience in game production with experience shipping multiple games (console, PC, Mobile) Experience in strategic planning and execution through the development on large complex project You have robust experience overseeing the full lifecycle of game development with a specific focus on mult-platform releases An excellent knowledge of licensing and IP complexities, understanding the difficulties generally encountered by teams and solutions tailored to their requirements. Experience leading complex cross-functional projects with successful delivery of quality and schedule and in balancing scope, capacity, budget, risk, and time. Ability to influence direction, without relying on positional authority You have an uncanny knack for arriving at solutions through unconventional methods and developing a plan to put them into action You have excellent communication and are able to work with a variety of people, effectively communicating everything from data to creative feedback Passion for video games, innovations in software, and how they enrich the player's experience. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top-of-market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $160,000 - $610,000 Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more details about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with 270 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. The Role The position will lead on industry programming and awards screenings events to engage with industry and voters in the UK and EMEA. They will work closely with the Senior Manager, Talent Relations & Awards - EMEA on overall strategy and will be responsible for managing and executing these events, primarily in the UK and occasionally across EMEA. This will include supporting not only top regional priority titles but also global awards priority titles. Ideally, they have experience with executing creative and impactful publicity / marketing campaigns and/or events for films and series. We are seeking someone with a deep knowledge in the UK entertainment business. This is a great opportunity to join a team of professionals dedicated to supporting an exciting slate of films, series, and documentaries that feature some of the brightest filmmakers, creatives, and actors in the industry. This is a very hands-on role, one where we want you to throw the playbook out the window and push the team to innovate as we continue to push the boundaries of what we can do. To succeed in this role you will need: An entrepreneurial spirit with the ability to make tough decisions, even when faced with ambiguity. The ability to think creatively and strategically and look at the bigger picture when brainstorming campaign ideas. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to foster strong relationships with people and talent at all levels internally and externally. The ability to be scrappy, resourceful and relentless in trying to find solutions. A direct and candid communication style to articulate clearly what you are - and are not - trying to do. Not be defined by past experiences and able to put a new, creative spin on what a campaign can be. Organized, thorough and not afraid to get your hands dirty. Eager to learn and yet, also be able to contribute effectively outside of your specialty. The successful candidate will have: 7+ years of experience in the film/entertainment industry with an agency, studio, broadcaster or film/TV organisation  working across publicity / marketing campaigns and/or events. Knowledge of the awards landscape. Knowledge of awards campaigns and awards voter membership. Established relationships with venues and vendors is ideal. Comfortable with travel and non-traditional working hours in the evenings and on. weekends - due to the nature of the job. Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and to effectively prioritize. Responsiveness with a bias towards action. Highly organized, thorough and very hands-on. Comfortable making tough decisions; being candid and direct. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

description: Location: Remote, United States Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with 250 million paid memberships in over 190 countries, enjoying TV series, documentaries, feature films, and mobile games across a wide variety of genres and languages. The Security Incident Response Team is a global team that works to protect Netflix and its customers across this broad range of services. As part of Detection and Response, the Security Incident Response Team partners closely with Security Operations and Intelligence and Detection Engineering. You’ll lead a team that focuses on incident response preparedness and best practices, identification and mitigation of security incidents, builds its own tools and automation, and works with the broader information security org to identify and reduce risks. This is a mature and globally distributed team, and we are looking for a leader who can manage a hybrid team of security software engineers and security engineers, evolve the incident response program to handle rapidly changing business requirements and align closely with other incident management teams across the business. The person in this role will own, build, and advance our incident response charter, including games, insider risk, and regulatory assessments. You will closely collaborate with many other Netflix teams to actively defend Netflix’s assets across streaming, studio, games, and enterprise. This is an active and highly visible role that requires an appreciation for operational excellence, a pragmatic view of risk, and a strong ability to build cross-functional relationships. Desired Background: You are a meticulous and responsive cross-team communicator and program leader. Your technical background aligns with the current team operating at the intersection of software engineering, incident response, and digital forensics. You are well versed in the latest adversary techniques, attack lifecycle, and incident response procedures. You can successfully coach, mentor, develop, and inspire a talented and senior team. You are confident in working with frontline teammates, executives, and third-party organizations to inform and coordinate collaborative efforts. You can drive success with minimal process and a heavy emphasis on individual responsibility. You cultivate team morale and culture and partner with leadership to implement strategies for managing the high-velocity and often stressful tempo. You have experience managing a hybrid team of in-person and remote engineers. We are looking for thoughtful security professionals who enable our mission, lead with empathy, and encourage and enable the growth of our teams. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $190,000 - $920,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services, with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries, enjoying TV series, films, and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. The Opportunity Netflix is seeking a Manager, Sports Publicity to spearhead publicity campaigns for its sports and nonfiction series, with a primary focus on the US market. This role is an individual contributor position and reports to the Director of Series Publicity, who oversees a team of publicists dedicated to Sports, Nonfiction, and Comedy series. The Manager of Sports Publicity will be part of a seasoned group of professionals based in the Los Angeles office. The Role As the Manager, you play a key role in strategizing, executing, and managing publicity campaigns for our sports and nonfiction series titles. You will collaborate with cross-functional partners spanning across content/programming, marketing, social, product and beyond to bring innovative campaigns to life. You are passionate about sports in the live, documentary and league follow space and have a deep understanding of the press and social landscape. You understand the audience and how they consume sports, and have a proven track record working first-hand on the development and execution of high-profile sport campaigns. Your innovative spirit enables you to conceive and actualize creative ideas that leave a lasting impression on the cultural zeitgeist. Responsibilities: Leverage multiple earned media channels, including broadcast, print, online, and new media. Work closely with producers, athletes/ talent, and production company partners during production up to and beyond launch. Create cultural moments and innovative high-impact campaigns, explore new tactics for promoting series, and be able to communicate different facets of their campaigns to executives, producers, talent, and talent representatives. Pitch media and creative; innovate and secure press opportunities; cover set visits; and help plan and work junkets. Coordinate requests and initiatives from international territories and will help prioritize what is important and vital to accomplish. Formulate and manage a budget, and give visibility into their work successfully. Support awards campaign from strategy and submission process for their shows. Requirements: BA/BS and 7+ of entertainment experience in-house at a league, sports brand, agency, studio, network, or journalism setting. Experience managing agencies on projects; has established relationships with key sports media, and building and maintaining connections with key journalists and social media influencers. Strong media relationships at traditional and emerging entertainment, consumer, trade, and business outlets across broadcast, print, online and digital. Thinks strategically and avoids relying on basic PR tactics by innovating and redefining campaign approaches. Comfortable multitasking and working at a fast pace with high-volume tasks; thrives in an entrepreneurial environment characterized by ambiguity. Clear, direct, and candid communication style; strong written and verbal skills. Avidly consume sports entertainment and are passionate and curious about the growing global entertainment landscape. Preferred: A strong business acumen and experience working at a global company. Open to self-assessment and continuous improvement. search_text:
Los Angeles, California Marketing and Communications Publicity Manager, Sports Publicity Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services, with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries, enjoying TV series, films, and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. The Opportunity Netflix is seeking a Manager, Sports Publicity to spearhead publicity campaigns for its sports and nonfiction series, with a primary focus on the US market. This role is an individual contributor position and reports to the Director of Series Publicity, who oversees a team of publicists dedicated to Sports, Nonfiction, and Comedy series. The Manager of Sports Publicity will be part of a seasoned group of professionals based in the Los Angeles office. The Role As the Manager, you play a key role in strategizing, executing, and managing publicity campaigns for our sports and nonfiction series titles. You will collaborate with cross-functional partners spanning across content/programming, marketing, social, product and beyond to bring innovative campaigns to life. You are passionate about sports in the live, documentary and league follow space and have a deep understanding of the press and social landscape. You understand the audience and how they consume sports, and have a proven track record working first-hand on the development and execution of high-profile sport campaigns. Your innovative spirit enables you to conceive and actualize creative ideas that leave a lasting impression on the cultural zeitgeist.  Responsibilities:
  • Leverage multiple earned media channels, including broadcast, print, online, and new media.
  • Work closely with producers, athletes/ talent, and production company partners during production up to and beyond launch.
  • Create cultural moments and innovative high-impact campaigns, explore new tactics for promoting series, and be able to communicate different facets of their campaigns to executives, producers, talent, and talent representatives.
  • Pitch media and creative; innovate and secure press opportunities; cover set visits; and help plan and work junkets.
  • Coordinate requests and initiatives from international territories and will help prioritize what is important and vital to accomplish.
  • Formulate and manage a budget, and give visibility into their work successfully.
  • Support awards campaign from strategy and submission process for their shows.
    • Requirements:
  • BA/BS and 7+ of entertainment experience in-house at a league, sports brand, agency, studio, network, or journalism setting.
  • Experience managing agencies on projects; has established relationships with key sports media, and building and maintaining connections with key journalists and social media influencers.
  • Strong media relationships at traditional and emerging entertainment, consumer, trade, and business outlets across broadcast, print, online and digital.
  • Thinks strategically and avoids relying on basic PR tactics by innovating and redefining campaign approaches.
  • Comfortable multitasking and working at a fast pace with high-volume tasks; thrives in an entrepreneurial environment characterized by ambiguity.
  • Clear, direct, and candid communication style; strong written and verbal skills.
  • Avidly consume sports entertainment and are passionate and curious about the growing global entertainment landscape.
    • Preferred:
  • A strong business acumen and experience working at a global company.
  • Open to self-assessment and continuous improvement.
  • Handles sensitive issues with tact and diplomacy, including delivering bad news.
    • Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $160,000 - $320,000.  Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits.
