description: Netflix, the world's leading streaming entertainment service, reaches over 230 million paid memberships across 190 countries. As we expand our original productions and licensed content globally, scaling our business and creating value across diverse markets and user segments becomes paramount. At Netflix, Payments is vital for ensuring members stay and sign up hassle-free. Our team crafts a scalable, seamless and largely familiar payments experience, across a range of locally preferred methods of payment (MOPs) that in turn drive incremental paid member growth and long-term revenue. About the Role As a Senior Product Designer within our Growth Team, y ou'll shape consumer payment experience on Netflix across all commerce use cases . Your responsibility is crafting intuitive, frictionless, and engaging payment journeys that resonate with our diverse global audience. This role extends beyond interface design to drive member engagement and retention. About You Natural leader with exceptional communication skills Comfortable navigating ambiguity Ability to collaborate with multiple stakeholders to solve problems Capable of driving vision and change in established domains Skilled at simplifying complex workflows into intuitive design solutions Strategic balance between short-term feature building and long-term team goals Proficiency in identifying patterns and streamlining workflows across vertical content teams Responsibilities Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define and execute growth initiatives Deep dive into global payment systems and user behaviors Lead design process from concept to implementation Advocate for user needs through research and usability testing Champion design-centered product enhancements Stay updated on industry trends and best practices Develop relationships with global stakeholders and ensure cohesive product experiences Must Haves 7+ years of UX/UI design experience, demonstrating proficiency in creating intuitive and engaging user experiences. Strong background in payments or e-commerce, with a deep understanding of industry trends and best practices. Direct experience in successfully scaling payment solutions in both global and emerging markets, showcasing the ability to adapt strategies to diverse cultural and regulatory landscapes. Knowledge or hands-on experience with mobile payments, payment processing, and fraud detection, including familiarity with industry standards and emerging technologies. A robust portfolio showcasing exceptional problem-solving abilities and a keen eye for detail in crafting user-centric designs that drive positive outcomes. description: At Netflix, we want to entertain the world and are constantly innovating how entertainment is imagined, created, and delivered to a global audience. We currently stream content in more than 30 languages in 190 countries, topping over 260 million paid subscribers, and are expanding into new forms of entertainment such as gaming. Producing content globally, at this scale is a unique challenge; this is where our organization comes in. Studio Production Engineering (SPE) plays a pivotal role in Netflix's content creation and delivery journey. The seamless magic of your favorite show starting with a click is the result of thousands of intricate processes and workflows behind the scenes that are enabled by our tools. We empower Netflix studios to bring creative excellence to life - develop tools to achieve operational excellence and economies of scale. Our solutions aim to elevate the ROI of the $15 billion dollars spent on content creation through cost/time efficiency, and data-driven decision-making. User & Access Management Engineering, part of SPE, manages experiences, platforms, backend services and data facilitating the goal of seamless user onboarding and managing access to Netflix Content and Studio ecosystem. We are seeking a talented Engineering Manager to lead our dynamic team of local and remote engineers and drive the development and innovation of our complex infrastructure while improving the overall security posture. As an Engineering Manager you will: Provide technical vision and strategy for building platforms that scale for the growing needs of Content & Studio. Build strong relationships and work closely with various cross-functional partners including product, engineering, design, data science, security team and stakeholders across time zones. Support your team by helping them understand priorities, drive down ambiguity bringing focus, provide context and empower them to bring their best and create impact. Participate in architecture decisions for technology innovation and be a thought partner/sounding board for your team, stakeholders, and partners. Coach and lead a dream team of UI, backend, and full-stack engineers to execute a shared vision between engineering, product and security partners. Be an exemplar of the Netflix culture About You: You are an inclusive leader with a proven track record of building and leading high-performing diverse teams. You have an extensive background and strong technical expertise working in backend infrastructure and platforms, and understand how to build for complexity, scale and business impact. You have a solid knowledge of distributed systems architectures and understanding of the whole web stack: front-end, back-end, databases, and integrations. You are well versed in technical principles like cloud engineering, operational excellence, and balancing performance, efficiency, and reliability You have a proven track record of taking innovative projects from concept to production. You are inherently curious and enjoy leading through challenges. You balance short-term needs along with long-term vision. You are a proactive, effective communicator with great judgment and a bias towards action. You are a role model for integrity, transparency and courage. You enjoy enabling your team to work on hard problems with tech, but what really drives you is creating levers for making a big impact You have at least 2 years experience with hiring, leading engineering teams staffed with a range of experienced engineers and coaching through personal and professional growth. Bonus Experience if: You have application security domain experience - awareness of AuthN and AuthZ constructs. You have a background working with Security Engineering or IAM foundational principles. To learn more about Content Engineering, feel free to listen to this video . Our team includes people of all genders, varied sexual orientations, parents, folks who are self-taught, and people of a wide variety of nationalities, ages, and socio-economic backgrounds. Diverse teams are strong teams, and we encourage those with varied identities and experiences to apply. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $190,000 - $920,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: Netflix is the world's leading streaming video service, with over 200 million paid memberships in 190+ countries. Most of that streaming happens on CE devices (which comprise Smart TVs, streaming sticks, game consoles, and set-top boxes). Who We Are We are a team of passionate engineers who delight our members with industry-leading playback experiences on CE devices. To provide the best streaming experience, we design and develop playback features that adapt to device capabilities, are optimized for performance, and are scalable for reach. The TV Player team sits at the nexus of diverse activities powering new strategic product feature development (Live Streaming, Seamless Ads playback, and Cloud Games Streaming). From supporting UI and product innovation, adhering to evolving content protection features and A/B experimentation of new encodes (ex: AV1 ), and Platform Capabilities, we partner with various cross-functional teams across Netflix, including UI , Encoding , Streaming Algorithms , Security,  and Open Connect . We also manage and deploy our player releases with test automation and continuous integration. Our team comprises engineers from diverse backgrounds with expertise spanning different disciplines (Embedded systems, Streaming Media Playback, Content Protection,  Client Server Communication, Networking protocols, Continuous Integration, Test Automation, Experimentation, and Software engineering). Our success comes from self-motivated, selfless, curious, and highly collaborative engineers in the team. The Role We are looking for a senior software engineer to join our team in enhancing our video player with new features and tackle challenges to improve streaming quality and reach on TV devices. In this role, you will lead and drive initiatives in new feature developments, conduct A/B experiments, analyze the data, influence decision-making, contribute to CI and test automation, and manage our player releases to millions of devices worldwide. What sets you apart? You are a curious, self-motivated, and self-starter, comfortable identifying opportunities and driving technical roadmaps. You have a mindset to go deeper to understand the problems, identify the root causes, and develop solutions that consider trade-offs. You seek alternate perspectives to improve your ideas. You can rethink existing designs and rebuild them to improve performance and scalability. You use data and seek input from others to inform your decisions. You are selfless, highly collaborative, and willing to help colleagues when in need. What skills are essential to us: Expertise in developing software for streaming media applications. Live Streaming experience is a plus. A Javascript expert with experience working with Typescript. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Has a quality and performance mindset to drive automation and QoE improvements. Experience with A/B testing, developing experiments to test hypotheses, and analyzing data to drive improvements in streaming quality. Proven ability to tailor communication to a given audience. Experience working with CE devices (Smart TVs, Set-top boxes, or Streaming sticks) is a plus. What you will Do: Design and Develop new playback features to optimize and fine-tune streaming QoE for the same on TV devices to increase reach. Work cross-functionally with the TV Platform Team, UI, Streaming Algorithms, Encoding, DSE, and other player client teams to collaborate and drive new initiatives. Run experiments to gauge system performance for new device capabilities and feature exploration. Design and develop tools to increase developer velocity and aid in-field issue triage. Contribute to CI and test automation and manage our player releases. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $100,000 - $720,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. Remote, United States Products & Technology Client and UI Engineering Software Engineer (L5) - TV Player Netflix is the world's leading streaming video service, with over 200 million paid memberships in 190+ countries. Most of that streaming happens on CE devices (which comprise Smart TVs, streaming sticks, game consoles, and set-top boxes).  Who We Are We are a team of passionate engineers who delight our members with industry-leading playback experiences on CE devices. To provide the best streaming experience, we design and develop playback features that adapt to device capabilities, are optimized for performance, and are scalable for reach.  The TV Player team sits at the nexus of diverse activities powering new strategic product feature development (Live Streaming, Seamless Ads playback, and Cloud Games Streaming). From supporting UI and product innovation, adhering to evolving content protection features andA/B experimentation of new encodes (ex:AV1), and Platform Capabilities, we partner with various cross-functional teams across Netflix, includingUI,Encoding,Streaming Algorithms, Security,  and Open Connect. We also manage and deploy our player releases with test automation and continuous integration. Our team comprises engineers from diverse backgrounds with expertise spanning different disciplines (Embedded systems, Streaming Media Playback, Content Protection,  Client Server Communication, Networking protocols, Continuous Integration, Test Automation, Experimentation, and Software engineering). Our success comes from self-motivated, selfless, curious, and highly collaborative engineers in the team. The Role We are looking for a senior software engineer to join our team in enhancing our video player with new features and tackle challenges to improve streaming quality and reach on TV devices. In this role, you will lead and drive initiatives in new feature developments, conduct A/B experiments, analyze the data, influence decision-making, contribute to CI and test automation, and manage our player releases to millions of devices worldwide. What sets you apart?
  • You are a curious, self-motivated, and self-starter, comfortable identifying opportunities and driving technical roadmaps. 
  • You have a mindset to go deeper to understand the problems, identify the root causes, and develop solutions that consider trade-offs.
  • You seek alternate perspectives to improve your ideas.
  • You can rethink existing designs and rebuild them to improve performance and scalability.
  • You use data and seek input from others to inform your decisions. 
  • You are selfless, highly collaborative, and willing to help colleagues when in need.
    • What skills are essential to us:
  • Expertise in developing software for streaming media applications. Live Streaming experience is a plus.
  • A Javascript expert with experience working with Typescript. 
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Has a quality and performance mindset to drive automation and QoE improvements.
  • Experience with A/B testing, developing experiments to test hypotheses, and analyzing data to drive improvements in streaming quality. 
  • Proven ability to tailor communication to a given audience.
  • Experience working with CE devices (Smart TVs, Set-top boxes, or Streaming sticks) is a plus.
    • What you will Do:
  • Design and Develop new playback features to optimize and fine-tune streaming QoE for the same on TV devices to increase reach.
  • Work cross-functionally with the TV Platform Team, UI, Streaming Algorithms, Encoding, DSE, and other player client teams to collaborate and drive new initiatives.
  • Run experiments to gauge system performance for new device capabilities and feature exploration. 
  • Design and develop tools to increase developer velocity and aid in-field issue triage.
  •  Contribute to CI and test automation and manage our player releases.
    • Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $100,000 - $720,000.  Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here. Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with 270 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. As Netflix continues to grow, we are venturing into exciting new frontiers of personalization to help our members find the content they’ll most enjoy. To do this, we have to understand which titles, and what experiences in the product, produce the most joy for each member. We are looking for exceptional individuals to work full time with us as research scientists. This includes researching and applying cutting edge machine learning techniques to understand how members experience titles, and how that changes their long-term assessment of their satisfaction with the Netflix service. In this role, you will conduct applied research by conceptualizing, designing, implementing and validating the next generation of personalization algorithms using techniques such as causal inference, machine learning, reinforcement learning (specifically rewards models), and econometrics. You will be responsible for operating, as well as innovating on, these algorithms in production, and validating through running offline experiments, and building online A/B tests to run in production systems. You will partner with people from many disciplines, including behavioral scientists, machine learning researchers, and application engineers. To be successful in this role, you need a strong machine learning background, solid software development skills, a love of learning, a passion for solving end-user problems and to collaborate well in multi-disciplinary teams. You will need to exhibit strong communication and leadership skills, an ability to set priorities, and an execution focus in a dynamic environment. What we are looking for: A burning desire to solve real world problems at scale by applying Machine Learning PhD or Masters in Computer Science, Statistics, or any of the related fields 5+ years of research experience with a track record of delivering quality results Experience in end-to-end ML application development Expertise in machine learning spanning supervised and unsupervised learning methods Excellent software engineering skills in multi-language settings with Scala, Java, and Python Experience with Spark, TensorFlow, Keras, or PyTorch Exceptional problem solving skills Strong mathematical skills with knowledge of statistical methods Great interpersonal skills Strong written and verbal communication skills Preferred, but not required: Experience using Reward models, LLM Alignment models of RLHF in real world applications Experience in Personalization, Recommendations, Deep Learning, Bandits, CausalML, Industrial scale ML systems, etc Experience as a technical leader Experience working with cross functional teams Experience with cloud computing platforms and large web-scale distributed systems Experience in applied research in industrial settings Open source contributions Research publications at peer reviewed journals and conferences on relevant topics Links: Netflix Research site Our culture Our long term business view Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $100,000 - $720,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: About Netflix: Netflix is a global powerhouse in streaming entertainment, with over 260 million paid memberships spanning 190+ countries. Our members enjoy a diverse array of TV series, documentaries, feature films, and mobile games, all available on-demand and across various genres and languages. About the Team: The Scaled Launch Operations team forms part of the backbone of Netflix's Film, Series, Games, and Live event launches. Our Project Managers, Coordinators, and Program Managers collaborate with many internal and external partners, local teams, and subject matter experts within Netflix to set up and scale new workstreams and experiences on the Netflix Product. We are part of a border Operations team that serves other parts of our Product, Discovery, and Promotion organization. Underpinning all we do is a core focus on quality (protecting the member experience is the heartbeat of our team) and driving scale for the business in finding smart opportunities to optimize how we deliver our work. Role Overview: We’re looking for a strong Operations Manager of Emerging Experiences to join our leadership team. This role will spearhead the development and overseeing of the latest functions in our Mexico City hub, focusing on games and live events. Additionally, you will support the incubation of new workstreams within our hub. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of building and leading high-performing operational teams and designing effective workflows to meet the demands of our evolving business. You will report to the Director of Scaled Launch Operations. Key Responsibilities: Leadership and Development : Lead and develop our Live and Games operations team in Mexico City. Resource planning is a critical part of the role. Execution and Strategy: Drive the day-to-day execution of developed strategies, ensuring successful launches of new Games and Live events within your team's domain. Representation: You will be the point person in Mexico City for UCAN-based Live and Games Leadership and teams. Represent our team in Games and Live forums with a solid operational voice. Coaching and talent density: Provide mentorship and development opportunities for team members, fostering a culture of excellence, high performance, and continuous improvement. You are responsible for maintaining a dream team. Collaboration: Partner with Mumbai-based peers and cross-functional teams, including Live and Games leadership based in UCAN, to drive project success and integrate new experiences into our broader hub capabilities. Expectations: Align team priorities with the broader mission and vision of the Ops organization. Deliver timely, high-quality results within your team's sphere of impact. Engage with peers and key stakeholders to navigate critical decisions thoughtfully and promptly. Coach individual contributors on decision-making processes, ensuring appropriate context is absorbed and cascaded. Make solid and data-informed decisions without falling into analysis paralysis. Take thoughtful risks. Stay involved in the day-to-day operations to fully understand your team's activities. Requirements: Games &/or Live Operations experience would be ideal; however, we’re open to different backgrounds. Proven leadership experience with a focus on developing talent (8+ years) Excellent, precise, and proactive global communication skills. Passion for meeting the needs of cross-functional teams involved in Games and Live events. Comfort with ambiguity and ability to drive projects to completion with clarity and excellence. Significant experience in Project/Program Management. Strong relationship-building and proactive risk management skills. Experience with driving successful large-scale projects/initiatives

description: Netflix is the preeminent home for best-in-class sports content. Behind it all sits Netflix’s Nonfiction Sports team: an organization of people who are passionate about creating elevated and captivating sports content and making it available to viewers around the globe. We are seeking a Production expert to add to the Nonfiction Sports Production Team in Los Angeles. This position will work with Netflix Production Management in executing the day-to-day tasks involved in overseeing a slate of Nonfiction Sports titles. Associate Manager acts as a key point of contact for both internal and external partners, tracking and organizing vital production information and workflows from pre-production through post & wrap, as well as contributing to ongoing internal projects with cross-departmental teams at Netflix. The Role A successful candidate will have a thorough knowledge of production, hands-on experience working on shows in production management, and an insatiable curiosity for all things nonfiction. Candidates should be self-motivated, proactive, quick-thinking, flexible, a team player, thorough, and able to juggle multiple and diverse tasks, with a strong emphasis on organization and unwavering attention to detail. This is a demanding and fast-moving position that requires high performance, a bias for action, and a positive demeanor. Candidates should excel at exercising good judgment and communication even during times of ambiguity. Responsibilities include, but are not limited to: Act as the key point of contact for both internal and external production teams from pitch to delivery. Being a team player who can manage a team or project and support numerous production team members while working collaboratively with cross-functional partners as needed. Review all production plans, budgets, and schedules in order to improve and implement the best practices for production. Responsible for all production documentation, ensuring the workflow pipeline is efficient and effective as it pertains to capturing all data. Track and oversee all production schedules, keeping things up-to-date and well-communicated throughout the course of Production. Keep up to date with Netflix and industry-standard tools, tech specs, and technologies Attend production events, shows, and meetings as required, representing Netflix at the highest standard at all times. Keeping a pulse on market rates, freelance crew, vendors, incentives, and all forward-thinking production strategies. Qualifications: 5 years of nonfiction production management experience as a Line Producer or similar role. Nonfiction production experience should include at least one or all of the following categories;  documentary, unscripted, and sports. Streamer or studio experience is a plus. A high-performance team player who is experienced in a fast-paced environment overseeing several projects at various points of production (from development through delivery). A passion for sports content and comfort in navigating the ever-changing plans that go hand in hand with managing sports productions. Experience managing quick turnaround and topical content where deadlines are firm. Knowledge of current trends and workflows for both UHD/4K capture. Ability to be discreet and maintain confidential information. Understanding how to prioritize and respond accordingly. Desire and self-motivation to continuously learn. Strong written and verbal communication skills and the ability to multitask. Proficiency in Google Suite, Slack, and budgeting software. BA/BS Degree or equivalent experience. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $50,000 - $245,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: The role location is flexible between our California-based office locations (Los Gatos or Los Angeles). Although we can be flexible on a hybrid working model, we are not offering a fully remote work option for this role. Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services, with 270 million paid memberships in over 190 countries, enjoying TV series, films, and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause, and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. Members can play, pause, and resume watching, all without commercials or commitments. It's an amazing time to join Netflix as we continue shaping the future of global entertainment, bringing new stories to millions of people worldwide.  Visit our culture memo and long-term view to learn more. The successful candidate will be well-versed in existing global regulatory ESG reporting requirements, and a thought leader as we strategically navigate this evolving landscape.  You’ll be hands-on as well as strategic, with deep expertise in regulatory reporting and internal controls and in building and improving robust processes that will scale to meet both our current and future challenges.  You will collaborate exhaustively with our Finance, IR, Legal, Public Policy, and subject matter teams covering E, S, and G,  across the globe to ensure we remain well coordinated and meet all of our ESG regulatory reporting requirements. This position is at the Director level and will report to the VP, Chief Accounting Officer. Responsibilities: Monitors the evolving global regulatory ESG reporting landscape and orchestrates various stakeholders in evolving our strategy to meet all requirements; stays apprised of voluntary ESG reporting developments so as to ensure consistency in what Netflix reports externally Evaluate and determine the applicability of new reporting regulations globally (and at the legal entity level) based on deterministic thresholds (e.g. materiality, corporate size, etc.) Builds our capabilities in terms of people, processes, internal controls and systems (including the evaluation of reporting software workflows) to meet all mandatory ESG reporting requirements globally Assists teams in building and/or optimizing data and process flows, ultimately implementing SOX-like controls across the end-to-end business processes from data sources through disclosures Develops and operationalizes standardized policies and processes with regard to sustainability reporting (e.g., materiality assessments, disclosure controls and procedures, estimation approaches) Coordinates limited and reasonable assurance over ESG disclosures, with external accounting firms, where required Coordinates mandatory ESG-related reporting, in partnership with Finance, IR, Legal, Policy, Finance, Statutory, and subject matter experts (e.g. Sustainability for E, Inclusion for S, etc) across the globe to ensure we remain well coordinated and meet all of our regulatory reporting requirements Supports and coordinates with teams managing our voluntary ESG reporting to ensure we’re working in a synergistic manner Builds and leads a global dream team that will support all ESG reporting and other activities Trains key employee groups on reporting processes, controls, need/value of reporting. Minimum Qualifications: 10+ years of experience in a combination of ESG reporting, accounting and financial reporting, internal controls, risk management, data management, or related fields. Experience in working with ESG reporting standards and frameworks such as GRI, SASB, TCFD, etc; Experience in building and improving well-controlled (SOX compliant) processes leveraging technology that scales globally; Experience in building and leading high-performing and diverse global teams; Strong understanding of ESG issues and willingness to keep up-to-date with the latest ESG guidelines and developments; Proven track record in managing multiple projects and consistently meeting deadlines; Strong business acumen, communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills; High level of critical and logical thinking and comfort with ambiguity; Incredible attention to detail and ownership of business outcomes. A Master's degree in Business, Accounting, Finance, or a related field is a plus; Big 4 experience and/or media & entertainment exposure are pluses; Relevant professional certifications such as CPA, CFA, Certified Sustainability Practitioner (CSP), Greenhouse Gas Management Institute diploma, or equivalent are a plus. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top-of-market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $310,000 - $830,000. Los Gatos, California Corporate Functions Finance ESG Controller The role location is flexible between our California-based office locations (Los Gatos or Los Angeles). Although we can be flexible on a hybrid working model, we are not offering a fully remote work option for this role. Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services, with 270 million paid memberships in over 190 countries, enjoying TV series, films, and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause, and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. Members can play, pause, and resume watching, all without commercials or commitments. It's an amazing time to join Netflix as we continue shaping the future of global entertainment, bringing new stories to millions of people worldwide.  Visit our culture memo and long-term view to learn more. The successful candidate will be well-versed in existing global regulatory ESG reporting requirements, and a thought leader as we strategically navigate this evolving landscape.  You’ll be hands-on as well as strategic, with deep expertise in regulatory reporting and internal controls and in building and improving robust processes that will scale to meet both our current and future challenges.  You will collaborate exhaustively with our Finance, IR, Legal, Public Policy, and subject matter teams covering E, S, and G,  across the globe to ensure we remain well coordinated and meet all of our ESG regulatory reporting requirements. This position is at the Director level and will report to the VP, Chief Accounting Officer. Responsibilities:
  • Monitors the evolving global regulatory ESG reporting landscape and orchestrates various stakeholders in evolving our strategy to meet all requirements; stays apprised of voluntary ESG reporting developments so as to ensure consistency in what Netflix reports externally
  • Evaluate and determine the applicability of new reporting regulations globally (and at the legal entity level) based on deterministic thresholds (e.g. materiality, corporate size, etc.)
  • Builds our capabilities in terms of people, processes, internal controls and systems (including the evaluation of reporting software workflows) to meet all mandatory ESG reporting requirements globally
  • Assists teams in building and/or optimizing data and process flows, ultimately implementing SOX-like controls across the end-to-end business processes from data sources through disclosures
  • Develops and operationalizes standardized policies and processes with regard to sustainability reporting (e.g., materiality assessments, disclosure controls and procedures, estimation approaches)
  • Coordinates limited and reasonable assurance over ESG disclosures, with external accounting firms, where required
  • Coordinates mandatory ESG-related reporting, in partnership with Finance, IR, Legal, Policy, Finance, Statutory, and subject matter experts (e.g. Sustainability for E, Inclusion for S, etc) across the globe to ensure we remain well coordinated and meet all of our regulatory reporting requirements
  • Supports and coordinates with teams managing our voluntary ESG reporting to ensure we’re working in a synergistic manner 
  • Builds and leads a global dream team that will support all ESG reporting and other activities
  • Trains key employee groups on reporting processes, controls, need/value of reporting. 
    • Minimum Qualifications:
  • 10+ years of experience in a combination of ESG reporting, accounting and financial reporting, internal controls, risk management, data management, or related fields.
  • Experience in working with ESG reporting standards and frameworks such as GRI, SASB, TCFD, etc;
  • Experience in building and improving well-controlled (SOX compliant) processes leveraging technology that scales globally;
  • Experience in building and leading high-performing and diverse global teams; 
  • Strong understanding of ESG issues and willingness to keep up-to-date with the latest ESG guidelines and developments;
  • Proven track record in managing multiple projects and consistently meeting deadlines;
  • Strong business acumen, communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills; 
  • High level of critical and logical thinking and comfort with ambiguity; 
  • Incredible attention to detail and ownership of business outcomes.
  • A Master's degree in Business, Accounting, Finance, or a related field is a plus; 
  • Big 4 experience and/or media & entertainment exposure are pluses;  
  • Relevant professional certifications such as CPA, CFA, Certified Sustainability Practitioner (CSP), Greenhouse Gas Management Institute diploma, or equivalent are a plus.
    • Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top-of-market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $310,000 - $830,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more details about our Benefits here. Netflix has a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here. We are an equal opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: Netflix is the preeminent home for best-in-class sports content. Behind it all sits Netflix’s Nonfiction Sports team: an organization of people who are passionate about creating elevated and captivating sports content and making it available to viewers around the globe. Netflix is seeking a Production Coordinator to support the Nonfiction Production and Post-production sports team. This position would focus on an increasing slate of nonfiction sports series from pre-production through delivery, working closely with third-party production companies, freelance crews, and our cross-functional teams within Netflix. The Role A successful candidate will be passionate about production, self-motivated, quick-thinking, flexible, team player, able to pivot when necessary, thorough, and able to juggle multiple and diverse responsibilities, with a strong emphasis on organization and unwavering attention to detail at all times. This is a demanding and fast-moving position that requires someone who is a proactive and positive thinker, and able to exercise good judgment and communication. Responsibilities: Work in tandem with production and post executives to onboard and support Nonfiction Sports productions at Netflix. Administrative responsibilities such as managing incoming and outgoing calls and messages, recording calls, setting meetings, updating schedules, taking notes, generating decks for presentations, preparing thorough agendas prior to meetings, and ensuing follow-ups as needed. Create and coordinate document distribution and production information workflow, schedules, and production resources, with emphasis on updating, maintaining, and championing the use of technology and databases. Audit all deliveries from productions throughout the entire length of development through final delivery. Track incoming cut deliveries and ratify against published schedules. Keeping a close eye on evolving technologies and determining how to incorporate them into production/post-workflows. ­In collaboration with inter­departmental Netflix production and post teams, develop and update production/post “best practices” and refine evolving film production guidelines to deliver to filmmakers Perform special project research for production executives as needed. Assist and curate a diverse contact database of top-performing nonfiction freelance staff, crew, and vendors. Any other duties as necessary to support the productions and the department. Qualifications: 3 + years of hands­-on production/post-management in nonfiction production. Candidates will likely be at the production coordinator level equivalent outside of Netflix. Ability to respond after hours for important, timely, or urgent matters. A high-performance team­player who operates efficiently and with empathy in a fast-paced team-oriented setting. Ability to be discreet and maintain confidential information. Understanding how to prioritize and respond accordingly in the best interest of the team. Willingness to continue learning to ensure understanding of current production/post processes. Strong understanding of traditional production/post schedules and paperwork. Strong written and verbal communication skills and the ability to multi­task. Proficiency in Microsoft Word, Microsoft Excel, Google Docs, Google Sheets, and Google Mail, and proficiency in Slack. Familiarity with Movie Magic Budgeting and Scheduling beneficial but not required. BA/BS Degree or equivalent experience. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $50,000 - $245,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with over 270 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. About API Federation and Developer Experience API Federation and Developer Experience builds the federated GraphQL infrastructure and productivity tools that power product APIs across Netflix. We help Netflix engineers build the GraphQL APIs that make their applications run: from enterprise applications used by our production studio to create, launch, and promote our global content, to the applications that stream that content to your television. We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive team to bring new perspectives as we solve the next set of challenges. In addition, we are open to remote candidates - we value what you can do, from anywhere in North America. Our Team’s Mission Our team’s mission is to provide an API development platform that is expressive, extensible, and reliable. We provide both the runtime and the developer productivity tools that enable Netflix engineers to ship innovative products quickly and with high confidence. Just as an API is a point of contact between client and server, our team seeks to foster connection and collaboration across Netflix through clear contracts and a rock-solid runtime. We strive to provide our customers with systems that are scalable, documented, observable, and easy to operate. About the Role We are looking for a talented Technical Support Engineer to help us onboard and support hundreds of internal engineering customers onto our Federated GraphQL ecosystem. This involves both proactive support of customers migrating to GraphQL, as well as on-call support during business hours, writing excellent documentation for our internal partners, and helping guide the team’s engineering priorities to increase customer joy and improve the developer ergonomics of our products. Concretely, this position will be about 50% support and enablement with our internal customers and 50% working on documentation, developer tooling, and other strategic investments to empower our customers and lower our hands-on support and enablement load. This role will require you to: Work with a large and diverse array of partners who depend on our products to build software every day. Dig into problems and troubleshoot collaboratively. Write excellent documentation (we believe that “it’s not done if it’s not documented”). Balance between the priorities of our home engineering team and the needs of our customers. Multitask while juggling a lot of context. What you’ll need to be successful: Strong knowledge of GraphQL (bonus points for Apollo Federation) Some combination of the following work experience: 3+ years of experience in second-line technical support for enterprise software products OR 3+ years in technical solutions engineering OR 3+ years of engineering developer-oriented products Excellent technical writing skills Debugging and troubleshooting skills A customer-oriented mindset Nice to have: Java and/or JVM ecosystem experience Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $100,000 - $720,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: At Netflix, we want to entertain the world and are constantly innovating how entertainment is imagined, created, and delivered to a global audience. We currently stream content in more than 30 languages in 190 countries, topping over 230 million paid subscribers. We have many workstreams at Netflix that require robust data, and data governance to help us manage operations.  In this role, you will be responsible for driving the strategy, construction, adoption, and governance of taxonomies that support the growing volume of core content data through dozens of applications and multiple workflows to support the lifecycle of content at Netflix. We are seeking a senior-level Taxonomy Strategist who has experience with and passion for bringing structure to large-scale, disparate databases and vocabularies. You will be responsible for scoping, creating, and maintaining data dictionaries, controlled vocabularies, schema governance, and data integrity/enforcement. Ideal Candidates: Collaborating with cross-functional partners, you are confident in making informed decisions. You possess the communication skills to successfully advocate for and gain acceptance of new taxonomy-related processes and governance policies. You have experience developing both product-facing and internal taxonomies for supply chains, operations, jobs, and vendors, preferably related to the entertainment industry. As a Taxonomy Strategist, you will work closely with multiple internal teams, including but not limited to Product, Design, Engineering, Content Data Management, and Data Science teams to define, develop, maintain, and govern related taxonomies. Reporting to the Product Metadata & Ratings Taxonomy & Governance Manager, this is an exempt role. Preferred location is Los Gatos or Los Angeles, but will consider US Remote, with some required travel to California. Responsibilities include: Defining new taxonomies and metadata related to the categorization, technical and creative attributes that will support the Netflix content pipeline. Reconciling disparate taxonomies and metadata across teams. Strategically evaluating the taxonomy and requests for new data for synergies with existing taxonomies wherever possible. Evaluation of adoption of industry taxonomies and associated mapping solutions. Surveying and interviewing stakeholders and observing current workflows (or, leveraging past and current discovery work to glean relevant insights). Working with subject matter experts to define workflows and standards for metadata application. Working closely with engineering partners to identify solution requirements, including tooling and intuitive UI for metadata application. Ensuring metadata is defined such that its integrity will not be compromised by cultural bias. Evangelizing the importance of the adoption of common taxonomies. Working with team experts to develop training materials and sessions. Creating and maintaining documentation to support taxonomies. Reviewing other taxonomies and collaborating with Taxonomy Team colleagues. Auditing existing taxonomies and improving their efficiency. Establishing, implementing, and/or updating maintenance and governance tracks for created taxonomies. Requirements: Deep experience with complex, interconnected taxonomies. Experience defining and developing new taxonomy and metadata schemas. Experience as a team member with software development cycles and practices. Experience working in a high-volume content environment. Experience working with systems shared across disparate internal teams. Experience establishing a governance system. Excellent communication skills: written, verbal, and presentation. Comfortable working with stakeholders, partners, and co-workers to create order out of vague and/or ambiguous requirements. Able to work with and manage multiple technical and non-technical stakeholders' expectations and priorities. Ability to influence across various function groups. Experience working in a global context, sensitive to regional requirements. Familiarity with legal compliance and the changing landscape of data regulations around the world. Ability to set goals and work independently in a highly cross-functional, non-hierarchical workplace. Nice to Have: Master's degree in related fields: Data Management, Computer Science, Library & Information Science. Merchandising, or marketing experience, particularly around campaign lifecycles. Experience working in the entertainment industry. Experience working with a global catalog, consumer-facing experiences, and creative content. Interest in Machine Learning and/or Artificial Intelligence capabilities. Interest in Information Architecture, User Experience, and/or Human-Computer Interaction. Experience with Multilingual Taxonomies. Familiarity with Ontologies and Graph Models. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $80,000 - $300,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: This is your chance to be at the forefront of Netflix’s new offering of Video Games. We will bring these new experiences to market through the world's leading streaming entertainment app with 208 million paid memberships in over 190 countries who are already enjoying TV series, documentaries, and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and now they can download and play mobile games anytime, anywhere with a collection of Netflix curated and produced Games. At Netflix, we have an insatiable need to continually improve our product experience and the creative elements that support it and this team sits at the forefront of the effort. Responsibilities: Take the lead as an external developer’s primary point of contact, working with developers in the creation of project and milestone schedules, submission planning, and overall development plans; provide ongoing management checks and balances throughout the full product life cycle. This role will manage external game development partners across multiple titles at once. Review and evaluate game builds and milestones across design, creative, development, and production progress. Work with Head of External Game Development and Executive Producers to ensure all projects are delivered on time, within budget, against the design scope, and aligned to broader portfolio and quality goals. Take a long-term view and ownership towards developing games with an eye toward sequels, localizations, and product line extensions. Maintain relationships with external leadership level development & publishing teams to ensure all production and publishing goals and concerns are met, cultivating relationships to effectively collaborate and problem solve. Help resolve unique, complex product issues through ingenuity, creativity, and any other means necessary to get the job done. Identify risks early and often and remove roadblocks and performance bottlenecks as needed. Inspire and empower the development teams that you will be working with, guide them through continuous improvement, and share learnings with the studio. Serve as internal product champion/evangelist by crafting and presenting product pitches in appropriate ways to specific and different audiences, providing visibility into milestones and challenges. Ensure that all teams have optimal product information to deliver games to market. Work cross-functionally to Create a healthy team culture that is communicative, transparent, motivated, committed, and focused on realistic goals. A strong knowledge of production, the difficulties generally encountered by teams, and solutions tailored to their requirements. Having significantly contributed to complex cross-functional projects with the successful delivery of quality, schedule, and balancing scope, capacity, budget, risk, and time. Experience managing a team of multiple developers (programmers, artists, animators, designers, testers). Licensed game experience is a plus. Strong project management skills - Fluent with Agile methodology. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. description: Join a groundbreaking initiative dedicated to utilizing cutting-edge technology to transform gaming genres and development methods, embracing innovation and pushing boundaries. We are dedicated to developing and shipping innovative games through a research and development (R&D) approach. This involves iterative prototyping, exploring emerging technologies, and crafting advanced game development pipelines. The Senior Gameplay Engineer will play a crucial role in developing game prototypes that integrate generative AI. Collaborating closely with data scientists, this role is pivotal in uniting machine learning with interactive gameplay. The position demands a blend of creative engineering and technical prowess, tackling diverse challenges to bring these prototypes to life. Responsibilities extend from coding exceptional gameplay features to integrating various game elements such as characters, animations, VFX, and UI—either independently or in collaboration with artists. The ideal candidate will possess a comprehensive understanding of game development and demonstrate the autonomy needed to deliver a compelling user experience focused on player engagement. Responsibilities: Prototype Development: Lead and actively participate in the rapid prototyping of new game concepts. Ensure effective utilization of AI technologies to elevate gameplay. Game Mechanics: Innovate and refine game mechanics through AI technologies and conventional game mechanics that make great games. Tool Development: Construct and maintain robust tools that empower other game developers to integrate AI functionalities within the game development pipeline. Technical Leadership: Provide mentorship within the gameplay engineering team, exemplifying high standards in code quality and engineering practices. Cross-functional Collaboration: Work alongside teams in design, art, and production to align gameplay systems with overarching project goals. Research and Innovation: Keep abreast of the latest trends in game development and generative AI. Explore new technologies and methods to enhance game development and player experiences. Creative Initiative: Thrive in an environment that encourages stepping out of one’s comfort zone to drive creative aspects of game experiments and development. Requirements: At least 5 years of experience as an engineer, with a history of shipping multiple AAA, casual, or mobile games. A profound understanding of game design, including mechanics, user interfaces, AI behavior, and game loops. Advanced skills in game programming languages such as C++, C#. Experience with major game engines, including Unity3D and Unreal Engine. Experience with backend development such as  REST server and AWS Versatility in various game development domains with a can-do attitude. Exceptional problem-solving skills; capable of innovative thinking in a fast-paced R&D environment. Strong communication skills; able to articulate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders. A passionate gamer with a preference for quick, focused game development projects over multi-year cycles. Location: Los Gatos, CA /Los Angeles, CA - Preferred: Remote: United States or Canada will be considered. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top-of-market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $100,000 - $500,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix has a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: Netflix is revolutionizing entertainment. We connect people with movies and television globally by delivering outstanding content and technological innovation. Infrastructure Engineering provides the backbone for Netflix products (SVOD, Live, Games, etc.) by building and operating an efficient, scalable, secure, and easy-to-use development platform and content delivery network. Join us as we push the boundaries of scale, performance, and resilience, empowering developers to create groundbreaking applications on a reliable platform. Our Technical Program Management (TPM) team is chartered with driving Infrastructure Engineering’s most challenging and cross-functional initiatives. Our TPMs are technically adept and partner directly with product and engineering functions to align and mobilize teams to deliver high impact business outcomes. The team has grown organically over the last few years and we are looking for an experienced leader to coach, mentor, and grow our TPMs, while also shaping the vision and strategy of the TPM function. We are seeking a Director of TPM to drive the evolution of the TPM function within Infrastructure Engineering. You will lead our TPM team's overall vision and strategy, which is focused on establishing the right-sized practices and rituals for the organization and the TPM team to create operational excellence within the organization and across Engineering. Your contributions will directly shape how Infrastructure Engineering operates and delivers the critical platforms and products needed for the Netflix Engineering community. Responsibilities Lead, grow, and mentor a team of Staff+ Technical Program Managers building an environment of teamwork, trust, and mutual success Deeply understand business and technical strategy to proactively identify high-impact programs Develop KPIs to measure the effectiveness of programs and establish frameworks using program management principles that foster high-quality, metrics-driven program delivery Partner with product and engineering teams to drive alignment, prioritization, and critical decision-making with internal partners and stakeholders Navigate diverse stakeholder groups, forming and sustaining trusted relationships Work directly with Engineering and Product leadership to define and shape the execution strategy for our critical bets Define and manage the operating rhythms for the Engineering org - planning, program management, partnership syncs, etc. Influence leaders and teams to effect change across Netflix Engineering Be a catalyst for change within Infrastructure Engineering Requirements 15+ Years of experience in managing engineering or TPM teams and designing large-scale or complex technical initiatives on shared infrastructure platforms 5+ Years in building and improving common platforms including AWS cloud products, CI/CD tooling (Github, Circle CI, JFrog, EKS), messaging (Kafka), and storage (Redis, Cassandra, Aurora, MySQL) Experience leading and mentoring TPMs Flexible, agile, and fast learner Excellent cross-group collaboration, outstanding verbal and written communication Someone looking to make a large impact in their next role What Sets You Apart Self-starter who enjoys quickly bringing organization and direction Exemplify the Netflix culture by understanding, advocating, and demonstrating its values Able to identify gaps in solutions and weigh in on product vs. technology tradeoffs Deep understanding of cloud infrastructure, especially microservice or distributed systems architecture Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $310k-$1.8M. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with 270 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. In the Europe, Middle East, and Africa (EMEA) region, Netflix is headquartered in Amsterdam The Public Policy team at Netflix proactively manages the company's relationship with policy makers and advises the company on regulatory matters. The team engages with governments and key stakeholders on a variety of issues and initiatives that materially impact our business and our members, with the goal of setting Netflix up for success and growth around the world. We are looking for a talented EU Audiovisual (AV) Compliance Coordinator to join our EMEA Public Policy team and support compliance and regulatory matters connected to the Audiovisual Media Services Directive (AVMSD) such as reporting on compliance with national financial obligations. The position is based in Amsterdam and reports to the Senior Director of EU Public Policy. The successful candidate will have broad responsibility for tracking and assisting with the details of the company’s AVMSD compliance strategy, and will be self-motivated, quick-thinking, flexible and able to juggle multiple responsibilities with a strong emphasis on organization and an unwavering attention to detail. About the job Preparing AVMSD compliance submissions by sourcing input from all relevant teams across the legal, content, and finance departments. Overseeing the calendar of all AVMSD compliance deadlines and tasks with a view to ensuring timely completion. Effective understanding of legal documents to ensure accurate reporting. Identifying and proactively bringing up issues and business developments impacting compliance with existing obligations to the relevant teams. Organizing, logging, and maintaining accurate data regarding AVMSD compliance submissions. Providing broader research, analysis, and drafting support to the EMEA Public Policy team where needed. Requirements Hold at least a Bachelor or preferably a Master degree in Law, Business, or a related field. Have 3+ years experience and a demonstrated track record in the field of regulatory compliance, law, business consulting. Work experience in the space of media regulation or data analytics are positively valued. High level of organization, detail orientation, ability to time-manage across multiple deadlines and a mindset that processes can always be improved; strong critical thinking and operational skills. Team-player who thrives in a fast paced, team-oriented setting Flexibility and willingness to provide support on a broad range of regulatory matters, including outside the area of expertise. Tech­-savvy individual, quick to adapt to new or changing systems, with proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel and  Google Suite. Understand, advocate, and embody the Netflix culture and team goals. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.
