description: It’s an amazing time to be joining Netflix as we continue to transform entertainment globally. Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with over 270 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films, and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. The Opportunity The Social Marketing team at Netflix is constantly in tune with conversations among our consumers; we're not just listening, but also participating in and initiating engaging, humorous, and thrilling discussions with fans across various external platforms. Although we are part of the broader marketing organization, our primary role is to foster affection for both the brand and our titles by keeping Netflix members entertained even when they are not streaming. We are currently seeking a Title Social Manager who possesses a strong background in social marketing and a genuine passion for content and entertainment. As a part of the social marketing team, this individual will oversee title-specific social marketing campaigns, from developing an integrated strategy for each title to executing these campaigns, aiming to maximize viewership by sparking social conversation around our titles. Key responsibilities: Generate positive and impactful conversations around the title and cultivate a fandom for both the title and Netflix. Develop a holistic social marketing strategy for the title and execute the entire campaign - planning, execution, and measurement - based on title prioritization. Lead the creation of the complete package of title social marketing assets, which includes social editorials, talent shoots, bespoke content, and more. Develop new and innovative social stunts, ranging from single content format to globally scaled campaigns, that will create impact and generate buzz among social audiences. Work alongside the social channel manager to develop a cutting-edge social media campaign strategy, based on a comprehensive understanding of social platforms and audiences. Develop the paid social strategy for unscripted series under the overarching social marketing strategy for the title in collaboration with the agencies. Lead export title social strategy for global audience  by collaborating with global social teams to enhance the presence of Korean titles within Netflix's social ecosystem. Collaborate with internal stakeholders, including the Film and Series marketing, PR, and event teams, to develop a holistic campaign strategy. Communicate with external stakeholders including showrunners, business partners, and agencies. Qualifications: Has a minimum of 10+ years of experience in the social, digital marketing team in agencies, start-up and CPG brands preferably entertainment and content industries. Has a proven track record in social marketing, including upscale digital campaigns that successfully create meaningful conversations both online and offline. Has a deep understanding of social platforms and experience in overall social marketing including community building, fan engaging campaign, influencer collaboration, social assets creation and paid social campaigns. Has an understanding of a comprehensive marketing strategy that encompasses all marketing communication functions, including PR, advertising, social, events, and more. A team player capable of engaging and collaborating with internal teams at Netflix. Strong communication skills are essential, along with experience in managing needs and requirements from multiple stakeholders. Thrives in a fast-paced culture with a high tolerance for change and the ability to accomplish substantial amounts of work within tight timelines. Above all, must have an in-depth love and passion for entertainment and Netflix. Respect and understanding of Netflix culture. Fluency in both English and Korean is required. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. Seoul, South Korea Marketing and Communications Editorial and Publishing Title Social Manager, Social Marketing - Korea It’s an amazing time to be joining Netflix as we continue to transform entertainment globally. Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with over 270 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films, and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. The Opportunity  The Social Marketing team at Netflix is constantly in tune with conversations among our consumers; we're not just listening, but also participating in and initiating engaging, humorous, and thrilling discussions with fans across various external platforms. Although we are part of the broader marketing organization, our primary role is to foster affection for both the brand and our titles by keeping Netflix members entertained even when they are not streaming. We are currently seeking a Title Social Manager who possesses a strong background in social marketing and a genuine passion for content and entertainment. As a part of the social marketing team, this individual will oversee title-specific social marketing campaigns, from developing an integrated strategy for each title to executing these campaigns, aiming to maximize viewership by sparking social conversation around our titles. Key responsibilities:
  • Generate positive and impactful conversations around the title and cultivate a fandom for both the title and Netflix.
  • Develop a holistic social marketing strategy for the title and execute the entire campaign - planning, execution, and measurement - based on title prioritization.
  • Lead the creation of the complete package of title social marketing assets, which includes social editorials, talent shoots, bespoke content, and more.
  • Develop new and innovative social stunts, ranging from single content format to globally scaled campaigns, that will create impact and generate buzz among social audiences.
  • Work alongside the social channel manager to develop a cutting-edge social media campaign strategy, based on a comprehensive understanding of social platforms and audiences.
  • Develop the paid social strategy for unscripted series under the overarching social marketing strategy for the title in collaboration with the agencies.
  • Lead export title social strategy for global audience  by collaborating with global social teams to enhance the presence of Korean titles within Netflix's social ecosystem.
  • Collaborate with internal stakeholders, including the Film and Series marketing, PR, and event teams, to develop a holistic campaign strategy.
  • Communicate with external stakeholders including showrunners, business partners, and agencies.
    • Qualifications:
  • Has a minimum of 10+ years of experience in the social, digital marketing team in agencies, start-up and CPG brands preferably entertainment and content industries. 
  • Has a proven track record in social marketing, including upscale digital campaigns that successfully create meaningful conversations both online and offline.
  • Has a deep understanding of social platforms and experience in overall social marketing including community building, fan engaging campaign, influencer collaboration, social assets creation and paid social campaigns.
  • Has an understanding of a comprehensive marketing strategy that encompasses all marketing communication functions, including PR, advertising, social, events, and more.
  • A team player capable of engaging and collaborating with internal teams at Netflix.
  • Strong communication skills are essential, along with experience in managing needs and requirements from multiple stakeholders.
  • Thrives in a fast-paced culture with a high tolerance for change and the ability to accomplish substantial amounts of work within tight timelines.
  • Above all, must have an in-depth love and passion for entertainment and Netflix.
  • Respect and understanding of Netflix culture.
  • Fluency in both English and Korean is required.
    • We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. description: About Netflix: Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries, enjoying TV series, documentaries, and feature films across various genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any Internet-connected screen. Members can play, pause, and resume watching, all without commercials or commitments. Recently, Netflix has expanded its entertainment offering to include Live content, like The Roast of Tom Brady Comedy Special, the SAG Awards ceremony, and The Netflix Slam tennis match. Our scope will grow to include premium live entertainment with partners like WWE and the NFL in 2025. Join us as we push the boundaries of scale, performance, resilience, and user experience to drive the future of Live Streaming. The Role: You will work closely with Live Engineering teams across broadcast, encoding, content delivery, device playback, recommendations and discovery, UI, content management, and security to ensure the effective execution of our Live program. We are looking for an experienced technical program manager with Live Streaming experience who can partner closely with engineering managers, engineers, product managers, and other technical program managers to execute complex technical programs. If you’re looking for a technical and highly dynamic opportunity that will outsize the future of software engineering at Netflix, we’d love to talk to you! What you will do Build and manage the roadmap in collaboration with technical teams (including Engineering, Product Operations, Data Science, etc.) that work on building and scaling Netflix's Live offering. Leverage deep knowledge and functional expertise to drive road mapping, execution planning, and cross-functional alignment across multiple stakeholder groups. Craft and drive engagement with partners, work with multiple engineering teams to decompose requirements into technical execution plans, track progress towards goals, and report status to product, customers, and technical leadership. Collaborate with technical leads to break down annual goals into measurable milestones while proactively managing risks, blockers, and delays. Manage cross-functional dependencies, risks, and changes effectively by optimizing scope, schedule, and resources. Proactively communicate the progress of the programs and technical investments up/down/across the Engineering organization. What we are looking for // Skills: You understand broadcast technology, encoding, and media delivery well. You are highly skilled, experienced, and enjoy orchestrating programs with many moving parts - people, needs, and technologies. You can identify gaps in solutions, debate technical approaches, and weigh in on product vs technology tradeoffs. You aren’t afraid to get your hands dirty, pulling data to provide insight, debug issues, and monitor system health. You have a data-driven mindset in your decision-making. You have a deep understanding and point of view within your technical domain(s) of expertise. What we are looking for // Qualifications: 10+ years of experience driving large-scale SW projects, with deep knowledge of on-demand and or/ live streaming systems. Experience managing projects across cross-functional teams, building sustainable processes, and coordinating release schedules. Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including clear articulations of business impact and technical constraints tailored to the audience. Self-starter who enjoys tackling 0 to 1 problem spaces and quickly bringing organization and direction. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $230,000 - $960,000 Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services, with 270 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films, and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause, and resume watching as much as they want, anytime , anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. The Role We’re on the hunt for a passionate and talented Senior Tax Analyst for India with a strong tax background who would be part of the tax team located in Mumbai, reporting to India's Head of Tax. As our India operations are growing and expanding rapidly, this person will gain excellent learning opportunities and exposure through working on exciting projects with Direct and Indirect tax impact.  This person will be working closely with internal stakeholders as well as external tax service providers to evaluate and implement tax compliance requirements, support on tax assessments/litigations and impact on business operations both from a direct and indirect tax perspective. The core tax responsibilities include:- Tax compliance: Assist with all direct tax compliances including corporate income tax, withholding tax compliances, etc. Assist with all indirect tax compliances i.e. GST filings, GST audits / annual returns, etc. Tracking and reporting of taxes Work closely with Accounting / Finance teams, ensuring all India specific compliance and tax accounting requirements are met Month-end tax accounting close: Creating journal entries, monitoring tax accounts positions, performing tax account reconciliations, etc. Tax Assessment / Litigation: Handle tax assessments / queries raised by tax department Preparations of various letters / response to notices,  appeal and other documents for submission to tax department Doing research on tax issues and prepare technical documentation Work closely with the finance team and external service providers Business advisory: Provide support to cross-functional teams (legal, finance, treasury, etc.) on direct and indirect tax for various projects and queries Research complex direct & indirect tax issues and prepare technical documentation Assist in reviewing contracts to ensure key tax deal terms are consistent with our structure and positions Monitor changes to tax laws and regulations Relevant experience in the areas mentioned will be key when applying for the role. Candidate Profile The ability to adapt to the Netflix culture and values A great communicator who can build strong working relationships with internal teams and external advisors A self-starter, who is able to work effectively, and autonomously and drive projects and process improvements under tight time frames in a fast-paced environment Accustomed to multitasking, prioritizing and meeting multiple tight deadlines Proactive, hands-on, and innovative Curious and enthusiastic, not afraid to ask questions and challenge the status quo Highly accurate and detail-oriented Flexible to collaborate with our International offices across multiple time zones Willing to travel to our offices overseas Strong oral and written communication skills and the ability to effectively interact cross-functionally and with external advisors Requirements Chartered Accountant with 8 to 10 years of direct and indirect tax experience in a Big4 and/or a corporate environment (preferably at a tech or entertainment company) Solid understanding of direct and indirect tax concepts and experience in handling audits / litigations Experience working on tax accounting and other tax reporting requirements Proven project management experience and demonstrated ability to drive process improvements Advanced MS office and Google Workspace experience with the ability to navigate large data sets Experience with Workday Financials or other cloud based ERP systems is a plus We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

description: Who We Are Next Games, a Netflix Game Studio, is a Helsinki-based studio dedicated to crafting fans-first interactive experiences that combine the stories from popular movies and shows with engaging game mechanics. Our values, Caring, Courage, and Curiosity, drive our commitment to our players and each other, with a focus on fun gameplay free from the constraints of free-to-play. We don't seek culture fit, but rather the unique contributions each individual brings to enrich our culture. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status. We're eager to hear from you if you're passionate about creating innovative mobile games in a fun, supportive environment! The Role As a Designer at NextGames, you'll be instrumental in delivering on the game's vision, translating concepts into captivating and highly engaging designs. Your proactive approach will drive innovation, ensuring fresh and compelling gameplay experiences while taking ownership of key design elements and providing leadership within the team. Mentoring junior designers will be integral as you foster craft excellence and a culture of continuous improvement, ensuring accessibility in both gameplay and design processes and creating an inclusive and immersive experience for all players. Responsibilities Collaborating closely with the Lead Designer ensures the game vision achieves its fullest potential. Leading and mentoring fellow designers and team members, drawing on your expertise. Designing, planning, and implementing game mechanics, systems, and content. Fine-tune features using live game metrics and user experience testing. Collaborating with experienced colleagues on economy design, user experience, and other disciplines to enhance the game's performance based on key performance indicators. Develop comprehensive design documentation covering gameplay mechanics, guidelines, game loops, and player progression. Create concepts and prototypes, actively participating in planning and analyzing tests. Skills and Experience Ideally 5+ years of commercial experience with a successful track record shipping two or more free-to-play titles in a Design role for mobile F2P games. Experience in live game operations is valuable, the paramount advantage lies in the ability to craft games entirely from scratch Experience building Logic Puzzle/Systems Strong passion for games and excellent analytical and communication skills. Understanding player motivations and audience profiles and the ability to align these with mechanics and systems. Experience working with external partners and curating design work Preferred Skills and Experience Experience in designing cooperative and/or competitive social game mechanics in mobile games The Team You’ll be joining a new game team with people from different backgrounds. We seek a candidate who works primarily from our Helsinki office alongside the game lead and lead designer. We value transparent communication, proactive problem-solving, and an enthusiasm for crafting accessible experiences. Does this opportunity sound like your next adventure? Then apply today!! We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

description: Now is an amazing time to join Netflix as we seek to entertain the world. We have over 260 million paid members in over 190 countries, and we won’t stop there. Games are our next big frontier and an incredible opportunity for us to deliver new experiences to delight and entertain our quickly growing membership. You will be jumping in at the early stages of this adventure and be in a position to help us redefine what a Netflix subscription means for our members around the world. Data Science and Engineering (‘DSE’) at Netflix is aimed at using data, analytics, and sciences to improve various aspects of our business. We are looking for a Senior Analytics Engineer to join our Games DSE team, leading end-to-end analytics & data needs for the Games space. This role will be partnering closely with our stakeholders from Game Studios, product and engineering to do advanced analytics and define key metrics, build and maintain key analytic tools and provide data driven insights to our stakeholder set. As an early member of the team, you will also help shape our overall Games Data Strategy at Netflix. What You Will Do: Partner directly with our Game stakeholders (e.g., Netflix Games Studio, Games Product, Game Strategy, Planning & Analysis team) on data, metrics & analytics initiatives Lead end-to-end development of reports/dashboards/tools used by your direct stakeholders and a diverse set of teams across the company Proactively perform data exploration and analytical deep dives to discover insights or future opportunities Be a bridge between the business and tech, scaling access to insights that can empower better decision-making Drive the direction and execution of your work, which span from developing scrappy analytic tools to designing scalable analytic systems Balance handling engineering efforts, analytical deep dives and building analytic products Who You Are: 5+ years of experience in leveraging technical skills in manipulating large data sets with complex SQL and Python (or similar languages), big data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark) and visualization tools (e.g., Tableau) Exceptional communication and collaboration skills coupled with strong business acumen Comfortable with ambiguity; able to take ownership, and thrive with minimal oversight and process You are experienced in managing stakeholder asks, expectations, and relationships across a variety of stakeholders Experience in the Gaming industry preferred Netflix culture resonates with you Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. search_text:
Los Gatos, California Products & Technology Data Science and Engineering Senior Analytics Engineer, (L5) Games Now is an amazing time to join Netflix as we seek to entertain the world. We have over 260 million paid members in over 190 countries, and we won’t stop there. Games are our next big frontier and an incredible opportunity for us to deliver new experiences to delight and entertain our quickly growing membership. You will be jumping in at the early stages of this adventure and be in a position to help us redefine what a Netflix subscription means for our members around the world. Data Science and Engineering (‘DSE’) at Netflix is aimed at using data, analytics, and sciences to improve various aspects of our business. We are looking for a Senior Analytics Engineer to join our Games DSE team, leading end-to-end analytics & data needs for the Games space. This role will be partnering closely with our stakeholders from Game Studios, product and engineering to do advanced analytics and define key metrics, build and maintain key analytic tools and provide data driven insights to our stakeholder set. As an early member of the team, you will also help shape our overall Games Data Strategy at Netflix.    What You Will Do:
  • Partner directly with our Game stakeholders (e.g., Netflix Games Studio, Games Product, Game Strategy, Planning & Analysis team) on data, metrics & analytics initiatives
  • Lead end-to-end development of reports/dashboards/tools used by your direct stakeholders and a diverse set of teams across the company
  • Proactively perform data exploration and analytical deep dives to discover insights or future opportunities
  • Be a bridge between the business and tech, scaling access to insights that can empower better decision-making
  • Drive the direction and execution of your work, which span from developing scrappy analytic tools to designing scalable analytic systems
  • Balance handling engineering efforts, analytical deep dives and building analytic products
    • Who You Are:
  • 5+ years of experience in leveraging technical skills in manipulating large data sets with complex SQL and Python (or similar languages), big data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark) and visualization tools (e.g., Tableau)
  • Exceptional communication and collaboration skills coupled with strong business acumen
  • Comfortable with ambiguity; able to take ownership, and thrive with minimal oversight and process
  • You are experienced in managing stakeholder asks, expectations, and relationships across a variety of stakeholders
  • Experience in the Gaming industry preferred
  • Netflix culture resonates with you

description: Netflix is revolutionizing entertainment by producing, distributing, and streaming content at a massive scale. Over 260 million members around the globe are currently enjoying more than two billion hours per month of original series, documentaries, and feature films. Visit our long-term view to learn more. The Team The Privacy and Data Protection Engineering team ensures safe & efficient data use across Netflix. We work closely with our stunning colleagues in Legal to provide privacy engineering guidance, support, and assurance throughout the company. We are a growing team with tremendous visibility and impact, and with Netflix’s culture of “Freedom and Responsibility,” you’ll decide how to best use your talents and time. The Role We are looking for a Privacy Engineer to join our Data Protection team with an exciting mission of protecting all data at Netflix! You will work closely with security and privacy engineers, software and data engineers, product managers, and legal, product, and engineering leadership to design, develop, and maintain effective data handling guidelines and policies. In this role, you’ll set technical direction, create strategies and plans, develop great technical documentation, and facilitate alignment across cross-functional teams to ensure our guidance, tooling, and practices are driving tangible data privacy improvements both in the management of personal information and accountability of our privacy program. This role will have a significant impact ranging from protecting data at a massive scale to how Netflix engineers use data and data tools in their daily work. This role offers a chance to make a real impact in Entertaining the World . If you're up for the challenge, we'd love to hear from you! Desired Background: You’re passionate about privacy and data protection! You have the expertise to develop scalable and pragmatic controls related to data collection, storage, access, usage, and deletion in data warehouse environments and/or operational data systems. You can advise on what Privacy Enhancing Technologies to use and explain why they make a difference. You are familiar with data cataloging and classification approaches and best practices at scale. You utilize a variety of communication and collaboration tools and methods to facilitate effective alignment with cross-functional stakeholders, including legal. You have prior experience in software development, large-scale distributed systems, or data engineering technologies (Hive, Presto, Spark). Stunning colleagues come from different education levels and backgrounds. The Netflix culture determines who we hire, how we work together and how we make decisions. You will be surrounded by a great team and empowered to produce your best work. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $100,000 - $720,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services, with 270 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume as much as they want, anytime, anywhere and can change their plans at any time. Netflix Sustainability serves to tackle our carbon footprint at the speed prescribed by climate science, raise awareness through our film and television content, and engage our millions of members on climate & environmental change. See more at sustainability.netflix.com . The Opportunity Leveraging Netflix’s innovative and fast-paced culture, help Netflix attain its public climate targets and engage our members on climate & environmental change. Responsibilities Reporting into the Sustainability & Operations workstream of Netflix Sustainability, bring key quantitative and qualitative expertise and experience in the following areas: Renewable Electricity: Support Netflix Sustainability in evaluating larger-scale on-and off-site renewable energy investment opportunities such as Virtual Power Purchase Agreements (VPPAs) and Tax Equity Investments, including emissions analysis and - with Finance - project-level economics. Liaison with vendor and project developers Support Real Estate and Internal/External Events teams interested in the procurement of renewable energy at the site level where possible. Work with utility and landlord partners to secure renewable energy supply agreements. Structure and lead competitive procurements (RFIs/RFPs) for Environmental Attribute Certificates (e.g. RECs, GOs, SAFc) Renewable Fuels: Support Netflix Sustainability, Aviation, Internal & External Events and other corporate teams interested in the procurement of renewable fuels (e.g. SAF, RNG, etc) Energy Efficiency: As needed, support the real estate teams in implementing cost-saving energy efficiency projects already identified or to-be-identified Preferred Qualifications 5+ years with corporate renewable energy procurement and related markets Experience in portfolio management of renewable energy investments, including direct sourcing, utility-based supply programs to bundled and unbundled credits Experience in energy management for internal or external events Knowledge of corporate GHG accounting a plus Location: North America, remoteOur compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $160,000 - $360,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. See more at sustainability.netflix.com . The Opportunity Leveraging Netflix’s innovative and fast paced culture, help Netflix attain its public climate target to reduce our emissions by roughly half by 2030; and to spur change across the value chain (see our quantitative Scope 3 target  in our ESG report ). Responsibilities Reporting into the Sustainability & Operations workstream of Netflix Sustainability, bring key quantitative and qualitative expertise for: Support Scope 3 emissions reductions strategy and initiative implementation - Corporate and film/TV production supply chain engagement, including internal and external stakeholders, to drive emissions reductions in material Scope 3 subcategories - Represent Netflix in Scope 3 industry/academic/NGO collaborative groups - Ensure the company's procurement activities align with leadership practices - Help to maintain up-to-date industry knowledge regarding Scope 3 carbon accounting best practices, including insetting (within-value chain EACs) Support carbon accounting and forecasting for Scope 3 emissions - Establish supplier-specific emissions factors from value chain partners by enhancing data collection from inside and outside of the business - Quantify the relative emissions benefits of hosting digital services (e.g. VFX and Virtual Production) at different vendor types, and in comparison to traditional techniques - Maintain and adapt key input data sources to the Scope 3 annual carbon footprint process, and support with Scope 3 GHG accounting - Maintain data on how Scope 3 emissions are changing year over year, including tracking against Netflix’s public targetsMaintain a quantitative forecast model for Scope 3 emissions across the business Preferred Qualifications 5+ years of experience with Scope 3 related sustainability initiatives 3+ years with carbon footprinting and forecasting Strong quantitative and analytical skills required, including modeling and forecasting Experience collaborating with industry coalitions, research groups, policymakers, vendors, 3rd party certifiers, etc. Proven experience with the best 3rd party standards for product and supply chain carbon footprinting Management and/or strategy consulting experience a plus Life cycle assessment (LCA)  knowledge a plus Comfortable working in fast-paced, dynamic environments, with an ability to structure and have ownership of your work Location: North America, remoteOur compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. description: Netflix is changing the way more than 270 million subscribers around the world enjoy entertainment. As a company, we challenge industry norms by pushing one another to think creatively about complex questions. Our legal team is no exception. We think critically about the range of legal issues our business faces and act consistent with our freedom and responsibility culture, one marked by a bias toward action, collaborative work, and candid discussions by leaning into smart risks and taking ownership of bold decisions. Our culture is unique, and we live by our values, so we encourage learning more about Netflix at https://jobs.netflix.com/culture The opportunity We are looking for a seasoned legal Specialist to be part of a team of lawyers and legal professionals responsible for handling a challenging docket of consumer claims and supporting the global consumer dispute resolution program. Consumer Claims include but are not limited to claims filed at consumer organizations, consumer protection agencies, low-risk litigation matters, attorney letters, and escalated consumer inquiries. The ideal candidate has a “hands-on” attitude, demonstrates strong judgment, and believes that disputes are opportunities to learn and grow. Though part of the Legal Team, being an attorney is not a requirement for this role. This position is based in Amsterdam. Responsibilities: Handle all phases of consumer claims, including management of service, validation of documents, indexing of information, investigation of claims, information gathering, and drafting responses. While reviewing the claims, proactively utilize customer service tools and other internal resources necessary to investigate them. Create, maintain, and update internal documentation, including policies, playbooks, summaries of legal research, etc. Organize, log, and maintain accurate data regarding the volume and types of consumer claims for reporting purposes, and to drive product and customer experience improvements. Partner with cross-functional internal stakeholders such as customer service, public policy, marketing, and product counsels to enhance strategy and provide insights to the business. Handle various types of legally sensitive matters (i.e., bankruptcy notices, guardianship requests, etc) Collaborate in the implementation and maintenance of legal compliance programs (i.e., Dawn Raid) Requirements: 5+ years of experience in legal operations in a law firm and/or legal in-house team. Fluency in English is required. Fluency in Spanish is desirable. Excellent written and verbal communication skills (succinct and clear), including an ability to explain complex information clearly and effectively to different audiences. Ability to work proactively, independently, and reliably with little guidance. Analytical and investigative skills, with attention to detail and the ability to think strategically, but also to use good judgment to build scalable processes and escalate matters that require urgent attention. Flexibility and willingness to provide administrative support on a broad range of legal matters. Ability to be flexible in a fast-paced environment with limited direction, balance competing priorities, and manage several time-sensitive projects at once. Program Management experience supporting regulatory and compliance initiatives. Solution-driven mindset and the ability to think practically, looking for innovative solutions that can scale. Ability to work effectively and collaboratively cross-functionally Experience with Consumer Claims or Legal Operations (nice to have). We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

description: It’s an amazing time to be joining Netflix as we continue to transform entertainment. We deliver billions of hours of movies and TV shows per month to more than 220 million members in over 190 countries. At Netflix, we want to entertain the world. To achieve this, we must be able to rapidly build and ship innovative experiences for our members and creators all around the globe. Within the Platform Engineering organization, our Data Platform exists to maximize the value of data throughout Netflix by improving the productivity and innovation of Netflix engineers, data scientists, machine learning practitioners, and business users. Our Data Platform enables Netflix to scale effectively and evolve rapidly by providing highly performant, secure, compliant, and flexible data infrastructure that supports the expanding needs of the business. Ultimately, we aim to democratize data by making it more accessible and useful to technical and non-technical employees. The Opportunity We are looking for a principal technical product manager to help drive the next evolution of our analytics experience at Netflix. Your mission is to simplify and accelerate data experience at Netflix and offer best-in-class experiences to Netflix software engineers, data engineers, analytics engineers, data scientists, machine learning practitioners, and business users. Your focus will be on the end-to-end experience for our users who need to leverage our analytics platform to accomplish their work. You will lead the vision and strategy for our data development experience, remote analytics environments, Notebooks, data visualization, and business intelligence tools leveraged by technical and non-technical talent at Netflix for business-critical work. Examples of the types of opportunities you might tackle include developing a seamless end-to-end managed ETL platform to reduce friction and toil for our users, enabling semantic modeling at scale to improve self-service data analytics for multiple Netflix businesses, and integrating the data analytics platform with machine learning workflows. The scope and impact of this role is significant. You'll be responsible for managing a portfolio of products and driving holistic product strategy and prioritization across them. If you’re looking for a deeply technical and highly dynamic opportunity that will have an outsized impact on the future of data platform at Netflix, we’d love to talk to you! What You Will Do Deeply understand customer needs, product analytics, and industry innovation to drive the product vision and strategy, maximizing business and customer impact. Partner closely with senior management and engineering teams to define and align with stakeholders on vision, strategy, and roadmaps. Develop product roadmaps in partnership with relevant product and engineering teams that execute on product vision and strategy and inform our engineering teams of what problems need to be solved. Foster a metrics-driven environment that encourages quality experimentation and sets high standards for measuring product success. Stay informed about industry advancements, influence their direction, and conduct comprehensive buy vs. build analysis to align with state-of-the-art solutions, encouraging ROI-based decisions. Foster a collaborative environment with Netflix engineers, creating continuous feedback loops to ensure we solve the right problems and drive maximum impact for Netflix. Exhibit robust problem-solving and decision-making skills, tackling technical and strategic challenges in innovative ways and leveraging data and intuition to make strategic choices in the face of ambiguity and complexity. Ensure thoughtful product evolution that addresses product lifecycle and adoption experience. Help evolve our customer engagement model, communication strategy, prioritization, and planning/road-mapping practices. What We’re Looking For 8+ years of experience as a Technical Product Manager with at least 3+ years of domain experience in data analytics platforms, data analytics experience, or ML platforms. Proven track record of managing and evolving a product portfolio and/or driving product vision and strategy A healthy blend of technical depth and deep domain expertise with a customer-focused mindset Demonstrated passion and experience in one or more of the following technologies: Compute engines (Spark, Trino), ETL Platforms, Notebooks and BI Tools Strategic thinker who can connect customer use cases to technology solutions and think holistically about the end-to-end experience Ability to manage a portfolio of bigger and smaller bets while balancing short-term goals and long-term vision Comfortable applying a combination of qualitative and quantitative methods to define success Leverages product intuition and judgment to solve problems and make decisions without perfect information Insatiable curiosity to learn new domains, keep up with industry innovation, and constantly ask ‘why’ Excellent communication skills; timely communication with clear expectations We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. Within the Platform Engineering organization, our Data Platform exists to maximize the value of data throughout Netflix by improving the productivity and innovation of Netflix engineers, data scientists, machine learning practitioners, and business users. Our Data Platform enables Netflix to scale effectively and evolve rapidly by providing highly performant, secure, compliant, and flexible data infrastructure that supports the expanding needs of the business. Ultimately, we aim to democratize data by making it more accessible and useful to technical and non-technical employees. The Opportunity We are looking for a principal technical product manager to help drive the next evolution of our analytics experience at Netflix. description: Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with over 265 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any internet-connected screen. Members can play, pause and resume watching, all without adverts or commitments. | Role As an N-Tech: Technology Experience Specialist (TES) - Animation, you will manage and maintain technology services on-site at Netflix Animation Studios. This position will partner with our remote Netflix Support team and act as an escalation point for various applications, services and technologies. You will be responsible for building in-depth knowledge of Netflix technologies and integrations across the ecosystem. For service efficiency, this role will also partner with Managed Service Providers to ensure on-site support scales to meet the needs of the workforce. | Your Responsibilities: Provide day-to-day support to onsite users by serving as a primary point of contact for users seeking technical assistance. Responsible for learning how users experience technology through investigation, documentation, and categorization of interactions with a focus on trends and contact reasoning. Prioritize managing technical issues, triage/research bugs, be a part of incident/outage management workflows, escalate issues to appropriate partner groups, and develop/maintain robust documentation to create a positive knowledge base experience. Recognize and connect patterns in how users experience technology across 1st and 3rd party technologies by composing bug reports when needed. Recommend and/or implement experience improvements, potentially direct on-site Managed Service Providers (MSPs), make feature requests, bring to attention opportunities to create self-service solutions, as well as productivity enhancements. Identify and link ZenDesk tickets that show a pattern of behavior/user friction, curate the stories of the patterns, and maintain the health of the User Experience Jira space. Ensure that user interactions are at the highest quality technical support level while engaging in our organization's strategy to learn from user experience. Engage and work with our global team as part of an overall user journey experience team, gathering important information, data, and context to bridge the user experience with partner teams, using compassionate and thoughtful feedback/ideas. Leverage metrics and reporting to identify trends within the environment and collaborate with cross-functional partners to proactively identify issues before they arise. Contribute to an inspiring, empowering, collaborative, and supportive team environment, leading by example and flexing to roll up your sleeves and support the team as needed. Actively participate and contribute to efforts designed to improve how users experience both technology and support at Netflix. Ensure the quality of support through review, feedback, and coaching. Flexibility in working hours to help meet the needs of the business. Live the Netflix Culture. | Your Skills & Experience: 4+ years experience providing support in a fast-paced studio environment, working alongside talent, technical teams, vendors, contractors etc. Subject matter expertise of on-site studio needs for Animation, Visual Effects, Games, or post-production workflows. Experience prioritizing and supporting Internal and Creative Executives. Knowledge of troubleshooting studio infrastructure (storage, network, etc.). Knowledge of troubleshooting MacOS, Windows, remote workstations, and AV systems. Demonstrated cross-functional working relationships and advanced communication skills. Experience using data to tell a story and influence direction. Experience creating, editing, and maintaining knowledge base and/or training documentation. Experience with JIRA, Confluence, Zendesk or similar products. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $100,000 - $170,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. The N-Tech Systems Engineering team at Netflix focuses on improving the employee experience, collaboration, and productivity of our global employees and support teams. As a centralized engineering team responsible for helping Netflix employees with how they work, we aim to remove friction, simplify workflows by increasing automation, and provide technical solutions so they can focus on bringing engaging stories to our members all over the world. This role will focus on engineering solutions for Active Directory, Microsoft Azure and Google Workspace products. Key Responsibilities: As a member of the N-Tech Systems Engineering team, you will be responsible for developing tools and services that support Netflix’s Active Directory infrastructure. Implement and enforce security policies, access controls, and group memberships within Active Directory. You will establish the technical strategy and offer insights on the deployment of Microsoft Azure & Google Workspace products and services through collaboration with stakeholders and by understanding business use cases. You will be collaborating with cross-functional teams to design and implement solutions that meet the needs of our stakeholders and business. You’ll help maintain and document services owned by the team to ensure our runbooks and processes stay up to date. Participate in a weekly on-call rotation with the team, be responsible for answering operational questions during business hours, and be available during off-hours for emergency pages. Stay up to date on the latest trends and technologies of the N-Tech Systems Engineering service portfolio. Qualifications: Systems Engineering experience supporting and operating Active Directory, Microsoft Azure, and Google Workspace in an Enterprise Environment. Strong background in designing scalable, reliable, and efficient systems. Including understanding trade-offs in system design, design for fault tolerance and recovery, and knowledge of best practices in distributed systems. Know one or more general-purpose programming languages including but not limited to Python, Javascript, or Go. Working knowledge utilizing APIs for integration/ETL automation. Ability to use well-established enterprise standards, processes, and procedures to ensure engineering projects are delivered in a timely fashion with high-quality work products. Ability to manage and maintain AWS infrastructure to support production systems. Understanding SDLC and project management frameworks agile, scrum and iterative. Exposure to directory services and cloud identity providers (Okta, Google, Azure AD/Entra ID). Well-versed in producing technical documentation that conveys the story of business impact. Production experience utilizing CI/CD for code deployment. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $100,000 - $720,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: Netflix aspires to provide great entertainment for people everywhere, from the world's best creators across movies, TV series, documentaries, comedy and more. Our members have control over what, when, and where they watch.  It's an amazing time to join the Netflix team as we continue to transform entertainment. If you are a talented public relations executive with a passion for content and entertainment, keep reading! About the Role We’re looking to hire a creative self-starter, who loves entertainment and storytelling to lead our PR efforts in Thailand - one of our priority markets - in our fastest-growing region, Southeast Asia. You will have deep relationships with the media (both traditional and digital), Key Opinion Leaders and Talent and/or Filmmakers; an instinctive ability to mentor and build teams; and the ability to think strategically. You’ll need to be curious but cool under fire and able to build and maintain stellar relationships with internal and external partners. To succeed in this role you will need: An entrepreneurial mindset, given the pace at which we operate; A willingness to think from first principles, challenge established wisdom and work well cross-functionally; The ability to create compelling campaigns in conjunction with Marketing, Social Marketing, and Content, that tie our titles and talent to our brand; Passion or curiosity for Entertainment (TV or Film) Publicity; A love of trying new things; High standards in everything you do (we aspire to be excellent); Excellent written and oral communication skills; Willingness to roll-up your sleeves and get work done; To be a role model of courage and candor (per our cultural values ) foundational to successful team leaders; Passion for building and mentoring team members; The confidence and skills to deal with people at all levels internally and externally; Experience living and working in Thailand. This is a must. The work: Developing proactive, impactful PR campaigns that tie our titles and talent to our brand in conjunction with our marketing and social teams; Acting as a strategic thought partner to our content, partnerships teams and when necessary key external production and talent partners; Working to build strong external relationships within the media and creative communities - including onscreen talent, showrunners, filmmakers and producers; Crafting PR strategies to support our brand, raise awareness of our service, and promote our titles; Serving as an expert on Thailand - in particular, being able to convey its specific cultural needs and nuances within Netflix; Creating conversations and cultural moments for our shows and films; Being confident enough to serve as a company spokesperson; and Protecting and enhancing the Netflix reputation and brand in Thailand. The successful candidate will likely have: 12-15+ years experience in communications, publicity, media, journalism and/ or agency, studio or TV network; The ability to speak and write in Thai and English is important; Deep knowledge of the entertainment industry would be ideal - including experience working with creators, writers, producers, showrunners and talents; Strong press relationships, including at the editorial level; Have experience/good working knowledge of Digital PR and social media platforms Have experience managing agencies; Familiarity with the policy issues that impact companies working in the entertainment and technology space in Thailand is an advantage; Ability to work proactively, independently, and juggle multiple tasks at once; and The role may require frequent travel across the Southeast Asia region, and periodic travel to other international locations. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

  • The ability to speak and write in Thai and English is important;
  • Deep knowledge of the entertainment industry would be ideal - including experience working with creators, writers, producers, showrunners and talents;
  • Strong press relationships, including at the editorial level;
  • Have experience/good working knowledge of Digital PR and social media platforms 
  • Have experience managing agencies;
  • Familiarity with the policy issues that impact companies working in the entertainment and technology space in Thailand is an advantage;
  • Ability to work proactively, independently, and juggle multiple tasks at once; and 

    • The role may require frequent travel across the Southeast Asia region, and periodic travel to other international locations. 
    We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

description: Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with 270 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. We have ambitious plans, an enormous scale of opportunity and the passion to be the best in customer experience - which now includes a new ad-supported plan at a more affordable price point for customers. Within the broader Finance, Strategy & Analysis (FS&A) organization, we’re building out a new team, Ads Revenue & Yield Analytics, who will help steward and support our Ads go-to-market strategy.  In this role, you will support the Ads business in the EMEA region, inclusive of Sales & Account Management, with specialization in Inventory Management and Revenue Analytics. In tandem, you will have the opportunity to learn and grow quickly in this space, working closely with a global, cross-functional team across FS&A, Data Science & Engineering, Partnerships, Consumer insights, Marketing & Content to help build a cohesive understanding and unified approach to advertising at Netflix. Visit our culture memo and long-term view to learn more about the unique Netflix culture and the opportunity to be part of our team. Responsibilities will include: Develop an inventory monetization strategy across Netflix Ads product to drive revenue growth and improve yield. Manage inventory availability across targeted media, sponsorship executions and custom programs. Partner with Pricing and Yield to optimize go-to market initiatives against inventory composition, pricing strategies and ad serving logic. Collaborate with Microsoft & Account Management to oversee effective inventory utilization throughout the pitch-to-pay process. Work cross-functionally to define inventory guidelines for campaign executions across transaction models and currencies. Work with Product and Data Science & Engineering to assess delivery scenarios across the Ad Product catalog to increase serving efficiency. Work with Business Operations to assess transactional buying trends against marketplace conditions to quantify impacts across the Sales portfolio. Collaborate with MSFT to establish a sustainable and reliable data model throughout the Ad Tech stack to ensure consistent and accurate outputs. Work cross-functionally to build a reporting suite to track performance, elevate data-driven insights and advise real-time business decisions. Prepare clear and concise presentations for Sales leaders and Ads stakeholders. Support Sales, FS&A and Business Operations to assess Ad Tech stack / platform investments and to evaluate the impact on growth opportunities. What we’re looking for: 7+ years of Inventory Management and/or Advertising Strategy experience Strong modeling skills and comfort with manipulating large datasets in Excel, Google Sheets, Tableau, and other data visualization tools A strong attention to detail and eye towards using the 80/20 rule to address problems Candidates must be motivated, disciplined, flexible, able to work autonomously, and perform tasks with a wide range of difficulties Very strong project management, planning and organizational skills, including the ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously and to deliver under tight timelines Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with proven ability to build successful relationships and partners at all levels The ability to communicate ad serving logic with varying degrees of detail depending on the forum.  You know your audience and what they’re looking for. Expertise in programmatic advertising, auction dynamics, ad tech Familiarity with  the streaming ecosystem is a plus (though not required) We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

description: We're a group of developers, artists, and storytellers who make games full of wonder, danger, and humor. Everyone at our studio, whether an industry vet or a new voice, impacts each game through collaborative feedback, mutual respect, and creative empowerment. If you want to make games that leave a meaningful impact on players: we want to hear from you. We're looking for new teammates who deeply care about the work they do, the stories they tell, and the people they create with. As part of the Netflix team, we strive to hire the best and value integrity, excellence, respect, inclusion, and collaboration. PRODUCTION AT NIGHT SCHOOL At Night School, production helps keep the art, design, story, audio, engineering, and marketing teams coordinated, collaborating, and on track to build unique and compelling narrative game experiences. Iteration and autonomy are core production values at Night School. Where there is a gap in process or way to improve a workflow, the production team is empowered to make positive adjustments to bring about a higher quality to our development processes and, ultimately, our game experiences. We’re always looking for ways to reduce project risk and maximize potential. ABOUT THE JOB The production team takes the creative goals of the development team and translates them into achievable steps to reach those goals. We anticipate and avoid pitfalls in the path toward our creative vision and technical processes. We build plans and seek alignment on strategy across all disciplines while keeping a healthy balance of scope and creative ambition. As a Senior Producer at Night School Studio, you’ll be leading production on one of our game titles and working within our department on establishing and improving our development processes. Responsibilities Include: Support studio developers and projects to drive vision and execution at a high quality. Help translate our creative ambitions into balanced, healthy production realities. Mentor, motivate, and support your teammates and partners by identifying and helping to remove roadblocks and project risks. Identify, build, and drive programs that span multiple projects and initiatives inside the studio and with our partners. Ensure high visibility to the teams and stakeholders on the strategy and status of projects and goals. Work with leadership and development teams on building and maintaining project timelines, production plans, and budgeting. Skills & Requirements: 8+ years of game studio development experience shipping multiple games. Strong fluency in game development methodologies, best practices, and production systems. Excellent leadership and communication skills with a passion for working with and guiding creative teams. Skillful ability to scale up and down on day-to-day needs that range from high-level development strategy to the nitty gritty tasks. Excellent writing, analysis, and organizational skills. Thrives in uncertainty and an enthusiasm for working with new or bleeding-edge tech stacks. Preferred Skills: Hands-on development experience building games as a developer and understanding of the creative and technical side of making games. Experience with game publishing on major platforms such as Mobile, PlayStation, Switch, Steam, Xbox, etc. Highly knowledgeable about the game industry from a player's and developer’s perspective. About You: Passionate about story-telling, video games, and video game development. Strengths include being goal-oriented, conscientious, tenacious, thoughtful, meticulous, organized, and being both a great listener and communicator. Self-starter that works well autonomously and willing to find solutions, be curious, and ask questions when needed. Desires to support and guide a team to achieve their goals from a “bottom up” rather than “top down” management approach. Filters team creative ideas, ambitions, and goals through the lens of strategy and pragmatic next steps. Proficient at interpersonal communication, negotiation, and diplomacy. Receptive to and skilled at giving and receiving critique and feedback. Lifelong learner who wants to bring experience and knowledge to the project and team every day. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $60,000 - $270,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: Company Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with over 240 million paid memberships in over 190 countries. The Client and Partner Technologies (CPT) organization is charted with enabling brilliant Netflix experiences on partner devices and building foundational client systems and tools. Partner Enablements Apps group within CPT is looking for a software engineering manager to lead our Ecosystem Platform and Reliability team. Role We are seeking an experienced Software Engineering Manager to lead our Ecosystem Platform and Reliability team. This role involves establishing long-term technical strategy, driving the development and evolution of the core services to power our suite of web applications to scale partner management, device lifecycle management and partner payment channels, collectively known as Enablement Apps. The team is also responsible for the reliability and support for Enablement Apps, which includes first tier support for internal and external partners . The ideal candidate will be an inspiring leader, an effective communicator, dedicated to fostering an environment of continuous improvement and good development practices, and enjoys working in the office a few days per week (some of the team and close partners are local and work in person a few days per week). Team The Ecosystem Platform and Reliability team develops the foundational software platform for Enablement Apps. We provide a unified approach for developing and delivering cloud and data systems leveraged by application teams and other stakeholders. The team makeup is primarily senior software engineers based in California and globally for our regional reliability teams in Hsinchu, Taiwan and Amsterdam, Netherlands. The core service offering is a gateway for partners to execute the engineering and business interactions with Netflix. It also allows Netflix employees to manage hundreds of millions of devices and related partnership financial operations. Responsibilities Thoughtful leadership with experience in hiring, coaching, and retaining strong engineering talent with various needs for personal and professional growth. Lead a team of globally distributed engineers, providing technical guidance and career development support. Foster a culture of continuous learning and development best practices within the team. Collaborate with cross-functional partners to identify, design, and implement scalable and performant solutions for our evolving applications. Coordinate and prioritize migration and deprecation of legacy services. Champion data quality and engineering excellence. Establish a strong and mature foundation for the core services for all Enablement Apps including but not limited to: Testing - unit/automated testing to minimize downtime, Monitoring & alerting, Scalable on-call support (i.e. balanced enough for the team to not always feel like they’re on-call and we have the right level of support) Stay current with the newest trends, tools, and technologies in the field, assessing their relevance to our ecosystem. Requirements Minimum of 7 years of experience in software development, with 3+ years leading a backend services platform team. At least 3 years of experience in a leadership or management role within a software engineering team. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with an ability to navigate cross-functional team dynamics. Comfortable working across multiple time zones in the US, Asia, and Europe when communicating with global distributed team members. Familiarity with systems such as Jenkins, Github actions, Gradle, Spinnaker etc. is a plus. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $190,000 - $920,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.
