description: Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. As Netflix's business grows, financial data is becoming increasingly mission critical. Netflix’s financial footprint is expanding with complexity due to its global scale, product innovations and business model evolvements. The Finance Data Science and Engineering team is part of the centralized Data and Insights organization, supporting the office of our Chief Financial Officer. The team’s core mission is to enable our business partners to access key financial data efficiently and provide insights to drive revenue growth and expense optimization. The team is looking to add a Senior Analytics Engineer, who will work collaboratively with cross-functional partners including Finance, FP&A, Data Engineering, Product, and Engineering teams to build insights and tools that help the company make better data-driven decisions. To learn more about analytics engineering at Netflix, read here . Visit our culture deck and long-term view to learn more about the unique Netflix culture and the opportunity to be part of our team. In this role, you will: Partner closely with Finance leads to identify strategic, high-impact analytical problems and innovative ways to solve them with data. Conduct statistical analyses and modeling,  exploratory analysis, and metric development to uncover data insights and inform key decisions. Deliver data insights and drive for adoption through tools (e.g. dashboards, self-serve reporting),  memos and presentations. Develop scalable data pipelines to collect, clean, and analyze data from various sources; prototype, and productionize metrics and models. Facilitate data ownership and accountability by closely partnering with data engineering, product, and engineering partners to improve data robustness. To be successful in this role, you are/have: Highly effective in engaging with diverse stakeholders and adept at cultivating strong partnerships. Strategic-minded, impact-driven, and capable of incorporating larger business context into data questions and product development. A background in statistics, math, data science, or a similar quantitative field, with strong statistical skills and intuition. High proficiency in statistical programming, Python preferred. High proficiency in scripting with SQL, extracting large sets of data, and designing ETL flows. Experienced with developing data tools, memos, and presentations to deliver data and insights to stakeholders. Past experience in solving problems in Finance or other business-facing areas is a plus. A passionate learner who is eager to learn and apply a broad set of data techniques. A self-starter who thrives under a high level of ambiguity and autonomy. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $170,000 - $720,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

  • Facilitate data ownership and accountability by closely partnering with data engineering, product, and engineering partners to improve data robustness.
    • To be successful in this role, you are/have:
  • Highly effective in engaging with diverse stakeholders and adept at cultivating strong partnerships.
  • Strategic-minded, impact-driven, and capable of incorporating larger business context into data questions and product development.
  • A background in statistics, math, data science, or a similar quantitative field, with strong statistical skills and intuition.
  • High proficiency in statistical programming, Python preferred.
  • High proficiency in scripting with SQL, extracting large sets of data, and designing ETL flows.
  • Experienced with developing data tools, memos, and presentations to deliver data and insights to stakeholders.
  • Past experience in solving problems in Finance or other business-facing areas is a plus.
  • A passionate learner who is eager to learn and apply a broad set of data techniques.
  • A self-starter who thrives under a high level of ambiguity and autonomy.

To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $170,000 - $720,000. description: Netflix is the world's leading internet entertainment service with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any internet-connected screen. Members can play, pause and resume watching, all without commercials or commitments. With this international expansion and a move into Korean originals, it's a great time to join Netflix. The Opportunity Netflix is seeking a Public Policy Manager, Korea. The role will be based in Seoul and report to the Head of Public Policy in Seoul.  The Public Policy Manager will work to ensure that the policy and regulatory environment remains conducive to the growth of our business in the market. This will include educating and raising the awareness of stakeholders, providing thought leadership on policy issues of concern to us, and advocating for our position with policy stakeholders by collaborating with industry partners and associations. Responsibilities: Monitor policy changes, relevant news, and developments of the government which may have an impact on Netflix. Gather and analyze intelligence on policy and regulatory developments in Korea. Help colleagues across Netflix understand the impact that potential changes to policies in Korea may have on our business and their respective functions Develop relationships with a diverse set of public and private sector stakeholders to educate them about Netflix and build support for our policy positions. Develop and maintain relationships with public policy representatives across the technology and media community, and serve as a representative of Netflix in relevant trade groups or other industry bodies. Work closely with our global teams to strategically align on various policy objectives. Qualifications: At least 7+ years of experience in a policy-related role in either a government organization, legislative body, policy consulting firm, policy research institute or in-house government relations department. Strong industry knowledge - an in-depth understanding and keen curiosity of the internet, telecom, media and entertainment industries. Demonstrated and thoughtful business judgment, strong research and analytical skills, and ability to work well under pressure. An ability to cover a broad range of issues and work with a network of consultants, lawyers, and other partners. Excellent written and verbal communication skills in both English and Korean. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status or disability status. 넷플릭스는 다양한 경험과 생각을 가진 구성원이 모였을 때 최고의 성과를 내는 팀을 만들어 갈 수 있다고 믿고 있습니다. 다양성과 포용성은 우리가 지향하는 기업 문화의 핵심 중 하나이며, 이것의 궁극적인 목적은 모든 직원이 역량을 마음껏 발휘하고 성장하며 기여할 수 있도록 환경을 조성하는 것입니다.  인재를 선별하는 과정은 이러한 목적을 달성하는 데 매우 중요합니다.  이에 따라 넷플릭스는  성별, 인종, 피부색, 국적, 종교, 성적 지향, 나이, 결혼 여부 등 모든 개인적인 배경과 상관없이 모두에게 평등한 기회를 보장하며, 공정한 과정을 통해 채용을 진행하고 있습니다.장애인 및 국가보훈 대상자는 관련 법령에 따라 우대합니다.

description: We are seeking an experienced Manager, Korean Non-fiction Originals (예능) to help build and execute the original slate strategy for Korean productions for the world to watch. This role will carry projects from a creative perspective from pitch / development through to final delivery. The targeted programming will primarily focus on a variety of genres, formats and budget ranges of non-fiction programming across Korea. Responsibilities will include establishing and growing strong partnerships with creative partners in the market to source and commission great content. This role will also lead the execution of the shows working with internal cross functional partners such as FS&A, Physical and Post Production. VFX, Marketing and Publicity. This position will report to the Director, Content(Non-fiction) - Korea. The Opportunity Netflix is the world's leading internet entertainment service with over 167 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any internet-connected screen. Members can play, pause and resume watching, all without commercials or commitments. The Role A successful candidate will have a regional sensibility and ability to guide a project from pitch/idea through to delivery. They will be self-motivated, proactive, quick-thinking, flexible, able to pivot when necessary, thorough and able to juggle multiple and diverse responsibilities across projects at varying stages from development through to delivery. At all times an unwavering attention to creative detail. They will have excellent problem solving skills, with the ability to think about the best solution in the best interest of the company as they arise. This is a demanding and fast moving position that requires someone who is a proactive and positive thinker, is able to exercise sensitivity, good judgment and initiative while working with a high volume production slate and a diverse range of creative/production partners. Specific responsibilities include, but are not limited to: Development/Pre Production/Setup of Show Work closely with Directors(PDs), Producers, Writers and external creative team to develop projects and assess for long-term viability Work with Finance, Legal, Business Affairs, Product, Post & external production teams on establishing key schedules and workflows while maximizing budget to spend as much on screen as possible Develop and foster relationships with a multitude of producing partners/third parties Qualifications: BA/BS Degree Minimum 8 years of experience in non-fiction production, including directing and assistant directing roles Relevant experiences with directing non-fiction shows including co-directing experience High understanding of fast-paced media industry and latest trends Ability to handle a fast paced environment simultaneously supervising several projects in various phases of production (from evaluation to production through delivery) Team-player who operates in a fast paced team-oriented setting Ability to be discrete and maintain confidential information Strong written and verbal communication skills and the ability to multitask Willingness to take educated risks and think out of the box English proficiency is a plus We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. description: THE OPPORTUNITY Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. Netflix is revolutionizing the media and entertainment industry. Underpinning this revolution are leading-edge technology efforts in Cloud Infrastructure (running on Amazon Web Services) and Open Connect Content Delivery which are the foundational components that deliver a great Netflix experience to 260M+ members around the globe. As a team, we are responsible for driving efficient utilization and scaling of our cloud infrastructure. We are looking for an Associate to join our Technology Strategy & Analytics team focusing on driving infrastructure-aware product innovation decision making. You will partner with leaders and senior engineers across our Consumer Engineering organization, which operates hundreds of microservices running on Amazon Web Services that power the “before you press play” Netflix experience (think: sign-up, authentication, billing, personalization, search, messaging, etc.). You will be responsible for understanding our product innovation roadmap (incl. genAI-driven features) and how it will affect our infrastructure cost, and partnering with engineering leaders in an analytical and strategic capacity to develop key metrics and drive overall cloud efficiency. The ideal candidate will be highly analytical, partner-focused, an effective communicator, and relentlessly curious. Ideal candidates have a proven track record of managing cross-functional working groups and hands-on analytics experience. We are a self-service, data-driven organization so previous experience with query languages such as SQL, a scripting language (e.g., Python), or a strong desire to learn these skills is strongly preferred. The ideal candidate will thrive in a fast-paced, high-stakes environment, possess a high degree of intellectual curiosity, and be results-driven while upholding the highest personal and professional integrity and ethics. In addition to intellectual curiosity and aptitude, we look for candidates who are excited by technology, either from a professional or personal background. Since we are deeply embedded with our business partners, having the ability to connect specific engineering initiatives to the broader Netflix business impact is critical to success. This position is expected to operate at a senior level, leading cross-functional projects/teams composed of software engineers, data engineers, and data scientists while collaborating with engineering leadership. This role will report directly to the Senior Manager, Technology Strategy & Analytics, and is based out of our Los Gatos, CA office. RESPONSIBILITIES (non-exhaustive) Work closely with Engineering and Data Science partners to drive the adoption and continued development of analytical tooling that estimates the infrastructure impact of A/B tests. Understand the Netflix consumer product innovation roadmap and how we expect it to impact our cloud infrastructure. Extensive analysis of our Cloud infrastructure, focusing on optimization and efficiency opportunities. Based on the findings, propose solutions and project manage cross-functional teams (software engineers, data engineers, analytics/viz engineers, etc.) through implementation. Provide strategic, ad-hoc analysis to engineering teams, senior leaders, and the broader finance organization. Report and iterate on key operational and financial metrics. Partner with our Data Science and Engineering teams to develop tools for cost visibility, deep analytics, and dashboarding. QUALIFICATIONS 4+ years of experience in a highly analytical environment -- worked in a consulting firm, strategy & operations, technical program management, or analytics at a technology company, or similarly demanding functions in which strategic analysis, partner management, and operational optimization is essential. Experience working as a business partner with technical engineering teams in a fast-paced, constantly changing environment. Ability to present to and context switch between peer groups and senior-level management. Ability and willingness to quickly learn internal data warehouse tools to independently (self-service) explore and analyze high-volume datasets. Working proficiency with SQL or other query languages. Bonus: Familiarity with Python or another scripting language. Expert with Excel or Google Sheets. Working knowledge of visualization tools (e.g. Tableau). Degree in economics, mathematics, engineering/ computer science, or other relevant field that demonstrates quantitative competence. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $50,000 - $240,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: Netflix has been changing how people watch shows and movies, enabling seamless on-demand access across a wide variety of streaming devices, from set-top-boxes to mobile devices to TVs . Recently, we have expanded our entertainment offering with Live programming, like the  Chris Rock Comedy Special, the SAG Awards and The Netflix Slam tennis match.  We are looking for an experienced Technical Launch Manager to help drive the success of these live shows. As Technical Launch Manager, you will be responsible for cross-functional coordination of the assigned Live show, partnering closely with all the Engineering teams in the critical path of Live, and stakeholders in Product, Production and Marketing. Before the event, you will ensure that all partners are aligned on team responsibilities and show-specific features (broadcast technology, localization and accessibility requirements, social and marking needs, member-facing features),  and follow-up on execution. You will lead readiness reviews and assess risks and help drive them to resolution. You will schedule, coordinate and document pre-event testing and validation. You will plan for and coordinate the day-of-event launch (virtual) room presence and on-calls. During the event, you will act as the call leader and manage communication across different teams. You will perform hands-on execution of operational steps if needed.  You will track issues and coordinate escalations with incident managers and relevant service owners. After the event, you will compile operations summaries and coordinate retrospectives. About You Experience.  You have experience in coordinating and operating live shows in the streaming domain. You have worked closely with engineers (as a project manager or operations engineer, etc). You have handled incidents in the context of live streaming. Domain Knowledge. You are knowledgeable about live streaming systems. You have a good understanding of broadcast technology, encoding and media delivery. Essentials. You are a great communicator and very organized. You collaborate effectively with all stakeholders. You thrive in a fast-paced environment and remain calm and focused amidst ambiguity.  You can execute the details, and at the same time, you are motivated to drive the strategic direction of the team. You are excited about delivering live shows embedded in the Netflix culture. Our culture is unique, and we tend to live by our values, so it’s worth learning more about Netflix here . Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $100,000 - $720,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status. Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with +260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries, enjoying TV series, documentaries, and feature films across various genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any internet-connected screen. The role This is your chance to be on the ground floor with a team that is transforming entertainment through original production. The Mexico Content Risk Manager candidate will support our safety and security functions across all of our verticals and in particular our Local Language Originals. This role is responsible for risk advisory and guidance for Netflix productions, events, and studio facilities. Reporting to the LATAM Content Risk Director, this role partners closely with Mexico’s Production, Events, PR, GR, and Legal teams. Job Responsibilities: Primacy on assessing content and operational risk for Netflix productions and providing advice on mitigation measures; Supports Netflix’s response efforts to safety & security incidents in close coordination with internal stakeholders and our production partners; Provides safety & security guidance to ensure global best practices are followed while accounting for local production practices and nuances; Monitors and analyzes international, regional, and local security incidents that can have an impact on Netflix operations; Evaluates production concepts, scripts, plans, etc., for health, safety, security, and environmental concerns and risks as required; Works directly with the Production team in the planning and execution phase of all filming: assessing safety & security needs, recommending appropriate vendors, and overseeing high-risk activities, as needed; Assesses gaps and opportunities for regional production safety & security needs, internally and externally; Contributes to the development of global risk guidelines, while advocating for the local requirements within Mexico; Proactive in the coordination of discussions surrounding production issues and concerns relating to safety & security; Promotes development of local safety & security vendors to meet Netflix operational standards; Negotiates service levels and quotes with vendors; Works independently without direct management supervision; Develops and maintains effective working relationships with industry safety organizations, representatives, and governmental regulatory agencies as appropriate. Qualifications: Experience managing risk for complex operations is strongly desired; A strong understanding of the Mexican and Latin American socioeconomic, cultural, and security dynamics is desired; Experience in film and TV production safety & security is desired but not essential; Professional safety qualifications are an asset; Professional fluency in written and spoken Spanish and English (Portuguese a plus). Ability to: Solutions-based mindset; Learn quickly and adjust to rapidly changing environments; Travel domestically and internationally; Quickly recognize and resolve various production safety & security issues that arise during the course of production activities; Demonstrate leadership in all subjects relating to safety & security; Work collaboratively with diverse groups of people to assess and develop bespoke safety & security needs for productions; Interact with regulatory agencies, company management, productions, and studio personnel. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

description: Netflix is seeking a junior production executive to join our dynamic Animation Series Production Team. As part of the world's leading streaming entertainment service, you'll help shape the future of animated content by supporting and collaborating with production crews, partner studios, and cross-functional teams on our ever-growing slate of animated series. This role demands an individual who excels in a fast-paced environment, demonstrating exceptional production management skills and balanced decision-making to effectively support multiple high-profile projects. Join us at Netflix Animation Series and contribute to creating groundbreaking animated series that captivate audiences worldwide. The successful candidate will be self-motivated, proactive, quick-thinking, and flexible, while adeptly managing multiple and diverse responsibilities. Excellent written and verbal communication skills are essential. The role demands impeccable organizational skills and unwavering attention to detail at all times, along with the ability to be discreet and handle confidential information. This is a demanding and fast-moving position that requires a positive thinker who can exercise good judgment and work independently, yet be loosely coupled to the rest of the Series Production Team. Responsibilities: At least 3 years experience in an animation production capacity that carries responsibility and ownership, ideally in a Production Manager role or higher. Serve as the first point of production contact and the central Netflix communication point for show productions and Netflix cross-functional teams. Track the work against schedules and production reports. Train crews in complexity tools and guide in managing assumptions and complexity throughout all phases of production. Spearhead understanding of animation production studio needs. Identify and manage gaps in the pipeline, technical support, and production management tools, ensuring that productions have the necessary tools and deciding the priority of introducing new tools and training. Propose and implement the updating and maintenance of Netflix information sources, new tools, and best workflows (Shotgrid, Google Suite). Onboard and train show leadership and potential studios on Netflix processes, tools, and resources. Update Netflix generic development schedules and budgets. Update Netflix development schedules/crew trackers and maintain the slate. Organize and track deal types for the crew, following up when needed. Perform other adhoc duties as required to support the animation series production team and ensure seamless operations. Qualifications: 3+  years in animated television series production, with production manager level experience preferred. Must be able to work on-site 4 days per week in Hollywood, CA. Experienced in more than one phase of production and in more than one department of a production; production experience is preferred, with interest in development. Organized in thinking and action, able to take charge and be decisive and know when to elevate a problem. Self-starter, has implemented processes or pipeline improvements on prior productions. Interest in working in a team and good people skills. Possess integrity and is a team player. Ability to be articulate, have good written skills, and be a clear communicator. Ability to be discreet and handle confidential information Ability to multi-task and show flexibility in prioritizing and re-prioritizing as situations arise throughout the day. Organized and detail-oriented. Ability to respond to timely, important, or urgent matters after hours if needed. Proficiency in Google Suite, Final Draft, Shotgrid preferred. Able to understand basic Photoshop and design tools to manage files. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $50,000 - $245,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: We are an equal opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status. Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with over 200 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any internet-connected screen. Members can play, pause, and resume watching, all without commercials or commitments. The Content Finance, Strategy & Analysis team is looking for an Associate to join its Latin America team based in Mexico City. Content Finance, Strategy & Analysis is the team in charge of the valuation and analytical strategy behind our content buying and original content decisions for our local content in the region. The team works cross-functionally to translate the incredible amount of data at Netflix into financial and strategic decisions regarding the production and acquisition of TV shows and films. Content Finance, Strategy & Analysis also evaluates the general programming and content strategy, in addition to leading competitive analysis. We partner closely with the senior leadership of Netflix who depend heavily on the strategic insights we provide to inform critical business decisions across the company. This role will reside in Netflix's Mexico City office and involves close coordination with members of the Content, Finance, Strategy & Analysis teams across the world. Responsibilities Execute deal and valuation analyses (model building, scenario testing, etc) of new projects in partnership with the Creative and Business Affairs teams Conduct market research, tracking and compiling industry trends in the region Develop analysis to support the understanding of industry trends as well as competitive threats and opportunities Conduct ongoing analysis of key business drivers and content trends Work with leaders within the content organization to translate strategic initiatives into multi-year plans Regularly present analyses and reports on relevant Content performance, operating, and financial metrics in an easy-to-understand format to senior business leaders Compile thoughtful post-mortem analyses to determine areas for optimization and improvement Work cross-functionally with other FS&A teams globally as well as Product, Marketing, and Consumer Insights teams Qualifications 4+ years of experience in a top management consulting firm, investment bank, private equity, hedge fund, and/or media/entertainment/tech company in a strategy/business development/analytical role. Would it be great if you have worked in a highly demanding environment in which complex modeling and analysis is performed Experience in the entertainment industry (having worked in a studio, production company, agency, or distributor) is a plus, though not required Superb financial modeling skills and extensive experience conducting quantitative and qualitative analysis Strong communication/presentation skills with a track record of presenting complex analyses to executives/senior management clearly and concisely The successful candidate must display, through attitude and accomplishments, a strong initiative for anticipating and meeting the business demands of senior-level business managers. He or she must thrive in a fast-paced environment, possess a high level of intellectual curiosity, focus on generating results, and exhibit the highest personal and professional standards of integrity and ethics Netflix is fast-growing with a flat organizational structure, which means that employees are often asked to perform tasks with a range of difficulties. Candidates must be motivated, disciplined, and be able to work effectively autonomously Exceptional proficiency with MS Excel & PowerPoint; working knowledge of statistics and analysis packages A bachelor's degree in finance, economics, mathematics, statistics, or other relevant field would be ideal Passion for entertainment and content with ideally a good knowledge of local shows from the region Genuine passion and excitement for Netflix’s unique culture English and Spanish language fluency We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

The team works cross-functionally to translate the incredible amount of data at Netflix into financial and strategic decisions regarding the production and acquisition of TV shows and films. Content Finance, Strategy & Analysis also evaluates the general programming and content strategy, in addition to leading competitive analysis. We partner closely with the senior leadership of Netflix who depend heavily on the strategic insights we provide to inform critical business decisions across the company. This role will reside in Netflix's Mexico City office and involves close coordination with members of the Content, Finance, Strategy & Analysis teams across the world. Responsibilities
  • Execute deal and valuation analyses (model building, scenario testing, etc) of new projects in partnership with the Creative and Business Affairs teams
  • Conduct market research, tracking and compiling industry trends in the region
  • Develop analysis to support the understanding of industry trends as well as competitive threats and opportunities
  • Conduct ongoing analysis of key business drivers and content trends
  • Work with leaders within the content organization to translate strategic initiatives into multi-year plans
  • Regularly present analyses and reports on relevant Content performance, operating, and financial metrics in an easy-to-understand format to senior business leaders
  • Compile thoughtful post-mortem analyses to determine areas for optimization and improvement
  • Work cross-functionally with other FS&A teams globally as well as Product, Marketing, and Consumer Insights teams
    • Qualifications
  • 4+ years of experience in a top management consulting firm, investment bank, private equity, hedge fund, and/or media/entertainment/tech company in a strategy/business development/analytical role. Would it be great if you have worked in a highly demanding environment in which complex modeling and analysis is performed
  • Experience in the entertainment industry (having worked in a studio, production company, agency, or distributor) is a plus, though not required  
  • Superb financial modeling skills and extensive experience conducting quantitative and qualitative analysis
  • Strong communication/presentation skills with a track record of presenting complex analyses to executives/senior management clearly and concisely
  • The successful candidate must display, through attitude and accomplishments, a strong initiative for anticipating and meeting the business demands of senior-level business managers. He or she must thrive in a fast-paced environment, possess a high level of intellectual curiosity, focus on generating results, and exhibit the highest personal and professional standards of integrity and ethics
  • Netflix is fast-growing with a flat organizational structure, which means that employees are often asked to perform tasks with a range of difficulties. Candidates must be motivated, disciplined, and be able to work effectively autonomously
  • Exceptional proficiency with MS Excel & PowerPoint; working knowledge of statistics and analysis packages
  • A bachelor's degree in finance, economics, mathematics, statistics, or other relevant field would be ideal
  • Passion for entertainment and content with ideally a good knowledge of local shows from the region
  • Genuine passion and excitement for Netflix’s unique culture
  • English and Spanish language fluency 
    • We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

description: Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause, and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. The Opportunity Do you spend your free time discussing all things lore and canon for your favorite universe? Have you thought extensively about which model starship you would pilot? We’re looking for a social media expert who knows how to dive deep with fandoms (sci-fi, fantasy, animation, anime) and can reach genre audiences across multiple channels and platforms. The Geeked Social Manager role will build out social strategy to reach key audience segments and work to build long-term brand affinity through social marketing, as well as social-first integration within Netflix experiential and slate marketing opportunities. The right fit should have a social background, experience activating genre fandoms and communities, and excellent editorial judgment to balance the needs of the audience with the needs of our business. They will oversee comprehensive social campaigns for titles, collaborating cross-functionally to align social strategies with overarching marketing goals and effectively communicate these goals to partners. This role requires a dynamic individual who is deeply passionate about reaching different genre audiences and leveraging social platforms to fuel fandom for Netflix shows. It involves a diverse array of tasks, from coordinating within the company to crafting high-level strategies, to translating experiential moments like Geeked Week into compelling social coverage. Key Responsibilities: Develop and execute social strategy for genre channels across platforms, including Instagram, TikTok, Facebook, Twitter/X, YouTube, Reddit and more. Responsible for building title social strategy for genre film & series, aligned with the overall marketing campaign strategy. This is inclusive of target audience, social creative, content distribution across the Netflix social ecosystem and, if necessary, the creation of title social pages. Manage internal and agency resources to execute genre, title, and slate social campaigns at every stage from ideation through production and distribution. Work with key cross-functional partners including Consumer Products, Games, Integrated Marketing and more, to build social strategy that supports business priorities as they relate to the genre audience. Lead social strategy for genre-specific marketing campaigns, including Geeked Week and other experiential, and manage the launch of key marketing assets across social. Develop multi-title / always-on promotional narratives based on audience behavior and need states as well as existing channel tentpoles. Use internal and external social analytics and other internal data to inform strategy, iterate creative, and constantly learn to improve future campaigns. Main point of contact regarding social strategy and social creative across Marketing, Publicity, Content, and other teams working against genre single title or slate-level initiatives. Background and Specific Skills: Experience working on broad, multiple-platform marketing campaigns and delivering nuanced, insight-based social strategies. Knowledge of what works across various social platforms and experience in multi-channel distribution efforts. Background and affinity for genre entertainment spaces, including sci-fi, anime, fantasy, and animation. Entrepreneurial spirit and highly collaborative - loves working with others, isn’t afraid to lead or follow. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Experience using data and intuition to make content that grabs attention and engages its audience. Strong on social media analytics, but isn’t afraid to take big risks. Must be able to prioritize and handle several projects at the same time in a fast-paced environment while adhering to shifting deadlines. Able to build strong relationships and work across many internal cross-functional teams. Experience working directly with filmmakers and is skilled in pitching/ presenting with the ability to read the room. High tolerance for change, and the capacity to accomplish enormous amounts of work in a fast-paced, ever-changing environment. Respect, understanding, and enthusiasm for Netflix culture. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $170,000 - $360,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause, and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. Content Engineering builds the products and services used by our internal and external creative partners producing and managing our global content. Our products enable the entire workflow of content production, from pitch to play, and provide innovative new ways to develop and manage entertainment at scale. We are looking for an Engineering Manager to deliver high-impact results and to revolutionize the content creation space. You will hire and  grow a team of software engineers in Warsaw to develop and implement technology that enables the efficient ingestion and delivery of media assets. To do this, you will need to partner with engineering teams across Netflix as well as work closely with X-functional partners (Production Managers, Product Managers, Designers), across geographies and timezones. What You Will Do: Demonstrate consistent curiosity in the studio media management workflows and contribute towards the broader Studio strategy and goals. Position yourself as a thought leader with stakeholders and build trusting partnerships Act as a credible technical advisor to the team Understand the tradeoffs and balance between critical business needs and strong engineering principles Make thoughtful decisions in complex, ambiguous situations Informed risk-taking -  make strategic bets while driving tactical execution Foster an inclusive, high-performing environment where every member feels accepted and respected Hold a high bar in hiring and retention, and coach, mentor, and grow a diverse group of software engineers Be a strong culture role model, leading by example in alignment with our principles of Inclusion, Freedom & Responsibility, Informed Captaincy and Context Not Control Qualifications At least 5 years experience in building and leading diverse software engineering teams Maximizing the team’s impact while supporting the growth aspirations of employees Business applications development experience with keeping high standards Tenacity and the ability to balance competing priorities across multiple cross-functional stakeholders and programs Strong understanding of distributed media systems and architecture A strong product mindset Experience in leading large complex projects across many disparate, independent engineering teams through influence and joy of adoption Ability to deliver and receive candid feedback in a variety of situations Balancing between giving context vs. driving direction A track record of growing senior engineers deep into their careers to increase their impact A passion for communication - with the team, stakeholders, partners, and leadership, particularly across global borders We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. In EMEA, Netflix is headquartered in Amsterdam. The successful candidate will be self-motivated, proactive, quick-thinking, flexible, and able to juggle multiple and diverse responsibilities with an unwavering attention to detail at all times. A high level of organization, proactivity, and excellent communication skills are a must. We need someone who can not only be great in their day-to-day work, but can identify opportunities to make the wider team more organised and efficient. Someone who is curious, demonstrates significant initiative, and inherently exercises good judgement will be most successful both in the role and at Netflix itself. Read our culture memo to understand more about how we work. Responsibilities include: Support Executives on an Interim basis with complex calendar management, maintaining an agile approach to changing needs and priorities. Schedule and confirm meetings both internally and externally Administrative duties, including processing travel and expense reports Communicate with relevant stakeholders internally and externally. Participate in administrative tasks such as supporting the content team with updating documents, drafting amendments, and managing the process and flow of content submissions Be responsible for specific tools for both internal and external systems, and update documents and trackers. Support the team with ad hoc projects such as building presentations, organizing events and research Coordinate logistics / technical set-up for content partner meetings. Coordinate travel arrangements, both domestically and internationally Liaise with Creative talent and coordinate gifting for partners. Maintaining flexibility and openness to take on additional projects Requirements 4+ years as an assistant supporting multiple senior-level directors or executives Experience working in the entertainment or creative industry would be desirable Fluency in Dutch and English is required Team player who operates in a fast-paced team-oriented setting. Ability to be discrete and maintain confidential information. Demonstrates flexibility towards work such as responding after hours for important, timely, or urgent matters. Understanding of how to prioritize and respond accordingly. Strong written and verbal communication skills and the ability to multi-task. Proficiency in Google Docs, Sheets, Slides, and Google Mail. description: Netflix is one of the world's leading streaming entertainment services with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. Netflix has been on the leading edge of the cloud since beginning the migration to AWS 15 years ago and runs one of the largest Cloud footprints around. The Cloud Engineering organization exists to manage that massive scale, constantly innovating to increase fleet-wide agility, efficiency, and reliability of the Netflix cloud infrastructure, while solving scale problems that we are the first to ever hit. We build, operate, and maintain Compute, Network and Storage services so that developers at Netflix can rely on foundational building blocks when entertaining hundreds of millions of customers around the world. Join us as we push the boundaries of performance, efficiency, and resilience, empowering developers to create groundbreaking applications on a reliable platform. Cloud Network Engineering owns all aspects of cloud-based networking for services at Netflix. Our goal is to create network architectures that can readily evolve to the needs of our product services and initiatives. We achieve this goal through the development of feature-rich tooling and services that improve network availability, security, and visibility while removing friction for our users. Must-have skills At least 2-4 years of professional experience in Cloud Network Engineering on a major cloud provider platform at scale, preferably AWS. Deep understanding of TCP/IP, Routing, IPv6, and IPv4. Proficient with scripting and have a solid understanding of programming languages such as Go, Python, or Java. Passion for technology, pragmatic thinking, and the ability to dive into ambiguous areas and break down complex problems. Experience supporting core infrastructure services in an on-call rotation. What you will be doing in the role Building and operating Services, APIs, and Tooling for a variety of use cases related to cloud networking. Owning and driving cross-functional projects that enable new business areas for Netflix. Leveraging your Cloud Network Engineering expertise to influence the development of our codebase, working closely with our software engineers. Engaging directly with end engineering users to understand their needs and improve their overall experience with the Infrastructure at Netflix. Balancing bias to action with the ability to make well-informed decisions. Understanding and solving business needs at scale with high-quality solutions. Success criteria You thrive in ambiguity; complex and fuzzy requirements are more common than clearly defined customer expectations. You take incremental steps toward solving big problems; test-and-learn approaches work better than heads-down development. You are independent and self-driven; progress is often self-directed by teams & individuals. You’ve read about Netflix’s culture and think you would thrive here. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $100,000- $720,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: The Team The iOS Client Foundations team shepherds and builds foundational architecture and frameworks that power the Netflix iOS app. Our three core values are: Accelerate developer velocity, pave the path and set standards for App quality and experience metrics, and pave the path to build scalable app architecture (foundational scaffoldings), frameworks, documentation, and communication for iOS platforms across Netflix. Our responsibilities include implementing large-scale future-looking foundational architecture and frameworks ranging from core UI frameworks to core infrastructure that enables existing and future innovations for product teams across Netflix. We care deeply about the performance, quality, and accessibility of the Netflix app. We’re passionate about creating elegantly designed, highly performant architectures that empower engineers to build unique UI experiences used by millions of users across the globe. We partner closely with teams across Netflix to help deliver solutions that make UI development efficient and enjoyable. We are part of a global, diverse organization that includes people of all people of all genders, sexual orientations, upbringings, nationalities, ages, and socioeconomic & educational backgrounds. We encourage anyone passionate about building compelling mobile experiences that touch audiences worldwide to apply. The Role We are looking for an engineer to lead the iOS core libraries, framework & infrastructure strategy and innovate how we uphold the high bar for product quality amidst growing product areas while accelerating developer velocity. This role’s impact and visibility will be felt by (but not limited to) the entire iOS development community at Netflix. The engineer in this role will contribute to developer experience by building scalable libraries, frameworks & infrastructure to enhance the development of quick product feature iterations across the entire product engineering stack. Provide technical leadership to drive pragmatic, yet deeply impactful architectural decisions in logging and UI infrastructure that address both current and future product needs. Create scalable, modular, extensible, and highly performant custom UI components that are leveraged by engineers on a variety of teams. Strong advocate for building transparent observability tooling and solutions that enhance developer velocity. Set the vision and strategy for a robust and scalable logging framework that consolidates our customers’ varying needs (other engineering teams) in close collaboration with our data science team. Bring a wide variety of experience building frameworks/libraries with technologies like UIKit, Core Animation, Objective-C and Swift, and other Apple frameworks to the team. Refine or define hypotheses with our stakeholders in a data-driven approach that informs foundational strategy and innovations. Enable and ship complex product experiences with exceptional quality on a regular, rapid cadence. Find ways to detect and improve code health in a fast-paced, high commit volume culture of experimentation. Find solutions to prevent regressions in the product experience, and improve test stability, coverage & performance. What’s Different About Us Scale, Impact : You’ll enable engineers across multiple teams and organizations at Netflix to create best-in-class streaming UIs used by hundreds of millions of members across a broad spectrum of devices worldwide. Unique Technical Challenges : We build framework solutions which are flexible enough to withstand the span of use cases introduced by rapid A/B test development, across a varied client stack, server and network performance landscape, all while being ergonomic to use for the engineers we support. Collaboration and Communication : It’s not all about the tech. We highly value the skills required to build strong relationships and collaborate effectively with a high performing, inclusive & supportive team of engineers. Freedom, Responsibility, Ownership : We believe in providing engineers with the business context they need, and then giving them the freedom and responsibility to define project scope, define/debate architecture, determine trade-offs, and figure out the implementation details. Our Culture : Lastly, but most importantly, we live by our values . What Sets You Apart You enjoy pushing the boundaries of what technology can do, and exploring uncharted waters You love the idea of your work empowering other engineers and strive to understand their use cases Colleagues appreciate the unique perspectives and balanced views you bring to collaborations You value the opinion of others when fleshing out solutions, to fill out your blind spots You know that there is rarely a single ‘right’ solution, and are thoughtful about trade-offs Curious about a broad range of new or unfamiliar technologies, our consumer base, and product vision. Familiarity with Data centric approach to app development Always seeking different perspectives, feedback, and relevant information to comfortably navigate ambiguity. Effective at establishing strong relationships with cross-functional teams through clear communication. Self-starter comfortable with identifying opportunities, defining & driving forward-looking technical roadmaps Deeply care about the quality & performance of the product shipped Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $100,000 - $720,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more details about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

Remote, United States Products & Technology Core Engineering Software Engineer 5 - iOS Client Foundations The Team The iOS Client Foundations team shepherds and builds foundational architecture and frameworks that power the Netflix iOS app. Our three core values are: Accelerate developer velocity, pave the path and set standards for App quality and experience metrics, and pave the path to build scalable app architecture (foundational scaffoldings), frameworks, documentation, and communication for iOS platforms across Netflix. Our responsibilities include implementing large-scale future-looking foundational architecture and frameworks ranging from core UI frameworks to core infrastructure that enables existing and future innovations for product teams across Netflix. We care deeply about the performance, quality, and accessibility of the Netflix app. We’re passionate about creating elegantly designed, highly performant architectures that empower engineers to build unique UI experiences used by millions of users across the globe. We partner closely with teams across Netflix to help deliver solutions that make UI development efficient and enjoyable. We are part of a global, diverse organization that includes people of all people of all genders, sexual orientations, upbringings, nationalities, ages, and socioeconomic & educational backgrounds. We encourage anyone passionate about building compelling mobile experiences that touch audiences worldwide to apply. The Role We are looking for an engineer to lead the iOS core libraries, framework & infrastructure strategy and innovate how we uphold the high bar for product quality amidst growing product areas while accelerating developer velocity. This role’s impact and visibility will be felt by (but not limited to) the entire iOS development community at Netflix. The engineer in this role will contribute to developer experience by building scalable libraries, frameworks & infrastructure to enhance the development of quick product feature iterations across the entire product engineering stack.
  • Provide technical leadership to drive pragmatic, yet deeply impactful architectural decisions in logging and UI infrastructure that address both current and future product needs.
  • Create scalable, modular, extensible, and highly performant custom UI components that are leveraged by engineers on a variety of teams.
  • Strong advocate for building transparent observability tooling and solutions that enhance developer velocity.
  • Set the vision and strategy for a robust and scalable logging framework that consolidates our customers’ varying needs (other engineering teams) in close collaboration with our data science team.
  • Bring a wide variety of experience building frameworks/libraries with technologies like UIKit, Core Animation, Objective-C and Swift, and other Apple frameworks to the team.
  • Refine or define hypotheses with our stakeholders in a data-driven approach that informs foundational strategy and innovations.
  • Enable and ship complex product experiences with exceptional quality on a regular, rapid cadence.
  • Find ways to detect and improve code health in a fast-paced, high commit volume culture of experimentation.
  • Find solutions to prevent regressions in the product experience, and improve test stability, coverage & performance.  
    • What’s Different About Us
  • Scale, Impact : You’ll enable engineers across multiple teams and organizations at Netflix to create best-in-class streaming UIs used by hundreds of millions of members across a broad spectrum of devices worldwide.
  • Unique Technical Challenges : We build framework solutions which are flexible enough to withstand the span of use cases introduced by rapid A/B test development, across a varied client stack, server and network performance landscape, all while being ergonomic to use for the engineers we support.
  • Collaboration and Communication : It’s not all about the tech. We highly value the skills required to build strong relationships and collaborate effectively with a high performing, inclusive & supportive team of engineers.
  • Freedom, Responsibility, Ownership : We believe in providing engineers with the business context they need, and then giving them the freedom and responsibility to define project scope, define/debate architecture, determine trade-offs, and figure out the implementation details.
  • Our Culture : Lastly, but most importantly, we live by our values.
    • What Sets You Apart
  • You enjoy pushing the boundaries of what technology can do, and exploring uncharted waters
  • You love the idea of your work empowering other engineers and strive to understand their use cases
  • Colleagues appreciate the unique perspectives and balanced views you bring to collaborations
  • You value the opinion of others when fleshing out solutions, to fill out your blind spots
  • You know that there is rarely a single ‘right’ solution, and are thoughtful about trade-offs
  • Curious about a broad range of new or unfamiliar technologies, our consumer base, and product vision.
  • Familiarity with Data centric approach to app development 
  • Always seeking different perspectives, feedback, and relevant information to comfortably navigate ambiguity.
  • Effective at establishing strong relationships with cross-functional teams through clear communication.
  • Self-starter comfortable with identifying opportunities, defining & driving forward-looking technical roadmaps 
  • Deeply care about the quality & performance of the product shipped

To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $100,000 - $720,000.  Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. description: At Netflix, we want to entertain the world and are constantly innovating on how entertainment is imagined, created and delivered to a global audience. We currently stream content in more than 30 languages in 190 countries, topping over 230 million paid subscribers. We have many workstreams at Netflix that require robust data, and data governance to help us manage operations.  In this role, you will be responsible for driving the strategy, construction, adoption, and governance of taxonomies that support the growing volume of core content data through dozens of applications and multiple workflows to support the lifecycle of content at Netflix. We are seeking a senior-level Taxonomy Strategist who has experience with and passion for bringing structure to large-scale, disparate databases and vocabularies. You will be responsible for scoping, creating, and maintaining data dictionaries, controlled vocabularies, schema governance, and data integrity/enforcement. Ideal Candidates: Collaborating with cross-functional partners, you are confident in making informed decisions. You possess the communication skills to successfully advocate for and gain acceptance of new taxonomy-related processes and governance policies. You have experience developing both product-facing and internal taxonomies for supply chains, operations, jobs, and vendors, preferably related to the entertainment industry. As a Taxonomy Strategist, you will work closely with multiple internal teams, including but not limited to Product, Design, Engineering, Content Data Management, and Data Science teams to define, develop, maintain, and govern related taxonomies. Reporting to the Product Metadata & Ratings Taxonomy & Governance Manager, this is an exempt role. The preferred location is Los Gatos or Los Angeles, but will consider US Remote, with some required travel to California. Responsibilities include: Defining new taxonomies and metadata related to the categorization, technical and creative attributes that will support the Netflix content pipeline. . Reconciling disparate taxonomies and metadata across teams. Strategically evaluating the taxonomy and requests for new data for synergies with existing taxonomies wherever possible. Evaluation of adoption of industry taxonomies and associated mapping solutions. Surveying and interviewing stakeholders and observing current and developing workflows. Ensuring metadata is defined such that its integrity will not be compromised by cultural bias. Working with subject matter experts to define workflows and standards for metadata application. Develop taxonomies that will be foundational to our asset management and core content data roadmaps.. Working closely with engineering partners to identify solution requirements, including tooling and intuitive UI for metadata application. Evangelizing the importance of the adoption of common taxonomies. Working with team experts to develop training materials and sessions. Creating and maintaining documentation to support taxonomies. Reviewing other taxonomies and collaborating with Taxonomy Team colleagues. Auditing existing taxonomies and improving their efficiency. Establishing, Implementing and/or updating maintenance and governance tracks for created taxonomies. Requirements: Deep experience with complex, interconnected taxonomies. Familiarity with job, vendor and operational taxonomies and standards. Experience defining and developing new taxonomy and metadata schemas. Experience as a team member with software development cycles and practices. Experience working in a high-volume content environment. Experience working with systems shared across internal teams and vendors. Experience establishing a governance system. Excellent communication skills: written, verbal and presentation. Able to work with and manage multiple stakeholders' expectations and priorities. Ability to set goals and work independently in a highly cross-functional, non-hierarchical workplace. Ability to influence across various function groups. Comfortable working with stakeholders, partners and co-workers to create order out of vague and/or ambiguous requirements. Experience working in a global context, sensitive to regional requirements. Familiarity with legal compliance and the changing landscape of data regulations around the world. Nice to Have: Experience with Data Science, Computer Science Experience working in the entertainment industry. Experience working with a global catalog, consumer-facing experiences, and creative content. Interest in Machine Learning and/or Artificial Intelligence capabilities. Interest in Information Architecture, User Experience and/or Human Computer Interaction. Experience with Multilingual Taxonomies. Experience with DAMS and/or MAMS. Familiarity with Ontologies and Graph Models. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $80,000 - $300,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.
