description: Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. We are looking for experienced financial professionals to join our Contingent Compensation team based in Los Angeles. The Contingent Compensation team handles royalties and profit participations related to the exploitation of our content and related rights including consumer products, experiences, music, and games. We currently have the following opportunities available: - Financial Analyst - Content Participations - Financial Analyst - Consumer Products, Experiences, and Games Royalties The ideal candidate will have a general understanding of royalties or profit participations related to the exploitation of Netflix IP, along with a solid understanding of financial principles. You will work cross-functionally to identify royalty obligations, estimate financial impact, calculate and issue statements, and advise partners. Visit our culture memo and long-term view to learn more about the unique Netflix culture and the opportunity to be part of our team. Responsibilities: You analyze legal agreements, interpret contingent compensation deal terms, and prepare payments and royalty/participation statements based on contractual terms. You are able to develop ad hoc analysis to represent impact to the business (e.g. profitability analysis, financial impact of new deal terms, etc.) You’re comfortable assisting and leading projects of varying complexity. You clearly communicate complex ideas and effectively manage external relationships. This includes conversations with talent representatives and third party distributors to discuss and resolve any inquiries or discrepancies. You participate in efforts to innovate the way we work which includes system development and automation projects. You provide feedback, research industry best practices and implement impactful improvements to your area that demonstrate the capabilities of your team. Qualifications: BA/BS in accounting, finance, business administration or similar degree and/or equivalent combination of education and experience. 5+ years experience with participations, royalties and/or contract management. Background in content, consumer products, live experiences, and/or games is a plus. Strong analytical skills to identify issues and problem-solve effectively. Excellent verbal and written communicator who can build strong working relationships with a diverse group of cross-functional business partners. Able to provide world-class customer service to internal stakeholders and external partners. Self-motivated, quick-thinking and adaptable to change. You thrive in a fast-paced and demanding environment, possess a high level of intellectual curiosity, and demonstrate strong judgment in the face of ambiguity. Understand, advocate, and embody the company's values and team goals. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $50,000 - $240,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service, with 270 million paid memberships in over 190 countries, enjoying TV series, documentaries, feature films and games across various genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any internet-connected screen. Members can play, pause, and resume watching, all without commercials or commitments. It’s a fantastic opportunity to join a global team with cross-functional partners sharing the goal of improving user functionality and system stability on our applications. N-Tech: Technology Experience Specialists (TES) use their technical knowledge and experience to provide technology support to users, converting information and learning from interactions to prioritise actionable understandings of the holistic user experience. As a Technology Experience Specialist, you play a critical role in supporting Netflix staff and external partners and their engagement with technology by examining user friction and gathering relevant information while thoroughly documenting the thought process and overall process around the experience. This begins the process of working with partner teams to improve the overall technology experience and permanently resolve recurring issues. Responsibilities Serve as the primary point of contact for users seeking technical assistance across various applications and services. Prioritise and manage technical issues, triage/research bugs, be a part of incident/outage management workflows, escalate issues to appropriate partner groups, and develop/sustain robust documentation to create a positive knowledge base experience. Recognise and connect patterns in how users experience technology across 1st and 3rd party technologies by composing bug reports when needed. Responsible for learning how users experience technology through investigation, documentation, and categorisation of interactions with a focus on trends and contact reasoning Recommend and/or implement experience improvements, make feature requests, bring to attention opportunities to create self-service solutions, as well as productivity enhancements Identify and link ZenDesk tickets that show a pattern of behaviour/user friction, curate the stories of the patterns, and maintain the health of the User Experience Jira space Ensure that our users interact with us at the highest quality technical support partnership while engaging in our organisation's strategy to learn from user experience Actively participate and contribute to efforts designed to improve how users experience both technology and support at/or working with Netflix Engage and work with our global team as part of an overall user journey experience team, gathering important information, data, and context to bridge the user experience and partner teams, using compassionate and thoughtful feedback/ideas Work to ensure Netflix’s commitment to fostering an inclusive environment is demonstrated in every facet of our efforts Create an inspiring, empowering, collaborative, and supportive team environment, leading by example and flexing to roll up your sleeves and support the team as needed You have the flexibility to work evening and weekend hours, at times Skills & Experience 5+ years of relevant experience related to IT support, application support and technical troubleshooting (preferably in a multinational context) Critical thinking skills to troubleshoot, research, and diagnose complicated technical issues by utilising available systems and tools Robust documentation mindset, translating the information into knowledge-base articles and/or user stories Able to proactively seek out opportunities to improve our user experiences and deliver cohesive ideas around innovative support strategies and application design considerations Strong communication skills with demonstrated ability to engage with users through various ingestion points and communication platforms, including the ability for direct (virtual) interaction with stakeholders as part of your investigation around a particular technology friction and the user experience Consistently developing your skill set while seeking out opportunities to learn Collaborative through listening, seeking to understand, and supporting Fluency in English (business level) and additional European Language We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

  • Serve as the primary point of contact for users seeking technical assistance across various applications and services. 
  • Prioritise and manage technical issues, triage/research bugs, be a part of incident/outage management workflows, escalate issues to appropriate partner groups, and develop/sustain robust documentation to create a positive knowledge base experience.
  • Recognise and connect patterns in how users experience technology across 1st and 3rd party technologies by composing bug reports when needed.
  • Responsible for learning how users experience technology through investigation, documentation, and categorisation of interactions with a focus on trends and contact reasoning 
  • Recommend and/or implement experience improvements, make feature requests, bring to attention opportunities to create self-service solutions, as well as productivity enhancements
  • Identify and link ZenDesk tickets that show a pattern of behaviour/user friction, curate the stories of the patterns, and maintain the health of the User Experience Jira space
  • Ensure that our users interact with us at the highest quality technical support partnership while engaging in our organisation's strategy to learn from user experience
  • Actively participate and contribute to efforts designed to improve how users experience both technology and support at/or working with Netflix
  • Engage and work with our global team as part of an overall user journey experience team, gathering important information, data, and context to bridge the user experience and partner teams, using compassionate and thoughtful feedback/ideas 
  • Work to ensure Netflix’s commitment to fostering an inclusive environment is demonstrated in every facet of our efforts
  • Create an inspiring, empowering, collaborative, and supportive team environment, leading by example and flexing to roll up your sleeves and support the team as needed
  • You have the flexibility to work evening and weekend hours, at times
    • Skills & Experience
  • 5+ years of relevant experience related to IT support, application support and technical troubleshooting (preferably in a multinational context)
  • Critical thinking skills to troubleshoot, research, and diagnose complicated technical issues by utilising available systems and tools 
  • Robust documentation mindset, translating the information into knowledge-base articles and/or user stories
  • Able to proactively seek out opportunities to improve our user experiences and deliver cohesive ideas around innovative support strategies and application design considerations
  • Strong communication skills with demonstrated ability to engage with users through various ingestion points and communication platforms, including the ability for direct (virtual) interaction with stakeholders as part of your investigation around a particular technology friction and the user experience
  • Consistently developing your skill set while seeking out opportunities to learn
  • Collaborative through listening, seeking to understand, and supporting
  • Fluency in English (business level) and additional European Language
    • We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: Netflix is one of the world's leading streaming entertainment services with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, feature films, live events, and mobile games across a wide variety of genres and languages.  As our entertainment slate continues to grow, we must scale the technology solutions we use to manage content and data to meet the changing needs of the business. The goal of the Title & Launch Management team is to enable operational and creative excellence in the distribution and promotion of our content, ads, and games. Our work directly enables the launch of high-quality content on our service and helps our members discover titles they will love. We are looking for an experienced design leader to manage the design team responsible for these critical enterprise applications that help us ensure our titles are launched accurately, on-time, and at scale. In this role, you'll collaborate closely with several cross-functional leaders while managing a talented and diverse remote design team. You’ll help your teams design and build applications that ensure flawless global delivery, accurate tagging and data that powers personalization, innovative solutions that control how we distribute our titles on our platform, and much more. These are critical B2B applications, so experience with (and passion for) working on enterprise applications is essential. This role can be based in our Los Angeles or Los Gatos offices. There is also the option to be based remotely from the West Coast/PST working hours. Expect to travel monthly to meet with your teams, stakeholders, and partners. Key Responsibilities Collaborate closely with your Product, Engineering, Data Science, and Operations leadership partners to plan and execute our product roadmaps. Develop and nurture relationships with our global stakeholders, learn the nuances of their workflows, and ensure your team is designing and shipping impactful and cohesive product experiences that meet our stakeholders’ needs. Balance being a passionate advocate for our users while pushing your teams towards efficient operational excellence. Manage and coach your design leadership team by helping them navigate the complexity and ambiguity of our business areas. Keep your teams inspired and engaged by providing clear direction that looks towards the future while creating actionable steps that are impactful today. Skills, Characteristics & Qualifications 5+ years of experience successfully leading and scaling high-performance design teams. Demonstrated passion for B2B2C / Enterprise related user problems and a successful track record of shipping impactful products at a global scale. Experience collaborating closely with cross-functional stakeholders, helping drive alignment between design and your cross-functional partners, and building strong relationships across business areas. Comfortable working with ambiguity - ability to bring rigorous design thinking and operational structure to complex and evolving problem spaces. Exceptional communication skills, in writing and verbally, whether in small group discussions, large-scale presentations, or with executives. Ability to inspire, lead, and engage your design team, leaning in and giving them critical business context, feedback, and direction. Bring a balanced perspective and thoughtful decision-making to strategic discussions, advocating for both user-centricity and needs of the business with your teams and your peers. Bonus Experience working in the entertainment industry and a deep understanding of media workflowsPassion for storytelling and filmmaking. Courage when asked to join team karaoke 🎤😜 Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $270,000 - $700,000 . Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: Netflix is one of the world’s leading entertainment services with over 270 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. About the Photo & Audio Visual (AV) Studio team The Photo & AV Studio team has the enviable position of straddling two worlds in the entertainment industry: Photo & AV asset creation and global communication strategy. We specialize in capturing and creating photo & video assets that shape, enhance and support our publicity campaigns for our Netflix content including Series, Films, and Documentaries. Simply put, we produce content that compels people to watch our shows through various media. About the Role We’re looking for a senior creative storyteller with an editorial, creative and/or entertainment background to be based close to one of our production hubs. The role requires a high level of creativity, innovation and an ability to identify creative solutions and efficiencies at scale. A successful candidate will be self-motivated, a succinct communicator with the ability to start and drive innovative initiatives at scale, as well as someone who has a deep passion for investing and fostering team development. This role is highly cross functional working with Publicity, Marketing, Product, and global Photo & AV Studio leadership to provide best in class photography and on-set video content from our TV and films to create stories press and consumers alike can’t stop talking about. Responsibilities of the role: Manage an agile team of Photo and Audio Video specialists across APAC Be a regional creative and editorial expert, to guide your team in driving innovative visual storytelling strategy based on title and talent insights as well as the evolving external media landscape Identify opportunities for creative inspiration and learnings to ensure team members across countries and regions have access to new ways of thinking in order to support continued team and skill development Provide regional oversight on operational strategies and creative output by being a connection within the global Photo & AV Studio leadership team to drive APAC needs globally while adopting global best practices locally Collaborate with global partners in creating and championing better ways of asset creation, management, and storage in order to find scale without losing local or creative nuance Develop relationships across functions beyond PR e.g. Product, Production, Marketing identifying opportunities for greater collaboration and/or efficiencies Skills & Requirements: 12-15+ years experience working across visual asset creation, publishing, publicity and/or entertainment Deep background in leading diverse creative and/or editorial teams and growing those teams from a “start-up” phase to more established organizations Strong people manager who can lead through context and not control Must possess solid organizational skills, model effective time management and deliver consistently excellent verbal and written communications across internal and external teams Strong creative eye with a keen understanding of visual storytelling in the service of audience-first communication Must be able to work independently, make sound decisions-exercising judgment, think strategically, and maintain accuracy and attention to detail Experience working with TV/film productions, talent, filmmakers and with publicity teams Understand and interest in copyright laws, usage licenses and embargoes Understand the photography/video industry and preferably with networks in each Strong knowledge in creative digital assets formats and asset management Extensive knowledge of Adobe Suite including Photoshop and Pro is preferred Fluency in English and ideally, one other Asian language We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status or disability status.   • Manage an agile team of Photo and Audio Video specialists across APAC
  • Be a regional creative and editorial expert, to guide your team in driving innovative visual storytelling strategy based on title and talent insights as well as the evolving external media landscape

  • Provide regional oversight on operational strategies and creative output by being a connection within the global Photo & AV Studio leadership team to drive APAC needs globally while adopting global best practices locally

  • Fluency in English and ideally, one other Asian language

description: Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries. Our mission is to entertain the world and we are constantly innovating to bring the best stories from around the world to our members. With the incredible launch of our ad supported model, we are now working toward providing more choices for consumers and a premium brand experience for advertisers. Netflix is seeking an Account Manager who will be an exceptional addition to our growing Netflix Ads team.  The Account Manager will be responsible for leading the pre-to-post sale campaign execution workflow as a strategic partner to Netflix Sales Partner(s).   Our Account Managers will partner with clients and sales on RFP responses, media plan generation, campaign execution and monitoring delivery performance to ensure flawless execution and excellent client service. Familiarity with Advertising Research and Verification vendors like Nielsen, ComScore, Moat, Integral Ad Science, DoubleVerify, Kantar, etc. If you have a passion for entertainment and a desire to work in a fast-paced, innovative environment, we would love to hear from you. Tokyo, Japan Products & Technology Advertising Account Manager - Japan Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries. Our mission is to entertain the world and we are constantly innovating to bring the best stories from around the world to our members. With the incredible launch of our ad supported model, we are now working toward providing more choices for consumers and a premium brand experience for advertisers.  Netflix is seeking an Account Manager who will be an exceptional addition to our growing Netflix Ads team.  The Account Manager will be responsible for leading the pre-to-post sale campaign execution workflow as a strategic partner to Netflix Sales Partner(s).   Our Account Managers will partner with clients and sales on RFP responses, media plan generation, campaign execution and monitoring delivery performance to ensure flawless execution and excellent client service.   Key Responsibilities:
  • Partner with aligned Agency Sales Partners to understand client goals and objectives in order to deliver excellent customer service
  • Host weekly Pipeline & Pacing meetings with Agency Sales Partners to align on upcoming launches and active campaign performance 
  • Build Media Plans and contribute to RFP responses around campaign packaging, pricing, targeting, etc. 
  • Host campaign kick-off meetings and partner with client on gathering campaign launch assets 
  • Partner with cross-functional teams on the production of custom creative assets  
  • Work closely with Ad Operations for flawless order implementation and technical troubleshooting
  • Responsible for overseeing the delivery performance of Ad Campaigns and partnering with clients on necessary campaign optimization tactics 
  • Provide clients with necessary campaign performance including post-campaign wrap reports 
  • Ability to navigate campaign escalations and contribute to long-term solutions to prevent similar issues in the future
  • Maintain an in-depth understanding of our ad products, sponsorship offerings, targeting capabilities and ad policies 
  • Contribute to monthly billing & invoicing  process with clients and finance 
  • Establish strong working relationships with client and agency partners

  • 4 years of experience in Account Management and/or Sales Planning functions in the digital media industry, with a focus on video advertising
  • Fluency in Japanese and English is required
  • Experience working in Sales Operation systems (CRM, OMS, Ad Servers) 
  • Knowledge of digital media sales and marketplaces including Direct IO, Programmatic Guaranteed and PMP advertising
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills 
  • Strong analytical and strategic thinking abilities with the ability to make data digestible for cross-functional stakeholders
  • Proven project management skills with ability to multitask and manage requests from various stakeholders.
  • Familiarity with Advertising Research and Verification vendors like Nielsen, ComScore, Moat, Integral Ad Science, DoubleVerify, Kantar, etc.

Seoul, South Korea Products & Technology Advertising Account Manager - Korea Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries. Our mission is to entertain the world and we are constantly innovating to bring the best stories from around the world to our members. With the incredible launch of our ad supported model, we are now working toward providing more choices for consumers and a premium brand experience for advertisers.  Netflix is seeking an Account Manager who will be an exceptional addition to our growing Netflix Ads team.  The Account Manager will be responsible for leading the pre-to-post sale campaign execution workflow as a strategic partner to Netflix Sales Partner(s).   Our Account Managers will partner with clients and sales on RFP responses, media plan generation, campaign execution and monitoring delivery performance to ensure flawless execution and excellent client service.   Key Responsibilities:
  • Partner with aligned Agency Sales Partners to understand client goals and objectives in order to deliver excellent customer service
  • Host weekly Pipeline & Pacing meetings with Agency Sales Partners to align on upcoming launches and active campaign performance 
  • Build Media Plans and contribute to RFP responses around campaign packaging, pricing, targeting, etc. 
  • Host campaign kick-off meetings and partner with client on gathering campaign launch assets 
  • Partner with cross-functional teams on the production of custom creative assets  
  • Work closely with Ad Operations for flawless order implementation and technical troubleshooting
  • Responsible for overseeing the delivery performance of Ad Campaigns and partnering with clients on necessary campaign optimization tactics 
  • Provide clients with necessary campaign performance including post-campaign wrap reports 
  • Ability to navigate campaign escalations and contribute to long-term solutions to prevent similar issues in the future
  • Maintain an in-depth understanding of our ad products, sponsorship offerings, targeting capabilities and ad policies 
  • Contribute to monthly billing & invoicing  process with clients and finance 
  • Establish strong working relationships with client and agency partners
    • We’re Looking for:
  • 4 years of experience in Account Management and/or Sales Planning functions in the digital media industry, with a focus on video advertising
  • Experience working in Sales Operation systems (CRM, OMS, Ad Servers) 
  • Knowledge of digital media sales and marketplaces including Direct IO, Programmatic Guaranteed and PMP advertising
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills 
  • Strong analytical and strategic thinking abilities with the ability to make data digestible for cross-functional stakeholders
  • Proven project management skills with ability to multitask and manage requests from various stakeholders.
  • Familiarity with Advertising Research and Verification vendors like Nielsen, ComScore, Moat, Integral Ad Science, DoubleVerify, Kantar, etc. 
    • If you have a passion for entertainment and a desire to work in a fast-paced, innovative environment, we would love to hear from you. Come join us and help us entertain the world! We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status or disability status. 넷플릭스는 다양한 경험과 생각을 가진 구성원이 모였을 때 최고의 성과를 내는 팀을 만들어 갈 수 있다고 믿고 있습니다. 다양성과 포용성은 우리가 지향하는 기업 문화의 핵심 중 하나이며, 이것의 궁극적인 목적은 모든 직원이 역량을 마음껏 발휘하고 성장하며 기여할 수 있도록 환경을 조성하는 것입니다.  인재를 선별하는 과정은 이러한 목적을 달성하는 데 매우 중요합니다.  이에 따라 넷플릭스는  성별, 인종, 피부색, 국적, 종교, 성적 지향, 나이, 결혼 여부 등 모든 개인적인 배경과 상관없이 모두에게 평등한 기회를 보장하며, 공정한 과정을 통해 채용을 진행하고 있습니다.장애인 및 국가보훈 대상자는 관련 법령에 따라 우대합니다.

description: Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries. Our mission is to entertain the world and we are constantly innovating to bring the best stories from around the world to our members. With the incredible launch of our ad-supported model, we are now working toward providing more choices for consumers and a premium brand experience for advertisers. As the Sales Partner at Netflix Korea, you will be responsible for helping lead the development and execution of the advertising sales strategy in Korea. You will play a pivotal role in shaping and executing advertising strategies that drive the revenue growth in the highly competitive entertainment industry. You will be at the forefront of our advertising business, managing and nurturing client relationships, while also collaborating with internal teams to create and implement innovative ads campaigns. Your deep understanding of the client's business and the Korean advertising landscape will enable you to deliver tailored, compelling ad experiences that resonate with diverse audiences. Your work will directly contribute to enhancing the visibility of Netflix's vast array of content and reinforcing our position as a leader in the streaming entertainment industry. This role offers a unique opportunity to make a significant impact in a dynamic, fast-paced environment that values creativity, collaboration, and results. The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of the advertising ecosystem in an established network of relationships, and a track record of delivering revenue growth. Key responsibilities: Develop and execute sales strategies for clients and agencies to meet revenue targets and exceed client expectations. Cultivate and manage robust relationships with key decision-makers at top Korean brands and agencies in order to secure enduring advertising partnerships and promote revenue growth. Craft compelling, data-driven sales presentations that highlight the unique value proposition of Netflix's premium offerings. Negotiate and finalize advertising deals, ensuring mutually beneficial outcomes for both Netflix and our brand partners. Manage and maintain a solid pipeline of prospective clients, nurture existing relationships, and identify new opportunities for growth. Collaborate with external advertising partners to collectively expand the advertising business. Work in tandem with cross-functional teams to ensure the successful delivery of advertising campaigns that are in alignment with the client's marketing objectives and strategies. Leverage Netflix's unique audience insights and premium content offerings to drive revenue growth. Analyze market trends and competitor activities, identifying opportunities for innovation and growth in the advertising industry. We're looking for: 8+ years of advertising sales experience Fluency in Korean and English is required for this role Proven strategic thinker with the ability to analyze data and translate it into specific and measurable tactics, actions, and outcomes Highly skilled in negotiating and selling the intrinsic value of a premium offering to customers Problem solver with the ability to collaborate and work across functions Strategic planning and prospecting skills necessary Understanding of how our clients set priorities and performance goals, and how we can align our product portfolio to best fulfill those needs Excellent written, verbal and interpersonal communication skills Ability to multitask, make decisions and manage at entrepreneurial speed Strong, confident presentation skills Interest in our corporate culture (read our memo here) If you have a passion for entertainment and a desire to work in a fast-paced, innovative environment, we would love to hear from you. Come join us and help us entertain the world! We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status or disability status. 넷플릭스는 다양한 경험과 생각을 가진 구성원이 모였을 때 최고의 성과를 내는 팀을 만들어 갈 수 있다고 믿고 있습니다. 다양성과 포용성은 우리가 지향하는 기업 문화의 핵심 중 하나이며, 이것의 궁극적인 목적은 모든 직원이 역량을 마음껏 발휘하고 성장하며 기여할 수 있도록 환경을 조성하는 것입니다.  인재를 선별하는 과정은 이러한 목적을 달성하는 데 매우 중요합니다.  이에 따라 넷플릭스는  성별, 인종, 피부색, 국적, 종교, 성적 지향, 나이, 결혼 여부 등 모든 개인적인 배경과 상관없이 모두에게 평등한 기회를 보장하며, 공정한 과정을 통해 채용을 진행하고 있습니다.장애인 및 국가보훈 대상자는 관련 법령에 따라 우대합니다.

description: This position is part of our Global Talent Operations Center (GTOC) team which runs the infrastructure to deliver an outstanding talent experience from hire to retire. This role will be a key player in the evolution of our enablement function. You are expected to understand and establish connections between various programs and processes within our Talent team and ensure their effective operation. Collaborating closely with our Talent Operations team, you will identify, measure, and rank projects according to priority. Utilizing your expertise in project management and process enhancement, you will spearhead cross-functional projects aimed at enhancing our operational efficiency. What you will support: Act as the GTOC representative for new program launches and cyclical programs across Talent, managing the intake of new global projects, overseeing program enhancements, evaluating project feasibility, and assigning resources. Champion process improvement by identifying and implementing opportunities for streamlining, automation, and enhancement, and by integrating GTOC services into other business units’ workflows. Serve as the primary point of contact across different time zones for all global project-related queries and coordination, rapidly troubleshooting any functional and technical issues in collaboration with HR, end users, and partner teams. Track and analyze Talent Operations KPIs to propose actionable enhancements and monitor process efficiency while ensuring adherence to the control landscape and acting as a point of contact for internal and external stakeholders. Collaborate with Global Talent Operations Center Leaders and Program and Project leads to enhance the overall delivery of the shared service center, manage the center-wide project agenda, and address service center issues proactively. Drive a continuous improvement agenda by setting efficiency directions, identifying automation opportunities, designing solutions, and overseeing their implementation. Define, manage, and deliver the Shared Services training agenda, ensuring effective training documentation management. Oversee the management and publishing of performance reporting dashboards, analyzing the delivery performance of the people services organization and identifying recurring issues. Handle the intake process of new procedures to be transferred to the GTOC team and oversee the development, distribution, and collection of responses for employee experience satisfaction surveys. To be successful, you are: Experienced in HR systems and project management, with a minimum of 4+ years, and proficient in Workday (employee lifecycle management transactions, data accuracy controls, and mass upload execution). Skilled in project planning and development, project execution and control, ensuring that project tasks are completed on time and on budget. Proficient in quality control, ensuring project deliverables meet quality standards and stakeholder needs. You manage stakeholder involvement, expectations, and communication effectively. Proficient in process mapping concepts and tools like Microsoft Visio, Lucidchart, or other similar software. You have proven hands-on experience in creating, analyzing, and optimizing process maps. Possess a continuous improvement mindset, constantly seeking to utilize process mapping and other analytical tools to drive process improvement and operational efficiency. You're proficient in tools that eliminate manual steps from HR processes by automating and integrating them for greater operational efficiency. Successful in collaborating and providing ongoing support to the Talent team, identifying and resolving customer needs, and contributing to the best employee experience. Possess strong analytical skills with the ability to analyze complex data, identify project risks, and formulate action plans. You have knowledge of using different sources of data (e.g., surveys, interviews, focus groups) and basic concepts in statistics (e.g., descriptive statistics, correlation) and measurement (e.g., reliability, validity). Preferred Qualifications: Agile project management skills: Certification in Agile methodologies (i.e., CSM, SAFe) is highly desirable. Lean Six Sigma Experience: Familiarity with Lean Six Sigma principles and methodologies is highly desirable. This includes knowledge and experience in process improvement, waste reduction, and variation reduction. Change Management skills: Familiarity or certification in change management principles. Interpersonal Skills: Exceptional negotiation and conflict-resolution skills. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: ABOUT NETFLIX: Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. THE OPPORTUNITY: The Netflix Marketing Legal team is seeking a talented and passionate lawyer to join our team of counsel and contract managers to provide legal support across Netflix’s Marketing, Publicity, Communications and Marketing partnerships teams. KEY RESPONSIBILITIES: In this role, the successful candidate will work closely with other members of the Marketing legal team as well as cross functional legal and business teams, including Advertising, Consumer Products, Intellectual Property, Business and Legal Affairs, Labor, Privacy, Employment and Product Legal, to perform the following functions: manage/update templates, draft and negotiate marketing and marketing production-related agreements including MSAs/SOWs, PSAs, participant releases, talent/influencer agreements, event/venue agreements, licensing and promotion agreements; prepare promotion terms and conditions including official rules for sweepstakes/contests; advise on marketing campaigns and activations including risk assessment and clearances; conduct rights analysis for licensor, talent and third party rights and approvals; provide advice on compliance with laws and regulatory matters; and prepare memos and guidance documents and conduct trainings to help increase legal acumen across teams. This is a great opportunity for a junior attorney to join our Marketing Legal team while learning, growing, and developing specialized industry knowledge and skills along the way. This role is based in Los Angeles, CA and reports into the Head of Marketing Legal UCAN. The ideal candidate will be intellectually curious, demonstrate great initiative, and be excited and inspired by the Netflix culture . WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR: 2+ years of relevant experience as a lawyer, ideally including experience working in marketing/advertising. Entertainment experience is also a plus. Ability to work autonomously and reliably within tight timeframes in a fast-paced, high-performance environment Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills (both oral and written) Strong analytical capabilities and ability to exercise sound judgment in the absence of perfect information Ability to take initiative to identify and solve problems in a business-friendly and solutions-oriented manner Ability to think strategically, commercially and practically Excellent organizational and time management skills with an ability to multitask, prioritize and meet deadlines Strategic interest and outlook High degree of professional ethics and integrity Flexibility to work across various projects and teams Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $70,000 - $350,000 Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: Netflix At Netflix, we want to entertain the world and, over the last few years, have been expanding our offerings to products like Live and Games. We aspire to connect our members with a variety of high-quality games that they’ll enjoy, starting with mobile but expanding to additional devices through the cloud. We make games for all members, with the conviction that everyone can have fun in a game if we put the right experience in front of them. We want Netflix to be a global top-5 game company, known as much for its great games as its awesome shows and movies. The Role This role will work closely with the Infrastructure Engineering, Game Experience Engineering, Product, and Games Studios to ensure we are delivering efficient, scalable, and reliable game streaming infrastructure that is a core part of our Cloud Games program. We are looking for an experienced technical program manager who can partner closely with engineering managers, engineers, product managers, and other technical program managers to execute complex technical programs. If you’re looking for a technical and highly dynamic opportunity that will have an outsized impact on the future of software engineering at Netflix, we’d love to talk to you! What you will do: Build and manage the roadmap, in collaboration with technical teams (including Engineering, Product, Data Science, Game Studio, etc), that focus on building a highly efficient, scalable, reliable, and secure infrastructure Leverage deep knowledge and functional expertise to drive road mapping, execution planning and cross-functional alignment across multiple stakeholder groups. Craft and drive engagement with partners, work to decompose requirements into technical execution plans with multiple engineering teams, track progress towards goals, and report status to product, customers, and technical leadership. Champion breaking out annual goals into measurable milestones while proactively managing risks, blockers, and delays. Manage cross-functional dependencies, risks, and changes effectively by optimizing scope, schedule, and resources accordingly. What we are looking for: You have domain expertise in one of the following areas: server infrastructure, distributed systems, game performance optimization You are highly skilled, experienced, and enjoy orchestrating programs with many moving parts - people, needs, and technologies You have an ability to identify gaps in solutions, debate technical approaches and weigh-in on product vs technology tradeoffs You aren’t afraid to get your hands dirty, pulling data to provide insight, debug issues, and monitor system health You have a data driven mindset in your decision making You have a deep understanding and point of view within your technical domain(s) of expertise. Basic Qualifications: 10+ years of experience driving large scale SW projects with engineering and product teams 4+ years of software engineering, systems engineering or technical product/program management experience Experience managing projects across cross functional teams, building sustainable processes and coordinating release schedules Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including clear articulation of business impact and technical constraints tailored to the audience Self-starter who enjoys tackling 0 to 1 problem spaces and quickly bringing organization and direction Additive Qualifications: Experience in cloud gaming and/or distributed systems Location of work: Our organization has a distributed team across the US. We are considering candidates who are willing to relocate to Los Gatos, California. The expectation is that candidates will work during core Pacific Standard Time business hours. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top-of-market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $240,000 - $725,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more details about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.
search_text:
Los Gatos, California Products & Technology Core Engineering Technical Program Manager L6 - Cloud Games Netflix At Netflix, we want to entertain the world and, over the last few years, have been expanding our offerings to products like Live and Games. We aspire to connect our members with a variety of high-quality games that they’ll enjoy, starting with mobile but expanding to additional devices through the cloud. We make games for all members, with the conviction that everyone can have fun in a game if we put the right experience in front of them. We want Netflix to be a global top-5 game company, known as much for its great games as its awesome shows and movies.   The Role This role will work closely with the Infrastructure Engineering, Game Experience Engineering, Product, and Games Studios to ensure we are delivering efficient, scalable, and reliable game streaming infrastructure that is a core part of our Cloud Games program. We are looking for an experienced technical program manager who can partner closely with engineering managers, engineers, product managers, and other technical program managers to execute complex technical programs. If you’re looking for a technical and highly dynamic opportunity that will have an outsized impact on the future of software engineering at Netflix, we’d love to talk to you! What you will do:
  • Build and manage the roadmap, in collaboration with technical teams (including Engineering, Product, Data Science, Game Studio, etc), that focus on building a highly efficient, scalable, reliable, and secure infrastructure
  • Leverage deep knowledge and functional expertise to drive road mapping, execution planning and cross-functional alignment across multiple stakeholder groups.
  • Craft and drive engagement with partners, work to decompose requirements into technical execution plans with multiple engineering teams, track progress towards goals, and report status to product, customers, and technical leadership.
  • Champion breaking out annual goals into measurable milestones while proactively managing risks, blockers, and delays.
  • Manage cross-functional dependencies, risks, and changes effectively by optimizing scope, schedule, and resources accordingly.
    • What we are looking for:
  • You have domain expertise in one of the following areas: server infrastructure, distributed systems, game performance optimization
  • You are highly skilled, experienced, and enjoy orchestrating programs with many moving parts - people, needs, and technologies
  • You have an ability to identify gaps in solutions, debate technical approaches and weigh-in on product vs technology tradeoffs
  • You aren’t afraid to get your hands dirty, pulling data to provide insight, debug issues, and monitor system health
  • You have a data driven mindset in your decision making
  • You have a deep understanding and point of view within your technical domain(s) of expertise. 
    • Basic Qualifications:
  • 10+ years of experience driving large scale SW projects with engineering and product teams
  • 4+ years of software engineering, systems engineering or technical product/program management experience
  • Experience managing projects across cross functional teams, building sustainable processes and coordinating release schedules
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including clear articulation of business impact and technical constraints tailored to the audience
  • Self-starter who enjoys tackling 0 to 1 problem spaces and quickly bringing organization and direction
    • Additive Qualifications:
  • Experience in cloud gaming and/or distributed systems
    • Location of work: Our organization has a distributed team across the US. We are considering candidates who are willing to relocate to Los Gatos, California. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top-of-market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $240,000 - $725,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more details about our Benefits here. Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here. description: THE OPPORTUNITY Netflix seeks a seasoned and intellectually-curious business and legal affairs executive to join our team based in Singapore. This role will handle business and legal affairs for our Chinese-language content initiative that licenses and commissions Chinese-language films and series for Netflix’s global streaming service. The successful candidate will serve as a key collaborator to Netflix’s Chinese-language content team, and will be responsible for providing clear, actionable, and strategic business and legal affairs advice to drive business objectives. Additionally, they will be responsible for structuring, negotiating, drafting, and closing content deals; providing production legal support for Chinese-language films and series; and building and managing internal and external relationships with key content and production partners. The ideal candidate is excited and inspired by Netflix culture and welcomes the opportunity to be part of an entrepreneurial, global organization. They are comfortable working proactively and making decisions that have both business and legal impact. This is a demanding, fast-paced role that requires curiosity and significant initiative. This position will be based in Singapore with periodic international travel, including to Netflix’s office in Taiwan. REQUIREMENTS The successful candidate must have fluency in English and Mandarin, with the ability to communicate confidently and effectively in both languages. Demonstrated business-level written proficiency in Chinese is required. This person must have experience advising on business and legal issues in the entertainment, media, and/or intellectual property industries. Experience in the Chinese-language film or television industry (in licensing, production, financing, and/or distribution) is highly preferred. The successful candidate will also possess the following: Ability to take initiative and work independently Ability to work on a high volume of assignments under tight timeframes in a fast-paced environment and to prioritize accordingly Curiosity and willingness to tackle matters outside their area of expertise Strong written and verbal communication skills (candor, honesty, tact) Ability to work closely with and manage outside counsel Ability to work effectively and collaboratively cross-functionally Ability to think practically and be solution-oriented Adaptable negotiation style Responsibilities include but are not limited to: Serving as business partner and key collaborator to Chinese-language content executives. Providing clear, actionable, and strategic business and legal affairs advice. Deal structuring and contract drafting and negotiation in Chinese, with a focus on content licensing and acquisition and on original content development and production Conducting industry and territory-specific research Working cross-functionally to maintain alignment between departments We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

description: Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films, and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause, and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. We’ve recently introduced a new ad-supported plan, offering a more affordable price point for customers. To support this exciting new area of the business, we are building out the Financial Planning & Analysis team to lead the budgeting, forecasting, and financial planning for this exciting new initiative. We are currently looking for a Manager to lead Financial Planning & Analysis for our Ads business in the LatAm region. In this role you will have the opportunity to learn and grow quickly in this space, collaborating closely with a highly cross-functional and global team. This role will work closely with the Netflix Ads LatAm leadership team to oversee short and long-term planning for ads revenue and expenses across Sales, Operations, Measurement, and other supporting functions. Furthermore, you'll collaborate with the global Ads finance and strategy team in Los Angeles, consolidating the complete financial outlook for the business. The ideal candidate is a selfless, curious, passionate leader with exceptional analytical, financial modeling, and communication skills.  We are looking for someone who can drive financial planning with a strategic lens. This role demands comfort with ambiguity, collaborative problem-solving, and the capability to manage complex work streams with multiple stakeholders. Visit our culture memo and long-term view to learn more about the unique Netflix culture and the opportunity to be part of our team. The position reports to the regional FP&A leader located in LatAm and coordinates closely with the global head of Ads FP&A located in Los Angeles. Responsibilities will include: Oversee short and long-term financial and headcount planning covering the full ads business P&L (i.e. revenue through expenses) for the LatAm region. Coordination with Ads Strategy, Planning & Analysis colleagues to model and consolidate the financial impact of product, plan, and pricing changes. Perform ad hoc financial analyses to deliver insights, and facilitate trade-off discussions, scenario plans, opportunity size, etc. Create insightful presentations to summarize analyses and facilitate decision-making. Ownership of our financial projections and assumptions in planning systems including Anaplan, Workday, Essbase, Tableau Develop KPIs, metrics, and dashboards to track the ongoing impact of Ads business. Creation, standardization, and automation of management reporting in dashboards, reports, & templates. Building strong relationships with a wide group of stakeholders (Ad Sales & Ops, Data Science, Accounting, Talent Acquisition/HR, etc.). and being able to effectively communicate financial tracking/impact. Qualifications 8+ years of experience in a fast-paced, highly analytical environment. Prior experience in advertising FP&A, management consulting, and strategic finance in tech or high-growth startups is preferred. Experience building & refining financial reporting processes, with high ambiguity and shifting requirements. Strong modeling skills and comfort with manipulating large datasets in Excel, Google Sheets, Tableau, and other data visualization tools. Candidates must be motivated, disciplined, flexible, able to work autonomously, and perform tasks with a wide range of difficulties. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with proven ability to build successful relationships and partners at all levels. Very strong project management, planning, & organizational skills, including the ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously, and deliver work under tight timelines. A strong attention to detail with strong judgment on when to apply the 80/20 rule to address problems. Familiarity with financial systems such as Workday, Essbase, Anaplan, sales incentive compensation, and general knowledge of the streaming advertising and ad tech ecosystem is a plus, though not required.

description: Netflix is one of the world’s leading entertainment services with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans any time. The Team You’ll be Joining: Photo & AV Studio The Photo & AV Studio team has the enviable position of straddling two worlds in the entertainment industry: photo & AV asset creation & global communication strategy. We specialise in capturing and creating photo & video assets that shape, enhance and support our publicity campaigns for our Netflix Original content including series, films, and documentaries. Simply put, we produce the content that compels people to watch our shows through earned media! The Role What photos will ensure a magazine spread? What video will get audiences and publishers excited about a new show? How do we make a talking head interview visually pop? How can we be smart and tell different stories across different countries through visual assets. These are just some of the opportunities you’ll be delivering in this role. We are looking for a seasoned, Photo & AV Studio Manager a strategic individual to support on PR campaigns, driven by A/V materials, for Netflix titles - photography, videos, the next big thing. Our content stands out and makes an impact on the industry and consumers alike, compelling them to watch Netflix content. The role requires a high level of creativity, an inquisitive, innovative and self motivated personality, and a succinct communicator with a strong project management background. Being a team player with a positive attitude and willingness to be flexible and get the job done is essential, as is the ability to strategically plan and execute multiple projects simultaneously. You’ll be working with TV/film productions, talent, filmmakers and publicity events as part of the Netflix PR team in the Nordics region. Building relationships as well as working autonomously in a fast paced environment will be key to success. We don’t focus on job titles at Netflix but hire outstanding high performers who act responsibly on the resources and freedom they are given to do their work. The ideal candidate will use sound judgement to make wise decisions, think strategically and drive their colleagues to do the same. Read our culture memo to learn more. This job is based in Sweden. Responsibilities of the role include: Develop and execute strategy for the Nordics region, per project/title, to capture, produce and utilise creative material to enhance and support the publicity campaign throughout its lifecycle Lead on a slate of projects that include several original series, films, documentaries, docu-series and comedy specials Drive communication with your regional campaign publicist counterpart, marketing/social teams, showrunners/filmmakers and talent reps. Hire and oversee unit photographers and video crews, including script and schedule review and communication with production Produce strong creative materials that shape and enhance the overall publicity campaign Oversee photography/video needs for premieres, events and photo shoots Budget Management Skills and Requirements: 10+ years experience working across visual asset creation, collaborating closely with publicity, publishing or communications within the Nordics region Understand the photography/video industry. Strong knowledge in digital file specs & size formats Fluency in Swedish and English (other Nordic languages a plus) Strong eye for producing visual assets Understand and interest in copyright laws, usage licenses and embargoes Experience handling high volume of complex projects and tasks for multiple people and departments simultaneously and manage competing priorities Possess solid organizational, effective time management and excellent verbal and written communication skills to communicate effectively with internal and external teams Must be able to work independently, make sound decisions, think strategically, and maintain accuracy and attention to detail Experience working in a global team is preferred, but not essential Is someone committed to creating more inclusive spaces in advertising, passionate about fostering diversity within their primary network of partners, agencies, production companies etc. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

In this exciting new role, you will report to the Director of Finance Program Management and be a part of building the recently established Program Management Office (PMO). In addition to leading complex initiatives in support of the Finance transformation journey, you will help establish project management guidelines and practices to ensure effective, efficient, high-quality delivery that consistently meets or exceeds the expectations of the business. You will handle the business side of multiple projects and will interact with multi-disciplinary and cross-cultural teams at all seniority levels, including leadership. A successful candidate should be able to quickly understand the business and must have excellent communication skills, with strong experience in leading complex projects in a global environment. This is a hybrid position that can be based in either Los Angeles or Los Gatos and offers the flexibility to work remotely part-time. Develop project charters and plans, balance resources, and track timelines & milestones to ensure alignment across project teams on objectives and deliverables. Proactively manage risks and anticipate potential issues that pose a threat to achieving project goals; propose and implement issue or risk-mitigating strategies. Partner with the Finance Product and Technology teams to determine the strategy and execution of the implementation of new systems and integrations for reporting initiatives Drive the strategy on implementing reporting, process, or system improvements across finance working with cross-functional stakeholders throughout the company Stakeholder Management and Business Engagement Cultivate strong stakeholder relationships and maintain effective communication channels. Provide stakeholders with project decisions and milestone tracking. Ensure executive sponsors are informed via status updates and appropriate escalations. Collaborate with Finance business leads, and product, engineering, and technical program managers to deliver solutions that meet or exceed business stakeholders' needs. Manage through others; successfully influence cross-functional team members to achieve project goals. Establish and foster healthy, collaborative working partnerships. Change Management Apply a structured methodology to lead change management activities Develop and ensure execution of change management deliverables (stakeholder analysis, business impact assessment, change adoption strategy, training plans, etc.) Domain Knowledge Order to Cash and Record to Report business processes Experience with external financial reporting a plus Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree required (business or finance preferred) 7+ years in finance or finance systems; with 4+ years finance project or program management Strong knowledge of finance and accounting principles preferred CPA or any professional finance accreditation is a plus Project Management Professional (PMP) certification a plus Experience building and scaling reporting, workflows, or processes for a global team Great communicator who can build strong working relationships with cross-functional and finance teams Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options.   • Cultivate strong stakeholder relationships and maintain effective communication channels. Provide stakeholders with project decisions and milestone tracking. Ensure executive sponsors are informed via status updates and appropriate escalations.
  • Collaborate with Finance business leads, and product, engineering, and technical program managers to deliver solutions that meet or exceed business stakeholders' needs.
  • Manage through others; successfully influence cross-functional team members to achieve project goals.
  • Establish and foster healthy, collaborative working partnerships.
    • Change Management
  • Apply a structured methodology to lead change management activities
  • Develop and ensure execution of change management deliverables (stakeholder analysis, business impact assessment, change adoption strategy, training plans, etc.) 
    • Domain Knowledge
  • Order to Cash and Record to Report business processes
  • Experience with external financial reporting a plus
    • Qualifications:
  • Bachelor’s degree required (business or finance preferred)
  • 7+ years in finance or finance systems; with 4+ years finance project or program management
  • Strong knowledge of finance and accounting principles preferred
  • CPA or any professional finance accreditation is a plus
  • Project Management Professional (PMP) certification a plus
  • Experience building and scaling reporting, workflows, or processes for a global team
  • Great communicator who can build strong working relationships with cross-functional and finance teams

description: Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with 230M+ paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. The Consumer Engineering team builds the industry-leading Netflix iOS, Android, and TV apps. We work with our design and product partners to rapidly experiment with new product ideas . We’re looking for a Software Engineer to drive innovations in the member experience space. This is a high-impact role that enables delivering delightful experiences to Netflix subscribers on the iOS app. Our responsibilities include working on large-scale A/B tests of features - ranging from highly visible product experiences to core infrastructure that enables existing and future innovations. We care deeply about UI performance, quality, and accessibility of the Netflix iOS app. To bring new kinds of engaging and cinematic experiences to life, we partner closely with many cross-functional teams including product management, experience design, and creative production. You will excel if you are product-minded, detail-oriented, and can drive scalable technical solutions that mesh with our business goals. We have a unique culture that allows you to do your best work and grow. About the Role Collaborate with developers and product teams to build delightful, performant, and accessible user experiences. Contribute to product features, core infrastructure and A/B tests using advanced UIKit, Core Animation, and Foundation APIs in Swift. Architect maintainable, performant iOS client code with effective documentation that can be leveraged by other developers. Write automated tests with XCTest and XCUITest frameworks to deliver high quality code. Partner closely with product management to scope projects, with designers to refine UI specifications or collaborate with partner engineering teams on shared infrastructure. What Sets You Apart Curious about a broad range of new or unfamiliar technologies, the consumer base, and product vision. Seek different perspectives, feedback, and relevant information to continuously grow and improve. Maintain strong relationships with cross-functional teams through clear communication. Take a thoughtful, practical approach to problem solving that considers tradeoffs and avoids over-engineering. Comfortable asking questions and seeking knowledge in unfamiliar or ambiguous situations. Endeavor to elevate the knowledge, skills, abilities of yourself and others that is conducive to fostering an inclusive, collaborative environment. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. description: Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with over 230 million paid memberships in over 190 countries. In addition to great shows and movies, our membership also includes exclusive access to a growing portfolio of high-quality games. The games platform team is looking for a Technical Program Manager to strengthen our game software development kit (SDK) and game services capabilities in Netflix’s relatively nascent opportunity in games. The game SDK and services Technical Program Manager will partner closely with product and engineering to drive impactful cross-functional programs both within the games org and across the company. The role requires strong coordination and collaboration with multiple engineering teams in our core games platform team, Netflix Game Studios organization, design, data science, security and others. This role has the direct opportunity to impact the quality, engagement, and satisfaction of our game development partners - and ultimately our members' satisfaction with Netflix games on our product. Responsibilities Leading multiple cross-functional programs, in collaboration with product, engineering, design, and data science. Provide deep domain expertise to form technical strategies with engineering partners. Drive engagement with internal partners, work to decompose requirements into technical execution plans with measurable milestones, effectively optimize scope and schedule, manage cross-functional dependencies, and proactively manage risks. Craft clear communication of progress toward goals, reporting status to stakeholders and leadership. Requirements 10+ years of technical program management experience Deep understanding and experience with game development SDKs and Services Direct experience with game or game platform development is beneficial (TPM, product, development, etc.) Highly skilled, experienced, and enjoys orchestrating multi-organizational impacting software programs with many moving parts Proven experience creating partnerships with cross-functional teams, driving large-scale technical strategies, debating technical approaches, and building long-term scalable solutions Able to identify gaps in solutions  and weigh in on product vs. technology tradeoffs Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to clearly articulate the business impact and technical constraints tailored to the audience Self-starter who enjoys tackling 0 to 1 problem spaces and scaling 1-100, quickly bringing organization and direction Exemplify the Netflix culture by understanding, advocating, and demonstrating its values Location of work: Our organization has a distributed team across the US. We are considering both candidates who are willing to relocate to Los Gatos, California, and fully remote candidates (remote in the US with travel to Netflix HQ). The expectation is that candidates will work during core Pacific Standard Time business hours. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top-of-market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $240,000 - $725,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off.
