description: Netflix, a global leader in Internet entertainment services, entertains over 260 million members across 190 countries. Our members enjoy an extensive range of TV series, documentaries, and feature films across multiple genres and languages. With no commercials or commitments, our members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any Internet-connected screen. As a Full-Stack Engineering Manager at Netflix, your role will be multifaceted. You will be responsible for creating a strong vision, formulating a strategic roadmap, and leading a team of top-tier software engineers. Your main task will involve overseeing the development and optimization of sophisticated full-stack workflows for all things revenue & financial reporting. You will also be instrumental in managing and mitigating technical challenges that arise from the ever-increasing volume and complexity of our productions, all the while ensuring the precision and timeliness of our financial data. Your Responsibilities: Drive success in a lean organization structure, emphasizing individual responsibility and minimal processes. Identify and foster the development of innovative solutions that enhance our understanding of Revenue Financial data. Oversee the team's design and development of scalable, highly available, and user-friendly solutions on AWS, using technologies like React, Node.js , and Java. Champion product quality through the team, emphasizing enhanced observability, alerting, dashboarding, and the development of cutting-edge tools. Embody and champion the Netflix culture. Lead the team of engineers to build efficient tools that accurately track all aspects of Revenue Infrastructure Engineering Ensure the design and implementation of intuitive user interfaces in alignment with best practices in UI/UX. Guide the team in developing and implementing interactive UI components, data visualization tools, and real-time analytics dashboards. Enforce coding standards and conduct regular code reviews to ensure the application's robustness and reliability. Promote and enforce best practices in full-stack development within the team, including responsive design and accessibility standards. About You: You're an experienced Engineering Manager with a strong background in overseeing financial applications development and a passion for leading teams to create engaging and user-friendly interfaces. You have a robust understanding of the full web stack, including front-end technologies such as HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and popular frameworks like React, Vue.js , or Angular, along with back-end technologies like Node.js , Java, databases, HTTP protocol, cloud applications, and integration. You're skilled at architecture, understanding the trade-offs involved in building high-scale architectures. You have a proven track record of managing successful teams and are dedicated to mentoring, teaching, and reviewing to help your engineers grow. You believe in high standards of execution and feature velocity and aren't afraid to dive in and take ownership of problems. You're also a thoughtful interviewer, dedicated to raising the bar of excellence with each new hire. You value data accuracy and understand the nuances of projects in flight. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

description: Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. In April 2022, we introduced new, more affordable, ad-supported tier for our customers, marking a significant milestone for Netflix. Our focus is now on expanding choices for consumers and providing advertisers with a premium TV brand experience that surpasses traditional linear formats. The challenge ahead involves scaling our ad tech to maximize its impact on our business. Our Team The Ads Platform Engineering teams build advertising systems and integrations that powers the delivery of ads using our world-class content delivery ecosystem. We use a number of Netflix investments and innovations to power our ads - unique mix of client and server-side ad insertions, state of the art content delivery system, ad encoding recipes, content understanding and metadata. We deliver ads in a manner that’s thoughtful of our member’s viewing experience and drive great outcomes for advertisers. We also ensure that advertiser brand safety is ensured during serving, members only see the most appropriate ads for them. Our team is new and yet faced with the enormous ambitions of building highly performant advertising systems and delivering high impact to our business by monetizing our incredible slate of content. As one of the newest entrants in the Connected TV advertising space that’s rapidly growing, we seek to build unique value propositions that help us differentiate from the competition and become a market leader in record time. We are looking for highly motivated engineers working in the advertising space who are excited to join us on this journey. Experience & Skills: Publisher-side ad tech systems including ad servers, bidders, yield optimizers, and their demand-side counterparts (SSPs/DSPs) Bringing complex models to life in low-latency real-time advertising environments Budgeting and Pacing systems, models, and algorithms Yield Optimization, scoring, and bid ranking models and Dynamic Allocation of direct/programmatic guaranteed and non-guaranteed inventory Modeling and Building Cost Per Click, Cost Per View, and Cost Per Video Complete modeling and optimization Applying Modeling and machine learning techniques for business problems at the intersection of product, data science, and engineering Collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders from product, engineering, operations, design, consumer research, etc., to develop and deploy models at scale Nice to Haves: Contributed to an ads industry technology standard (e.g  VAST, OpenRTB) or worked on an industry consortium effort, or working group. Familiarity with legal compliance and the changing landscape of ad regulations around the world. Experience working in the CTV space and knowledge of its unique constraints Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $100,000- $720,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . description: Location: Los Gatos, CA only (Hybrid). It’s an amazing time to be joining Netflix as we continue to transform entertainment. We deliver billions of hours of movies and TV shows per month to more than 260 million members in over 190 countries. At Netflix, we want to entertain the world. To achieve this, we must be able to rapidly build and ship innovative experiences for our members and creators all around the globe. | Who we are Change Automation is a full-stack platform engineering team that accelerates the adoption of the “paved road” across the fleet. We work cross-functionally with partners across engineering to make working inside the Netflix engineering ecosystem more efficient and enjoyable for all. We focus on increasing productivity, minimizing toil, and automating the rollout of changes. | What you could work on Our team is primarily responsible for the developer platform that powers updates, migrations, and software changes for the entire engineering organization. Some example goals for projects include: - Reduce friction, cognitive load, toil, and time required to adopt technologies across Netflix engineering. - Simplify and minimize manual interventions for service owners during migrations. - Make it easier to adopt new technologies through automated code change, validation, and deployment. | What We’ll Expect From You We are seeking a frontend focused engineer and ideally can also work across the stack. Below are the specific behaviors and competencies important for this role. Behaviors: Cross-Functional – You enjoy collaborating with multiple teams on creating solutions with myriad, sometimes conflicting, requirements. Seeking Excellence – You enjoy the pursuit of engineering excellence by evangelizing, establishing, and iterating on best practices. Curiosity – You are curious and enjoy working on ambiguous problems where the solutions are not (yet) well defined. Communication –  You are proficient in verbal and written mediums at explaining topics that the audience was not familiar with previously. Core competencies: You possess strong software skills in Typescript. You are experienced with operating complex React applications and how to debug them/how they can fail. You are proficient in UI applications that leverage client-side caching, pagination and GraphQL mutations. Helpful competencies: You possess strong software skills in Java or Kotlin. You have worked on a developer platform team where other engineers were your customers. You have worked on schema changes in a federated GraphQL gateway You are familiar with the Spring Boot framework. You are proficient with data pipelines and generating analytics/insights. What to Expect From Us: High Impact - your work will touch every engineer at the company and be crucial for the ongoing success of Netflix. Stunning Colleagues - you will be working with other excellent people with diverse perspectives who value collaboration, working to excel as the “dream team.” Energizing Challenges - there is a wealth of opportunity when working on complex technical projects and our culture both enables and encourages you to rise to the challenges. Feedback – you will constantly have opportunities for growth because meaningful, positive, and constructive feedback is part of everyday life at Netflix. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Our culture is unique, and we live by our values, so it’s worth learning more about Netflix culture . Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $100,000 - $720,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here .

It’s an amazing time to be joining Netflix as we continue to transform entertainment. We deliver billions of hours of movies and TV shows per month to more than 260 million members in over 190 countries. At Netflix, we want to entertain the world. To achieve this, we must be able to rapidly build and ship innovative experiences for our members and creators all around the globe. | Who we are Change Automation is a full-stack platform engineering team that accelerates the adoption of the “paved road” across the fleet. We work cross-functionally with partners across engineering to make working inside the Netflix engineering ecosystem more efficient and enjoyable for all. We focus on increasing productivity, minimizing toil, and automating the rollout of changes. | What you could work on Our team is primarily responsible for the developer platform that powers updates, migrations, and software changes for the entire engineering organization. Some example goals for projects include: - Reduce friction, cognitive load, toil, and time required to adopt technologies across Netflix engineering. - Simplify and minimize manual interventions for service owners during migrations. - Make it easier to adopt new technologies through automated code change, validation, and deployment. | What We’ll Expect From You We are seeking a frontend focused engineer and ideally can also work across the stack. Below are the specific behaviors and competencies important for this role. Behaviors:

description: Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any internet-connected screen. Members can play, pause and resume watching, all without commercials or commitments. Netflix is looking for finance professionals to join our team. This role will support the FP&A team and manage data-entry, validation, and reconciliation to build accurate financial forecasts. This role will also contribute to reporting and financial analysis that are used to inform important business decisions. We currently have opportunities available on the following teams: - Content FP&A All roles are based in our Manila office. Depending on business needs and candidate background, there may be future opportunities to rotate across business functions (e.g., marketing FP&A) as needs open up. Responsibilities: Execute and manage data entry for forecasting and analysis Perform data validation and reconciliation analysis Supporting near-term and long-term P&L forecasts Supporting key portions of the company's free cash flow forecast Contribute to presentations and memos that can support financial and business decisions Prior experience in financial planning & analysis or accounting is preferred. Ideal candidates will have a proven track record of performing financial analysis and knowledge of the forecast submission process. This person must thrive in a fast-paced environment and exhibit the highest personal and professional standards of integrity and ethics. Netflix is fast-growing with a flat organizational structure, which means that employees are often asked to perform tasks with a range of difficulties. Candidates must be motivated, disciplined, and able to work effectively autonomously. Requirements: 2+ years of experience conducting quantitative and qualitative financial analysis Proficiency with spreadsheet-based tools like Google Sheets or Excel Experience with managing and analyzing large, complex data sets Exceptional verbal and written communication skills Sound working knowledge of the related accounting guidance preferred Bachelor's degree with emphasis on coursework of a quantitative nature, preferably Business, Economics, or Mathematics We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

description: The Role Netflix is the world's leading internet entertainment service with more than 270 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying series, documentaries and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Visit our culture memo and long-term view to learn more about the unique Netflix culture and the opportunity to be part of our team. The Content Risk Management Team supports our Content Organisation functions globally. This APAC-based role will lead the Production Security discipline in APAC and report to the Senior Manager, Content Risk Management APAC. Partnering with Physical Production, Content Security, Post Production, Business and Legal Affairs, and Content, the role will be instrumental in leading risk assessment and security design for our Netflix branded original content production in the APAC region. This role is based in our Tokyo office and will be involved in projects across APAC. Responsibilities Build and execute the strategy for production security in the APAC region in alignment with assessed risk and business objectives Lead the development/ review of risk assessments, security plans, vendor management, coordination of local support, and incident response Develop and communicate specialised guidance for higher-profile/risk production activities, IP, and locations Utilise forward-looking analysis of dynamic global, regional, and local security events/trends to keep APAC production operations resilient Collect and analyse local intelligence and risk signals to support production planning and security design Lead relationship management with relevant law enforcement, emergency response, and trusted security networks Brief a wide range of internal and external stakeholders on security plans and impactful developments Works collaboratively with Production Safety functions in minimising operational risk Qualifications 8-10+ years of relevant experience, which can include security, intelligence, military, media production, or NGO Advanced degree in relevant subject matter or demonstrated equivalent experience preferred Experience with production, talent relations, or content creation is a plus Strong written and oral communication Proficiency in a regional language preferred, especially Japanese Ability to Interpret regional security signals and data, and conduct risk assessments Maintain an awareness of risk trends affecting the global entertainment sector Communicate relevant analysis and forecasting to key stakeholders Interact with a wide range of internal and external stakeholders Travel regionally (approximately 25%-50%) and internationally as required We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status or disability status. Please do not forward resumes to our career page or employees.

description: About Netflix Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any Internet-connected screen. Members can play, pause, and resume watching, all without commercials or commitments. As a global company, Netflix’s customers come from diverse backgrounds. And each of these backgrounds allow them to experience joy from Netflix in their own unique way. Ultimately, this joy is rooted in our customers’ ability to trust Netflix. At Netflix, we earn this trust through our actions every day. And we work hard to continue to build this trust with our customers throughout the world. With the growth of Netflix consumer products to include new verticals such as Games, Live and Ads, we are evolving our solutions to support the unique needs of additional consumer facing solutions, reflecting unique requirements for transported data and integrations. The Team The Security and Privacy Technical Program Management team is a force multiplier for the security organization; we partner closely with engineering and product teams across Netflix to deliver impactful and scalable security initiatives. We collaborate with leaders inside and outside the organization to align on strategic goals and vision to further the security roadmaps for our partnering teams in a business-driven way. We then work with the right stakeholders to establish and drive initiatives that move the needle on this. The Opportunity You will drive large, at-scale security initiatives across multiple products and central engineering orgs with stakeholders ranging from senior leadership, product managers, engineering managers, and developers. It is a great opportunity to help mature the security posture in the most rapidly growing parts of our business and gain intimate knowledge of Netflix’s products and services. These are highly visible and cross-functional efforts that require technical thought leadership across Netflix’s engineering and product organizations. We are leaning into the “T” (Technical) for this role. By technical, we mean that the ideal candidate has a strong understanding of the overall security domain and the ability to gain a technical understanding of programs across their lifecycle. TPMs must be skilled at both strategy and execution as well as have depth in their technical domain. As we expand our product offerings in the consumer space from SVOD to Live events, Gaming, etc., you will have an opportunity to lead initiatives in the consumer product security space. Onboard one of the first programs you will lead is Distributed Denial of Service (DDoS) prevention that is business critical and is closely related and focused around preserving the high availability of our streaming service. You will be responsible for crafting and executing the overall program. This includes translating the vision into a program strategy, leading critical initiatives, building the technical execution plan, stakeholder management, and overseeing the development of quarterly roadmaps. You will be successful in the role if… You are passionate about leading by influence and advocating for change. You have a demonstrated ability to establish a vision and to execute on it. You have excellent written and verbal communication skills, including clear articulation of business impact and technical constraints tailored to the audience. You are able to triage multiple initiatives to make a judgment to tackle the right problems at the right time. You have an ability to identify gaps in solutions, debate technical approaches and weigh-in on product vs technology tradeoffs. You have familiarity with consumer product security principles and best practices, and have developed and driven security initiatives such as DDoS and fraud prevention, to name a few. A few reasons why we love this work and think you will too: You will have the opportunity to facilitate impactful security work for the Netflix business and engineering ecosystem. You will be working with an industry leading security team with many opportunities to improve existing projects and identify new ones. You will have the opportunity to research new ideas and share them across the community. You enjoy learning and working closely with domain experts in diverse areas such as microservices architecture, data science and engineering, content delivery networks, and a production studio. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $100,000 - $720,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: This is your chance to be at the forefront of Netflix’s new offering of Video Games. We will bring these new experiences to market through the world's leading streaming entertainment app with 208 million paid memberships in over 190 countries who are already enjoying TV series, documentaries and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and now they can download and play mobile games anytime, anywhere with a collection of Netflix curated and produced Games. At Netflix, we have an insatiable need to continually improve our product experience and the creative elements that support it and this team sits at the forefront of the effort. Responsibilities: Take the lead as an external developer’s primary point of contact, working with developers in creation of project and milestone schedules, submission planning, and overall development plans; provide ongoing management check and balance throughout the full product life cycle. This role will manage external games development partners across multiple titles at once. Review and evaluate game builds and milestones across design, creative, development, and production progress. Work with Head of External Game Development and Executive Producers to ensure all projects are delivering on time, within budget, against the design scope and aligned to broader portfolio and quality goals. Take a long-term view and ownership towards developing games with an eye toward sequels, localizations, product line extensions. Maintain relationships with external leadership level development & publishing teams to ensure all production and publishing goals and concerns are met, cultivating relationships to effectively collaborate and problem solve. Help resolve unique complex product issues through ingenuity, creativity and any other means necessary to get the job done. Identify risks early and often and remove roadblocks and performance bottlenecks as needed. Inspire and empower the development teams that you will be working with, guide them through continuous improvement, and share learnings with the studio. Serve as internal product champion/evangelist by crafting and presenting product pitch in appropriate ways to specific and different audiences, providing visibility into milestones and challenges. Ensure that all teams have optimal product information to deliver games to market. Work cross functionally to Create a healthy team culture, communicative, transparent, motivated, committed and focused on realistic goals. Qualifications: 10+ years of experience in game development/product management (social, F2P, mobile, web, console, handheld) 5+ years experience as a Producer in the games industry 2+ years experience in publishing Ability to collaborate with and manage external development teams An excellent knowledge of production, the difficulties generally encountered by teams and solutions tailored to their requirements. Having led complex cross functional projects with successful delivery of quality, schedule and in balancing scope, capacity, budget, risk, and time. Experience managing a team of 10+ developers (programmers, artists, animators, designers, testers) Licensed game experience a plus Extremely strong project management skills - Fluent with Agile methodology Excellent verbal and written communication skills Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $90,000-$600,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

  • Work cross functionally to Create a healthy team culture, communicative, transparent, motivated, committed and focused on realistic goals.
    • Qualifications:
  • 10+ years of experience in game development/product management (social, F2P, mobile, web, console, handheld) 
  • 5+ years experience as a Producer in the games industry
  • 2+ years experience in publishing
  • Ability to collaborate with and manage external development teams 
  • An excellent knowledge of production, the difficulties generally encountered by teams and solutions tailored to their requirements. 
  • Having led complex cross functional projects with successful delivery of quality, schedule and in balancing scope, capacity, budget, risk, and time. 
  • Experience managing a team of 10+ developers (programmers, artists, animators, designers, testers)
  • Licensed game experience a plus 
  • Extremely strong project management skills - Fluent with Agile methodology
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
    • Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $90,000-$600,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. description: Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. We are looking for a practicing attorney to join the Product & Tech Legal Team as a Legal Director to partner with our Data & Insights Group. The role reports directly to the Senior Director of Studio Product & Technology Legal based in Los Angeles, and you will be based in Los Angeles or Los Gatos. To entertain the world is no small task, so we rely on really smart people who know a lot about how technology and data can create great content and high-quality member experiences and insights. The Netflix Product Counsel is an integrated part of this innovations team, partnering with our product managers, stakeholders, designers, engineers and data scientists across the entire innovations lifecycle from ideation to launch. They are essential contributors often extending beyond legal advice. The Netflix Product Counsel understands how to inspire these business teams towards innovation, because they have that important mix of courage, judgment, curiosity and great instinct. The Legal Director is a multi-faceted role requiring a breadth of product experience, an instinct for innovation, and the wisdom to discern practical real-world risks from theoretical ones. You will have a particular interest in leveraging data in innovative ways to fuel products and generate insights. You are a diplomat, with the skills to bring folks together to collaborate and share information and ideas, and you thrive in a loosely coupled world where we lean into integrity and judgment over rigid rules and inflexible processes. You will be both a specialist in the science, and a generalist in your counseling, with the ability to digest competing legal and policy viewpoints in a manner that masterfully advances the business objectives, always with a view towards the overall company strategy. Responsibilities Support our data scientists and consumer insights team in the many ways they leverage data and insights to improve our models, tools  and enhance the member experience. Provide practical product counseling to enable rapid development of innovative products, coordinating closely with subject matter legal experts and distilling real world advice. In other words, you will be a legal generalist with a business instinct. This is not a compliance role. Understand the studio world and content production, with some familiarity with business affairs. Fluent in product and engineering principles with the ability to “speak science” as well as the skills to simplify these principles for others to understand. Qualifications JD required and active bar membership in the state of California or New York 10+ years of legal experience in the entertainment and/or technology industries in a strategic leadership capacity, either through a law firm and/or an in-house role, with subject-matter experience in data science. Strong track record demonstrating a collaborative approach, effective communication skills, and excellent legal/business judgment. Strategic and creative thinker who thrives in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment, undeterred by ambiguity. Demonstrated curiosity and ability to quickly master new areas of technology. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $280,000 - $960,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: The Team We want to invent entertainment experiences the world can’t live without, connecting people with stories they’ll love. The Member Experiences Product Management team is accountable for making the core Netflix experience better every day for over 270M members. Our work spans all platforms (TV/living room, mobile, tablet, and web), and includes experiences and ranking/recommendations strategy across discovery/browse (shows, movies, live programming, and games), player, identity/profiles, and new surfaces. The Role We are looking for an experienced Product Manager to join the team. You will lead work focused on experiences that help members discover what to watch or play next, and features that help members get more out of their Netflix subscription. In partnership with the cross-functional team, you will set the vision and conceive of ideas that delight members, convert those ideas into well-scoped projects, prioritize smartly among competing efforts, and lead the team to execute at a high level. This role is based in our Los Gatos (preferred) or Los Angeles office in a hybrid model. As a Product Manager at Netflix, you will: Make a meaningful contribution. Our key product managers -- including this position -- work with multiple teams but do not have direct reports. We’re looking for experienced product managers who are strategic and also like rolling up their sleeves. Take on big responsibility. Netflix offers PMs autonomy and substantial scope. Be expected to learn every day and enjoy being curious. You will be creating experiences that may not exist yet. You will work with stunning colleagues who value collaboration and from whom you can learn. Contribute to and benefit from an environment where you can grow your career. Many of our top execs started out as individual contributors. Who will be successful in this role? To be successful in this position, you will partner with world-class teams across design, engineering, research, and data science, flexing both your analytical acumen and ability to use your intuition to empathize with customer problems. You will frequently use experimentation as a way to validate your hypotheses. The following attributes are highly valued on the PM team: An ability to synthesize the complex into the simple and persuasive, and tell compelling stories with data. Excellent data-informed judgment. Good balance between being collaborative and open to alternative views versus being decisive and clearly communicating the vision for the team. Comfort advocating for a path forward among ambiguous options. An eagerness to seek feedback and improve. Familiarity with and enthusiasm for entertainment products. Skills Experience building consumer products (4-6 years minimum) with a proven record of prioritizing and launching experiences valued by consumers. Proven ability to map algorithmic solutions to product problems. Demonstrated leadership working effectively with designers, data scientists, engineers, researchers, and colleagues across content, communications, and marketing. Experience with A/B testing. Excellent verbal and written communication skills and an ability to present technical content to non-technical audiences. Very high attention to detail, with an ability to connect the smallest experience elements to the big picture goals at the company and team level. We strongly believe that diversity of experience, perspectives, and backgrounds will lead to a better environment for our employees and better products for our customers. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $120,000 - $515,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: As Netflix’s global member base grows from 250+ million members, the ability to operate at scale without compromising on quality is paramount to our success. Netflix is looking for a skilled Project Coordinator to join its Scaled Launch Operations team in Mumbai. This team will be part of a broader operational hub strategy and manages the launch readiness process, focusing on the on-service promotion of our content, by combining rigorous project management and risk mitigation with a strategic, member-first mindset. This is an exciting opportunity for a Project Coordinator with a passion for operations in service of delivering promotional material for Netflix titles to our global members, at scale. If you are analytically minded and your attention to detail is unmatched, you excel at challenging the status quo and influencing change, you thrive in a global team, possess a high level of intellectual curiosity, and demonstrate strong judgement in the face of ambiguity, then this role is for you. The Project Coordinator will align with multiple cross-functionals across the globe, track multiple assets, assign to required teams, monitor finalized asset delivery all the while ensuring their accuracy and that they are available for member consumption. You will manage a large volume of titles across the global slate, have effective communication, manage dependencies with moving launch targets, predicting and mitigating risks and pivot as required with short turnaround time. What You’ll Do: You will own and be accountable for some of the critical workflows, which affect  how the Member views the titles from across the globe.  While multiple teams (internal and external) are responsible for creating and delivering assets, you will be responsible for ensuring those assets are coming in at the right time to support the predetermined launch date that all of your stakeholders are aligned to. You will help shape and redesign existing workflows to help accelerate the efficiency of our operations in line with key business objectives for our group. Partner with internal and external teams (vendors) to ensure operational momentum and seamlessness across launches. Exercise sound judgement and risk mitigation to create/modify delivery and launch plans including use cases that fall outside the norm. Partner with our Technology, Engineering, Partnerships, and Quality Control teams within Global Product Creative Operations, to guide tooling, workflow, and vendor needs to help scale operations. What You’ll Need: The candidate must have 5+ years of experience in project management / coordination roles Ability to handle a fast-paced environment and the ability to keep multiple priorities moving at the same time Excellent verbal and written communication skills with a self starter mentality An analytical and innovative mindset with a passion for operational excellence Attention to detail while executing on work across several tools and systems The ability to build deep cross-functional relationships An optimistic, solutions-driven attitude in the most challenging situations Fluency in an additional language is a bonus The ability to adapt to the Netflix culture and values We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

description: Emerging Creative specializes in interaction, animation, cinematic UX, and engaging content-forward interfaces. Our goal is performant, intuitive & delightful user experiences that immerse users in an effortless flow, effectively convey information, and foster meaningful connections between Netflix, members (and soon-to-be members), and B2B partners around the globe. As strategic creative partners, we work with a range of Product teams to create, build, and implement UX concepts using motion, sound, video & visual design. We are looking for a Senior Product Designer to join the team! As ECXD Designer you will be responsible for UX/UI strategy with a focus on user interface design and brand expression across our full suite of consumer products including web, mobile, and TV. Working horizontally and collaboratively across a range of member and nonmember surfaces to envision and build product experiences that advance business goals, and the aesthetics and usability of the Netflix Product Excperience. Deliverables include UX concepts for testing and future-forward ideas communicated through a variety of artifacts like qual stimuli, wireframes, mockups, videos, high-fidelity prototypes, novel promotional asset concepts, and compelling business storytelling. Responsible For Establishing and leading UX visual design of the team’s portfolio. Acting as informed captain on complex multi-disciplinary projects, leading creative development and aligning multiple disciplines to project goals and creative direction. Partnering with cross-functional stakeholders to interpret goals into creative strategies for the team. Creating, iterating on, and supporting the testing of new UX designs. Translating business requirements to functional and engaging user interfaces. Based on feasibility requirements, ensuring an appropriate level of effort and complexity in the work. Incorporating user & market research into design and articulating strategy behind proposed solutions. Collaborating with XFN partners including UX designers, dev teams, researchers, writers, product managers, and other product partners. Continuously establishing and optimizing new partnerships and workflows. Collaborating with Design Systems to understand, apply, and evolve Netflix’s Brand Language to our product experience, responsibly applying and evolving established design Staying updated on the latest industry trends and techniques, and sharing knowledge with the team as a specialist in visual design. Must Have Ability to cultivate and craft beautiful, visionary product UX concepts grounded in user needs. Attention to detail and a passion for upholding an exceptional quality bar. Strong cross-discipline partnership and collaboration skills, with the ability to see the big picture strategically, bring pieces together, and drive clarity through ambiguity. Experience working with multidisciplinary teams including video, audio, and motion graphics on a variety of creative artifacts. Strong understanding of design systems and user-centered design principles. Excellent communication and presentation skills, able to articulate design decisions and high-level strategy clearly with an informed perspective. Proactive and self-starting, able to uncover (and propose ideas to solve) challenges and opportunities independently. Ability to participate in and influence driving impactful design solutions through all phases of a product development lifecycle. Bonus UX prototyping Product Marketing Expertise B2B business communications and Brand partnerships Content Promotion Creative UX motion design skills Strategic UX product planning and roadmap development Why work at Netflix? If you want to have a large impact at a growing company and work with a high-performance team. Work with talented colleagues on challenging problems that affect 250+ million members across the globe. We value high performance, freedom, and responsibility. We don't focus on rules, processes, or procedures. We are candid and transparent and seek excellence in all that we do. We tackle hard problems that others have yet to be able to solve. We produce great content, build systems at scale, and use data to push the business forward. We connect people with visual storytelling globally. Pay Transparency Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top-of-market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $200,000-$700,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here .Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

  • Strategic UX product planning and roadmap development
    • Why work at Netflix?
  • If you want to have a large impact at a growing company and work with a high-performance team.
  • Work with talented colleagues on challenging problems that affect 250+ million members across the globe.
  • We value high performance, freedom, and responsibility. We don't focus on rules, processes, or procedures.
  • We are candid and transparent and seek excellence in all that we do.
  • We tackle hard problems that others have yet to be able to solve.
  • We produce great content, build systems at scale, and use data to push the business forward.
  • We connect people with visual storytelling globally.
    • Pay Transparency
  • Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top-of-market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $200,000-$700,000.

  • Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off.

  • See more detail about our Benefits here.Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here.

  • We are an equal opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully.

  • We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. Content Engineering builds the products and services used by our internal and external creative partners producing and managing our global content. Our products enable the entire workflow of content production, from pitch to play, and provide innovative new ways to develop and manage the entertainment at scale. You’ll have a direct impact on how the Netflix studio creates and produces shows, such as “The Witcher”, “The Crown” and “Stranger Things” on a global scale. With an increasing slate of original content being produced every year, our products manage billions of dollars worth of content-spend. This role is based in Warsaw and our teams work in a hybrid-working model. Your Day-to-Day Work cross-functionally to build new services, tools, and data models to operationalize our workflows at scale. Participate in product reviews and team meetings, providing technical insight. Help scope, estimate, and prioritize between conflicting needs. Evaluate new technologies and approaches to streamline and improve our rapid application development tooling and conventions. Regularly learn new systems and tools as the Netflix platform and ecosystem evolve. Participate in our on-call rotation and contribute to incident reviews. You may enjoy working with us if you: Are self-driven and highly motivated to deliver top-tier solutions with minimal guidance. You also recognize when you're wrong, learning from your mistakes and moving past them. Love brainstorming with fellow Backend and UI engineers, product designers, and product managers, and directly with our users, to understand what they want, figure out what they really need, and finally, what we should build. Strive to embrace best practices and are always searching for opportunities to continually improve. We would love to work with you if: You have experience building media creative apps and/or media workflow You are passionate about user experience and have an eye for improving UIs You are adept at building enterprise applications with HTML/JavaScript/TypeScript/CSS. We currently build our user experiences with GraphQL, Node.js , and Electron frameworks, and the ability to adapt to changing technology is important. You have previous experience working with designers/PMs You have previous experience in the Media and Entertainment industry. Does this sound interesting? We’d love to talk to you! We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

description: Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films, and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause, and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. As Netflix continues to grow, we are venturing further into exciting new innovations in personalization and discovery, experimentation and decision-making, understanding our members and our titles, backend and infrastructure, and more, all driven by research at the frontiers of ML and its many intersections with adjacent fields. The Machine Learning and Inference Research team is a dedicated research team designed to build up Netflix’s technical capabilities by diving deep and exploring research questions aligned with the biggest challenges at Netflix while partnering with teams across the business to bring these capabilities to life. As a member of the Machine Learning and Inference Research team, you will have the opportunity to drive and execute bleeding-edge research while working in close partnership both with other researchers in the team and with partners in a wide range of teams across product, growth, and content. You will leverage your expertise in the frontiers of ML to influence the direction of company roadmaps and to work collaboratively cross-functionally to prototype, test, and implement your research to deliver improvements to the member experience and drive change across the company.  Additionally, you will be actively engaged with the broader ML research community through conferences, publications, organizational activities, and academic collaborations. We are looking for an experienced researcher with broad expertise in machine learning who can establish and execute a strong research agenda, disseminate knowledge, get others behind their ideas, and foster an open environment of collaboration, innovation, and intellectual excitement. What you bring Ph.D. in a relevant area, with multiple years of post-Ph.D. experience in industry and/or academia. Experience in applying research (preferably yours) to transform real business problems in collaboration with engineering and business teams. Ample research experience, in industry and/or academia, including as evidenced in publications. A track record of bringing clarity to and leading ambitious research projects inspired by real-world challenges. Regarded as a role model both because of your technical expertise as well as the impact you drive. Consistently sought out by stakeholders for collaboration, guidance, problem-solving, and decision-making. Excellent judgment in identifying and framing ambiguous research and business problems and the links between the two. Passion for collaboration and building strong relationships with colleagues and stakeholders to tackle big, cross-functional problems. Exceptional communication with technical, non-technical, and mixed audiences. Self-motivated with an ability to thrive and to lead with minimal oversight and process. Uplevels the greater org through sharing knowledge and guiding thought on the adoption of new methods. Actively mentors others and is sought out as a mentor. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $400,000 - $960,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with over 220 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any internet-connected screen. The Finance Strategy & Analysis (FS&A) Content team is looking for a Senior Manager to join its India team. FS&A Content is the team that leads the charge on co-developing the strategy and planning behind our content buying and original content decisions for local language film and TV series and its development. The team works cross-functionally to translate the incredible amount of data at Netflix into financial decisions regarding the production and acquisition of shows and films. The team also evaluates the general programming and content strategy, in addition to leading competitive analysis. We partner closely with the senior leadership of Netflix who depend heavily on the strategic insights we provide to inform critical business decisions. This person will have a high degree of visibility with India senior management which uses the team’s strategic input to inform important decisions on our India content strategy and planning. The role involves close engagement and coordination with members of the FS&A team in both Asia Pacific and the US and will report to the Director Finance & Strategy, India in Mumbai. Responsibilities Lead development of local content strategy to improve our value proposition of our members and members to be in partnership with the Content teams Lead deal analysis and valuation of new projects in partnership with the Content and other cross-functional teams Develop a deep understanding of industry trends as well as competitive threats and opportunities to better inform our future strategic choices. Compiling thoughtful post-mortem analyses to determine areas for optimization improvement and  innovation. Work cross-functionally with other teams including regional / global Strategy, FP&A, Production Finance Product, Consumer Insights, and Data Science Qualifications 10 to 12 years of experience in a top management consulting firm, investment bank, private equity, hedge fund, and/or media/entertainment/tech company in a strategy/business development/analytical role. Significant experience in influencing Senior Management and Executive stakeholders on areas of strategy creation, planning and enabling execution Highly analytical and experienced in leading complex quantitative and qualitative analysis. Exceptional proficiency with MS Excel & PowerPoint; working knowledge of statistics and analysis packages. and be a strong, effective communicator. Experienced in building and managing high-performing teams Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment, possess a high level of intellectual curiosity, focus on generating results and exhibit the highest personal and professional standards of integrity and ethics. Passion and familiarity with India local language content and entertainment is a strong plus

description: Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. The Team Ads Marketing function leads the development of our core Netflix Ads positioning, and the GTM plans to bring this positioning to life through differentiated messaging and narratives in the market.  The team activates this messaging through Sales Materials(presentations, narratives, talking points) and broader B2B channels to garner broad awareness and excitement amongst our key advertising partners. The Opportunity As the Manager, of Ads B2B Marketing, Germany will be a key part of the Ads Marketing team’s success by crafting and activating the Netflix advertising story and value proposition to advertisers across the German market. You’ll work with multidisciplinary teams to develop strategic approaches to fueling business growth on the platform, unlocking the creative potential of Netflix's Advertising offering. Additionally, you will contribute to broader business tactics beyond your role and pursue learning and development opportunities to consistently grow and evolve as a Netflix marketer. Key Responsibilities include but are not limited to: Design and craft go-to-market strategies and narratives in an exciting way for the Sales team and their advertising clients in Germany in collaboration with the European Ads Marketing team. Lead the strategy and approach for how Netflix Ads show up at local industry events and bespoke client engagements in Germany. Understand our advertisers, assess the right data, seek insights and inform local marketing strategy and stories. Partner regularly with international teams for launches and ongoing growth ( Ad Sales Marketing, Sales, Ad Product, Events, Comms/PR, and others). Help inform the development of new Ads products based on advertiser feedback and market insights. Deliver regular updates to leadership complete with wins, challenges, and asks. Qualifications: At least 7 years of experience in B2B marketing, product marketing, digital advertising and marketing communications. Fluency in English and German An understanding of the CTV/OTT/Streaming landscape is preferred. Previous experience in product positioning, narrative, and sales collateral development. Extensive experience working closely with product and Ad sales teams to develop strategy and messaging. Ability to develop and implement creative ideas, partner with agencies, and manage competing projects with tight deadlines. Experience with developing content including blog posts, case studies, presentations, creative assets, and thought leadership that support our marketing objectives. Ability to work in a highly cross-functional environment to drive stakeholder alignment and scaled communications. You have an entrepreneurial mindset and are eager to flourish in our unique company culture (see Who We Are ). We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

description: The Role Netflix is the world's leading internet entertainment service with over 222 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Visit our culture memo and long-term view to learn more about the unique Netflix culture and the opportunity to be part of our team. The Content Risk Management Team supports our Content Organisation functions globally. This East Asia-based role will be a joint lead for the Production Safety discipline across APAC (ex-India) and reports to the Regional Lead, Content Risk Management APAC. The role will be responsible for the development, implementation and management of safety programs necessary to ensure a healthy, safe and environmentally sound work place, as well as assisting productions in compliance with all applicable governmental health & safety and environmental regulations. Responsibilities Provides health & safety guidance to Netflix’s APAC ex-India productions Review and advise on production health and safety plans and guidelines to production partners. Upon request, evaluates production/post concepts, scripts, production facilities and workflows for safety and environmental concerns and risks Mitigates safety concerns by working directly with Production Executives, Producers, Unit Production Managers, Supervisors and other production staff as required Advises Production as required in the planning, budgeting and execution phase of filming services: assessing safety needs, securing appropriate vendors, and travelling to remote locations and/or facilities as required Reviews partner Risk Assessments and recommend corrective actions and assist productions in implementation Responds to, and investigates production safety emergencies, incidents and accidents Coordinates production employee health & safety training Develops and maintains effective working relationships with industry safety organisations, representatives, consultants and governmental regulatory agencies as appropriate Determines the applicable regulations in locations where a particular production may be shooting Works collaboratively with Production Security functions in minimising operational risk Qualifications A minimum 5 years of occupational health & safety related experience. Bachelor's degree in H&S, ES, PS is a plus Strong experience in regional market health & safety programs with willingness to learn regulatory framework across APAC region Understanding of motion picture and television production process including organisational structure, terminology, equipment, construction methods, stunt and special effects techniques, etc. preferred Certified Safety Professional (CSP) or Chartered Member to the Institute of Occupational Safety & Health (CMIOSH) certification or regional equivalent a plus Excellent written, verbal and interpersonal communication skills in English and a regional language Understanding of security planning and processes a plus Ability to Communicate relevant analysis and forecasting to key stakeholders Interact with a wide range of internal and external stakeholders Ability to respond to production needs/emergencies at all hours of the day Ability to work independently without immediate management supervision Travel regionally (approximately 25%-50%) and internationally as required We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status or disability status. 넷플릭스는 다양한 경험과 생각을 가진 구성원이 모였을 때 최고의 성과를 내는 팀을 만들어 갈 수 있다고 믿고 있습니다. 다양성과 포용성은 우리가 지향하는 기업 문화의 핵심 중 하나이며, 이것의 궁극적인 목적은 모든 직원이 역량을 마음껏 발휘하고 성장하며 기여할 수 있도록 환경을 조성하는 것입니다.  인재를 선별하는 과정은 이러한 목적을 달성하는 데 매우 중요합니다.  이에 따라 넷플릭스는  성별, 인종, 피부색, 국적, 종교, 성적 지향, 나이, 결혼 여부 등 모든 개인적인 배경과 상관없이 모두에게 평등한 기회를 보장하며, 공정한 과정을 통해 채용을 진행하고 있습니다.장애인 및 국가보훈 대상자는 관련 법령에 따라 우대합니다.

  • Certified Safety Professional (CSP) or Chartered Member to the Institute of Occupational Safety & Health (CMIOSH) certification or regional equivalent a plus
  • Excellent written, verbal and interpersonal communication skills in English and a regional language
  • Understanding of security planning and processes a plus
    • Ability to
  • Communicate relevant analysis and forecasting to key stakeholders
  • Interact with a wide range of internal and external stakeholders
  • Ability to respond to production needs/emergencies at all hours of the day
  • Ability to work independently without immediate management supervision
  • Travel regionally (approximately 25%-50%) and internationally as required

We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status or disability status. 넷플릭스는 다양한 경험과 생각을 가진 구성원이 모였을 때 최고의 성과를 내는 팀을 만들어 갈 수 있다고 믿고 있습니다. 다양성과 포용성은 우리가 지향하는 기업 문화의 핵심 중 하나이며, 이것의 궁극적인 목적은 모든 직원이 역량을 마음껏 발휘하고 성장하며 기여할 수 있도록 환경을 조성하는 것입니다.  인재를 선별하는 과정은 이러한 목적을 달성하는 데 매우 중요합니다.  이에 따라 넷플릭스는  성별, 인종, 피부색, 국적, 종교, 성적 지향, 나이, 결혼 여부 등 모든 개인적인 배경과 상관없이 모두에게 평등한 기회를 보장하며, 공정한 과정을 통해 채용을 진행하고 있습니다.장애인 및 국가보훈 대상자는 관련 법령에 따라 우대합니다.

description: Established in September 2022, Moonloot Games is a Netflix game studio located in Helsinki, Finland. We thrive to become a world-class games studio bringing a variety of delightful and deeply engaging original games to hundreds of millions of Netflix members around the world. As a part of Netflix, we strive to hire the best and value integrity, excellence, respect, inclusion, and collaboration. We are looking for an experienced full-time VFX Artist and Animator with a strong sensibility for art and the technical ability to create visual effects and 3D animations. This position will work with the Art Director, Designers, and Engineering Team to bring innovative visuals to life in the Unity Engine and Blender. As a VFX Artist and Animator at Moonloot you will... Design dynamic VFX systems that add atmosphere and depth to environments and gameplay Create animations for the environment and characters that bring the game to life Maintain a given style across a variety of assets, and expand that style to fit the requirements of new assets Recognizing what VFX and animations are needed, and supporting art vendors and engineers with VFX visualization Designing, creating, and integrating VFX and animations from start to finish Rendering loopable animations You will work closely with the artists, designers, and engineers on the team, to develop, implement, set dress environments and cinematics with VFX and animations You will be the link between the artistic and technical teams and therefore it is vital that you are able to develop the needed systems and applications Ideally, you are... Available full time in Helsinki or open to relocate to Helsinki Receptive to working independently and driving the visual style for the VFX and animations Able to communicate ideas clearly and effectively Self-starter willing to find solutions and ask questions when needed A person with attention to detail and a desire to make excellent games An artist proficient with Blender and Unity Engine Skills & Requirements: Portfolio demonstrating wide variety of VFX on mobile games Shipped games as a VFX artist or animator in mobile games Strong game design and communication skills Experience in testing and debugging your own work, and solving problems and fixing bugs Performance testing and optimizing VFX and animations for mobile platforms We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.
