description: It’s an amazing time to be joining Netflix as we continue to transform entertainment globally. Netflix is the world's leading internet entertainment service with 260+ million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any internet-connected screen. We are pursuing consumer products because we believe it will drive meaningful show awareness/buzz with more tangible, curated ways to interact with our most popular content and in effect, drive long term value. We want merchandise, interactive games, and experiences to help promote our titles and build them into title brands, or franchises, so they become part of the zeitgeist for longer periods of time. That’s where you come in, we’re seeking a Retail Lead to support our consumer products growth ambitions in DACH. In this role, you lead the launch of innovative products and immersive retail activations, featuring Netflix titles such as Stranger Things, Squid Game, and Bridgerton. Reporting directly to the country lead, your focus is on developing and implementing best practices to position Netflix as a preeminent player in the region's retail landscape. This role requires someone to take on the responsibility of creating and executing the Netflix consumer retail strategy for DACH based on the Netflix originals content slate. Mission As the Retail Lead DACH at Netflix, you have a broad and deep knowledge of the diverse DACH retail sector and navigate strategic partnerships with retailers such as Edeka, Schwarz Gruppe, dm-drogerie Markt, Amazon etc. Job Description (Objectives) Foundation & Strategy: Laying out the strategy through DTR and/or retail development and continue building retailers relationship Management & prioritization: Inform retailers about Netflix upcoming content, products and provide necessary tools for them to increase sales performance of Netflix products Revenue maximization: Analyze and scale business opportunities through category analysis, as well as identifying key revenue drivers throughout the year Planning & Trade Marketing: Plan the launch-to-market programs as well as potential cross-category retail activations with key stakeholders both retailers and licensees Cross-functional support: create and leverage best-retail practices from other countries/regions - UCAN, LATAM, APAC and EMEA into local market and vice-versa What we are looking for Demonstrated, 8+ years of experience in the retail industry with F&B brands and/or content IPs, with proven results Ownership of relationship with retailers across buying, marketing and category management, solid retail network Knowledge on operational marketing / omnichannel approach Agile, goal-oriented, driven to succeed and always up for a challenge Data performance analysis Cross-functional teamwork knowledge, how to navigate and connect the dots Retail business knowledge across different tiers from Mass-market, speciality to online Trade marketing and retail activations experience Passion for innovation Proactive and creativity at its core Entrepreneurial and fast-growing competency Adaptable to multiple changes and speed A natural and deep affection for film, television and or brands Deep engagement competency and ability to work with multiple, disparate stakeholders to achieve the best outcome for Netflix. You can read more about our company culture here German/ English (mandatory) Bachelor’s or advanced degree (preferred) We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

description: Netflix is the world’s leading streaming entertainment service with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, feature films, and mobile games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause, and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change plans at any time. The Product Finance, Strategy & Analysis (FS&A) team is tasked with partnering with Product leaders and ensuring great discovery and engagement experiences for our members. To guide the business effectively, this role requires evaluating Netflix’s product experience across markets and platforms, tracking market dynamics and competitor trends, and understanding consumer behavior changes to various in-product experiences. We collaborate closely with several teams including Data Science and Engineering, Consumer Insights, Corporate Finance, and Member Product. This role will be based in the Netflix Headquarters in Los Gatos, California and report to the Senior Director of Product FS&A. Responsibilities include, but are not limited to: Evaluating how changes to the member/user experience drive user behaviors including engagement and churn. Understanding market, platform, and consumer characteristic differences and the impact each has on key membership metrics. Determining areas for product improvement based on external benchmarks, competitive research, and internal performance metrics. Evaluating opportunities to improve member lifetime value by increasing engagement. Developing models to understand the mechanics and business impacts of different initiatives. Helping build a product and business roadmap by prioritizing projects and product features based on their contribution to business objectives. Translating our initiatives into presentations and memos for cross-functional partners and senior management to facilitate decision-making and disseminate information. Helping track industry developments and relevant benchmarks to understand impacts and implications to our business. What we are looking for: 5+ years of experience in highly analytical roles tied to consumer product strategy. Strong modeling skills and comfort managing large sets of data. Strong proficiency with Excel / Google Sheets and SQL. Team player with strong interpersonal skills. Ability to work independently; must thrive in a fast-paced, always-changing environment. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Skilled in preparing and delivering effective presentations to executive audiences. Highly intellectually curious, has the courage to challenge the status quo, and exhibits the highest personal and professional standards of integrity and ethics. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $50,000 - $240,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: *Location can be Los Angeles or Los Gatos, CA. This is not available as a remote opportunity.* Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with 270 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films, and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause, and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. Netflix aspires to “entertain the world” by finding amazing stories, and by sharing those stories through a personalized product experience which pleases our members and generates value for the business. The Plans & Pricing Strategy team focuses on that product experience, seeking to improve our monetization strategy through new business initiatives and pricing optimization. In this role, You will partner with product managers to drive member satisfaction and long term growth, and with financial leadership to understand how upcoming product changes will impact near term business outcomes. What You’ll Do Analyze + Understand The Business : Become a subject matter expert in the subscription space, understanding how changes in acquisition + churn impact financial outcomes Follow performance trends across markets, tracing irregularities back to their root-cause and rallying the business to react quickly when necessary Build financial models for new business initiatives, identifying the key success drivers Core focus areas will include: optimizing paid sharing, understanding member willingness to pay, setting price points across markets, scaling ads, etc Communicate Your Understanding To Drive Action : Translate your analyses into straightforward + actionable frameworks to drive decisions (e.g. when/where should we raise prices?) Simplify your findings for incorporation into financial guidance (e.g. how many subscriber additions will this new initiative drive in the next quarter?) What you have 2-5 years of experience. Talent, appreciation, and patience for building detailed + complex excel models. Some SQL knowledge, with a desire to deepen your technical skills by collaborating with data scientists and engineers. An ‘economics orientation’, thinking of problems as trade-offs in need of optimization. Strong communication skills, with ability to calibrate the level of detail in your presentations to your audience while maintaining accuracy and impact. Willingness to work in a fast-paced, demanding, and nebulous environment. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service. To determine your personal top-of-market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $50,000-240,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs. Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment. Learn more here .

Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs. Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here. Netflix is a unique culture and environment. Learn more here.

description: We are looking for a dynamic candidate with music production or in-house studio experience to act as a  Music Production Coordinator for our live-action and anime productions in Japan. This role will be reporting to the Manager, Music Production - Japan and will partner with them to provide support on the implementation of cross-functional music production solutions that will support our productions and overall slate growth across Netflix-branded Japanese live-action and anime titles. If you are someone with a passion for both the creative development and execution of music for content and who thrives in a collaborative, entrepreneurial, and innovative environment, this role may be for you. Key Responsibilities Read and break down incoming scripts for music needs, flagging upcoming visual vocals/on cameras, and potential licensing issues (challenging song approvals, grand rights, etc.) Liaise with Composer agents//music producers during the personnel hiring process, ensuring key dates, project information, and watermarked materials are distributed. Help field project inquiries as needed Distribute onboarding materials to partners, music supervisors and composers Make appropriate introductions between production and music crew, also ensuring that the music team receives scripts and cuts from production Attend regular check-ins with music supervisors/composers, taking relevant notes and connecting with the Music manager on action items Review cuts, flagging unaddressed music needs/clearance issues as they arise in conjunction with the music supervisor, composer, production, post, etc. Maintain consistent communication between Music Legal Team/Music Licensing partners regarding relevant Music Production updates/action items Attend show-specific/check-ins and provide music updates to the internal title management team Experience & Skills Experience: 5 years either as a music director, producer, or supervisor at a studio. Has in-territory experience in music production ideally for live-action features, series and anime. This role will have deep creative relationships with labels, publishers, managers, agents, composers, music supervisors, etc. as well as an internal content team and have a vast understanding of music supervision or worked in-house at a studio as a music producer. This role will be a liasion between internal cross-functional teams and external partners, and be responsible for ensuring the internal cross-functional teams understand the music production workflow. Collaborate with the external music director, producer, or supervisor to oversee and manage the music production objectives/workflow for the project. Advise/support on-camera performances in collaboration with Music team - including clearance, pre-records, on-set production and post production requirements Work with music editor and post supervisor during temp dub to make sure music is ready for preview/test screening. Support post supervisor, music editor and composer to develop a music post schedule that coincides with  post timeline and adhere to said schedule and music milestones Coordinate music notes and approval process between the studio, composer, director and producers by organizing score review sessions after locked picture Frequently check in with the composer, music director, producer, or supervisor on scheduling, booking and supervising scoring sessions and live recordings to ensure they are running on time and on budget Align with the music team as they are in the process of existing song selection as it relates to studio approvals and budget. Thrive in a fast-paced environment, are very curious and have an entrepreneurial mindset. Native Level Fluency in Japanese is required. Business-level English is a plus. The Netflix culture attracts individuals who exhibit good judgment, innovation, selflessness, courage, impact, candid communication, passion and curiosity. Our culture is a critical foundation of how we work. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status or disability status. Netflixは男女雇用機会均等法を順守しており、考え方や背景の多様性がより強力なチームを構築すると認識しています。Netflixは多様性・インクルージョンについて、真剣にかつ思慮深く取り組んでおり、人種、宗教、出身地、性別、性自認・性表現、経済状況、性的指向、年齢、婚姻状況、兵役、障がいの有無、その他の属性によって差別することはありません。 Netflix Japan will not accept unsolicited resumes or applications from recruitment agencies, and we will not be responsible for any related fees. Please do not forward resumes to our career page or employees.

description: Company & Role Overview: At Netflix, we are reinventing the way people are entertained by both enabling and innovating how visual storytelling is produced, discovered and enjoyed. Netflix provides a platform for stories from different places and different perspectives to reach, connect, and inspire millions of people all over the world. In this role, you sit at the intersection of content, marketing and product, powering one of the most transformational shifts in the industry. Netflix is the world's leading internet entertainment service with over 230 million members in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, feature films, and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. As the Product Discovery & Promotion (PDP) Leader for Korea, you will grow, develop and lead a team that is ultimately responsible for contextualising what is special about Korean stories on our service - for the world.  Your team strives to authentically represent the multiple narratives that exist in every story so that our members can discover the stories that they will love.  You and your team define and drive the creative and operational strategy for how we represent and launch titles across these regions and partner with internal and external partners to ensure a seamless experience for our members in these countries and beyond. Key Characteristics Sought: You value, understand, and can deliver great experiences for our members Approach problems with both a local and regional lens Build strong partnerships locally, regionally, and globally to advocate for the needs, nuances, and complexity of Korea, while seeking a broader understanding and best practices Have first-hand experience working with product/brand/content in Korea Understands that local titles have the power to inspire global phenomena Have a strong track record of building and cultivating great locally-oriented teams You are equally adept at defining and driving both Creative and Operational Excellence Understands the challenges and importance of driving high-quality creative work at scale Ensures regional and global business context is considered alongside local ambitions to find the sweet spot for this team Inspires a multi-disciplinary team toward  shared goals, objectives, and opportunities Complexity and volatility do not faze you - you are able to stretch to drive/ set strategy AND drive implementation/ execution You are a strong strategic partner to cross-functional leaders Great bridge - both to cross-functional teams; as well as to broader PDP (regionally + globally): equally adept at articulating your own vision while also collaborating to drive market success. Adept at speaking to Product considerations (member-first approach, hypotheses forming and experimentation) as well as Marketing/Content concerns (audiences, how to integrate brand into day-to-day work, storytelling) Influence and synthesize functional context and strategy for your teams in a way that best suits the needs of the markets. You are a builder and developer of strong multidisciplinary teams Bring nuanced and deep local business experience which allows you to provide input on local creative and operational strategy from a market perspective while influencing regional and global teams. Be an excellent leader who sees the big picture. You know how to inspire your own team through the challenges of a rapidly evolving, complex business. Be an invaluable colleague to your cross-functional stakeholders and partners by working with them closely to recognize opportunities and synthesize strategy across other countries, regions, and functions. Be equally comfortable in “left brain” or “right brain” problem solving, but be most excited when both are deployed at the same time and understand how to leverage data and insights to push the boundaries of creative excellence. Have an eye for compelling creativity, inspire and set a high bar for quality, and advocate effectively on behalf of what’s best for the member experience. Adept at identifying, innovating, and developing opportunities for efficiency and increased impact on the team. Have experience working within a matrix organisation structure - and be adept at effectively influencing and advocating for both local and global/ functional business goals, serving as a bridge between both. Be an earnest and inclusive leader who will be a great steward of the Netflix culture while also helping it to shape and evolve over time. Qualifications: Leadership experience in a fast-paced growth environment, adept at scaling within a rapidly expanding company and market. 10+ years of experience in building and growing diverse teams through hiring, developing, and managing a sizable team of high-performers. Experience working in Korea, with a nuanced understanding of navigating the local challenges and opportunities while synthesizing regional and global contexts. Experience in managing teams and influencing outcomes in a matrix environment. Comfort working at a company, and in a team, where data and insights are heavily leveraged in decision-making.  First-hand experience with A/B testing is a plus. Business fluency in Korean and English. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status or disability status. 넷플릭스는 다양한 경험과 생각을 가진 구성원이 모였을 때 최고의 성과를 내는 팀을 만들어 갈 수 있다고 믿고 있습니다. 다양성과 포용성은 우리가 지향하는 기업 문화의 핵심 중 하나이며, 이것의 궁극적인 목적은 모든 직원이 역량을 마음껏 발휘하고 성장하며 기여할 수 있도록 환경을 조성하는 것입니다.  인재를 선별하는 과정은 이러한 목적을 달성하는 데 매우 중요합니다.  이에 따라 넷플릭스는  성별, 인종, 피부색, 국적, 종교, 성적 지향, 나이, 결혼 여부 등 모든 개인적인 배경과 상관없이 모두에게 평등한 기회를 보장하며, 공정한 과정을 통해 채용을 진행하고 있습니다.장애인 및 국가보훈 대상자는 관련 법령에 따라 우대합니다.

description: Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. It's an exciting time for Netflix with continued rapid expansion into original programming around the world; it's a great time to join our team in EMEA. As Netflix expands, we continue to look for the best and brightest talent to scale with our growth opportunities. Visit our culture memo and long-term view to learn more. Netflix seeks a Counsel, Employment Legal - EMEA to join our growing team in EMEA.  We are looking for someone who has great passion for the Netflix brand and our content, and who wants to be a part of our global team of employment lawyers who use their legal knowledge and experience in the most practical and risk tolerant way possible to support our ever-growing business. This position is based in our EMEA head office in Amsterdam (or could be based in Berlin). With our rapid expansion across EMEA, this person would primarily support our offices in Germany, Poland and the Nordics. The role reports to the Director, Employment Legal - EMEA,  based in Amsterdam. Next to him, you’d be working closely with our other Employment legal counsels based in EMEA  as well as with the global employment legal team. Still, the aim is to have this largely be an independent role and to have you run with it! We have multiple corporate offices and a large slate of local language original series and films being produced all across the region in Europe, the Middle East and Africa. This means that we have a wide array of different roles and employees based across our EMEA offices. From Marketing to Business Development and from Tax to Studio and Production roles. All these teams are supported by an amazing HR/Talent team and employment legal. While part of this job may be to handle issues on productions, the main focus, especially over time, will be to provide support to our corporate offices. This means that you could be joining a call on how to set up a new entity in Hungary in the morning, negotiate a termination in Sweden after lunch and have a discussion about benefits in Germany in the afternoon. Believe me, there is still time to watch your favorite shows. Some other examples of what you’d be doing: Main focus: Advise on all corporate employment matters in close collaboration with members of HR (Talent), HRBP’s, Talent Operations,, Employment Tax, Mobility & Immigration. Subsidiary focus: Support EMEA content productions with employment-related matters in EMEA; Provide subject matter expertise and, when appropriate, train on a broad range of employment issues, including recruiting, contingent workers, employment practices, anti-harassment and termination practices and approaches, as well as supporting our other employment legal team members in EMEA on these issues as needed for other EMEA countries; Proactively identify, assess, and balance employment law risk, and be able to offer practical, business-oriented and creative solutions in partnership with the business teams; Stay current with, and advise Netflix on, meaningful employment-related legal developments; When necessary, help investigate incidents and/or complaints and manage employment-related litigation in EMEA; Actively collaborate with the global Employment Legal team on projects and issues; Select, manage and use outside counsel effectively; and Support Netflix’s commitment to maintaining a diverse and inclusive harassment-free workplace. Requirements The successful candidate will have at least 6+ years of deep experience in employment law and labor relation matters in a law firm and/or in-house in a multinational company. German employment law experience is desirable Ability to work effectively and collaboratively cross-functionally, think practically and be solution-oriented This role is for someone who thrives in an environment where freedom and responsibility are core values, and passion, innovation, courage and curiosity are at the heart of everything we do. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

description: The Discovery & Viewing Experiences team builds novel product features on Netflix’s industry-leading Android, iOS, and TV apps to help members discover and connect with stories they’ll love. We’re looking for an Android engineer to join the team and help us entertain the world. You will partner with cross-functional teams like consumer insights, product management, experience design, and more to shape and ship user experiences that will delight millions of customers worldwide. We are part of a global, diverse organization that includes people of all genders, sexual orientations, upbringings, nationalities, ages, and socioeconomic & educational backgrounds. We encourage anyone passionate about building compelling mobile experiences that touch audiences worldwide to apply. The Job Partner with product, design, and engineering teams to scope and build delightful and accessible user experiences Learn and iterate on product features as we validate our judgment by A/B testing product variants with real customers Leverage technologies like DI/Dagger/Hilt, Jetpack Compose, MvRx, GraphQL, etc., to build product features Shape product and design requirements weighing the tradeoffs between moving fast and building for the long-term Develop code with quality in mind and write automated tests with JVM Unit/Espresso What Sets You Apart You take great satisfaction in building user experiences that please our members and move our business forward You’re effective at developing strong relationships with cross-functional teams through clear communication, curiosity, and selflessness You enjoy a creative and collaborative problem-solving approach enabling our design and product partners to realize their vision You take an active role in shaping the features you build, informed by your knowledge and expertise You’ve developed strong coding skills, especially with Java and Kotlin, and can navigate different languages and technology stacks (eg. Remote, United States Client and UI Engineering Android Software Engineer (L4) - Discovery & Viewing Experiences The Discovery & Viewing Experiences team builds novel product features on Netflix’s industry-leading Android, iOS, and TV apps to help members discover and connect with stories they’ll love. We’re looking for an Android engineer to join the team and help us entertain the world. You will partner with cross-functional teams like consumer insights, product management, experience design, and more to shape and ship user experiences that will delight millions of customers worldwide. We are part of a global, diverse organization that includes people of all genders, sexual orientations, upbringings, nationalities, ages, and socioeconomic & educational backgrounds. description: It’s an amazing time to be joining Netflix as we continue to transform entertainment globally. Netflix is the world's leading internet entertainment service with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, feature films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages.  Netflix members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and now they are able to download and play games anytime, anywhere with a collection of Netflix curated and produced games. About the Job ​​The Director of Game Licensing will report to, and work closely with, the Senior Director of Portfolio Strategy and Content Acquisition to devise and implement the game licensing strategy and execution plan across Netflix's External Games business that will touch licensed, Netflix-owned, and co-published games, high impact marketing activations and Netflix IP integrations with top tier third party game companies. This individual will also oversee the operations and production of a variety of licensed game projects partnering with our Marketing, Production, Comms and Content teams.  Together you will build a successful catalogue of outbound licensed content, entertaining our members across the globe. As a business development leader, you will be responsible for guiding game licensing programming strategies, exploring, managing and maximizing the commercialization of intellectual properties through collaborative partnerships with external partners, defining the right rules of engagement, collaborating with Netflix’s senior leadership on the Company's growth strategy across all of its Gaming businesses, and helping scale the value proposition of Netflix gaming via the right set of partners. You will work closely with game production, live-ops, transmedia, marketing, content, product, comms, strategy and analytics, legal, among others, to deliver results. Responsibilities Build and direct the execution, tone, and vision for the External Games team’s licensing programs. Develop category and distribution strategies that maximize our title and portfolio output, achieving a balance between driving consumer demand (a proxy for fan joy) and delivering meaningful impact. Own the overall production strategy for all External Games team’s game licensing projects, including pipelines and processes, to ensure Producers have everything they need to serve players, developers, and internal partners. Manage a team of Producers, supporting them in their role as our external developer’s and internal partner’s primary point of contact. Mentor and lead Producers, creating growth and opportunities for their success, while maintaining a balanced production capacity. Act as a senior thought leader and develop high-impact, high-priority game marketing activations outside of Netflix that help drive conversation around our biggest IP Franchises. Constantly analyze the rapidly evolving video game landscape, finding new opportunities for licensing deals and partnership opportunities that will support the growth of Netflix properties. Evaluate, negotiate, and close key game licensing deals across Netflix IP that will help grow the footprint of Netflix Gaming with creators and developers of all sizes. Demonstrate fluency in the most complex legal and business issues in contracts and develop creative win-win solutions with our partners. Quickly develop expertise in each of the relevant licensed categories and act as the resource for these categories. This includes developing a thorough understanding of the product line, the market, competitors, and all capabilities of the licensee. Collaborate with our Transmedia team to help expand Netflix’s ever-growing IP catalogue in the digital gaming space via key strategic partnerships with top global gaming companies. Be agile and execute across a quickly evolving range of products. Collaborate with a broad range of internal constituents to help define go-to-market strategies and drive sign-off from internal leadership. Qualifications 10+ years of licensing experience in the games industry across all major categories. 5+ years experience in game production with experience shipping multiple games (social, F2P, mobile, web, console, handheld). Proven track record with scaling businesses, including established and nascent brands. Strong experience sourcing in a gaming environment with a demonstrated track record of helping drive a broad range of PC, console and mobile-focused game partnership deals. High-level expertise in negotiation and deal construction including the legal aspects of negotiations. Strong program/project management skills with successful delivery of quality, drive planning, schedules, estimates, budgeting, resource plans and status reports. Thorough understanding of the product development process. Experience learning quickly about new technologies and distilling information into actionable insights for internal stakeholders. Experience successfully navigating a fast-paced, highly ambiguous environment. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $220,000 - $900,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: About Netflix: Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with over 270 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. We recently launched a new ad-supported tier to offer our members with more choice in how they consume their content. Our new tier allows us to attract new members at a lower price point, while also creating a compelling path for advertisers to reach audiences that are deeply immersed. Our Team The Ads Platform team builds the advertising systems and integrations that power the delivery of ads using our world-class content delivery ecosystem. We deliver ads in a manner that’s thoughtful of our member’s viewing experience and drive great outcomes for advertisers. Our team is new and yet faced with the ambitions of building highly performant advertising systems and delivering high impact to our business by monetizing our incredible slate of content. As one of the newest entrants in the Connected TV advertising space that’s rapidly growing, we seek to build unique value propositions that help us differentiate from the competition and become a market leader in record time. This role can be based out of our New York, Los Gatos or Los Angeles offices in a hybrid model. We are also open to remote-based in the US. Travel will be required if remote-based. What you'll be doing: Leading the ad server product vertical helping define Netflix’s Ad Suite and designing and developing the ad-decisioning and delivery pillar Contributing towards the ads platform business strategy and driving excellence in our offerings to brands Working closely with sales, marketing, and advertisers to understand needs and develop effective product offerings Working with large and distributed ad platform teams developing products for internal and external partners Collaborating with stunning colleagues across product managers, engineers, data scientists, designers, marketing, sales, and a broad set of cross-functional partners to craft, implement, and launch delightful products that improve business performance We’re seeking a candidate who has: Broad and deep technical understanding of Marketing and Advertising Technology; including DSPs, SSPs, CSSs, ad servers, optimization models, inventory management, cleanrooms, CDPs, programmatic IDs and graphs, measurement… Problem-solving capabilities evidenced by a proven ability to quantitatively and qualitatively analyze product concepts, strategic opportunities, and competitive threats The ability to influence with excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to prepare clear and concise stakeholder-ready documents Experience working with cross-functional teams (marketing, sales, etc.) 10 + years experience as a product manager, ideally in the advertising space Experience in leading and building product management teams in previous roles/companies Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $430,000 - $1,500,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: It’s an amazing time to be joining Netflix as we continue to transform entertainment globally. Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films, and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. This role focuses on the strategy, planning, and implementation of paid media campaigns across social, programmatic, local digital media & TV, OOH for the launch of our titles, as well as brand/service initiatives, in partnership with a media agency. It requires strong stakeholder collaboration, the ability to create scalable strategies, and manage the overall media strategy to ensure a balanced Netflix brand presence in the local media landscape. Our ideal candidate is an analytical thinker, adept at leveraging data and insights to uncover the most impactful and engaging marketing strategies. It is expected that a successful candidate will be developing detailed media plans and guiding our partner on operational specifics related to seamless campaign execution, so a knowledge of platform & media is required for the role. We highly encourage reading the Who We Are section of the Netflix website and learning about the Netflix Culture to ensure that all candidates feel that Netflix is a good fit. Responsibilities Develop and manage end-to-end strategy, planning, and measurement with media partners for executing media campaigns across various channels, including TV, OOH, digital platforms like Naver, Kakao, Google, and other social media. Work with media agencies to improve workflows for audience identification, performance evaluation, while identifying new ways of working and long-term opportunities to drive greater impact through media planning and buying. Collaborate closely with the country marketing teams (Title and Social) on title/campaign level paid strategy and goals to make informed recommendations regarding media mix, optimal targeting, platforms, creative formats, and budget allocation. Work with key stakeholders at digital platforms on ways to best leverage their products and opportunities for scalable digital innovation. Optimize and manage media investment in campaigns, ensuring balanced Netflix representation locally across multiple marketing channels. Work with functional leaders and the marketing director to optimize budget management, align it with strategic priorities, and ensure real-time bookkeeping. Partner with the country marketing team on campaign evaluation as well as strategic media principles, guidelines, and success criteria that are in line with marketing objectives. Provide feedback to global partner teams on tooling needs for campaign planning & execution efficiency. Requirements Minimum of 8 years' experience in managing and developing paid media strategies for multiple business lines or products, handling sizable campaigns in Korea. Experience with full-funnel campaign tactics and success evaluation. Proficiency in traditional media buying and major ad platforms including Naver, Kakao, Google, and social media. Well versed in paid social best practices, including channel specific creative formats and the latest strategies resonating with consumers. Highly detail-oriented with the ability to multitask and prioritize in a fast-paced, high-volume environment. Strong communication skills, ability to work cross-functionally with multiple stakeholders. Startup/scale-up mentality, experience building solutions from scratch, and excitement for the unknown/untested. Strong understanding of the overall marketing ecosystem, specifically digital media and paid social roles. Up-to-date with emerging social platforms and innovative industry trends. High proficiency with spreadsheet-based tools like Google Sheets or Excel. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status or disability status. 넷플릭스는 다양한 경험과 생각을 가진 구성원이 모였을 때 최고의 성과를 내는 팀을 만들어 갈 수 있다고 믿고 있습니다. 다양성과 포용성은 우리가 지향하는 기업 문화의 핵심 중 하나이며, 이것의 궁극적인 목적은 모든 직원이 역량을 마음껏 발휘하고 성장하며 기여할 수 있도록 환경을 조성하는 것입니다.  인재를 선별하는 과정은 이러한 목적을 달성하는 데 매우 중요합니다.  이에 따라 넷플릭스는  성별, 인종, 피부색, 국적, 종교, 성적 지향, 나이, 결혼 여부 등 모든 개인적인 배경과 상관없이 모두에게 평등한 기회를 보장하며, 공정한 과정을 통해 채용을 진행하고 있습니다.장애인 및 국가보훈 대상자는 관련 법령에 따라 우대합니다.

description: Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. The Public Policy team at Netflix engages with policymakers, regulators, and government bodies in order to advocate for Netflix’s interests in the policymaking process, and acts as a strategic partner to internal business groups as they navigate the policy world. The UCAN Policy team works with federal and local governments, as well as industry stakeholders, to: 1. Shape policy, including on matters of privacy, consumer protection, online safety, competition, tax, copyright and cultural regulations; 2. Promote a production ecosystem that aligns with our growth and values - including diversity and inclusion, accessibility and sustainability. The role is dedicated to Canada within the UCAN Policy team and reports to the Director, Public Policy, Canada. The role is based in Toronto, Canada but entails travel to Netflix offices in Washington D.C., Los Angeles and New York, and other locations as needed. As part of this team, the Coordinator will be immersed in the unique content for which Netflix is known and support advocacy on all matters related to content creation, production, and delivery. The Coordinator will implement and strategize ways to boost the overall effectiveness and efficiency of the team, be responsible for magnifying communications internally, help execute ongoing projects, and act as a point of contact for other internal teams and external stakeholders about the status of projects, progress updates, and team priorities and needs. We are looking for someone who is focused on developing solutions, able to juggle a high volume of requests and can communicate effectively across audiences, thinks creatively, is highly organized, and is eager to learn. Responsibilities Assist in legislative analysis and policy research on a wide range of issues Support the creation of internal communications on key policy developments Maintenance of databases and trackers on priority issues and goals Collaborate with a range of internal cross-functional teams as well as external stakeholder engagement with consultants, trade associations, and industry peers Assist in collateral, asset and campaign development Collaborate with other internal teams on screenings and events Attend company events, trade association meetings and industry receptions Respond to government requests for information Requirements Bachelor’s degree in Public Policy, Law, Economics or Business A minimum of 2 years of relevant professional experience in public policy or government affairs Exceptional written and verbal communication and research skills Excellent interpersonal skills with experience developing and fostering effective relationships across diverse teams Outstanding attention to detail and time management skills with the  ability to juggle multiple projects simultaneously Preferred Postgraduate degree in Public Policy, Law, Economics or Business Written and oral fluency in English and French Knowledge of the media & entertainment sector Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $70,000 - $350,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Supplemental Health and Dental Plans, Mental Health support, a RRSP Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment. Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: At Netflix, we want to entertain the world and are constantly innovating on how entertainment is imagined, created and delivered to a global audience. We currently stream content in more than 30 languages in 190 countries, topping over 260 million paid subscribers and are expanding into new forms of entertainment such as gaming. Content Engineering builds the products and services used by our internal and external creative partners to create, launch, and promote our global content. Our products enable the entire workflow of content creation, from pitch to play, and provide innovative new ways to develop and manage entertainment at scale. We are looking for talented distributed systems engineers like you to help build the technologies that allow us to scale our efforts across the globe, and do so effectively and efficiently! You’ll have a direct impact on how the Netflix studio creates and promotes shows such as “Squid Game”, “Stranger Things” and “The Queen’s Gambit” on a global scale. We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive team to bring new perspectives as we solve the next set of challenges. In addition, we are open to remote candidates - we value what you can do, from anywhere in the U.S. You will be successful in this role if you enjoy: Being self-motivated, working independently, and partnering with a diverse group of engineers, product managers and TPMs across different functional areas and organizations. Empowering other engineers by building and operating robust, scalable, and highly available infrastructures, with a focus on developer experience, observability and operational excellence. Thriving in ambiguity, diving deep to understand problems and customer pain points, and solving them using appropriate technologies. Being an evangelist for high quality code and engineering best practices. Assisting in the career development of others, actively mentoring individuals, and helping build technical communities across the organization. Living the Netflix’s culture and thinking you would thrive here. Qualifications: Have 5+ years of experience in crafting complex distributed systems. Have recent proficient experience with Java, C# or other OO programming languages with a solid understanding of OO design principles, concurrency, multi-threading, performance tuning and observability. Have a proven track record in architecting, building, and operating distributed systems with high availability, fault tolerance, and performance. Have solid experience in setting technical directions for engineering projects, making architectural decisions, and influencing partner and cross-functional teams. Have the ability to proactively describe complex technical concepts to a variety of stakeholders, driving conversations and decisions through written and/or verbal communication. Nice to have: Have a product mindset toward infrastructure and platforms. Experience in developing long-term technical strategies aligning with business goals via appropriate technology investments. Proficient with gRPC and/or GraphQL API design and implementation. Working experience with Kafka, Cassandra, Elasticsearch, Memcached, and/or AWS. Familiarity with library development and DI frameworks (preferably Spring Boot). Have application security domain experience - awareness of AuthN and AuthZ constructs. Spotlight on Content Engineering Teams: Studio Production Engineering (SPE) The Studio Production Engineering team builds products to enable Netflix Studio to optimize and innovate how Netflix plans productions, produces great content, and manages the production of content globally and at scale to achieve operational efficiency, scale economies, and better decision-making through shared, accurate, and transparent data. Content MiddleWare Infrastructure (MWI) The Content MiddleWare Infrastructure team(MWI), a part of the Content Infrastructure & Solutions group, provides Studio and Content Engineering specific, highly leveraged, and fully managed data, workflow, and messaging & communication platforms facilitating the goal of the Connected Studio . To learn more about what the MWI team does, check out the following tech blogs:Workflow ( 1 , 2 )Graph Search ( 1 , 2 , 3 )Data Movement ( 1 , 2 ) Media Infrastructure Platform (MIP) The Media Infrastructure Platform team provides large-scale infrastructure for content media, enabling Netflix to store, access, and process media files at scale, reliably, and efficiently to meet the demands of Netflix streaming and studio. Our products are highly leveraged by Encoding, Netflix Studio, and Content Engineering. We closely partner with a variety of cross-functional teams, including Encoding Technology, Netflix Engineering Platform, Data Science Engineering, and Content Engineering, as well as Product Managers. The team currently owns a few key products such as a polyglot application framework, and container-based executor for media-aware serverless functions with observability tools and workflow orchestration frameworks, a storage layer built on top of S3 with a set of features like file and folder solution, lifecycle management,  media sequence detection, Netflix access control, security,  client side encryption, full file checksum, etc.  Besides the cloud services the team currently owns, the team is also looking to grow into a more diverse and hybrid media processing and storage media space to meet the needs of business growth. A few more things about us: As a team, we come from many different countries and our fields of education range from the humanities to engineering to computer science. Our team includes product managers, program managers, designers, full-stack developers, distributed systems engineers, and data scientists. Folks have the opportunity to wear different hats, should they choose to. We strongly believe this diversity has helped us build an inclusive and empathetic environment and look forward to adding your perspective to the mix! Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $170,000 - $720,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

As a Support Specialist, you play a critical role in supporting Netflix staff and their engagement with technology by examining user friction and gathering relevant information. This begins the process of working with partner teams to improve the overall technology experience and permanently resolve recurring issues. User Experience Jira space Ensure that our users interact with us at the highest quality technical support partnership while engaging in our organization's strategy to learn from user experience Manila, Philippines Netflix Technology Services Technology Experience Specialist - Manila N-Tech: Technology Experience Specialists (TES) use their technical knowledge and experience to provide technology support to users, converting information and learning from interactions to prioritize, actionable understandings of the holistic user experience. As a Support Specialist, you play a critical role in supporting Netflix staff and their engagement with technology by examining user friction and gathering relevant information. This begins the process of working with partner teams to improve the overall technology experience and permanently resolve recurring issues.  RESPONSIBILITIES
  • Serve as the primary point of contact for users seeking technical assistance 
  • Responsible for learning how users experience technology through investigation, documentation, and categorization of interactions with a focus on trends and contact reasoning 
  • Prioritize managing technical issues, triage/research bugs, be a part of incident/outage management workflows, escalate issues to appropriate partner groups, and develop/sustain robust documentation to create a positive knowledge base experience
  • Recognize and connect patterns in how users experience technology across 1st and 3rd party technologies by composing bug reports when needed
  • Recommend and/or implement experience improvements, make feature requests, bring to attention opportunities to create self-service solutions, as well as productivity enhancements
  • Identify and link ZenDesk tickets that show a pattern of behaviour/user friction, curate the stories of the patterns, and maintain the health of the User Experience Jira space
  • Ensure that our users interact with us at the highest quality technical support partnership while engaging in our organization's strategy to learn from user experience
  • Actively participate and contribute to efforts designed to improve how users experience both technology and support at/or working with Netflix
  • Engage and work with our global team as part of an overall user journey experience team, gathering important information, data, and context to bridge the user experience and partner teams, using compassionate and thoughtful feedback/ideas 
  • Work to ensure Netflix’s commitment to fostering an inclusive environment is demonstrated in every facet of our efforts
  • Create an inspiring, empowering, collaborative, and supportive team environment, leading by example and flexing to roll up your sleeves and support the team as needed
  • Flexibility in working hours to help meet the needs of the business
    • SKILLS & EXPERIENCE
  • Critical thinking skills to troubleshoot, research, and diagnose complicated technical issues by utilizing available systems and tools 
  • Robust documentation mindset, translating the information into knowledge-base articles and/or user stories
  • Able to proactively seek out opportunities to improve our user experiences and deliver cohesive ideas around innovative support strategies and application design considerations
  • Strong communication skills with demonstrated ability to engage with users through various ingestion points and communication platforms; including the ability for direct (virtual) interaction with stakeholders as part of your investigation around a particular technology friction and the user experience
  • Consistently developing your skill set while seeking out opportunities to learn
  • Collaborative through listening, seeking to understand, and supporting
  • Fluency in English (business level)
    • We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

description: We’re looking for a Production Director to drive the product development of a brand-new AAA multiplatform game, in partnership with the core leadership team.  As Production Director, you will be among the leaders of one of Netflix’s first generation of internally developed original games.  You will develop and execute the production plan - how we structure, build, launch and run the game and its operations, blending our creative aspirations with our desire to innovate in how games are built.  The right candidate will bring industry-leading expertise in managing and launching high-quality, deeply engaging games, along with attention to detail, structured thinking and flexibility.  Proven experience communicating and influencing across all development disciplines and support departments is integral to success in this role.  You will build a team of production experts, all in service of our primary goal of creating an amazing game. We're building the foundation for a small, but ambitious team of creators.  We’re looking for leaders who are aligned with our core values, and care deeply about the experiences they create as well as the people they make them with.  If you are someone with a bias towards action and are energized by the learning that comes with bold experimentation at an agile pace, we’d love to hear from you!  As a part of Netflix, we strive to hire the best and value integrity, excellence, respect, inclusion, and collaboration. Now is an amazing time to join Netflix as we seek to entertain the world. We have over 260 million paid members in over 190 countries, and we won’t stop there. Responsibilities Include Task Management in partnership with department leads - prioritization, scheduling, communication and day-to-day management Resource Management - estimation, load balancing, planning / road-mapping Process development and iteration on production pathways Day to day tasking/scheduling requiring hands-on expertise with Jira and Confluence.  Knowledge of plug-ins and best practices to enable smooth workflow for distributed teams. Coordination with partner teams within Netflix on shared development priorities Management of internal and external releases, coordinating across multiple stakeholders Hiring, mentorship, and management of a small team of production experts Adapting our production process to support all phases of development from initial prototyping and concepting through release and sustained operation at scale Actively contributing to the studio culture, modeling behavior, monitoring team health and evolving culture in a way that’s aligned with our core values as we grow Collaborate with the rest of the leadership team to create our development strategy, build a plan, execute on key initiatives, measure our progress and iterate throughout the project. The Ideal Candidate At least 10 years of production experience, including 5+ years of experience managing direct reports in a senior leadership role, with multiple shipped high-quality, large-scale multi-platform games Experience supporting a live service game from development planning to delivery of content and features post-launch Excellent communication skills grounded in authenticity, intention and curiosity Experience with all phases of game development from concept through release and post-launch Well-developed skills and judgment for assessing and balancing competing factors like quality, scope, cost, risk and time Passion for creating structure and organization out of chaos; A desire to build systems to support creativity and innovation Demonstrable track record for providing and accepting feedback; Established strong partnerships with creative and technical leadership, with the ability to influence decision-making through discussion and engagement, rather than authority Gets excited by learning new skills, dashing to pitch in, even if this means flexing beyond this role’s core responsibilities if it can help us win Passion for playing, incubating, building, and shipping video games Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $220,000 - $900,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. Remote, United States Games Netflix Games Studio Production Director, Games Studio (Blue) We’re looking for a Production Director to drive the product development of a brand-new AAA multiplatform game, in partnership with the core leadership team.  As Production Director, you will be among the leaders of one of Netflix’s first generation of internally developed original games.  You will develop and execute the production plan - how we structure, build, launch and run the game and its operations, blending our creative aspirations with our desire to innovate in how games are built.  The right candidate will bring industry-leading expertise in managing and launching high-quality, deeply engaging games, along with attention to detail, structured thinking and flexibility.  Proven experience communicating and influencing across all development disciplines and support departments is integral to success in this role.  You will build a team of production experts, all in service of our primary goal of creating an amazing game.   We're building the foundation for a small, but ambitious team of creators.  We’re looking for leaders who are aligned with our core values, and care deeply about the experiences they create as well as the people they make them with.  If you are someone with a bias towards action and are energized by the learning that comes with bold experimentation at an agile pace, we’d love to hear from you!  As a part of Netflix, we strive to hire the best and value integrity, excellence, respect, inclusion, and collaboration.  Now is an amazing time to join Netflix as we seek to entertain the world. We have over 260 million paid members in over 190 countries, and we won’t stop there.  Responsibilities Include
  • Task Management in partnership with department leads - prioritization, scheduling, communication and day-to-day management
  • Resource Management - estimation, load balancing, planning / road-mapping
  • Process development and iteration on production pathways
  • Day to day tasking/scheduling requiring hands-on expertise with Jira and Confluence.  Knowledge of plug-ins and best practices to enable smooth workflow for distributed teams.
  • Coordination with partner teams within Netflix on shared development priorities
  • Management of internal and external releases, coordinating across multiple stakeholders
  • Hiring, mentorship, and management of a small team of production experts
  • Adapting our production process to support all phases of development from initial prototyping and concepting through release and sustained operation at scale
  • Actively contributing to the studio culture, modeling behavior, monitoring team health and evolving culture in a way that’s aligned with our core values as we grow
  • Collaborate with the rest of the leadership team to create our development strategy, build a plan, execute on key initiatives, measure our progress and iterate throughout the project.
    • The Ideal Candidate
  • At least 10 years of production experience, including 5+ years of experience managing direct reports in a senior leadership role, with multiple shipped high-quality, large-scale multi-platform games
  • Experience supporting a live service game from development planning to delivery of content and features post-launch
  • Excellent communication skills grounded in authenticity, intention and curiosity
  • Experience with all phases of game development from concept through release and post-launch
  • Well-developed skills and judgment for assessing and balancing competing factors like quality, scope, cost, risk and time
  • Passion for creating structure and organization out of chaos; A desire to build systems to support creativity and innovation
  • Demonstrable track record for providing and accepting feedback; Established strong partnerships with creative and technical leadership, with the ability to influence decision-making through discussion and engagement, rather than authority
  • Gets excited by learning new skills, dashing to pitch in, even if this means flexing beyond this role’s core responsibilities if it can help us win
  • Passion for playing, incubating, building, and shipping video games
    • Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $220,000 - $900,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here. Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: With more than 260 million paid subscribers around the world and growing, Netflix is dedicated to bringing the world’s content to our members everywhere. We’re just getting started, and it’s an exciting time to work at Netflix and change the future of entertainment. THE OPPORTUNITY This is an opportunity to be part of a global entertainment company with a great consumer brand and to help Netflix shape the future of television. The legal team at Netflix is focused on collaborating with its business partners to help foster innovation. We are looking for a talented legal professional to join our Product & Corporate Legal team in Tokyo, Japan as a Legal Associate/Manager.  You will be instrumental in helping our team deliver fast and practical solutions for a wide range of legal issues.  The primary focus will be on supporting the Product & Corporate Legal, Marketing Legal and Consumer Products Legal teams. As a member of the Product & Corporate Legal, Marketing Legal and Consumer Products Legal teams, you will: Collaborate with stunning colleagues across business development, product, marketing, consumer products and other stakeholders to help Netflix achieve its key business objectives. Become the go-to point-of-contact for processing consumer claims and inquiries by local law enforcement to ensure timely and effective resolution. Build knowledge and expertise on Netflix’s products and services to help the business navigate and assess legal risks arising from new and existing user experiences. Draft, review, and negotiate procurement agreements to support Netflix’s business operations. Create and maintain informational resources for the marketing teams and support the marketing team’s contract needs, including reviewing agreements and coordinating with the content licensing team. Act as the legal liaison and partnering with the customer service teams to investigate, draft and respond to consumer claims and other legally sensitive consumer complaints. Work with internal stakeholders to prepare and submit regulatory filings. Required Qualifications: One to three years of legal experience as either a practicing attorney or a member of the legal team in a multinational company Fluency in Japanese and English A strong business-first mindset Excellent interpersonal and communication skills Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative environment. Be comfortable evaluating risk with imperfect information and willingness to ask questions, especially those that may be awkward and/or uncomfortable High intellectual curiosity and strong willingness to tackle new subject matters outside one’s comfort zone and take on special projects as the need arises, even outside the original role Preferred Qualifications: E-commerce and/or IT-industry experience Bar qualification in one or more jurisdictions We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status or disability status. Please do not forward resumes to our career page or employees.
