description: This is your chance to be at the forefront of Netflix’s new offering of Video Games. We will bring these new experiences to market through the world's leading streaming entertainment app with 208 million paid memberships in over 190 countries who are already enjoying TV series, documentaries, and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and now they can download and play mobile games anytime, anywhere with a collection of Netflix curated and produced Games. At Netflix, we have an insatiable need to continually improve our product experience and the creative elements that support it and this team sits at the forefront of the effort. Netflix is looking for an experienced Operations Manager to join the Netflix Game Studio in delivering the next generation of video games to a worldwide audience. This role is part of the External Games team focused on driving the development of new games on Netflix and supporting the production team in delivering a world-class platform. The Operations Manager will ensure that our large portfolio of licensed and developed games is delivered to the service on time and on budget and without unwanted surprises. The role will drive and improve operational efficiency for the games in development and live on the market, engaging with a broad array of Netflix cross-functional organizations. This role will partner and collaborate with External Production, Platform & Product, Engineering, and Creative Production teams and includes management and refinement of the entire lifecycle of the product portfolio through supporting development up to game release and the ongoing creation of engaging post-release content. Responsibilities: Tracking and reviewing development progress across a portfolio of games that will be in various stages of development. Building productive and open relationships with internal and external Development Teams, supporting functions (Platform & Mobile Product and Engineering, Creative Production, Localization, and QA), and Licensing leadership. Supporting the maintenance and evolution of our Production Games Framework (PGF) to ensure on-track development, identifying possible issues with the product/content development, whether that be resource challenges, time constraints, technical hurdles, or quality. Consistently engage with leadership to identify potential issues in the development cycle, narrow down solutions in partnership with the development teams, and support resolution. Find opportunities to introduce and optimize operational and production workflows. Partner with cross-functional teams to ensure game launches are executed cleanly and in line with the PGF. Requirements: A passion for serving the needs of production and cross-functional teams within the Netflix organization. Must be comfortable working with ambiguity and able to drive projects to completion with transparency and clarity. Significant experience in Project/Program Management for software development. Experience with games across various genres from casual to core. Experience managing projects through the development lifecycle from business case/pre-production to launch/post-launch management. Has worked on content development/release and live operations through the game lifecycle. Experience working on multiple projects simultaneously. Experience in partner management, internally or externally, working with licensors a plus. A history of collaboration with release management, production, and live operations of games. Strong relationship-building skills. Proactive risk management. Adept at collaboratively moving from uncertainty to clarity. Excellent, precise, and proactive communicator. Technical Project Management / Program Management / Production experience is nice to have. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $50,000 - $600,000 Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

At Netflix, we have an insatiable need to continually improve our product experience and the creative elements that support it and this team sits at the forefront of the effort.  Netflix is looking for an experienced Operations Manager to join the Netflix Game Studio in delivering the next generation of video games to a worldwide audience. This role is part of the External Games team focused on driving the development of new games on Netflix and supporting the production team in delivering a world-class platform.    The Operations Manager will ensure that our large portfolio of licensed and developed games is delivered to the service on time and on budget and without unwanted surprises. The role will drive and improve operational efficiency for the games in development and live on the market, engaging with a broad array of Netflix cross-functional organizations.    This role will partner and collaborate with External Production, Platform & Product, Engineering, and Creative Production teams and includes management and refinement of the entire lifecycle of the product portfolio through supporting development up to game release and the ongoing creation of engaging post-release content. Responsibilities:
  • Tracking and reviewing development progress across a portfolio of games that will be in various stages of development.
  • Building productive and open relationships with internal and external Development Teams, supporting functions (Platform & Mobile Product and Engineering, Creative Production, Localization, and QA), and Licensing leadership.
  • Supporting the maintenance and evolution of our Production Games Framework (PGF) to ensure on-track development, identifying possible issues with the product/content development, whether that be resource challenges, time constraints, technical hurdles, or quality.
  • Consistently engage with leadership to identify potential issues in the development cycle, narrow down solutions in partnership with the development teams, and support resolution.
  • Find opportunities to introduce and optimize operational and production workflows.  
  • Partner with cross-functional teams to ensure game launches are executed cleanly and in line with the PGF.
    • Requirements:
  • A passion for serving the needs of production and cross-functional teams within the Netflix organization.
  • Must be comfortable working with ambiguity and able to drive projects to completion with transparency and clarity.
  • Significant experience in Project/Program Management for software development.
  • Experience with games across various genres from casual to core.
  • Experience managing projects through the development lifecycle from business case/pre-production to launch/post-launch management. Has worked on content development/release and live operations through the game lifecycle.
  • Experience working on multiple projects simultaneously.
  • Experience in partner management, internally or externally, working with licensors a plus.
  • A history of collaboration with release management, production, and live operations of games.
  • Strong relationship-building skills.
  • Proactive risk management.
  • Adept at collaboratively moving from uncertainty to clarity.
  • Excellent, precise, and proactive communicator.
  • Technical Project Management / Program Management / Production experience is nice to have.

To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $50,000 - $600,000 Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here. Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. The Team Ads Marketing function leads the development of our core ads positioning, and the GTM plan to bring this positioning to life through differentiated messaging and narratives in the market.  The team activates this messaging through Sales Enablement (presentations, materials, talking points) and non-sales channels to garner broad awareness and excitement amongst our key advertising partners. The Opportunity The Manager, Ads B2B Marketing will be a key architect in the Ads Marketing team’s success by crafting and activating the Netflix advertising story and value proposition to advertisers in Japan/Korea. You’ll work with multidisciplinary teams to develop strategic approaches to fueling brand and business growth on platform, unlocking the creative potential of ads offering. Additionally, you will contribute to broader business tactics beyond and pursue learning and development opportunities to consistently grow and evolve as a Netflix marketer and executive. Core Responsibilities: Design and craft go-to-market strategies and narratives in an exciting way for the Sales team and their advertising clients in collaboration with Global Ads Marketing team Collaborate cross-functionally (Comms, Ad Product Marketing, Research & Marketing) to ensure a consistent ads narrative. Partner regularly with international teams for launches and ongoing growth ( like Sales, Ad Product, Comms, Partner Marketing, Events, PR, and others). Lead the strategy and approach for how Netflix Ads shows up at local industry events and bespoke client engagements Pull together business goals, to align on audiences to target, channels to employ, messaging to activate, etc. Work with product and comms partners to clearly define marketing needs and coordinate various parts of the Ad Sales organization to execute against those needs (e.g. brand design, organic social, paid social, partner marketing, etc). Assess the right data and insights and upcoming ad solutions to identify key B2B stories that will resonate with the region and local markets Understand our partners (advertisers), and seek actionable insights to inform product and marketing strategy, and represent partners to cross-functional teams. Deliver regular updates to leadership complete with wins, challenges, and asks. Qualifications: 7- 10 years of experience in B2B marketing, product marketing, digital advertising or marketing communications. An understanding of the CTV/OTT/Streaming landscape is preferred. Experience in product positioning, narrative, and collateral development. Work closely with product and sales teams to develop product strategy, positioning, and messaging. Ability to develop and implement creative ideas, partner with agencies, and carefully manage competing projects with tight deadlines. Develop content including blog posts, case studies, presentations, creative assets, and thought leadership that support our marketing objectives. Help inform the development of new measurement products based on advertiser feedback and market insights. Ability to work in a highly cross-functional environment to drive stakeholder alignment and scaled communications. You have an entrepreneurial mindset and are eager to flourish in our unique company culture (see Who We Are ). We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status or disability status. Netflixは男女雇用機会均等法を順守しており、考え方や背景の多様性がより強力なチームを構築すると認識しています。Netflixは多様性・インクルージョンについて、真剣にかつ思慮深く取り組んでおり、人種、宗教、出身地、性別、性自認・性表現、経済状況、性的指向、年齢、婚姻状況、兵役、障がいの有無、その他の属性によって差別することはありません。 Netflix Japan will not accept unsolicited resumes or applications from recruitment agencies, and we will not be responsible for any related fees. Please do not forward resumes to our career page or employees.

Tokyo, Japan Advertising Ads Marketing Manager - Japan Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time.  The Team Ads Marketing function leads the development of our core ads positioning, and the GTM plan to bring this positioning to life through differentiated messaging and narratives in the market.  The team activates this messaging through Sales Enablement (presentations, materials, talking points) and non-sales channels to garner broad awareness and excitement amongst our key advertising partners.   The Opportunity  The Manager, Ads B2B Marketing will be a key architect in the Ads Marketing team’s success by crafting and activating the Netflix advertising story and value proposition to advertisers in Japan/Korea. You’ll work with multidisciplinary teams to develop strategic approaches to fueling brand and business growth on platform, unlocking the creative potential of ads offering. Additionally, you will contribute to broader business tactics beyond and pursue learning and development opportunities to consistently grow and evolve as a Netflix marketer and executive. Core Responsibilities:
  • Design and craft go-to-market strategies and narratives in an exciting way for the Sales team and their advertising clients in collaboration with Global Ads Marketing team 
  • Collaborate cross-functionally (Comms, Ad Product Marketing, Research & Marketing) to ensure a consistent ads narrative.
  • Partner regularly with international teams for launches and ongoing growth ( like Sales, Ad Product, Comms, Partner Marketing, Events, PR, and others).
  • Lead the strategy and approach for how Netflix Ads shows up at local industry events and bespoke client engagements
  • Pull together business goals, to align on audiences to target, channels to employ, messaging to activate, etc.
  • Work with product and comms partners to clearly define marketing needs and coordinate various parts of the Ad Sales organization to execute against those needs (e.g. brand design, organic social, paid social, partner marketing, etc).
  • Assess the right data and insights and upcoming ad solutions to identify key B2B stories that will resonate with the region and local markets
  • Understand our partners (advertisers), and seek actionable insights to inform product and marketing strategy, and represent partners to cross-functional teams.
  • Deliver regular updates to leadership complete with wins, challenges, and asks.
    • Qualifications:
  • 7- 10 years of experience in B2B marketing, product marketing, digital advertising or marketing communications.
  • An understanding of the CTV/OTT/Streaming landscape is preferred.
  • Experience in product positioning, narrative, and collateral development.
  • Work closely with product and sales teams to develop product strategy, positioning, and messaging.
  • Ability to develop and implement creative ideas, partner with agencies, and carefully manage competing projects with tight deadlines.
  • Develop content including blog posts, case studies, presentations, creative assets, and thought leadership that support our marketing objectives.
  • Help inform the development of new measurement products based on advertiser feedback and market insights.
  • Ability to work in a highly cross-functional environment to drive stakeholder alignment and scaled communications.
  • You have an entrepreneurial mindset and are eager to flourish in our unique company culture (see Who We Are).
    • We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status or disability status. description: Netflix is the world's leading internet entertainment service, with over 250 million members in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any internet-connected screen. Members can play, pause, and resume watching, all without commercials or commitments. As part of the Content Engineering team, Metadata Distribution provides the infrastructure to safely and quickly verify, compute, package, and distribute the extensive catalog library, structure, and liveness that drives what you see and play when you use the Netflix product. This information plays a crucial role in shaping the user experience on Netflix, influencing everything from the recommendations you receive, to the way you experience content and even how the content is played back. As an Engineering Manager, you will: Coach a team of highly driven back-end focused senior engineers, providing them with robust career development opportunities. Establish strong partnerships with upstream teams to better model new entities in the ecosystem and any new metadata needs. Establish partnerships with downstream Engineering to understand controls and distribution needs in service of supporting new consumer product behaviors. Ability to drive architectures and decisions for technology innovation. This team is responsible for launching tiles on the Netflix product and the engineering manager acts as the product manager for some services. Ability to anticipate how new company initiatives will affect the movement of Title data and determine the most effective ways to evolve existing systems. Understanding the pros and cons of various options across different technology layers of the flow is essential. Represent the Content Engineering team in cross-functional forums. Ability to challenge designs and propose solutions for highly scalable distributed systems while minimizing technology costs and troubleshooting. About you: Prior expertise in all aspects of the data lifecycle such as modeling, movement, and distribution in highly scalable and low latency environments for core company data. Experience as an Engineering Manager is required. Experience leading teams working on highly scalable mission-critical distributed systems. Systems thinker with a strong desire to understand the entire end-to-end architecture and data flow. Strong influencing skills across partners and non-direct reports. Able to work with a wide breadth of stakeholders/partners ranging from operations, creative teams, engineering, legal, security, etc. Our culture is unique, and we live by our values, allowing you to do your best work and grow. To learn more about Content Engineering, feel free to listen to this video . Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $190,000 - $920,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service. Want to know more about our team? You can learn about us: - The Netflix culture - Re-Architecting the Video Gatekeeper - Netflix catalog categorization

  • Establish partnerships with downstream Engineering to understand controls and distribution needs in service of supporting new consumer product behaviors. 
  • Ability to drive architectures and decisions for technology innovation. This team is responsible for launching tiles on the Netflix product and the engineering manager acts as the product manager for some services.
  • Ability to anticipate how new company initiatives will affect the movement of Title data and determine the most effective ways to evolve existing systems. Understanding the pros and cons of various options across different technology layers of the flow is essential.
  • Represent the Content Engineering team in cross-functional forums.
  • Ability to challenge designs and propose solutions for highly scalable distributed systems while minimizing technology costs and troubleshooting.
    • About you:
  • Prior expertise in all aspects of the data lifecycle such as modeling, movement, and distribution in highly scalable and low latency environments for core company data. 
  • Experience as an Engineering Manager is required.
  • Experience leading teams working on highly scalable mission-critical distributed systems. 
  • Systems thinker with a strong desire to understand the entire end-to-end architecture and data flow.
  • Strong influencing skills across partners and non-direct reports.
  • Able to work with a wide breadth of stakeholders/partners ranging from operations, creative teams, engineering, legal, security, etc. 
    • Our culture is unique, and we live by our values, allowing you to do your best work and grow. To learn more about Content Engineering, feel free to listen to this video. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $190,000 - $920,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here. Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here.  We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service. Want to know more about our team? You can learn about us: - The Netflix culture - Re-Architecting the Video Gatekeeper -Netflix catalog categorization

description: Netflix is the world's leading internet entertainment service with over 240 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Netflix is also one of the largest studios in the world and empowers storytellers from all over the globe to tell the stories you fall in love with. Producing content globally, at this scale is a unique challenge; this is where our organization comes in. Studio Production Engineering plays a pivotal role in Netflix's content creation and delivery journey. The seamless magic of your favorite show starting with a click is the result of thousands of intricate processes behind the scenes. Our tools are the unsung heroes, enabling many of these workflows. We empower Netflix studios to bring creative excellence to life, build tools to bring operational excellence and accomplish economies of scale. Our solutions aim to elevate the ROI of the $15 billion dollars spent on content creation through cost/time efficiency, data driven decision making. We also provide technology to manage end-user access and build tools that help with resourcing workflows resulting in the production and delivery of the highest-quality content. We are looking for a Technical Program Manager with platform/infrastructure domain experience to drive high-impact cross-functional next-generation production solutions that scale for the growing business needs. This role requires strong collaboration with product managers, data science engineering, business stakeholders, peer technical program managers, and senior leadership to execute, track, and deliver high-impact strategic programs in the Studio space. What's Different About Us? Huge Impact - you will directly impact the workflows that help plan, produce and manage  billions of dollars worth of content spend Speed - we move quickly, iterate rapidly, and learn constantly Unique Culture - we live by our values Responsibilities Lead multiple cross-functional programs, in collaboration with product, engineering, design, and data science, that deliver technical solutions. Influence without authority and manage a large scope of initiatives and deliverables. Provide deep domain expertise to form technical strategies with engineering partners. Drive engagement with internal partners, work to decompose requirements into technical execution plans with measurable milestones, effectively optimize scope and schedule, manage cross-functional dependencies, and proactively manage risks. Craft clear communication of the big picture, challenges, progress toward goals and report status to stakeholders and leadership. We would love to work with you if: You have 10+ years of technical program management experience driving large scale software projects/programs with engineering and product teams. You have proven experience driving large-scale software projects, managing the definition of technical strategies, and building long-term scalable solutions. You have a deep understanding and point of view on product growth and discovery solutions. You are highly skilled, and experienced, and enjoy orchestrating multiple programs with many moving parts and creating partnerships with cross-functional teams. You are able to identify gaps in solutions, debate technical approaches, and weigh in on product vs. technology tradeoffs. You have excellent written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to clearly articulate the business impact and technical constraints tailored to the audience. You are a self-starter who enjoys tackling 0 to 1 problem spaces and quickly bringing organization and direction. You can exemplify the Netflix culture by understanding, advocating, and demonstrating its values. You truly believe that diversity is key to a team’s health and success. Bonus Points if: You have application security domain experience - awareness of AuthN and AuthZ constructs. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $230,000 - $960,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more details about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service. Our organization has a distributed team across the US. We are considering both candidates who are willing to relocate to Los Gatos, California, and Los Angeles, California (with occasional travel to other offices).

description: Netflix is revolutionizing entertainment. We connect people with movies and television globally by delivering outstanding content and technological innovation. This is your chance to be at the forefront of Netflix’s new offering of Video Games. We will bring these new experiences to market through the world's leading streaming entertainment app with 247 million paid memberships in over 190 countries who are already enjoying TV series, documentaries and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and now they can download and play mobile games anytime, anywhere with a collection of Netflix curated and produced Games. At Netflix, we have an insatiable need to continually improve our product experience and the creative elements that support it and this team sits at the forefront of the effort. Netflix is looking for an experienced Director of Live Service to join the Internal Games team. This role reports directly to the VP of Internal Games and will partner with Internal games leadership, first and second party game studios, as well as cross-functional partners to ensure the successful launch and operation of world-class, multi-platform live service games. What You’ll Do The Director of Live Services on the Internal Games team will be responsible for identifying, establishing, and running all central game product management processes related to launching, operating, and optimizing live service games for our internal game studios. The person in this role will take analysis and insights derived from multiple sources, including our cross-functional strategy, analysis, live services, and data science teams, to drive actionable strategies, strategic execution, plans, and recommendations across the internal studios organization and portfolio (including slate strategy, product strategy, and the approach to live services). You will be expected to form great relationships with our internal game teams, working through influence to ensure that all of our internal studios have top-notch game PM, live operations, and analysis capabilities. You will also be expected to form great relationships with our cross-functional partners who dive deep on analysis and insights and the platform teams who are in charge of developing and optimizing the games platform, discovery surface, recommendation algorithm, etc and advocate for the needs of internal studios when it comes to the tech and tools required to launch and operate great live service games on the Netflix mobile download and TV/Web streaming platforms. You will have the opportunity to influence the evolution and fine-tuning of the unique metrics used to evaluate game and portfolio performance in a subscription service. The ideal candidate will have deep knowledge and understanding of the competitive market for high-engagement feature design and live service programs, be able to anticipate and identify key emerging trends, and help our studios and our slate planning team be on the cutting edge of live service game development. Responsibilities Establish central processes and identify best practices for successful game product management and live operations of subscription and cloud based games. Partner with our first-party game studios, strategy, and central live services teams to ensure accurate forecasts for game launch KPIs. Participate in phase reviews for the internal games slate to help ensure that game teams are properly resourced and set up for success with respect to all things PM, live ops, and analysis. Provide ongoing support to game studios in their development and operation of live service games. Seek out data from all available sources (game strategy team, game teams, our external development team, customer insights, etc). Synthesize data and insights into recommendations that can inform our live ops best practices and content strategy decisions. Work through influence to inflect our games and slate based on these recommendations. Work with Netflix games platform and product teams to advocate for the tech, tools, and processes required for internal game teams to successfully launch and operate live service games. Partner with internal studios leadership to shape the go-forward strategy for internal game development at Netflix. Required Qualifications 8+ years of experience in the gaming industry, working in analytical roles including strategy & analysis and product management, assessing ongoing performance and optimization for games in multiple categories. Deep understanding of video game metrics with experience reading and interpreting metrics, forming and leveraging hypotheses to influence roadmaps and strategies. Experience running live service games on any platform (PC, console, mobile) with the ideal candidate having deep mobile live service experience. Experience as a heavily engaged player of live service games and a deep understanding of engagement drivers in live service game titles. Expertise in creating and presenting engaging, insightful narratives through data. Experience managing cross-functional groups and game teams through influence. Continuously looking for ways to improve and iterate on existing frameworks, or building anew for best results. Passion for video games, innovations in software, and how they enrich the player experience. Location Los Angeles, CA/Remote Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $220,000 - $900,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: Executive Producer The Executive Producer will be involved in organizing and collaborating with members of the Boss Fight team from every part of the studio, as well as partners outside the company to deliver exceptionally high-quality mobile games primarily based on iOS and Android platforms. You will act as both a manager and a mentor, fostering a team culture of collaboration, inclusivity, and empowerment. You will strive to develop processes and solutions that help to support a sustainable work life for your team. Essential Functions/Responsibilities Manage a team of internal producers and outsource partners. Develop and mentor production personnel, and look for coaching opportunities. Work with the GM to find opportunities to hone organizational structure, processes, and tools. Develop and maintain successful relationships across the studio, Netflix, and with external partners. Lead by example, creating a strong sense of purpose and community, and promoting a culture of excellence and inclusivity, encouraging a sustainable work/life balance. Exemplify reliability, accountability, and professionalism in all work-related interactions Deliver content updates on time and on budget. Create and maintain a track record of predictable and stable releases. Collaborate with discipline leads and external partners to find the balance between resources, schedule, and the right quality. Working with discipline leads to refining scope, schedules, and resource plans. Generate, update, and help maintain a shared library of process documentation and resources Manage the overall outsourcing budget and schedule. Look for thoughtful ways to manage costs. Skills and Abilities Subject matter expert in the game development process. Deep experience in managing both internal and external development teams. Ability to quickly tease out process inefficiencies and problems. Track record of shaping production culture. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Comfortable interacting with and presenting to all levels of the company, key stakeholders, and publishers. Capable of managing multiple competing tasks and being self-directed to meet deadlines in a quickly evolving environment Excellent attention to detail and a strong desire to iterate and improve on processes Strong analytical skills with experience using data to inform decision-making Self-motivated team player able to work in a team environment with maturity and leadership Highly organized with the ability to quickly identify and prioritize opportunities for optimal ROI Able to give detailed feedback and communicate direction between internal teams and external partners Education and Experience 12+ years of experience working in a related role on high-quality games in the console, mobile or web space Served as the lead or senior producer on multiple projects Free to play experience Experience managing a live service Position Type/Expected Hours of Work Our core hours are 10:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. CST, which means you should be available for meetings, etc., during this time frame. Other Duties Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties, or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job duties. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. description: The Opportunity We are seeking an experienced Coordinator, Production Management (series/film) in Korea to help manage our series/film slate of Local Language Originals being produced in Korean from a production perspective. Responsibilities include establishing and curating vendor & staff/crew relations, reviewing budgets and supporting/suggesting best practices from pre production through delivery. The position will work closely with our Creative, Post Production and other internal teams along with our local series producers to ensure the efficient delivery of the series. A successful candidate will be self-motivated, proactive, quick-thinking, flexible, able to pivot when necessary, thorough and able to juggle multiple and diverse responsibilities with a strong emphasis on organization and an unwavering attention to detail at all times. This is a demanding and fast moving position that requires someone who is a proactive and positive thinker, and able to exercise good judgment and initiative. S/he will report to the Director of Production Management team in Korea. This role will be the operational core of the creative team; expected to manage both internal and external parties for optimum efficiency and the successful launch of our Netflix Series/Film titles. Duties will include but not limited to: Responsibilities: Manage the workflow of incoming material submissions of pertinent materials in relation to titles and evaluate incoming submissions in proprietary Netflix systems. Act as the liaison with various departments and production partners to coordinate information sharing and address incoming and outgoing requests. Meticulously maintain calendaring of all key dates and deadlines related to titles, including tracking resubmissions and schedules. Cross-check and assist the internal creative-related tasks Evaluate and provide coverage of incoming assigned material. Provide secondary creative thought partnership to the creative executives on projects as needed. Qualifications: High level of organization, detail orientation, and ability to time-manage across multiple deadlines in execution of projects. description: We are on the hunt for a dynamic, innovative strategist and creative to spearhead the role of Manager, Social Marketing - Australia + New Zealand . With a global social reach of 877m followers, we fuel daily pop culture and foster passionate entertainment fandom to a scale that matches global celebrities. While today we live and breathe TikTok and Instagram - what’s next? We‘re looking for a social marketer who can answer this question by leaning into risk, experimentation and by making big bets. From global blockbusters like Stranger Things and Bridgerton to local Netflix hits like Heartbreak High and Boy Swallows Universe, this an opportunity to build social communities and editorials formats for one of Australia’s most loved entertainment brands. We highly encourage reading the Who We Are section of the Netflix website and learning about the Netflix Culture to ensure that all candidates feel that Netflix is a good fit. Core Responsibilities: Lead the Netflix social marketing strategy across various platforms, focusing on audience growth, organic social title campaigns, and repeatable editorial formats. Connect narratives across our titles to craft compelling brand stories that demonstrate entertainment expertise, local relevance, and title/brand fandom. Build strong relationships with cross-functional partners across publicity, comms, marketing, integrated planning, and content. Partner with external teams (agency, freelance) to deliver creativity and excellence across our social channels and formats. Maintain and strengthen our brand voice and tone and branding through social content strategy, community management and editorial curation. Utilize social analytics and internal data to inform strategy and identify opportunities. Stay on top of cultural trends to foster relevant brand conversations. Be experimental with content, take risks, be ambitious and original. Build and manage budgets to drive efficiency and scale impact. Skills and Requirements: A social /  editorial / marketing superstar with 10+ years of experience in entertainment media or brand building fueled by social content creation. Passionate about great stories. You can talk on and on about your favourite shows, genres, and creators you admire for your life. Deep knowledge of social platforms and the ability to craft engaging stories. Proven track record of creating content that gets shared and talked about. Strong global IQ and the ability to work with teams from different markets. Solid understanding of marketing and social media analytics. High tolerance for change, and the capacity to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. Strong leadership, team management and project management skills. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

description: It's an exciting time to join Netflix as we continue to transform entertainment globally. We are bringing new stories to millions of people worldwide by promoting our original, exclusive content. As we move beyond 260 million members and hundreds of partnerships worldwide, our approach to marketing is to build innovative, culturally relevant, creatively excellent campaigns that pierce the zeitgeist and drive conversation. The Role The Netflix Korea Film & Series  Marketing team is seeking a Marketing Manager to support and/or lead the day-to-day development and execution of 360 marketing campaigns for both Korean and global titles. Core Responsibilities: Build successful 360 marketing campaigns for Netflix’s brand and titles -- from strategy development to tactical execution (including media buy, activation, and creative assets) Lead the creation of marketing assets for titles and brand - development of creative, planning, and execution of shoots (key art, AV, etc) Drive successful marketing campaigns in Korea while creating strategies and assets that can also resonate outside of Korea. Act as a liaison to internal x-functional teams at every step of the campaign, from early strategy through campaign completion. Be the main point of contact with agencies - brief, hire, manage and give feedback to create the best campaigns. Communicate and collaborate with external studios, showrunners, producers, talent and talent representatives where needed. Incorporate branding elements into title campaigns to establish the Netflix brand in consumers' everyday lives. Qualifications: Minimum of 7 years of experience in the entertainment marketing/social department at a network, studio, agency or brand. Proven track record in impactful, world-class creative campaigns across multiple channels (AV/trailers, digital/social, print/out-of-home) that connect with audiences and break through the cultural zeitgeist. Experience in creating culturally relevant and conversation-driving creative, along with marketing shoot experience. Strong cross-functional collaboration skills, with the ability to engage and collaborate with internal departments. Effective communication with executives, showrunners, producers, talent and talent representatives as needed. Proactive self-starter with resourcefulness and a solution-oriented mindset, able to make sound judgments in ambiguous situations. Thrives in a fast-paced and demanding environment. Demonstrates a passion for innovation, embraces new technologies, and challenges marketing conventions. Curiosity and enthusiasm for all aspects of the Netflix business. Fluency in English and Korean is required. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status or disability status. 넷플릭스는 다양한 경험과 생각을 가진 구성원이 모였을 때 최고의 성과를 내는 팀을 만들어 갈 수 있다고 믿고 있습니다. 다양성과 포용성은 우리가 지향하는 기업 문화의 핵심 중 하나이며, 이것의 궁극적인 목적은 모든 직원이 역량을 마음껏 발휘하고 성장하며 기여할 수 있도록 환경을 조성하는 것입니다.  인재를 선별하는 과정은 이러한 목적을 달성하는 데 매우 중요합니다.  이에 따라 넷플릭스는  성별, 인종, 피부색, 국적, 종교, 성적 지향, 나이, 결혼 여부 등 모든 개인적인 배경과 상관없이 모두에게 평등한 기회를 보장하며, 공정한 과정을 통해 채용을 진행하고 있습니다.장애인 및 국가보훈 대상자는 관련 법령에 따라 우대합니다.

description: Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with over 247 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. To support our continued evolution, we are looking for an experienced and passionate Art and Print Production Manager LATAM to join our Marketing Planning, Operations, and Production team. This position will work for the LATAM region and will be based in our Mexico City Office. The Role The Art & Print Production Manager is the in-house leader and expert in all related to static marketing expression. This person will lead, design, and operate the ecosystem that produces marketing key art, out-of-home, and print campaigns for LATAM. Specifically, art development, finishing process, print adaptation, printing, and implementation are the focus of the role. You will serve as the go-to partner and key point-of-contact for all internal stakeholders, facilitating alignment between teams dedicated to strategy, creative, production, and localization. This means that you value the importance of protecting creative excellence while maintaining a logical outlook for project execution. You understand Marketing workflows and excel in managing a large volume of assets in a high-speed, high-performance environment. You are nimble, able to balance competing priorities among global stakeholders, and thrive as a strong individual lead, and a collaborative team member, in a rigorous environment. Key Responsabilities Functional Leadership: Design, implement, lead, and operate a high-performing Art/Print Production ecosystem, dedicated to delivery high-volume, high-quality creative campaigns for multiple marketing verticals/clients. Cross-functional thought leadership with senior leaders in creative, marketing strategy, analytics, and production to drive directional team alignment, innovation, and testing.Responsible for overall team financials, staff planning, and other operational functions. Through collaboration and coordination, manage scope, budget, and overall print production regional resourcesLiaise with internal and external partners to provide functional guidance and industry best-practices on art and print campaign collateral. Art Finishing: Design, implement and manage the ecosystem that delivers the finishing, production, localization, and servicing of design assets (key art, print adaptations, OOH, digital OOH), ensuring brand, layout, and specs for our marketing and communications teamsThrough high-end expertise, ensure the quality of the final art to its best level. Out-Of-Home Adaptations: High-quality and scale Lead, design, implement and operate the ecosystem that brings high-quality scale to the adaptations in LATAM. This includes the management and development of key partnerships, vendors, and suppliers throughout the region. Responsible for the final deliveries in time and manner as well as the quality control of the whole process. Experience & Skills 10+ of Print Production and/or Project Management experience, with an emphasis on marketing deliverables with distribution across LATAM — Full understanding of what is needed to produce and adapt print materials at scale as well as print models, materials, challenges and demands in LATAM 7+ years of team management experience, with direct report Producers and/or Project Managers. Experience in organizational design within these roles is preferred. Experience managing high volume programs in parallel, collaborating with diverse, geographically dispersed teams to deliver marketing materials. Experience developing and rolling out solutions to reduce complexity, level of effort and/or costs for your organization. Experience working with business analysts or analytics teams to measure operational metrics for forward-looking organizational planning. Technical experience that brings an understanding of the art and print process and the tools to make this happen (Adobe Creative Suite - Photoshop, Illustrator and InDesign) Art & Design: Previous experience on the finishing process, understanding its key milestones and challenges. Spanish & English fluency are required (Portuguese is a plus). You are passionate and curious about all aspects of the business -  a proactive self-starter, who doesn’t wait to be told what to do and is resourceful in finding solutions. You have great communication skills, you connect the dots when others cannot and simplify complex issues and questions. You thrive in a fast-paced and demanding environment, possess a high level of intellectual curiosity, and demonstrate strong judgment in the face of ambiguity You are an agile, goal-oriented personality, driven to succeed and always up for a challenge! See Who We Are and what our Culture is like. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

description: Next Games, a Netflix Game Studio, is a Helsinki-based studio dedicated to crafting fans-first interactive experiences that combine the stories from popular movies and shows with engaging game mechanics. Our values, Caring, Courage, and Curiosity, drive our commitment to our players and each other, with a focus on fun gameplay free from the constraints of free-to-play. We celebrate diversity, with dozens of nationalities and a third of our team identifying as women or non-binary. We don't seek culture fit, but rather the unique contributions each individual brings to enrich our culture. If you're passionate about creating innovative mobile games in a diverse, supportive environment, we're eager to hear from you! The Role We are searching for a Senior UX Designer to create high-quality games that are playable, enjoyable, and accessible to a broad audience.  You can work hands-on on a day-to-day basis with Your team and can create and execute a strategic UX vision for the game, showing a deep understanding of the game’s audience and their needs as players. You maintain a consistent relationship with players and provide relevant information to the team to help them maintain a player-centric approach to improving features and iterations of the game. You have fantastic communication skills and are a supportive and strong team player. Responsibilities: Have experience holistically improving the game, and guide the team through all of the steps in the UX process Design usable, enjoyable, and accessible UX experiences for a casual and broad audience. Helsinki, Finland Games Next Games Senior UX Designer Next Games, a Netflix Game Studio, is a Helsinki-based studio dedicated to crafting fans-first interactive experiences that combine the stories from popular movies and shows with engaging game mechanics. Our values, Caring, Courage, and Curiosity, drive our commitment to our players and each other, with a focus on fun gameplay free from the constraints of free-to-play.  We celebrate diversity, with dozens of nationalities and a third of our team identifying as women or non-binary. We don't seek culture fit, but rather the unique contributions each individual brings to enrich our culture. If you're passionate about creating innovative mobile games in a diverse, supportive environment, we're eager to hear from you! The Role We are searching for a Senior UX Designer to create high-quality games that are playable, enjoyable, and accessible to a broad audience.  You can work hands-on on a day-to-day basis with Your team and can create and execute a strategic UX vision for the game, showing a deep understanding of the game’s audience and their needs as players. You maintain a consistent relationship with players and provide relevant information to the team to help them maintain a player-centric approach to improving features and iterations of the game.  You have fantastic communication skills and are a supportive and strong team player.  Responsibilities:
  • Have experience holistically improving the game, and guide the team through all of the steps in the UX process
  • Design usable, enjoyable, and accessible UX experiences for a casual and broad audience. Creates the communication and the structure of the game
  • Maintain a holistic view by ensuring all the features are well connected and make sense from a player perspective, build enjoyable communication with the players, and be able to share the intended feeling. Define the content strategy
  • Work following a Design Thinking process. Be able to create hypotheses, and track to demonstrate that we are fulfilling user needs: ideate onboardings and new ways of developing and implementing features. Help the team to be player-centric
  • Work closely with UX researchers, UI Artists, Designers, Artists, Team Lead, and relevant stakeholders to continue identifying opportunities to improve our ways of working and the quality of our games. Teamwork and iteration are our goals
  • Be the player's advocate. Talk regularly with players and share your knowledge with the team to make informed decisions
  • Create a common framework of Heuristics to evaluate the game according to the same criteria
  • Generate a good atmosphere, and be able to transmit to the other departments the UX strategy of the game and the emotions that we must transmit
  • Leads proactively initiatives for improving the game, creating workshops, and improving communication
  • Share polished documentation
    • Skills and Abilities:
  • Create game architecture,  game flows, and wireframes
  • Create polished documentation regarding UX strategy, users, competitors, guidelines, etc.
  • Be able to create prototypes in Figma
  • Be able to create the testing plan. Ability to use User Research tools like PlaytestCloud, run tests, and share results with the team. Make sure the results are taken into account and acted upon
  • Ability to run Accessibility tests
  • Basic knowledge of Unity
  • Understands visual design principles
  • Experience working in a player-centric environment based on teamwork and iteration
  • Great communication and leadership skills
  • Help create UX maturity in the team

description: The Opportunity Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. As part of our commitment to keeping the theatrical moviegoing experience alive, Netflix films and shows are presented in many theaters around the world, including in our owned theaters such as the legendary Paris Theater in Manhattan, the historic Egyptian Theatre in Hollywood, and our in-office theaters and screening rooms around the world. The Post Services team is charged with the strategy, implementation, and operational management of Netflix’s purpose-built facilities and infrastructure, which include a diverse global portfolio of screening and review spaces that cater to a variety of use cases. We offer bleeding-edge technology, workflows, and expert services to our filmmakers and studio. Our commitment is to provide an unmatched screening experience: cultivating a creative and immersive environment, fostering filmmaker joy, and preserving artistic intent throughout the production to exhibition pipeline. In this early stage of our expansion to support external screenings, you’ll have a unique opportunity to pioneer and influence the course of our theatrical field operations. We’re looking for a visionary engineer who will not only extend our high presentation standards to the East Coast operations, but will continuously push the envelope to enhance the enjoyment of filmmakers and audiences alike. In this role, you will Serve as a technical lead and operate high-profile screenings at the Paris Theater, such as premieres, press screenings and awards engagements, Conduct tech checks with partners and talent, performing picture and sound calibration to achieve satisfaction Oversee daily exhibition best practices for general venue programming at the Paris Theater, seeking to maintain a high standard of exhibition quality Oversee and support screenings at 3rd party East Coast venues including festivals, and other high-profile publicity screenings Represent Netflix as its trusted expert at screening events and festivals, ensuring filmmaker satisfaction Support internal studio screening needs in the Netflix New York corporate office Consistently monitor quality of venues in New York and stay current on changes and upgrades Liaise with internal engineering teams on major upgrades and troubleshooting Provide excellent service to internal Netflix stakeholders and filmmaking talent Perform maintenance on cinema projection equipment, sound systems, servers, etc. Establish efficient workflows to ensure a reliable and consistent experience Partner closely with Events and Regional Publicity, Post Production Management teams, Distribution, Workplace Operations, and Media Systems Engineering to achieve uncompromising experience and drive filmmaker and audience satisfaction The Ideal candidate 10+ years of experience in high-end theatrical exhibition, working in an engineering capacity in a client facing role Demonstrated leadership in running complex screening events, orchestrating a variety of technical functions seamlessly to achieve a successful show Hands-on experience with theatrical exhibition workflows, Digital Cinema specifications, maintenance, and calibration, including digital projection, QSC, Dolby, etc. Able to consistently deliver spectacular DolbyAtmos sound experience that accurately reproduces artistic intent Strong understanding of file formats, screening assets, and auxiliary media. Attention to details necessary to deliver pristine audio-visual presentation Ability to detect and diagnose faults with both assets and environments, and proactively flag issues Knowledge of Post Production imaging and color space, as well as sound workflows such as Nearfield and Theatrical mixes Familiarity with live event technology Knowledge of film projection is preferred Certified Barco / Christie projection is a plus QSYS Level 1 Cinema certification is a plus Dolby training is a plus Strong organizational skills and the ability to manage a heavy volume of work Outstanding written and verbal communication and proactive, solution driven mentality Troubleshooting skills with a strong emphasis on long term solutions and innovation Resilient approach and proven ability to excel under pressure and thrive in constant change Existing relationships with outside vendors, including rental houses and engineering firms, is a plus Ability to respond after hours for important, timely, or urgent matters Ability and willingness to travel for work; primarily domestic, East Coast travel Passionate about Netflix culture and values in the workplace Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $50,000 - $245,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

New York, New York Content Post Production Management Cinema Engineer The Opportunity  Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. As part of our commitment to keeping the theatrical moviegoing experience alive, Netflix films and shows are presented in many theaters around the world, including in our owned theaters such as the legendary Paris Theater in Manhattan, the historic Egyptian Theatre in Hollywood, and our in-office theaters and screening rooms around the world.  The Post Services team is charged with the strategy, implementation, and operational management of Netflix’s purpose-built facilities and infrastructure, which include a diverse global portfolio of screening and review spaces that cater to a variety of use cases. We offer bleeding-edge technology, workflows, and expert services to our filmmakers and studio. Our commitment is to provide an unmatched screening experience: cultivating a creative and immersive environment, fostering filmmaker joy, and preserving artistic intent throughout the production to exhibition pipeline.   In this early stage of our expansion to support external screenings, you’ll have a unique opportunity to pioneer and influence the course of our theatrical field operations. We’re looking for a visionary engineer who will not only extend our high presentation standards to the East Coast operations, but will continuously push the envelope to enhance the enjoyment of filmmakers and audiences alike. In this role, you will
  • Serve as a technical lead and operate high-profile screenings at the Paris Theater, such as premieres, press screenings and awards engagements,
  • Conduct tech checks with partners and talent, performing picture and sound calibration to achieve satisfaction  
  • Oversee daily exhibition best practices for general venue programming at the Paris Theater, seeking to maintain a high standard of exhibition quality 
  • Oversee and support screenings at 3rd party East Coast venues including festivals, and other high-profile publicity screenings
  • Represent Netflix as its trusted expert at screening events and festivals, ensuring filmmaker satisfaction 
  • Support internal studio screening needs in the Netflix New York corporate office  
  • Consistently monitor quality of venues in New York and stay current on changes and upgrades
  • Liaise with internal engineering teams on major upgrades and troubleshooting
  • Provide excellent service to internal Netflix stakeholders and filmmaking talent 
  • Perform maintenance on cinema projection equipment, sound systems, servers, etc.
  • Establish efficient workflows to ensure a reliable and consistent experience 
  • Partner closely with Events and Regional Publicity, Post Production Management teams, Distribution, Workplace Operations, and Media Systems Engineering to achieve uncompromising experience and drive filmmaker and audience satisfaction
    • The Ideal candidate
  • 10+ years of experience in high-end theatrical exhibition, working in an engineering capacity in a client facing role
  • Demonstrated leadership in running complex screening events, orchestrating a variety of technical functions seamlessly to achieve a successful show
  • Hands-on experience with theatrical exhibition workflows, Digital Cinema specifications, maintenance, and calibration, including digital projection, QSC, Dolby, etc. 
  • Able to consistently deliver spectacular DolbyAtmos sound experience that accurately reproduces artistic intent 
  • Strong understanding of file formats, screening assets, and auxiliary media.
  • Attention to details necessary to deliver pristine audio-visual presentation
  • Ability to detect and diagnose faults with both assets and environments, and proactively flag issues 
  • Knowledge of Post Production imaging and color space, as well as sound workflows such as Nearfield and Theatrical mixes
  • Familiarity with live event technology 
  • Knowledge of film projection is preferred 
  • Certified Barco / Christie projection is a plus
  • QSYS Level 1 Cinema certification is a plus  
  • Dolby training is a plus 
  • Strong organizational skills and the ability to manage a heavy volume of work
  • Outstanding written and verbal communication and proactive, solution driven mentality
  • Troubleshooting skills with a strong emphasis on long term solutions and innovation
  • Resilient approach and proven ability to excel under pressure and thrive in constant change
  • Existing relationships with outside vendors, including rental houses and engineering firms, is a plus 
  • Ability to respond after hours for important, timely, or urgent matters
  • Ability and willingness to travel for work; primarily domestic, East Coast travel
  • Passionate about Netflix culture and values in the workplace

To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $50,000 - $245,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. description: We are seeking a Senior Technical Producer to join our production team and play a pivotal role in coordinating the complex technical aspects of our multiplayer game projects. The ideal candidate will have a solid technical background, experience in multiplayer game production, and the ability to manage technical risks effectively. Essential Functions/Responsibilities Lead the coordination of complex technical aspects of software development, ensuring alignment with strategic project goals and timelines. Act as a critical partner with external entities for outsourcing, managing relationships, and ensuring high-quality deliverables. Oversee and guide the technical pipeline, including tool building and feature implementation, focusing on innovation and efficiency. Mentor engineers, assisting them in planning and scheduling their work while proactively identifying and addressing potential risks and solutions. Drive the production of advanced technical features, especially those related to multiplayer gameplay, setting high standards for quality and performance. Collaborate with senior cross-functional teams to ensure seamless integration of technical components and alignment with overall project vision. Skills and Abilities Expert understanding of connected software development methodologies and best practices. Preferred proven knowledge of software methodologies, best practices, and leading technical teams on large-scale multiplayer games. Exceptional analytical skills and the ability to communicate complex technical features and risks clearly to a variety of stakeholders. Strong leadership and project management skills, with a demonstrated ability to drive technical projects to successful completion. Ability to coordinate and build effective partnerships Clear and proactive communication and coordination Able to manage multiple, competing tasks and be self-directed to meet deadlines in a quickly evolving environment Positive attitude and ability to receive and provide objective and constructive feedback Education and Experience Previous experience shipping 2 or more equivalent quality games Extensive experience as a Technical Producer or similar senior role in the gaming industry, with a proven track record of successful technical project management. Engineering degree or a related field (preferred but not required). In-depth experience with server and client networking, with a strong understanding of the challenges and solutions in multiplayer game environments. Significant experience in guiding key technical elements for multiplayer experiences, with a portfolio of successful projects. Other Duties Position Type/Expected Hours of Work: Our core hours are 10 am to 6:00 pm CST, which means you should be available for meetings etc. during this time. Other Duties: Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties, or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice. At Netflix, we carefully consider a wide range of compensation factors to determine your personal top of market. We rely on market indicators to determine compensation and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to get it right. These considerations can cause your compensation to vary and will also be dependent on your location. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top-of-market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $60,000 - $270,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more details about our Benefits here . Netflix has a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully.
