Application Development:  We optimize application development by providing tools, frameworks, and libraries for specific personas and use cases (e.g., backend, frontend), including code authoring, build, test, and debug workflows, build systems, test frameworks, and more. Continuous Integration & Delivery:  We ensure safe delivery of changes from commit to production with robust, seamless integration of changes, delivery workflows and pipelines, global deployment orchestration, safe delivery and rollbacks, and fleetwide change orchestration. Reliability & Resiliency: We ensure operational excellence and highly reliable, resilient, scalable systems with incident management and product readiness tools, testing frameworks, automation, reporting & insights, and product infrastructure experimentation (e.g., canaries, shadow traffic, performance testing, failure injection testing, chaos experiments, etc). Observability: We enable rapid issue detection and remediation with telemetry ingestion, storage, and querying of metrics, events, logs, and traces, monitoring and alerting, remediation, system health exploration and troubleshooting, and profiling and diagnostic tools. Examples of opportunities that you and your PMs might tackle include unifying the developer experience, providing holistic end-to-end workflows, managing more for users through higher levels of abstraction, reducing toil, optimizing cycle times, defining how we measure developer experience and productivity, and ensuring we provide best-in-industry tooling. The scope and impact of these roles is significant. You and your PMs will be responsible for managing a portfolio of products and driving holistic product strategy and prioritization across them. Product Management is a newer team within Platform Engineering, and we're on a mission to elevate product thinking across the organization. This unique opportunity allows you to shape our product management practices and contribute significantly to our evolution. If you’re looking for a deeply technical and highly dynamic opportunity that will have an outsized impact on the future of developer experience at Netflix, we’d love to talk to you! What You Will Do
  • Deeply understand customer needs, product analytics, and industry innovation to drive the product vision and strategy for Developer Platform, maximizing business and customer impact
  • Lead, mentor, inspire, and grow a high-performance team of technical product managers, developing strategies, roadmaps, and specifications that prioritize the most impactful opportunities
  • Collaborate with senior management to align vision, strategy, success metrics, and roadmaps
  • Foster a collaborative environment with Netflix engineers, creating continuous feedback loops to ensure we're solving the right problems and driving maximum impact for Netflix
  • Stay informed about industry advancements, influence their direction, and conduct comprehensive buy vs. build analysis to align with state-of-the-art solutions, encouraging ROI-based decisions
  • Foster a metrics-driven environment that encourages quality experimentation and sets high standards for measuring product success
  • Exhibit robust problem-solving and decision-making skills, tackling both technical and strategic challenges in innovative ways, and leveraging both data and intuition to make strategic choices in the face of ambiguity and complexity
  • Ensure thoughtful product evolution that addresses product lifecycle and adoption experience
  • Help evolve Platform Engineering’s customer engagement model, communication strategy, and prioritization and planning practices
  • Collaborate with other product leaders across Platform Engineering and Netflix to evolve our practices and competencies in technical product management
    • What We’re Looking For
  • At least 5 years of experience managing a team of senior and staff technical product managers as a Director of Product, Group Product Manager, or similar role
  • Proven track record of leading and scaling teams, managing and evolving a product portfolio, and driving product vision and strategy
  • Deep technical knowledge paired with a customer-focused mindset and empathy.
  • Experience working on developer platforms with a solid understanding of the software development lifecycle and passion for developer experience and productivity
  • Strategic thinker who can connect customer use cases to technology solutions and think holistically about end-to-end experience
  • Ability to manage a portfolio of projects, balancing short-term goals with long-term vision in a rapidly changing environment
  • Proficiency in using both qualitative and quantitative methods to define success, with a track record of making data-driven decisions
  • Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to leverage product intuition and judgment to make informed decisions in scenarios where perfect information may not be available
  • Insatiable curiosity, with a passion for learning new domains, keeping up with industry innovation, and constantly questioning the status quo
  • Excellent communication skills with a knack for setting clear expectations
  • Experience navigating and leading in a fast-paced, agile environment with rapidly shifting priorities
    • Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $430,000 - $1,500,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here. We are an equal opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Our culture is unique, and we live by our values, so it’s worth learning more about Netflix culture. More About Developer Platform @ Netflix Full Cycle Developers at Netflix -- Operate What You Build (techblog) Unifying the Netflix engineering experience with a federated platform console (video) Telltale: Netflix Application Monitoring Simplified (techblog) Machine Learning for a Better Developer Experience (techblog) Managed Delivery: Bringing Infrastructure as Code to Spinnaker (video)

description: It's an exciting time to join Netflix as we continue to transform entertainment globally. We are bringing new stories to millions of people worldwide by promoting our original, exclusive content.  As we move beyond 260 million members and hundreds of partnerships worldwide, a key to growth is our ability to work well with strategic partners across verticals. We’ve recently introduced a new ad-supported plan, offering customers a more affordable price point and offering advertisers a new way to reach engaged audiences. As we grow & evolve our partnerships & ads offerings, we are looking for a talented leader who can drive strong creative outcomes across the Marketing Partnerships team. The role: The Marketing Partnerships team seeks to drive meaningful marketing outcomes across our strategic partnerships: i) distribution partners like telco operators, pay TV services & consumer electronics brands, ii) co-promotion campaigns featuring the Netflix brand and / or IP with leading consumer brands & iii) the emerging Ad Sales business. The Marketing Partnerships Creative team supports all of the above by developing a strong partnership creative strategy and creating compelling campaigns, activations & sponsorships. We are seeking a strategic leader for the Marketing Partnerships Creative team (15+ years) who can lead a team of end-to-end creatives to develop, design and creatively execute all our partnership campaigns & Ad sales materials. This individual will be responsible for building our creative capabilities as we grow our team and supporting agencies across the region with a special focus on Korea and Japan. The ideal candidate also comes with a deep understanding of how to creatively support an Ad Sales organization. This individual must demonstrate deep passion and expertise in creative marketing. Any entertainment marketing experience will be a bonus. The ideal candidate will be capable of building a strong creative strategy that can drive specific outcomes - consumer acquisition, buzz / word of mouth around the biggest Netflix titles or exciting advertisers by helping them connect with our IP & brand in impactful ways. The candidate will be well versed in developing a partnership campaign positioning and strategy and ultimately, the crafting and execution of marketing campaigns that inspire people to share and talk about Netflix and our content. This role must be able to closely partner with external agencies/vendors, external partners (advertisers) as well as cross-functional teams across Ad Sales, Ads Marketing, Consumer Insights, Title Marketing, Consumer Products, Partnerships & more. This person should value entrepreneurial work environments and thrive in our ‘freedom and responsibility’ culture. If you are passionate about entertainment with demonstrated experience in crafting and executing impactful creative campaigns/programmes, we’d love to hear from you. Key responsibilities: Support & mentor a team of creative managers to develop high quality partnership and Ads Marketing campaigns. Establish a high quality creative team across the region. Build effective ways of working, budget & resourcing efficiencies and a regular cadence of learnings and best practices. Building a network of creative agencies & freelancers across the key APAC markets. Existing relationships with leading advertising agencies and brands across APAC markets is a bonus. Setting the creative strategy and ensuring business objectives are met over time. On occasion, leading creative workshops, presentations, briefings and owning the feedback loop and output with partners and agencies. Creatively supporting the Ads Business through pitch decks, AVs, events, experiences & more. Closely collaborate with key XF partners including Content, Marketing, Production, Ads Marketing and Consumer Products. Qualifications/Experience: THE BASICS: 15+ years of track record in brand or consumer marketing at advertising agency, or in-house Creative team. Experience in Entertainment or Ads Marketing Creative is a plus. Experience in Korea and/or Japan is a plus. STRATEGIC PLANNING: Connector of dots, able to scan through data, behaviours, comms plans, consumer research to find partner insights and content insights and bridge them in the right sweet spot to create the most fertile territory for great ideas to flourish. CREATIVE THINKER: A media-agnostic thinker who can ideate for any space and impact the right audience. Knows how to get to great work and brings a fresh perspective to the way people connect with culture, content and brands. PROJECT MANAGEMENT: A creative shepherd and problem solver who is able to drive multiple projects from start to finish and turn cool ideas into reality. Knowledge of production with the ability to execute flawlessly. Doesn’t hesitate to get into the details, and does not lose sight of the broader strategic intent. CLEAR & CONCISE COMMUNICATOR: We are looking for a fluent English speaker with excellent communication skills, who is comfortable collaborating with multiple internal cross-functional teams and confident in influencing external senior stakeholders. Knowledge of other Asian languages is a plus. Personality Attributes: Curious and creatively-minded in every way. Entrepreneurial and selfless collaborator who is selfless and goes beyond roles and titles to get great work done. Able to give and receive feedback positively, and see the value of different perspectives. Able to think and act with agility. Capable of being impactful without the support of a large team of direct reports. Demonstrates strong judgment in the face of ambiguity. Flexible and adaptive to evolve the role based on our business needs. A natural and deep affection for movies and television and the role of entertainment in today’s media landscape. A desire to thrive in our unique culture . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

description: Netflix is one of the world's leading internet entertainment services with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any internet-connected screen. Members can play, pause and resume watching, all without commercials or commitments. With this international expansion and a move into Korean originals, it's a great time to join Netflix. With this international expansion and a move into Korean originals, it's a great time to join Netflix. The Opportunity Netflix is looking for an attorney who will be responsible for a wide array of development, acquisition (licensing) and production matters related to Netflix’s content programming. The successful candidate will structure, negotiate and draft agreements to commission, develop and produce local programming with various content partners, and should be extremely comfortable counseling internal stakeholders and making decisions that have both legal and business impacts. The position is based in Seoul, South Korea. Responsibilities Draft, review, and negotiate a wide range of agreements, including: content license agreements under varying deal types, development and production agreements, IP agreements, ATL agreements, etc Conduct legal analysis on and handle issues arising through the lifecycle of content production and exploitation Provide guidance to external production partners Maintain close alignment with multiple internal cross-functional partners Manage, maintain, and update various templates Qualifications Minimum of 4-7 years of experience as an attorney, and membership in good standing in at least one jurisdiction Fluency in both Korean and English Strong business acumen, analytical capabilities, and judgment. We value practical, solution-oriented thinking Proven ability to work proactively, independently, and reliably under tight timeframes & deadlines Excellent organizational, interpersonal, and communication skills Preferred: A background in IP/entertainment teams at a law firm or experience in the media or entertainment industry as an in-house counsel We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status or disability status. 넷플릭스는 다양한 경험과 생각을 가진 구성원이 모였을 때 최고의 성과를 내는 팀을 만들어 갈 수 있다고 믿고 있습니다. 다양성과 포용성은 우리가 지향하는 기업 문화의 핵심 중 하나이며, 이것의 궁극적인 목적은 모든 직원이 역량을 마음껏 발휘하고 성장하며 기여할 수 있도록 환경을 조성하는 것입니다.  인재를 선별하는 과정은 이러한 목적을 달성하는 데 매우 중요합니다.  이에 따라 넷플릭스는  성별, 인종, 피부색, 국적, 종교, 성적 지향, 나이, 결혼 여부 등 모든 개인적인 배경과 상관없이 모두에게 평등한 기회를 보장하며, 공정한 과정을 통해 채용을 진행하고 있습니다.장애인 및 국가보훈 대상자는 관련 법령에 따라 우대합니다.

description: Netflix is the world’s leading streaming entertainment service with members in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries and feature films, across a wide variety of genres and languages. It’s an amazing time to join the Netflix India team as we continue to transform entertainment. If you are a talented public relations professional, with a passion for content and entertainment, and an informed point of view on the industry, keep reading. The Role We are looking to hire a creative self-starter who loves, lives and breathes entertainment. You are a strong and selfless leader. You have strong opinions and are open to healthy debate. You can run your team and campaigns with autonomy, independently formulate and drive creative and executable ideas, communicate priorities and present clear goals to stakeholders. You use sound judgment to make wise decisions. You think strategically and drive your XF stakeholders to do the same. You have an informed opinion on the entertainment industry and are driven to develop impactful and strategic publicity campaigns. You are inspired by creative single-title and multi-title storytelling, and out-of-the-box PR ideas that spark conversations. You understand people well. You maintain great relationships with internal and external partners. You are resilient and able to operate at a higher level. You are mature, and able to deal with ambiguity. You’re scrappy, unafraid to jump in and handle tasks, at all levels. You thrive in an environment devoid of bureaucracy and layers. Read our culture memo to learn more about how we work at Netflix. To succeed in this role you will need 10+ years of publicity or relevant experience working in entertainment A strong selfless outlook, proven leadership abilities and an entrepreneurial mindset The confidence/skills to foster strong relationships at all levels internally and externally A love of trying new things, and a relentless eye for excellence in execution Strong people-management skills (coaching, developing diverse talent) Proactive willingness to operate from first principles, challenge established wisdom In-depth experience in entertainment PR - agency, studio, TV network, filmmaking Deep knowledge and an informed point of view on the business of the industry Experience managing talent, talent reps, journalists and other media/influencers To able to build creative campaigns from start to end, around local and global films To know how to pitch a story, secure opportunities, cover sets, organize screenings To be able to plan press interactions/junkets and talent tours independently Excellent communication skills: a strong writer, and a clear and succinct speaker. To manage multiple tasks simultaneously under a deadline Operate effectively in a high-energy, fast-paced environment. Be decisive in making tradeoffs to work smarter versus harder Integrity. Judgment. Courage to question actions inconsistent with Netflix’s values. Develop and foster team growth & development Time spent living/working in India is essential. English and Hindi fluency is required Responsibilities include Build and execute strategies for scaled multidisciplinary/multi-phase campaigns Set and maintain a high bar of excellence for the Publicity team Make sound judgment calls despite ambiguity, across a wide range of issues Work proactively and collaboratively with the leadership team across the India office Role model inclusion, candor ( cultural values ). Embody Netflix’s valued behaviors. Actively develop and foster team growth and development Uplevel India’s publicity strategy and instill excellence for campaign execution Have business acumen to provide strategic input on behalf of PR in functional forums Contribute outside your scope in an impactful manner Lead PR initiatives and workflow changes that have broader impact Managing 10+ campaigns per year, while developing inexperienced team members Be a strategic thought partner to XF teams; establish strong relationships and trust We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

description: It's an exciting time to join Netflix as we continue to transform entertainment globally. We bring entertainment to over 260 million subscribers in over 190 countries. This requires great content, a frictionless choosing experience and engaging conversation. As we continue to grow, we’re increasingly focusing on Commerce as well. We have ambitious plans, an enormous growth opportunity and the passion to be the best in customer experience - which now includes a new ad-supported plan at a more affordable price point for customers. description: About Netflix: Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any Internet-connected screen. Members can play, pause, and resume watching, all without commercials or commitments. About the Role: Infrastructure Engineering provides the backbone for Netflix products (SVOD, Live, Games, etc.) by building and operating an efficient, scalable, secure, and easy-to-use development platform and content delivery network. Join us as we push the boundaries of scale, performance, and resilience, empowering developers to create groundbreaking applications on a reliable platform. This role will work closely with Data Platform (within Infrastructure Eng) and Data and Insights to ensure we deliver efficient, scalable, and reliable big data analytics infrastructure. This is the first TPM role supporting our Data and Insights organization and will help define functional excellence for technical program management within the organization. We seek an experienced technical program manager who can partner closely with Data practitioners, engineers, engineering leaders, product managers, and other technical program managers to execute complex technical programs. If you’re looking for a technical and highly dynamic opportunity that will outsize the future of software engineering at Netflix, we’d love to talk to you! What You Will Do: Build and manage the roadmap, in collaboration with technical teams (including Engineering, Product, Data Science, Researchers, etc), that focus on building a highly efficient, scalable, reliable, and secure infrastructure Leverage deep knowledge and functional expertise to drive road mapping, execution planning, and cross-functional alignment across multiple stakeholder groups Craft and drive engagement with partners, work to decompose requirements into technical execution plans with multiple engineering teams, track progress towards goals, and report status to product, customers, and technical leadership Champion breaking out annual goals into measurable milestones while proactively managing risks, blockers, and delays Manage cross-functional dependencies, risks, and changes effectively by optimizing scope, schedule, and resources accordingly What We Are Looking For - Functional Skills: You have domain expertise in one of the following areas: Big data analytics You are highly skilled, experienced, and enjoy orchestrating programs with many moving parts - people, needs, and technologies You can identify gaps in solutions, debate technical approaches, and weigh in on product vs technology tradeoffs You aren’t afraid to get your hands dirty, pulling data to provide insight, debug issues, and monitor system health You have a data-driven mindset in your decision-making You have a deep understanding and point of view within your technical domain(s) of expertise What sets you apart?: 10+ years of experience driving cloud-based Big data infrastructure programs 4+ years of software engineering, systems engineering, or technical product/program management experience Experience managing projects across cross-functional teams, building sustainable processes, and coordinating release schedules Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including clear articulation of business impact and technical constraints tailored to the audience Self-starter who enjoys tackling 0 to 1 problem spaces and quickly bringing organization and direction Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is  $230,000 - $960,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: Netflix is building a new internal game studio to incubate and build games to maximize the player value of the Netflix Games platform. This role will be a key owner for a variety of initiatives and projects from production to business operations - we’ll work together to generate a backlog and tackle them in priority order. You will report to the Director of Development for Internal Studios and work closely with the Internal Studios program management team to execute priority initiatives on behalf of Internal Studios. This may include deep dives on specific studios or products or portfolio-wide initiatives. An example of a key initiative will be producing prototypes using pieces of technology within the Netflix ecosystem to deliver novel experiences for players, which can then be leveraged for game teams. The successful candidate will have experience managing or leading multiple products through their full lifecycle - from ideation to live service, and have a history of successfully delivering games with a focus on player value with teams of varying sizes. They will have a deep stack of ‘seen that, done that,’ and be able to bring a deep toolkit of solutions yet retain the flexibility to tailor solutions to the team’s requirements. You’ll be joining a leadership team who aspires to create ideal conditions for game developers to do their best work, and work with leaders to prioritize and execute on key projects. The Internal Studios group is a small, scrappy team with big ambitions, and an obsession to create memorable game moments that leave players telling their own stories for years to come. We’re looking for strong allies who care deeply about the experiences they create - those who bias towards action and are energized by the learning that comes with bold experimentation at an agile pace. As a part of Netflix, we strive to hire the best and value integrity, excellence, respect, inclusion, and collaboration. Now is an amazing time to join Netflix Game Studio as we seek to entertain our hundreds of millions of members in a really new way. Responsibilities Deliver - As part of the Internal Studios production team, this role will be accountable for building and executing a program for the production and delivery of experimental (pilot) projects that are outside the scope of other game teams. Execute - Gather requirements, understand constraints, define acceptance criteria and be able to deliver a credible execution plan and deliver value against priority problems.  Especially valuable is a desire to deliver ‘slices’ of incremental value to iterate and take on feedback.  (This role will have a large number of ad-hoc projects, and will require the successful candidate to take an ill-defined problem space, define it better, come up with a plan for victory for alignment and then execute.) - These projects could be Operations-based or Production-based. Lead - The role will require the ability to establish and hold a vision, and then convince people (with both direct and indirect authority) to help on the mission. Collaborate - This role will involve collaborating with stakeholders and teams with their own priorities.  Strong communication and collaboration skills will be needed for the candidate to be successful in creating alignment and hitting the goal. Advise - Drawing on the depth of experience from multiple cycles of game development, the successful candidate would be able to spot problem areas from far away, and advise teams and stakeholders on them.  Helping the internal leadership group and development teams assess the risk and take commensurate action is a key value of this position Advocate - As with any large organization, there are many teams with competing priorities.  The successful candidate will be able to internally evaluate whether or not something needs to be prioritized, and then be able to successfully influence other teams to support, even without direct authority.  However, escalation is also warranted for cases where the candidate feels that this is a fight worth fighting. Report - Surface impediments and barriers where needed while working directly to break down hindrances for development teams. Requirements 10+ years of experience in producing multiple games for their full lifespan (prototype to sunset), ideally for PC, Mobile, and console platforms. (No seriously, you need a lot of experience and a lot of product cycles to be successful in this role) History of successfully delivering products to players on multiple platforms and across multiple teams, including data-informed live operations and player support Deep empathy and understanding on what it means to be a player and a developer - likely because they walk daily in those shoes. Experience in sourcing and managing outsourcers and co-dev partners Ideal requirements Differing roles in production, across small and large studios and small/large projects. Location Los Angeles preferred but remote OK (±3 Time Zones of California) Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top-of-market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $160,000 - $610,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more details about our Benefits here . Netflix has a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. We’re looking for a passionate Data Scientist to join our Consumer Insights Data Management & Analytics (DM&A) team. This team leverages technical expertise in applied data science, engineering, and solutions development to support a high-impact team of 90+ quantitative and qualitative researchers. The Consumer Insights team conducts cutting-edge research designed to help answer Netflix’s most complex business challenges. In this role, you will leverage your expertise in statistics/machine learning, causal inference, and research design to help drive innovations through the effective identification and application of analytics. You will seamlessly bridge attitudinal and behavioral data to deliver comprehensive insights that inform and guide our business strategy. You will collaborate with researchers, data scientists, and engineers to help answer Netflix’s most complex business challenges through the analysis of rigorous consumer research. This is a high-impact role in which you will directly influence strategic decision-making at Netflix. Visit our Research page to learn about what it’s like to work on Analytics at Netflix. In this role, you will: Leverage your expertise in Statistics, Causal Inference, Machine Learning, and research design to analyze quantitative survey data in conjunction with behavioral data to develop comprehensive insights. Partner with Researchers, Engineers, and Data Scientists to develop comprehensive analysis plans and generate high-quality quantitative research across the globe. Consult on research plans e.g. surveys, MaxDiff, Conjoint, A/B tests (tangential space to CI), and analysis plans e.g. experimentation or causal inference modeling, key drivers analysis (usually outsourced to vendors), etc. Develop a strong understanding of various business areas including Content, Brand, Product, Ads, Games and more to connect dots and effectively address primary business questions with attitudinal metric development. Work collaboratively and iteratively throughout the research lifecycle to support survey design, deployment, analysis, and interpretation. Consult with Legal and Privacy Engineering teams to ensure best practices in the collection, storage, retention and use of data collected across consumer surveys, focus groups, and other research methodologies. To be successful in this role, you have: Advanced degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Physics, Economics, or a related quantitative field or relevant industry experience. Strong statistical knowledge and intuition - ideally utilized in experimentation, market, consumer, or social research settings. Strong partnership skills and ability to plan, execute and independently drive projects forward. Ability to communicate technical and statistical concepts clearly and concisely among audiences at various levels. Expert quantitative analysis, programming, and data manipulation skills using SQL,  R and/or Python, and version control (Github, Stash). Experience building multi-step ETL jobs/data pipelines and working with job scheduling systems is a plus. Experience in building causal inference solutions is a plus. Experience working with 3rd party APIs for data ingestion is a plus. Tags: ResearchSite Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $170,000 - $720,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully.   • Develop a strong understanding of various business areas including Content, Brand, Product, Ads, Games and more to connect dots and effectively address primary business questions with attitudinal metric development.
  • Work collaboratively and iteratively throughout the research lifecycle to support survey design, deployment, analysis, and interpretation.
  • Consult with Legal and Privacy Engineering teams to ensure best practices in the collection, storage, retention and use of data collected across consumer surveys, focus groups, and other research methodologies.
    • To be successful in this role, you have:
  • Advanced degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Physics, Economics, or a related quantitative field or relevant industry experience.
  • Strong statistical knowledge and intuition - ideally utilized in experimentation, market, consumer, or social research settings.
  • Strong partnership skills and ability to plan, execute and independently drive projects forward.
  • Ability to communicate technical and statistical concepts clearly and concisely among audiences at various levels.
  • Expert quantitative analysis, programming, and data manipulation skills using SQL,  R and/or Python, and version control (Github, Stash).
  • Experience building multi-step ETL jobs/data pipelines and working with job scheduling systems is a plus.
  • Experience in building causal inference solutions is a plus.
  • Experience working with 3rd party APIs for data ingestion is a plus.

    • Tags: ResearchSite
    Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $170,000 - $720,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here. Netflix is a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. The Finance Strategy & Analysis Team (FS&A) for Content is looking for an Associate to join its APAC team in Tokyo. Finance Strategy & Analysis is the team in charge of the analytical efforts and strategic thinking  behind our content buying and original content decisions. The team works cross-functionally to translate the incredible amount of data at Netflix into financial and strategic decisions regarding the production and acquisition of series and films across Anime and Live Action. FS&A Content also evaluates the general programming and content strategy, in addition to leading competitive analysis. This person will have a high degree of visibility with senior management which uses the team’s analysis and insights to inform important business decisions, such as our content performance analysis and programming strategy. This role will reside in Netflix's Japan office and be involved in projects across Asia. You will report to the Director, Finance Strategy & Analysis for Japan, based in Tokyo. Responsibilities: Lead deal analysis and valuation of new projects (both titles and deals) in partnership with the Content Creative and Acquisition teams. Conduct ongoing analysis of key business drivers, trends and performance indicators. Develop a deep understanding of industry trends as well as competitive threats and opportunities. Regularly present analyses and reports on relevant operating and financial metrics in an easy-to-understand format to senior business leaders. Compiling thoughtful post-mortem analyses to determine areas for optimization and improvement. Work on region-wide analytical projects with the global Content Analytics team Working cross-functionally with other FS&A teams globally as well as the Product, Marketing, Consumer Insights, and Data Science team. Qualifications 2+ years of experience in a top management consulting firm, investment bank, private equity, hedge fund, and/or media/entertainment/tech company in a strategy/business development/analytical role. We are looking for candidates that have worked in a highly-demanding environment in which complex modeling and analysis is performed. Candidate are required to be highly analytical and be a strong, effective communicator with experience presenting complex analyses to executives/ senior management Candidate must thrive in a fast-paced environment, possess a high level of intellectual curiosity, focus on generating results and exhibit the highest personal and professional standards of integrity and ethics. Candidates must be motivated, disciplined, and flexible. Superb financial modeling skills and extensive experience conducting quantitative and qualitative analysis. Exceptional proficiency with MS Excel & PowerPoint; working knowledge of statistics and analysis packages. Passion and familiarity with Japanese content and entertainment is a strong plus Bachelor's degree in finance, economics, mathematics, statistics or other relevant field that demonstrates quantitative orientation. MBA is a plus, but not required. English and Japanese language fluency are mandatory. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status or disability status. Netflixは男女雇用機会均等法を順守しており、考え方や背景の多様性がより強力なチームを構築すると認識しています。Netflixは多様性・インクルージョンについて、真剣にかつ思慮深く取り組んでおり、人種、宗教、出身地、性別、性自認・性表現、経済状況、性的指向、年齢、婚姻状況、兵役、障がいの有無、その他の属性によって差別することはありません。 Netflix Japan will not accept unsolicited resumes or applications from recruitment agencies, and we will not be responsible for any related fees. Please do not forward resumes to our career page or employees.

description: About Netflix Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. About Marketing Partnerships * At Netflix, the Marketing Partnerships team maximizes the impact of our brand engagements, driving business results through creative excellence. * The team consists of (4) business units focused on distinct outcomes: Partner Marketing: grow our subscriber base * Brand Partnerships: promote our titles to membersAds B2B Marketing: drive preference with advertisersIntegrated Marketing: offer custom solutions for advertisers All of these business units and objectives are supported by the Marketing Partnerships Creative team. This creative team collaborates with external brands and agency/production partners as well as internal cross-functional teams to create compelling campaigns, activations, sponsorships, and other innovative solutions. The Marketing Partnerships Creative team consists of (3) disciplines: Brand Strategy, Creative, and Creative Production. This team is tasked with ensuring partnership programs are rooted in a compelling strategy, crafted at the highest quality, and executed flawlessly. Examples of the work created by this group can be found here - https://www.netflixmp.com/ About The Role After launching Netflix with Ads in late 2022, we have continued to innovate our offering to better serve advertisers while continuing to provide a best-in-class experience to ad-tier subscribers. We are building a new Integrated Marketing business unit and expanding our current creative capabilities to support this endeavor. Our goal is to help advertisers connect with our IP, fandoms, and the Netflix brand in innovative and impactful ways. All candidates should demonstrate their deep experience and passion for creative marketing. The truly outstanding candidates will offer a clear and compelling point of view on integrated marketing and how/why Netflix is well-positioned to enhance the entertainment experience for both brands and members alike. This role presents a huge opportunity to be at the forefront of a new Netflix offering, one that continues to prove how Netflix is the most innovative entertainment company in the world and grows an important new revenue stream for the business. This role is ideal for someone with a personal passion for entertainment and a belief that marketing can be a natural extension of the entertainment experience, enhancing members' experiences and providing unique value for brands. Key Responsabilities Be a creative leader for the Marketing creative team in LATAM. Ideate, pitch and execute best-in-class creative campaigns in service of the Netflix advertising tier and our advertising partners Extract insights from partners and internal marketing teams to develop and steer the creative vision from concept through to execution Build foundational concepts that reflect the strategic intersection between the brand and the title Provide guidance and feedback to partner creative agencies and brands Translate our brand/marketing requirements into ideas the partner and ultimately consumer easily understands Introduce new partners and their agencies to the Netflix brand, creative guidelines, and workflowAttend brand/advertiser meetings and manage all creative relationships Collaborate with cross-functional teams including: Integrated Marketing, Sales, Creative Marketing, Social, Content, Events, and Public Relations Requirements 15+ years of desired experience in a creative role (Art Director or Copywriter background) within the entertainment/media, advertising, or related industry. At least 5 years in a creative leader position (Creative Director and above) Passionate and curious about marketing, brands, and entertainment. Have key, demonstrable experience leading innovative creative solutions with notable brands. Strong experience in brand and/or consumer marketing. Partnerships experience a plus. Has a history of managing people and takes pride in helping others and the group succeed. Willing to invest the time and effort and sometimes even sacrifice personal goals for the benefit of the overall project. Confident presentation skills and excellent communication skills. Experience and palpable passion for building great content marketing programs that are unique and scalable. Clear and articulate writer/speaker, in Portuguese, Spanish and English, who is comfortable crafting a narrative and developing points of view, despite some ambiguity or uncertainty. Desired Attributes A natural and deep affection for entertainment and brands. Strategic, forward-thinker, extremely organized, effective communicator, and thrive in a fast-paced environment. Capable of working independently as well as part of a broader team. Can organize, clarify and communicate complex ideas quickly, succinctly and accurately. High level of intellectual curiosity with the ability to demonstrate strong judgment in the face of ambiguity. Agile, goal-oriented, driven to succeed and always up for a challenge. Has a passion for concepting and pitching unique and innovative marketing campaigns. Can flourish in our unique ​​ company culture . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

description: The Game Studio Tech Lab team is a small, dynamic team. We build focused, creative games to validate and steer Netflix’s emerging technology investments that will make Netflix an amazing destination for games of all kinds.  These unique projects will be a mix of demonstrating and inspiring what’s possible with these new technologies and services while working directly with partner teams to help ensure an excellent developer experience that enables developers to focus on the fun. The Tech Lab Games Engineer will be a senior engineer on this small, senior-leaning team of multi-talented game engineers, designers, and artists. This role will involve creative game engineering across a variety of technical and creative challenges to make these smaller, experimental games and projects. Responsibilities Games development and prototyping: Making fun, interactive game experiences of a variety of types across a variety of technologies (potentially including different engines), in a fast-paced, iterative environment comfortable with shifting or in-progress technologies and platforms. Creative: Enjoys not “staying in their lane” and is able to both directly and collaboratively drive creative intent around experiments and games. Requirements 5+ years experience as an engineer shipping multiple AAA, casual or mobile games Experience building games for early or unfinished platforms Exceptional communication, cross-discipline collaboration skills Familiarity with multiple game engine technologies such as Unity3D and Unreal Engine Passion for making video games, especially in a rapid, focused, smaller form vs multi-year investments Location: Los Gatos/LA - Preferred: Remote OK Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top-of-market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $90,000 - $600,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs. Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more details about our Benefits here. Netflix has a unique culture and environment.  Learn more here. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. description: The Opportunity As part of our Los Angeles Workplace team, we are seeking a Manager to lead the MAC (Moves, Adds, Changes) team in the move and relocation efforts of our evolving real estate portfolio. This position will be responsible for project strategy and execution for Netflix moves, adds, and changes of varying scale and complexity.  This role will work closely with our Space & Occupancy Planning, Design & Construction, and Workplace teams as well as our vendor partners to execute our evolving site strategies. The successful candidate will be passionate, strategic, proactive, quick-thinking, flexible, creative, innovative, and able to juggle multiple and diverse responsibilities with a strong emphasis on organization. This is a demanding position that requires a strategic leader who demonstrates curiosity, excellent communication, and unwavering attention to detail. We are seeking a forward-thinking leader who is passionate about driving innovation, navigating unchartered territory, and guiding a team through change. Responsibilities Develop strategy for moves, adds, changes, including complex campus-wide relocations, reconfigures, and restacks. Plan and successfully manage internal relocations of varying complexity and scale. Responsible for full-scale project plans, schedules, and budgets in partnership with Space & Occupancy Planning, Workplace, and Design & Construction teams. Collaborates with all levels of the organization. Meets with partners to detail project scope, results, goals, risks, blockers, success measures, and estimated resources needed. Ensures that projects remain in scope and meet budgetary, scheduling, and quality requirements. Craft, present, and distribute project communication plans to internal stakeholders and functional partners. Manage a team of full-time employees, contractors, and multiple vendors responsible for the successful execution of moves, adds, and changes. Optimize relocations and FFE providers, including the RFP bidding process, develop KPIs, and recommend the selection of a vendor/contractor. Provide regular status updates to leadership with a review of program metrics, achievements, and results. Update project status reports, review invoices, and ensure timely payment. Manage work orders and small projects, including but not limited to furniture reconfigurations and space enhancements. Ensure your team closely collaborates with supporting stakeholders (AV, security, engineering, etc.). Develop and implement a strategy for FF&E inventory management, including storage needs, asset tracking, and depreciation protocols. Role may require some weekend and evening oversight. Qualifications Experience executing projects in a leased environment in collaboration with property management groups. Ability to read and understand construction drawings. Excellent level of communication and organizational skills. Have an understanding of project cost analysis. Proficiency in GSuite (Docs, Sheets, Slides, Calendar), Slack, Zendesk, and Serraview. A plus: AirTable and Asana. Ability to lead inclusively. Incorporate inclusive leadership principles to drive collaboration, creativity, and innovation among team members. Fosters a workplace environment where diverse perspectives are valued. Familiarity with modular furniture systems, FF&E, ergonomics & traditional Move, Adds, Changes (MAC). Ability to problem-solve and manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment. Positive team-oriented, hands-on, adaptive, and client-focused attitude. Comfortable collaborating with diverse team members, including architects, building engineers, property management, senior internal partners, project managers, and facility managers. High tolerance for change, and the capacity to accomplish enormous amounts of work in a fast-paced, ever-changing environment. Respect, understanding, and enthusiasm for the Netflix Culture. Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $100,000 - $350,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs.  Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here . Netflix is a unique culture and environment. Learn more here . We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: Netflix’s mission is to entertain the world by building the world’s leading streaming platform offering TV series, documentaries, and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages that push the boundaries of storytelling and delight over 260 million members of all ages and tastes across 190 countries. Like all companies, we strive to hire the best and we value integrity, excellence, respect, inclusivity, and collaboration. What is special about Netflix, among other things, is our Culture . We treat each country we enter differently since it is not just about translation, it is about providing our audience with an experience that feels local, and we do it at scale. Our team is looking for an experienced Regional Language Manager to drive and manage the language strategy for Southeast Asian languages on Netflix Products, Content, and Games, and to work closely with external resources and internal stakeholders and partners at Netflix in order to deliver the best user experience to our members and non-members in the region. This highly motivated individual will be based in our APAC hub in Singapore and will work closely with the rest of the Globalization team in the US, Asia, and Europe. Responsibilities Develop linguistic and cultural standards and guidelines, define quality expectations across the whole localized user experience, including supporting the development of style guides, glossaries, tone and voice of Netflix products (UI, navigation, synopses) and content (subtitle, title name localization, supplementals), games and marketing in the region. Monitor the linguistic quality output of Thai, Indonesian, and Malay languages (subject to adjustment depending on shifts in the relevant business signals) by using our internal MQM-based LQA model and other internal quality metrics and KPIs, and provide feedback and context to the translation teams for each of the languages/markets supported, in order to ensure the best resource fit for the highest quality impact. Communicate proactively with Globalization cross-functional teams to anticipate, identify, and fix linguistic, product, and subtitling issues related to the region. Proactively engage with relevant stakeholders in regional offices (e.g. Marketing, PR, Social) for additional context and insights on high visibility titles and to define and influence the best creative and linguistic approach for top priority content. Facilitate collaboration between internal stakeholders (in the region and in the US) and vendors, making sure the necessary resources have access to the relevant information, and advising on the best course of action regarding localization processes. Collaborate closely with other Globalization Language Managers and internal stakeholders (e.g. Globalization Program Managers, Content Acquisition teams) to collect relevant cultural and linguistic information about Netflix South East Asian International Originals and support the localization effort in bringing this content to a global audience. Partner with our International Dubbing team to influence the language strategy of our local language dubbed assets for Netflix branded and non-branded content in the region. Gain deep production knowledge and awareness of product and content data for the region and define quality expectations through research and A/B testing. Proactively engage with internal and regional stakeholders to drive regional product initiatives and create an optimized and consistent local experience and ecosystem for our regional members and non-members. Role Requirements 10+ years of experience in managing language quality and localization programs at a strategic level - experience in entertainment localization (subtitling, dubbing, gaming) a plus. Strong business acumen and proven stakeholder management skills. Proven experience in translation, localization, and language quality management. Ability to show initiative, work independently, and drive initiatives at a strategic level. Fluency in English and native knowledge of Thai languages. Fluency in any other regional language is a plus. Strong knowledge of the movie/entertainment industry in the region. Experience in creative writing and media/journalism is a plus. Deep understanding of localization specificities and pitfalls. Eagerness to embrace a culture of candid feedback. Excellent presentation, communication, and interpersonal skills. Willingness to travel often in the region (between Singapore, Seoul, Tokyo, and Mumbai) as well as to Europe and the US on a regular basis, as external conditions permit. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status.

description: About Us Netflix is transforming how people enjoy TV shows, movies, live events, and games. While we already serve 260 million members across 190 countries, our major growth phase is still to come. Our team develops the mobile, TV, and web applications members use to discover and enjoy great entertainment. Our purpose is to increase member satisfaction by proving our product ideas through creativity and analytical thinking. Achieving this requires skilled, inquisitive technologists who can envision and implement solutions that scale across various devices and ambitious product features. Job Overview The Netflix app should provide an elevated and delightful experience: quick to open, highly responsive to user input, animate smoothly, have a low error rate and easy recovery when they do happen, visually elevated, and accessible by a broad user base from around the world. We are looking for engineers with experience in creating consumer apps for Android to join us in elevating the quality of our Android experience. What You'll Do Identify opportunities: help shape a strategic body of work related to performance, error reduction, visual polish, and accessibility Increase member satisfaction: improve the Android app to give members a more elevated experience Rigorous innovation: validate ideas by A/B testing variations with real customers Bring creativity: collaborate with other engineering teams to unlock your work Partner: collaborate with product and design to strike healthy tradeoffs Enhance our culture: be a great role model and active agent in improving our unique culture Why work at Netflix Make an Impact: Develop products that deliver top TV shows and movies to over 260 million customers worldwide High Performance: Collaborate with outstanding talent on each project Growth: Enjoy opportunities for personal and professional learning and mentorship Freedom and Responsibility: Proactively improve Netflix, even without explicit permission About You You’ve worked on consumer-facing client applications on Android You demonstrate user experience insights and have a usability and accessibility perspective You know performance optimization techniques for client applications You’re unafraid to take on new challenges and learn quickly to be effective in a new domain You can run with ambiguous requirements, be decisive when appropriate, and take smart risks You’re proactive and results-oriented You communicate and collaborate effectively and can advocate for controversial positions At Netflix, we have found that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams, leading to superior results. Our compensation solely consists of an annual salary without bonuses. You're free to choose your ratio of salary and stock options each year. Your compensation in the market range is based on market indicators, including your specific job family, background, skills, and experience. The range for this role is $100,000 - $720,000. Netflix provides inclusive benefits, including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more details about our Benefits. We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

description: Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with 270 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films, and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause, and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. We’ve recently introduced a new ad-supported plan, offering a more affordable price point for customers. To support this exciting new area of the business, we are building out the Financial Planning & Analysis team to lead the budgeting, forecasting, and financial planning for this exciting new initiative. We are currently looking for a Director to lead Financial Planning & Analysis for our Global Ads business.  In this role, you will work closely with the Netflix Ads leadership team to oversee short and long-term planning for ads revenue and expenses across Sales, Operations, Measurement, and other supporting functions. You will directly manage the UCAN Ads FP&A team and lead the regional Ads FP&A teams in EMEA, APAC, and LATAM to guide and consolidate the global financial outlook for the business. The ideal candidate is a selfless, curious, passionate leader with exceptional analytical, financial modeling, and communication skills.  We are looking for someone who can drive financial planning with a strategic lens. Given this is a newer area of the business, team-building, process design and systems implementation experience are a must.  This role demands comfort with ambiguity, collaborative problem-solving, and the capability to manage complex work streams with multiple stakeholders. Visit our culture memo and long-term view to learn more about the unique Netflix culture and the opportunity to be part of our team. The position reports to the Vice President of Product Technology, Ads & Games FP&A in Los Angeles. Responsibilities will include: Lead and develop the global Ads FP&A team, directly overseeing the UCAN team and partnering with regional FP&A and Ads Strategy leads to build and develop regional FP&A teams and capabilities Oversee annual budgeting and quarterly forecasting for the global advertising business P&L (i.e. revenue through expenses) proactively identifying risks and opportunities Work with Commerce, Revenue and Ads Finance & Strategy teams to understand and incorporate key drivers and projections (member growth, plan pricing, Ad load, etc.) into financial forecasts Collaborate with revenue analytics and sales teams to set annual ad sales revenue and incentive quotas/targets Partner with Advertising leadership and Ads Strategy teams to develop and align long-term financial plans with Ads business strategy Perform ad hoc financial analyses to deliver insights, facilitate trade off discussions, scenario plan, opportunity size, etc. Design and build scalable forecasting and reporting workflows to ensure consistency and accuracy across regions Work closely with FinTech and Data Science teams on the buildout of financial systems and automated forecasting and management reporting solutions Develop KPIs, metrics and dashboards to track ongoing impact of Ads business. Develop and maintain effective relationships with business partners, senior leaders, and cross-functional teams at all levels of the organization to deliver on targets and drive effective business decision making Qualifications 15+ years of progressive finance experience in a fast-paced, highly analytical environment. Prior experience in FP&A, management consulting, strategic finance in advertising in the tech and/or media spaces is required. Bachelor's degree in finance, economics, mathematics, statistics or other relevant field that demonstrates quantitative orientation a plus.  MBA and/or CPA preferred Excellent interpersonal skills, with proven ability to build successful relationships and partners at all levels Experience implementing and optimizing financial forecasting and reporting processes and systems Excellent communication and presentation skills with a track record of presenting detailed financial information and analytics to executives and senior management clearly and concisely A strong attention to detail coupled with the ability to uplevel and simplify to drive clarity and inform rapid decisions Extensive experience with leading, executing and communicating actionable quantitative and qualitative financial analysis to drive key business decisions Very strong project management, planning, and organizational skills, including the ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously, and deliver excellent work under tight timelines A strong track record of growing, leading and developing teams with an inclusive and high-performing culture Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $310,000 - $830,000. Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits.
